description: A five-in-a-row game where each player has five pieces.    All the lines of five cross at the center piece, so it turns into a struggle for the control of the center of the board.  The pieces are 6-sided dice, and the up face determines how the piece can move.  When a piece is captured, it is rerolled and can enter play in its new form (i.e. it is reincarnated).  One of the pieces, the Buddah, is actually not played on the board, but instead fills a blank spot, acting as a wild card.

title: Smart
description:
Based on information from the publisher's website:

Smart is about buying, selling and using Smarts in Smartcity. 'Eating' the Smarts determines your emotional situation on the Emotionhead.

In Smart players struggle to be the best Smartdealer and
to become the owner of three new Smartshops. To do this, players buy, sell and use Smarts in the twelve neighborhoods (gameboard).

In trading Smarts, you compare the popularity of different types of Smarts in the various neighborhoods, your distance from the neighborhoods in which there is demand for Smarts, the amount of various Smarts others want to  sell and the amount of Euro's others bid on new Smarts.

Trade is connected to the four actions in every round.
The Smarts you supply but don't sell are the Smarts you 'eat'. This 'eating' influences your emotional situation. How Relaxed, Dull, Hyper and Heavy you are, is indicated on the Emotionhead display. 
The corresponding actions can be used to improve your Smarttrade. So it's important to work on your emotional state.  Be careful of partial or even total epileptic attacks.

Available tactics include good bidding, good selling and good 'eating'. Doing well in one of these gives opportunities to do well in the other two. But sometimes it is important to 'take it easy'. In many cases the winner at the end doesn't sell in every round and doesn't play a large role in every auction. The best advice: play Smart!

Components:

     A2-sized city board, painted by Annette Wiesman
     real Smarts (actual candies, made of sugar, water soluble)
     real half walnut shells 
     play Euros 
     Emotionhead board

title: The Three Stooges Trivia Game
types: Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description: Standard fan trivia game about the Three Stooges. Players roll and move across the board, answering three types of questions: True/False, Multiple Choice, and Specific Answer. Players cannot move until they answer correctly; if three or more questions are missed, the player may declare themselves stuck, roll the die, and move backwards, in hopes of getting a different type of question. Questions range from the biographical (When Moe Howard skipped school, where did he spend his free time?) to show-specific (Which short features the phrase, 'Slowly I turn, step by step, inch by inch'?) Nostalgia will get you across the board, but only true fans will sweep the board.

title: Lost World
description: Based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyles novel.

title: Wizard of Oz's Emerald Town
description: Based on the novels by Frank Baum and Alexander Volkov

title: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Adventures by Gaslight
types: Deduction Expansion for Base-game Murder/Mystery Novel-based
description:
As the events unfold, day by day, can you clear Anny Forster of the charges against her?  Where are Amelie Thackers porcelain birds?  What is Mycrofts role in this affair?  These are only a few of the mysteries that will challenge your deductive reasoning as you spend a few days in May of 1889 trying to solve the Adventures by Gaslight.

This is a supplement to the Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective game and requires components from that game in order to play.  The game challenges your deductive reasoning skills and ability to discern important details from generally available information.  No luck is involved, just your mental ability.  Great fun with a group of fellow sleuths or as a challenge all by yourself.  Contents:

    Case Book -- a 24-page book containing the rules, daily briefings for each of the five days of the case, questions, solution and answers.
    Clue Book -- 143 numbered clues and the clue point listing.
    Newspaper Archive -- a collection of loose newspapers which provide clues and information pertaining to the cases as well as general Victoriana
    Newspaper and Post Card -- two of the clues you discover
    11 x 17 Map of Paris, circa 1889




It was originally published by Descartes Editeur in 1986 as the third volume for the French edition of the game as L'Affaire de L'Oiseau de Papier, and translated in 1988 into English, when it became the official fourth volume in the English Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective series. The Queen's Park Affair, which is volume three in the English series, was volume four in France.

title: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Mansion Murders
description:
Can you deduce who killed the wealthy tea magnate, Sir Alfred Sipton?  Or piece together the previously unknown chapter in the history of the Maltese Falcon?  Was it suicide or murder at the reunion party of Watsons old regiment?  Did Sir Harold Hobsons bookish son poison three of his fathers house guests?

This is the first supplement to the Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective game. Apparently there were 2 releases of this game: One required the original game, Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective and one that was complete and standalone.  The expansion that did require the original game did not have the 24 x 28 Map of Holmes' London or the London Directory.

The game challenges your deductive reasoning skills and ability to discern important details from generally available information.  No luck is involved, just your mental ability.  Great fun with a group of fellow sleuths or as a challenge all by yourself.

title: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Queen's Park Affair
description:
As the events unfold, day by day, can you find the missing reporter from The Queens Park Sporting Gazette?  Why was a bomb thrown at the cricket match?  What happened to the escaped prisoner?  What secrets does the discovery of a decapitated corpse portend?  These are only a few of the mysteries that will challenge your deductive reasoning as you spend five investigative days trying to solve the mysteries of The Queens Park Affair.

This is a stand-alone supplement to the Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective game and contains everything you need to play.  A copy of Consulting Detective is not required.

The game challenges your deductive reasoning skills and ability to discern important details from generally available information.  No luck is involved, just your mental ability.  Great fun with a group of fellow mystery buffs or as a challenge all by yourself.

NOTE: Was also released as a supplement only (i.e., without the London map and directory).

title: Sushi: Jalapeño War
description:
A what-if scenario war game set in the year 2019 when Japan and the South American Union invade Mexico.  The Republic of Texas and the U.S. intervene.  It contains:

      1 20  30 full color playing map
      85 spun molded plastic playing pieces of infantry, APCs, helicopters, hovercraft, fighter/bombers, laser batteries, etc.
      1 sheet containing 102 die cut counters
      1 rule booklet
      2 6-sided dice
      18 random event cards

title: Fraggle Rock
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This game is based on the TV show Die Fraggles (Fraggle Rock). The game board consists of two parts. Transfer between the parts is only possible through a gate in the middle. Cards determine where the players have to go; they can choose between rolling one or two dice to get there. There are two spinners, too, which change paths. When two cards' destinations have been reached, a player has to get a radish from the other side of the board and return home first to win the game.

title: Hype
description:
The only board game with all the slime and grime of the music business.

Form a band, recruit a manager, secure a record contract, then gig around the country in an attempt to get to Number One. You know, the old fashioned way .....before P*p Id*l.

title: Runngus' Game
description:
Chafing at his minor role in the Snit games, the god Runngus once again leaves Bulbous and his other companions and sets about creating his own game on his own world.

The game mainly consists of dropping counters from a three foot height, and hoping they land in auspicious areas of the map.

Published in Dragon magazine, Issue #40.

title: Beziehungskisten
description: This light, racing game is probably the least known of all the Dirk Henn creations. Predict in secret who will win. Title literally means dead end relationships.

title: Carrott's Canny Captions
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description: Jasper Carrott is a popular Brummy comedian who has fronted TV shows using funny TV ads. His photos front this lame game in which players write funny captions to whacky photos from the vaults of some photo agency library. Guess who wrote which caption and score points. 200 photos and a huge waste. Oh look, a dog on a lawnmower. Call an ambulance, my sides have split with much hilarity.

title: Cash Flow
description:
Accept and present demanding personal challenges, moral obligations and financial considerations.

Players attempt to build a viable, ' friendly ' financial empire within the constraints of a constantly changing inflation mechanism whilst resisting player takeover bids and personal challenges.

Unlike Monopoly, Cash Flow allows for all players to         ' be in the game ' at all times, even when they are without assets or cash.

Players are always participants rather than just seat dwellers; unlike Monopoly when one person gets ahead.

Intriguing challenge cards allow players to constantly challenge each other player, at any time, thereby Cash Flow is not just about cash management and acquisition.  
  
Players are also personally challenged to develop or destroy personal relationships, within a time limit constraint, rather than employ a one grabs all style.

Even the most modest underdog can get up and win like the proverbial hawk / phoenix.

The Number 1 selling game in South Australia during its limited Australian Release.

Cash Flow sold across South Australia and Interstate       ( QLD, NSW  VIC ) and still holds the auspicious record of selling 10,000+ games in just over 2 weeks.

The local market was designed and in place to support the overseas promotion / marketing of the game; based solely on the South Australian test market results, Cash Flow was assigned under master licensee over 6 continents, within one year of making its test market debut - making it one of Australia's most successful games ever.

title: King Tut
description: A Jenga/Mikado variant, de-construct a wooden pyramid without it falling and you losing, reconstruct a triangular structure and win. A surprisingly large wooden pyramid is made of 30 wooden pieces resting on a very solid wooden board, making the box really, really heavy.

title: Baywatch: The Game
description:
Question - Who did Neely Capshaw file false sexual harassment charges against? Situation - A cafe on the beach names a delicious health shake after you. It becomes a best seller. Move forward two spaces.
Take on the role of one of the famous lifeguards in this marketing exercise and get some actual exercise. Roll  move round the beach, collecting discs, doing Physical Challenges (press-ups, star jumps), answering quiz questions or gamble on the situation, and then move on. Get three discs matching your character and win. With almost no publicity shots of the crew to embellish it, this game is so wholesome, it will make your teeth squeak.
Question - How many bottles of sunscreen do the Baywatch stars use in a week? Situation - A gang of rowdy youths tell you that their beers are non-alcoholic, they are fibbing of course. Move back one space for believing them.

title: Alien Encounter
description:
Aliens Attack!Will you be strong enough to prevent their attack or will they consume the entire galaxy?
This game is a re-themed version of Pente with a small twist.

It consists of 80 counters (40 red and 40 silver) and an 8X8 battle grid that represent space.
Each player takes 40 counters.
One player represents the Aliens that are attacking the galaxy and the other is the defending force.
There are several starting positions that players can choose from in order to start a game.
Each starting possition presents players different chalenges.
The goal of this game is to manage to control the enemy territory and try to avoid losing your base.
Players add counters in turns to the board in order to block enemy counters and create lines of their counters.
Once a counters has been put to the board it can not be moved.
The aim is to align counters of the same colour in vertical hirizontal or diagonal lines.In order to capture your opponents counters you must flank in pairs your opponents counters in any same direction.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game has captured more enemy counters or the player who has captured 5 enemy counters in a row.

title: Hoodwinked
description: Hoodwinked is a children's game with a mix of puzzles and challenges that the player must complete while the world is upside-down. You wear a pair of goggles with a mirror pointing down at 45 degrees, so your view of the world is inverted. The game has a deck of cards showing tasks, such as word puzzles, drawing puzzles and building with little wooden blocks. The quarter-board shows a crazy room and you progress from task to task until you reach to the finish.

title: Gaukelspiel
description:
This is a seven card expansion for Beutelschneider.

It adds cards that can be played in a trick instead of cards dealt to affect the current trick.  The cards are used only once and then discarded.

title: Little League Lunatics
description: After the Little League game the players participate in a brawl.  You control cards representing the different kids who have different skills who then fight it out with hands and weapons.  Last player standing wins.

title: Crisis: A Twisted Laugh at Life
description:
From the publisher's website:

Your worst nightmares have come true. We've taken your life, packaged it, and are selling it back to you... as a board game! That's right, it's just that easy. Kicked out of the house by your parents, you must now learn to cope. Will your reputation be good? You'll have to maintain employment, avoid life's temptations and quite possibly go to school. Or will you prove to be bad? Crime sprees, excessive gambling, and weaseling the one's who love you most. Either way there's no way of avoiding Crisis. Survival is the key. Sound easy? Think again. Mr. X (that's you!) is a loser!

(The game appears to be one of roll, move, draw a card and apply it.)

title: Great Walls
description: In this game, players compete to build the largest wall in Ancient China. Choosing from a hand of possible structures, players take turns adding sections to their walls, forming vast, snaking barriers to surround territory and gain military might. A cunning sense of strategy and a small bit of luck combine to decide the next emperor of China.

title: Save Our Bureaucrats
description:
This is a representative of this peculiarly American class of board game produced for political reasons, as a form of parody.  For some reason, most instances of these games come from the right wing (another game in the same class is Capital Punishment, which is much more vitriolic in its political commentary).

The object of this game is to go broke and go on Welfare with the help of government grants and boondoggles.  As the player tokens go around the board, their starting money eventually dwindles to nothing, at which point they no longer receive nor pay out money (ignoring the instructions on most of the board spaces) and exclusively draw from the Welfare fund (a separate pile of money) each turn they go around the board.  The game continues until the Welfare is exhausted, and the winner is then the player who got the most Welfare.

title: Capital Punishment
description:
This game was published for political reasons, to make a point.  That it turns out to be somewhat enjoyable is purely coincidental.

In this game, a player may win by maneuvering all four of his criminals in such a way that they are all in Life Imprisonment, Death Row or the Electric Chair.  Or the player may use his two liberals to spring the opposing players' criminals from the Path of Justice back to the Street often enough to turn all fifteen of each opponent's Innocent Citizens into Victims of violent crimes.  Victims go to Heaven.

title: Miss Universe
description: Generation of an ideal girl.

title: Gulliver's Travel
description: Based on the novel by Jonathan Swift.

title: Web of Power: The Duel
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Medieval Print & Play Territory Building
description:
This expansion to Kardinal & König allows the game to be played by two players.  It adds a third, neutral, player (the King) which players alternate playing pieces of onto the board.  Five new influence cards indicate for which player the King's pieces score.  Additionally, each player has three special action cards which allow them to break certain rules when surrendered.

Expands:

    Kardinal & König/Web of Power

title: Kontor: 3 & 4 player expansion
description:
This cut-out-the-cards expansion to the normally two-player game Kontor provides two additional player decks for a third and fourth player.  It includes additional rules for three- and four-player games.

Expands

    Kontor

title: Holocaust
types: Card Game Fantasy Fighting Miniatures Science Fiction
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
FROM THE INTRO: 2028, a fateful year for the human race, the Third World War began about 30 years previously.  By now the world is for all practical purposes destroyed as the nuclear catastrophe descended with undreamed of disastrous effects on the human race.  The face of the earth is changed and numerous areas around the globe are contaminated and destroyed.  Now mankind must fight against aliens, mutants, delinquents, looters, criminals, disease, radiation, and all the other ills the war has brought.  The main objective now is to survive and to attempt to recreate human society as much as possible.

Holocaust is a fantasy board game in which a hero combats against the horrors of a world devastated by war.  He must fight for his family, find it and save it by leading it out of the devastated city towards the Road to Freedom...

Each player takes the part of Michael.  With the help of the cards he must find everything he needs in the city and then travel along the Road to Freedom and thus leave the city.  An important difference with this game is that to win it, it is not necessary to come out first.  In fact, since the winner is the player with the most points, even the last to come out can be the winner.

Content: 6 lead figures to be painted, 6 player cards, 181 adventure cards, 37 market cards, 6 lead cars to be painted, 1 petrol station and 2 lead repair shops to be painted, 3 dice, 400 markers, paper models to be build (optional), and rules.

This game comes with rules and cards in multiple languages (Italian, French, English, and German).

title: Vier auf einen Streich
description:
Vier aug einen streich combines elements from the card game Memory  and the chip game Connect Four.

The game consists of a deck of 16 cards with various simple images, 16 chips with corresponding images, a bag and a rule sheet.

The cards are placed face-down on a table in a 4x4 grid and the chips are placed in the bag. Players take turns drawing chips out of the bag and attempt to turn over the card with the same image as indicated on the chip. If the image on the card does not match the image on the chip, the card is flipped back over and the chip is returned to the bag. If the images match, the chip is placed on the card.

The winner is the person who places the chip on a card that creates a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally of 4 consecutive cards with chips on them.

title: Odyssee
description: Delightfully graphic design has the Greeks sailing home from victory at Troy, but all around the islands on the hexagonal grid.

title: Der Blaumilch-Kanal
description: In digging the BlueMilk Canal, problems arise. An grown-up mix of tiles, voting, wordplay and satire, impenetrable to non-German speakers.

title: Osiris
description: 12 priests follow 12 gods in ancient Egypt. Players distribute support between the gods and then the priests are moved and conflict and a power struggle to reach the pinnacle of a pyramid. The game involves magnetic stickers being placed on the god and priest counters, so that a priest connects to its particular god in secret initially. One of the gods is hidden at the top of the pyramid. When it is revealed, the player who has the most supporters in that god's temple will win. Nice graphics.

title: Bloody Mary
description: Cards  dice create a game themed on cocktail drinking. The rules include a recipe for a Bloody Mary. Published in an L-shaped box.

title: Plan-Cheroli
description:
In Plan-Cheroli each player has three arches which start at one corner of the board and must be moved to the opposite corner. On each turn, one arch is moved by rotating one leg of the arch around the other leg, with other pieces blocking the rotation.

Several variants are included. There are chips which can be placed on the board at the start of the game to block certain spaces, creating different board configurations. Alternatively, all the spaces can be covered with chips, and the goal of the game then becomes to capture the most chips by moving onto them. In addition, there is a die which can be used to give each player one to six moves per turn instead of the standard one.

Re-implements: Cheroli

title: Grabsch
description: Themed on pre-historic cave paintings, this appears to be a set building game. Rules in German, English, French  Italian.

title: In Dubio Pro Reo
description: In Doubt For The Accused is a card game of guilt or innocence but has total German text on the cards.

title: Die Druiden
description:
Moon  Sun Druids select a new leader by moving around the circles of stones. A mix of cards and dice and symbols.

The Druids start from the Grove, in the centre of the Stone Circle. When a player begins his turn, he must move his druid, firstly, onto one of the 6 stones showing a Pentagram. This is the only space that may be moved to, from the centre area. The player throws both dice. At the beginning of the game each player has only one piece available (his Druid), therefore only one of the dice is used to determine movement. The second dice is unused until such time as the player has other game-pieces available for him to move. The meaning of the symbols on the dice dictate the type of movement allowed.
The space on which a Druid lands also affects further events. After the player has carried out all necessary actions then his turn is over. If a Druid lands on a blank stone then his turn is immediately ended and play passes to the next player.
 Once a player has taken control of two or more pieces then he may apply the dice to their full potential. In this case a player can, for example, move two Spirits or one Spirit and one Druid. Naturally he will choose the optimum moves, considering the symbols on the stones and the location of other game pieces, which each piece can land on.
The player with the most points, overall, wins the game and is proclaimed the new High-Druid.

title: Denkste!?
description: Think!? A tri-fold board with a long track has players rolling dice to move and stack pieces to the finish.

title: Ostindien Company
description:
Unowned clipper ships race back to Europe with valuable exotic goods. Players have secret interests in various ships and play cards to move them.

Not to be confused with Dan Glimne's Ostindiska Kompaniet.

title: Irono Ofubi
description: A tricky game with colour, players use 30 round and 30 oval pieces, placed on a board showing faces/masks in a theatrical Japanese style.

title: Challenge the Zodiac
description: A Trival Pursuit style game with the object to increase your knowledge of the planetary system and obtain as many earth symbols as possible. Uses dice to establish movement  around the board of 44 spaces. Every space has instructions for the player to follow. If instructed to read a Planet card or a Sun card, the person on the right has first chance to answer, continuing around the board to the right (counter-clockwise). The first person with the correct answer receives the earth symbol. Recommended ages 10 and up.

title: Die LeuchtturmArchitekten
description:
A card driven placement game for Lighthouse Architects. Discs in black, white and red are moved to construct stacks matching the color bars off the lighthouses on the cards.

3rd Place 1993 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.

title: Soccerboss
description:
Soccerboss is a game of chance and skill. Each player becomes the manager of a football team, responsible for the running of the team, the strength of the team, its selection, finances and transfers - and subsequent F.A Cup humiliation by Alfreton Miners Welfare F.C.

Not Heanor Town F.C.?

title: Slapstick
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Slapstick! is a game in which players move their pieces around a board in an attempt to simulate the slapstick comedies of 1930s Hollywood.  The game represents these events, e.g. slipping on banana skins, encountering crazy gorillas, pie fights, etc., in the form of cards.

Each player starts from a corner of the board (which is divided into rooms) and with 2 cards of each type of comedic act in his or her hand.  Going in turns, they roll a die to move their tokens and attempt to get rid of their cards.  Certain acts, such as those for pie fights, can be passed to players whose tokens are within range.  Others can only be passed to players whose tokens are in the same room or are laid down as traps (a player whose token passes over them has to pick them up).  The player who empties his or her hand of cards wins the game.

title: Chartbuster
description: Chartbuster introduces the players into the exciting and glamorous world of pop. Records are promoted by performances at London theaters and clubs and perhaps on television until they are eventually launched onto the hit parade and top 20. The first player to sell one million records is the winner.

title: Frag Fire Zone
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Science Fiction Video Game Theme
description: Fire Zone thrusts Frag players into two deadly new arenas, where massive pools of boiling lava are as dangerous as the other players. This expansion also features new rules like rocket jumps, knock back effects from weapons, and jump pads.

title: The Scotch Whisky Game
description: The object is to become Scotland's most powerful Whisky baron, by producing the country's most prestigious brands. Players vie for control of Scotland's leading blended, deluxe, and malt whisky, answer questions on Scottish history, myth, and culture, and attempt to avoid the numerous hazards of the whisky industry.

title: Peloton
description: Much praised cycle racing sim from innovative Czech game company. The wrapper unfolds to be the game board showing a street race course. The game has advertising from cycle shops. Rules in Czech and German.

title: Karmas
description: Karmas is a game in which players roll dice to outscore each other.  Each die has its 1 face replaced with a letter, spelling K-A-R-M-A-S when all those faces are rolled.  Players take turns to roll the dice.  Various points are scored for different combinations of letters and pips rolled.  The highest points are gained for rolling all letters, essentially spelling the title of the game.  After a certain number of rounds, the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

title: Illegal
description: An ironic card game themed on making as much cash any way possible. The box has text in German, English  French, but only contained rules in German.

title: Ganoven Jagd
description: Ganoven Jagd ('Crook Hunt') has each player controlling 6 police officers and one robber. Your officers are trying to bring to justice the opponent's crook, whilst your fugitive is trying to elude the  hunt. Although themed, this is really an abstract movement game with black and white pieces roving the squared grid.

title: Hol's der Teufel
description:
All 38 cards are shuffled upside-down and evenly dealt to the players. Every player gets a total chip
value of '20'.

Each player must play one card when it is their turn. The starting player begins and plays one of his Devil cards onto the table. Then its the next players turn. The starting player must play a Devil card in one of the colors of the cards in the hand of the player to his left. The colors of the cards in each players hand are visible on the backs of the various cards. The player, whose turn it is, now has 4 possible alternatives for playing a card from his hand.
- He can play a Devil card with the same value as a 'free card', whose color is not yet represented on the table, face up. The player thusly starts a new row. This play costs the player no chips.
- He can play a card with a higher value in an already started color row at the top or bottom end of that started colors row. This play costs the player no chips. 
- He can play a card with a lower value in an already started color row at the top or bottom end of that started colors row. This play costs the player the difference between the value of the card he is playing and the card onto which he is playing it, in chips. The player pays this value in chips to the player to his right.
- He can play an Angel card onto the free end of any row in which there is no Angel card played so far. This play costs the player no chips.

The game ends when the dealer plays his last card. Since the dealer is last in the round, the dealer is always the one to play the last card. Whomever has the most chips at this point, is the winner if this heavenly hand.

title: Soccerama
description:
Soccerama is a football management game. As usual the teams must struggle through the 4 divisions hopefully lifting the European Cup (yes, the proper one - before the Champions League) on the way.

Acclaimed as The Best Game I've Ever Played by Alan Ball, it is fondly remembered by some, but not by many. (the game that is - not Alan Ball)

title: Admiral On Deck
types: Expansion for Base-game Nautical Print & Play Wargame
description:
Admiral On Deck is the first of several planned free expansions for Queen Victoria's Navy. It is being freely distributed, so ownership of Queen Victoria's Navy is not needed to download and view the file.

Admiral On Deck introduces several advanced rules to Queen Victoria's Navy. Rules for crew and admiral quality, shore batteries, mines, and smaller ship classes such as torpedo boats are included. Admiral On Deck will allow players to play historical scenarios from the 1894-95 Sino-Japanese war and the 1904-1905 Russo-Japanese war.

Included are 6 pages of advanced rules and 1 additional set of game charts. Scenarios are included for the opening engagement between the Chinese and Japanese cruisers that started the Sino-Japanese war of 1895, the Battle of the Yalu (1894-Sep-17, Sino-Japanese war), the Battle of the Yellow Sea (1904-Aug-10, Russo-Japanese war), and the Battle of Tushima (27..28-May-1905, Russo-Japanese war). The appropriate ship and utility counters are also included, in both full color and non-colored versions (but players will have to mount the counters themselves).

title: Sea-Life
description:
This is an underwater game for two to six players.
Each player has his own deck which consists of marine life and a fisherman.
Each marine life card has a set of stripes that allow players to know which fish can eat which.
A board is created using food(prey) cards.The board consists of prey giving either possitive or negative points.
The food cards are shuffled and placed in a stack in the middle of the table. Each player draws eight Food cards and adds them to his hand. 
The starting player begins and sets a card face down in the middle of the table. In turn then the other players follow in clockwise and insert their card played face down on the left of the previous card. This generates a hidden row of cards. 
During the second phase of the game, the first player begins again and sets this time one of his cards to food underneath a hidden playing card.
A food card must not be discarded under our own card. EAch player does the same until we have two complete rows with hidden cards on the table.
The next phase is scoring.The map tiles are successively uncovered, without changing their position. Initially the food map is resolved 
When all cards have been detected and analyzed, they come back in the box. The game continues anti-clockwise. 
Once all hole cards have been played and scored, the game ends. The player with the highest total wins.

title: Wer ist der Täter?
description:
Wanted. There are 48 suspects for the murder, can you reveal the killer?

The game has 48 cards showing combinations of old/young/man/women, in 4 colors, with different murder weapons. One player shuffles the cards and takes the top card without revealing it to the other players. This is the perpetrator. Now he takes the next card and places it face-up on the table. He compares it to the perpetrator-card.
If one the features (old/young/man/woman/poison/dagger/gun/blue/green/yellow/brown) matches the perpetrator-card he says that the person on that card is suspicious. If none of the features match he says that the person on the card is innocent.
This continues until a player thinks he knows who is the perpetrator. If the accuser is wrong, he may not guess again until another player succesfully accuses the right perpetrator. This player scores 1 point.
Now the next player shuffles the cards and picks a perpetrator and a new round starts. If all players started a new round, the game ends and the player with most points wins. In case of a tie, one additional round is played with the tied players.

Players take turn calling and the winner is the best detective.

title: Junk Yard
description: Throw a set of dominoes, a deck of cards, and a game board into a trash bag.  Shake it up really well then dump it onto the table.  Since you will still only have a jumbled set of dominoes, cards and a board, you should try the Junk Yard of games contained in this bag instead.  We have taken come of the best features of cards games like taking tricks, passing cards you don't like to another player and trumping your opponent's clever play.  We've added the great things about dominoes like standing them up in front of you instead of having to hold a deck of cards, stacking them up, knocking them down, and the solid thunk one makes when you play it on the table with authority.  Add a board (well, actually a bag with a board printed on it) to play these games on and make your tiles look better than most other trash and you have Junk Yard and other Trick-Taking Tile-Laying Board Games.

title: Fast Freddy's Hong Kong Dice Game
description: There are 6 special dice, red, white and blue chips, score pads, and a very nice dice cup. A die has 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 pips on one side. All the other sides of the dice are blank. Well, that's not exactly true ... The 2 pip die has a Red Dragon on the face opposite the 2 pips. So, we have 36 sides, but only 7 of the sides have pips and the Red Dragon. Each player starts with 20 points worth of chips. (White = 1 point, Red = 5 points, and Blue = 10 points) Play begins with each player putting 5 points in the pot. On your turn, roll the dice and count the pips. The player then takes that many points out of the pot. If there are not enough points in the pot, then the player adds points to the pot until the pot equals the numbers of pips rolled. There are special payment and rewards for rolling all blanks and for when the Red Dragon is rolled. The first time any player does not have enough points to pay the pot, the set has ended. All remaining players total their points and mark them on the score pad (provided with the game) and a new set is started.

title: Tripjat
description: A tactical card-laying game, with players placing colored, numbered cards on a grid. With a design themed on oriental calligraphy, this is a wildly over packaged game. The box gives the designer as 'Jeukuro', the rules identify it as 3 authors (Uwe Freyschmidt, Jana Kusch, Stefan Roth).

title: Das Zeitungsspiel
description:
Players gradually complete the layout of the front page of the local newspaper Nurnberger Nachrichten. The tiles are in various squared shapes and are placed and moved on the grid according to their topic, Politics, Sport, etc., which affects how each player scores. Graphic design by Franz Vohwinkel.

The game is similar to Karl-Heinz Schmiel's Kunst Stücke, but has somewhat different components and a few important rules differences.

title: Trödeln
description: Re-issue of Ausbrecher AG, with children dawdling to be the last into class and get to sit at the back. Includes selection cards showing the randomized positions, instead of the original version's choices being written out by the players. A light and funny dice-roller worth getting.

title: Zamix
description:
This game contains 80 cards, numbered from 1 to 20 and with numbers 10 showing the text Take an action card and 10 Action Cards.
To play players take one numbered card and place it in front of them, in case there is a 1 it is placed in the middle of the table. From there, players can place their card ascending in the middle stack or ascending or descending in the stacks of the rest of players. Every time a card is placed, players must take a new one.
Action cards are used only when the 10 cards cant be situated anywhere. Also if someone sees a mistake shouts ZAMIX and gives another card to that player.
When there arent more new cards to take, players put the card they have in their hand in the table as the ending stack and turn the stack they had in front of them. The one who is able to spend all the cards from his own stack wins the game.

title: Kaos, The Game
description:
The game playing components are a 7-square X 7-square playing board, a die to roll to see who plays first, and 4 different-colored playing sets, one set each for up to 4 players. Each playing set has 4 pieces: Alpha, Beta, Gamma, and Delta. The Alpha piece can be moved only one square, but in any direction (diagonally or laterally). The Beta can be moved either 1 or 2 squares, also in any direction. The Gamma can be moved 1 or 2 squares, laterally only. The Delta can be moved 1 or 2 squares, diagonally only. The players take turns, with each player moving 1 of his or her pieces each turn. Any piece can capture any enemy piece within range by moving into the enemy piece's square and removing the enemy piece. When an Alpha is captured, all its companion pieces are also removed. The surviving Alpha wins. As in many other multi-player games, temporary, unspoken alliances are unavoidable.

The playing components are of unique designs. The playing pieces are hardwood and the roll-up playing board is printed on cloth-backed vinyl. The game is packaged in a nylon drawstring carrying case.

title: The Company War
description:
This game is based upon C. J. Cherryh's Hugo winning Downbelow Station novel.

It uses area like movement between jump points for starships to move around a map of explored space. Conflict can either be resolved strategically or in an optional tactical hex and counter method.

The game's victory is determined on how many supplies can be delivered or enemy destroyed.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man Game
description: Spider-man roams New York fighting Dr Octopus, Hobgoblin and Venom and must rescue Aunt May and Mary Jane. Roll dice, use action cards and so on. Rules done as a comic strip.

title: ReBoot Mainframe Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A simple game based on a popular 90s kids cartoon series called ReBoot, which had very high quality computer graphics and characters themed on computer jargon. Players are either sprites or viruses trying to protect or infect the CPU where they all live. The board is a circle of paths, players roll and move, collecting 6 chips to win their goal, with Quantum shakes as hit points, magnets, Vid-windows, modems and so on. The graphic design is strong, the rules written in a very modern style, following the computing theme very heavily for a kids game, down to having a whole flow-chart on the back page! The board is very light card fan folded into a wedge, but there is a basic, sloppy production error in the tokens. You'll need to get your marker pen out and over-write some of the tokens if 5 or 6 play, which is a shame.

title: Snowboard
description:
This game is a race between snowboarders, but speed isn't all --you must also do a maximum of free-style figures to earn first place!

Avoid the ice slicks, trees and rocks, succeed in your figures, exploit the course and you'll be crowned the best snowboarder!

title: Bill: Le jeu
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Puzzle Real-time Trivia
description: Bill's game is a family party game which reproduces the adventures of Bill and his family when they land on Earth.  (I suppose this is based on a TV program)  It is a racing game with challenges (trivia and others).  One must have knowledge and a sharp sense of commerce to snatch the gifts through shrewd bargaining.

title: Loft Story
description:
Loft Story is one of those real TV programs. In it, eleven candidates (6 boys and 5 girls) are sequestered in a loft and filmed continuously. During 10 weeks, in addition to the daily routine they face game challenges through which they reveal their personalities to each other and the public. The public votes each week to eliminate a player. After 70 days, a couple emerges victorious.

The game recreates the program, in an atmosphere of charm and seduction --to win; each player must reveal part of his personality.

http://www.tilsit.fr/fiches_jeux/loft_story.php

title: Outlaw & Posse
types: Abstract Strategy American West Children's Game
description:
This is an abstract strategy game with an Old West theme.  It is inexpensively produced, with a small cardboard board, a 3D cardboard backdrop, and 14 cardboard playing pieces that are inserted into plastic stands.

One player controls the 13 deputies (the posse), the other controls the 1 outlaw.  The object of the game is for the posse player to surround the outlaw such that he can no longer make a valid move.  If that happens, the posse player wins.  The outlaw player tries not to get cornered and wins if he is able to remove enough deputies from the board such that it is impossible for the posse player to win.

Play starts with the outlaw player who must move his outlaw each turn, if possible (if not, he loses the game).  He can move the outlaw to any open orthogonally adjacent space.  He can also jump a deputy piece, like in Checkers, and thereby remove the deputy piece from the board.  The outlaw can make multiple jumps in a single turn, again like in Checkers.

The posse player simply moves one of his deputy pieces into any open orthogonally adjacent space on his turn, trying to create a situation on the board where the outlaw player can not move his piece.

title: Cross Over
description:
Cross Over is a two-player game of thought and chance. Each player gets (10) pegs and they place them in their start line. Roll the die to determine move, some numbers require a choice of move. This is where the strategy comes in. You win when you remove all the pegs off your side before your opponent does. There is one catch your opponent will try to keep you full of pegs. Good Luck!

www.crossovergame.com

title: Chiamo!
description:
Chiamo! is a strategic trick-taking game designed for 3 players, where your partner changes round to round! Those who dare to face the other two players call out  Chiamo!  (I call). The high bidder leads, while the other two players team up to stop him from winning enough points to take the hand. With a fun and unique Italian suited deck, Chiamo! will make you exclaim, Mamamia! each time the partners change.

Chiamo! also includes instructions for Chiamo! per Quattro (the 4-player game), where players partner up, vying for the most possible points and Chiamo! per Due (the 2-player game) for head-to-head competition!

title: Kooky Kalooki
description:
Kooky Kalooki is a fun family game based on the popular Jamaican Contract rummy where players try to form hands made of runs and sets, and then attempt to lay down all their cards first. This version of the game has added Kooky Kards, which act as special wild cards, but if you are stuck with one at the end of the hand, you get penalized 50 points!

Kooky Kalooki comes with a 112 card deck, all decorated with the traditional colors of Jamaica. After 9 different rounds of play, the person with the lowest score wins.

Play Kalooki online - http://www.playkalooki.co.uk/
all Kalooki tips and information, how to play Kalooki - http://www.playkalooki.co.uk/

title: SeaNochle
description:
SeaNochle is based on the classic American game of Pinochle. With this deck, the highly acclaimed strategy game has been redesigned with an ocean themed twist, and the rules provided are for 2 through 6 players.

SeaNochle consists of the traditional 48 card pinochle deck (with new suits - shells, seahorses, starfish, and fish) with mermaids and mermen serving as the royal cards. There are also BONUS Shark and Shrimp cards that act as ultimate trump and junk cards, respectively, which add a unique twist to the game. Also included is a game board and playing pieces to easily keep track of the score. 
The new look makes it a fun game for adults and the whole family alike!

title: Modigliani
description: The International Art Market Game. Try to achieve the most valuable art collection through a combination of buying and selling 42 famous works of art. The board has a circuit of auction houses and galleries. You can earn money if you arrive at a gallery that specializes in an artist whose work you own. You have to be at the right auction house to bid on the art you want, but there are telephone and postal bids and forgeries. The game is nicely packaged with its own wooden gavel.

title: Key Whiz
description: Key Whiz is a family oriented board/card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has a game board, game pieces, and are dealt 4 to 6 cards depending on the number of players. Players take alternate turns moving one piece at a time from the start square and along the board with the ultimate goal of being the first to reach the payoff with all game pieces. Along the way are doors that must be passed thru using keys (card combinations such as a single card, pair, 3 of a kind, or 4 of a kind). There is a fair amount of strategy involved, and often times movements can be planned well in advance. Two of the major features are WHIZ CARDS (count as double) and BONUS PLAYS (additional moves) created by passing through a door. The two-player version is excellent for tournament play.

title: Halleluja
description:
All Hell has broken loose in Heaven: Angels fight devils, devils fight angels and many a devious angel is not that well-thought of by his comrades. It is not easy to keep the big picture in mind in all this turmoil, everyone wanting to wipe out everyone else while also climbing the heavenly ladder on the side. Who will be able to make a good impression at the end of an evil game?

Players move stacks of disks about the playing grid, maneuvering to get the best position from which to attack their opponents' disks.  Points are achieved by capturing as many different colors of disks as possible.

title: The Mystic Wood Extension Kit
description:
This Expansion pack adds 2 new Knights - Astolfo and Marfissa - plus new Encounter cards and also expands the size of the wood to 63 tiles.

Game components: 

    18 area cards, including City, Swamp, Mountain and pool 





    16 small cards,consisting of: 


2 Knights (Astolfo and Marfisa)
1 spell (Mystic Thunder) 
13 denizens (Bear, Crone, Friar, Griffin, Immortal, Nymph, Ogre, Pilgrim, Sorcerer, Sphinx, Tartar, Tyrant and Wife)

title: Danger Guy
description:
An envelope game a-la 'Cheapass' style from Alien Menace, a newer contender in the simple, inexpensive, low-budget market.
From the publisher:
Youve seen him trapped beneath a fallen vending machine, burnt with acid, and even pulled into a wood chipper. He boldly stands between you and the perils of the modern world. He is Danger Guy, a faceless hero throwing his very body in harms way to protect the innocent, the hapless, and the stupid..

Using cards, counters, and the exclusive Anthropomorphic Danger Guy Cut-Outs you and your friends will face roaring fires, flashing blades, crushing weights, and much more as you plot your course through Danger Guys perilous world, countering dangers and seeding hazards as you go. Every danger mitigated is a point for you, every hazard an obstacle to your opponents, but remember, Danger Guy has only one ticket home: Death

title: Tip the Cows
description:
This small beer  pretzels game is a virtual clone of Pass the Pigs. It containing 2 cow dice, a pen, a score pad, and a rule/scoring all contained in a small imitation leather wallet.

The goal is to have the highest score at the end of 7 rounds of rolling. On your turn, you roll the cow dice (little cow miniatures) and try to get positions which score points. After most rolls you can bank your points and pass the dice or continue rolling. One roll, a milk dud with both cows on their sides, brand side up, halves your current points this round and forces you to pass the dice. Other rolls have various point values, or cause you to loose all accumulated points or win the game instantly.

title: Equations
description: Special 6-sided dice with numbers and arithmetic symbols on them are rolled out at the start of each round. A goal expression is formed, and then players take turns moving one cube at a time to one of three areas: Forbidden, Permitted, or Required. Each move is supposed to keep possible the ability to eventually form an expression equal to the goal, but it must not be possible to form such an expression immediately if there are still cubes remaining in the resources pile. Players may challenge each other if they believe a move has rendered impossible any expression that equals the goal, or if an expression can be formed prematurely. When a challenge is issued, all other players decide which side they want to be on. The side claiming that an expression is possible, has the burden of proof to create such an expression. The final expression must use all the Required cubes, none of the Forbidden cubes, and as many Permitted cubes as desired. Expressions are written down; the cubes are not moved. Parentheses may be inserted as desired. Rounds continue until some agreed condition is met (high score reached, or number of rounds).

title: Give Us A Clue
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description: Give Us A Clue was a hugely successful, very, very long running 80s UK TV game show of Charades, performed by two teams of popular light entertainers. This is a commercial version, with a sand timer to limit the miming, two big dice to select the clue to be mimed and a box of 500 cards with 5 titles from Songs, Books, Plays, Films and TV. And if you don't know what Charades is, it's an old parlor game in which you silently mime the title word by word as your team-mates shout out their guesses to much hilarity all round.

title: The Idiot Box
description: Roll and move, draw cards, impersonate celebrities, answer quiz questions, spoil with dirty deals, collect money, buy your TV show, try to get to the center and then try to roll a 6 to win.

title: PSI
description: PSI stands for Psychology Slander Intuition. This is a party game in which a person's character is described as a comparison to an object. Player's counters are the 7 deadly sins, Sloth, Avarice etc. You draw a Personality card, giving a clue to the type, eg sports, politician etc, the next player draws a PSI card and asks If you were a Language/ Salad Dressing/Letter Of The Alphabet, which would you be?. You're supposed to answer as if you were the personality and the questioner is supposed to guess who you are. If they guess correctly, they advance along a track, if they fail, the next player tries another question and so on. If no-one guesses correctly, you reverse down the track for giving bad clues. The hilarious party element is that the Personality cards include the Sins, so you would answer as if you were that player.

title: ESP
description: Using the symbols used in ESP tests, players have discs to secretly select a symbol, then bet on the collective outcome. You can bet on the color or shape and as the game progresses, you cash in your winnings, buying tokens to spell ESP to win.

title: Schatzsucher
description:
A version of Expedition/Wildlife Adventure for kids. Instead of the world map with irregular links of those earlier games, Schatzsucher is played on a square grid drawn over a map of an island (although the underlying island picture has no effect on the game). Players compete to locate their camping equipment first.

Re-implements:

    Expedition
    Wildlife Adventure
    Legemax

title: Gogol
description:
There are two players (White and Black), each having one king and eight pawns at their command.
On a common chessboard, place eight white pawns on the first rank and eight black pawns on the eighth. Then, the White player may place his king anywhere on the board, except on the second rank. Black, in turn, places his king anywhere except on the seventh rank.  The game then starts, each player moving in turn.
The pawns are free to move anywhere on the table, not being confined to moving along lines or diagonals! The king may move along any straight line or diagonal, like a chess Queen.
Capture is made by any piece standing next to the opponents piece, by jumping over it, straight or diagonally, thus landing on the other side of the captured piece.
The player who captures the enemy king, or reaches the last rank with his own king, wins the game.
For more information, including additional rules and a demonstration game, please go to www.gogol.nu

title: Shendao
description: Shendao, As d'or Cannes 2002, is a game board with effect cards and doors.The aim of the game is to connect the greater number of your tiles. Game action :place a tile in through an open door, slide it along its line or diagonal until it meets either a tile or a closed door, using a stick, close the door through which the tile was placed in. When you choose to play a card, apply the effect on a tile and close the door. Shendao, the way of the spirit, is based on Chinese mythological God and Goddess.

title: Quip Qubes
description: Quip Qubes is similar to Scrabble, only players form sentences instead of words.  On their turn players roll their (remaining) dice and use the words that come up to form a sentence that can be placed on the board crossword style with the other sentences that are already there.  Bonus points are scored when special spaces on the board are covered.

title: Marino
types: Abstract Strategy Animals Bluffing Children's Game
description:
(From the rules)
Who will become king of the bugs?
There are two paths leading to the coronation of the king of the bugs: the direct way is to crawl across the board. But this only works if your opponent isnt there! Alternatively, one can sort through the bluffing of your opponents and defeat their Marinos.  Note, though, that each error brings that opponent closer to the throne...

The prototype Marieno - Der Knig der Kfer (Marieno, King of the Ladybirds) was first presented by the authors during the 1991 Autorentreffen (Game Designer Meeting) in Gttingen, and it went on to make the top 10 of the prestigious Hippodice Design Competition in 1992. It was published the same year by VSK-Erwachsenenspiele with a much shortened title.

title: Politrics
description: Typical UK board game, Monopoly clone, roll  move, draw chance cards, hand paper money around. This has a theme of  politics  directorships, and two tracks, like Poleconomy (qv), with the highly original idea of sleaze and satire.

title: Royal Comette
description: Themed on the discovery of a comet by Halley in 1682, this is an imitation of a courtly game of the period. In Royal Comette, players place tokens on astronomical sections on the board, lay cards in a sequence, and when your card matches a section, you collect the tokens.

title: Playing Shakespeare
description: The board shows a wheel of Shakespeare's plays, split between the Comedies, Tragedies and Histories. Played in teams, you must get your pawns on 3 each by successfully completing quotes from the categories. Not guessing leads to miming. There are 37 plays, so you'd better know your Pericles from your Troilus  Cressida. The game includes a biography and digest of the plays and is supported by the Royal Shakespeare Company.

title: Game Spice: Monopoly Expansion
description:
Game Spice: Monopoly Expansion is a set of 30 new Chance Cards and 30 new Community Chest cards that replace the existing Chance and Community Chest cards. These new cards affect the game far more than the original cards. For example, various cards will allow you to steal property from other players, build houses without owning the whole color group, change your die roll, or charge an opponent double rent. One card even introduces a new victory condition.

This expansion set works with any version of Monopoly.

title: The Game of Maze
description: Bring your pawns together in the maze. The rules include a brief history of mazes and a list of British mazes open to the public.

title: Hazard
description: Themed on Chaucer's Canterbury Tales and an old dice game called Hasard, players gamble stakes on dice rolls, allowing to progress along the track. In doing so, they lay cards depicting the various pilgrims progressing to Canterbury.

title: The Dickens Game
description: Players move from inn to inn, collecting characters to complete the 5 chapters of a Dickens novel. The rules state that the designer Mary Danby is a great-great-granddaughter of Charles Dickens. Past Times is a chain store of cod repro English history, with games usually produced for them by Oxford Games, but this is a game they've published themselves and the rules are in English, French and Japanese!

title: Coffee!
description:
This is an interesting little card game... 
Included are two sets of instructions - a solitaire game called Barista, that plays similarly to traditional solitaire, except that you collect recipe cards for different coffee drinks and then build the ingredients on top of them - and Percolator, where players race to build a coffee drink.

The cards are cute with simple drawings of Vanilla, Cocoa, Irish Creme, Espresso, and the like - there's even a stir stick card that is used sort of like a wild.

title: The Zodiac Game
description: Russell Grant was a popular, jolly, rotund, camp TV astrologist in the 80s in the UK and this game contains advertising for his horoscopes, his premium rate phone lines and his personal charts by computer. The game is a simple quiz style effort in which you try to identify the Sun Signs and win tokens. Curiously, the game includes a d10 and a d12, which would have been a revelation to your family gamer in the 80s. If you happen to need photos of Russell Grant, this game is a must

title: Runestone
description: Themed on Anglo-Saxon runes, players roll dice with the runes and remove their markers from the board.

title: The Hieroglyphs Game
mechanisms: Pattern BuildingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Each player has a sheet showing words written in Egyptian hieroglyphs. Players roll a die and move around a board showing the glyphs, and put a counter on their sheet as their glyphs are reached. A simplistic game, more educational than fun, but nicely packaged with the rules written on a scroll tied with ribbon.

From the back of the box:

Involving both skill and chance, the game is an entertaining introduction to one of the oldest and most beautiful of written languages. Whilst no previous knowledge of this ancient script is required, play is designed to help you recognize a range of the more commonly found hieroglyphs - making future viewing of Egyptian exhibits even more exciting!

The game involves moving a scarab beetle around the board in an effort to collect the signs necessary to spell a given hieroglyphic word. Whilst attempting to do this, you are at the same time trying to thwart your opponents' efforts to complete their words.

The colorful game board displays the 24 signs of the basic hieroglyphic alphabet, plus a small selection of the seven hundred other signs used by Ancient Egyptian scribes.

Contents: 
One Scarab Beetle Playing Piece 
One Die 
One Full color Board 
Eight Hieroglyphic Word Sheets 
One Rule Scroll 
Twenty Black Counters

title: OrkoMondo
types: Abstract Strategy Dice Fantasy Print & Play
description: A relatively simple, tile-placing strategy game in which players choose an army to portray (Orc, Elf, Human, Dwarf).  After two dice are rolled, players can place units of their army on a small 6X6 board according to the coordinates on the dice.  Playing units in this manner costs Shield Points (which go into a kitty obtained by the player who deploys all his units first) and despite the light theme of combat between units, the game is actually won by the player who has the most shield points at the end (thus being the most resourceful).  OrkoMondo is part of KidultGames' series of free, downloadable games.

title: Star Quest
description:
Galactic Combat in the 22nd Century!

A game of interstellar combat between the six great trading Houses that control the exploration of the galaxy in the 22nd century. Plan out your moves while expending energy to accelerate and decelerate, travel in and out of hyper-space, lauch and evade missiles. Can you survive and make it to the prize before anyone else?

Starquest is a game of Interstellar combat as the spaceships of from two to six players move and fight around an unexplored star system. To survive Players must learn the most effective ways to accelerate and decelerate their spaceships, how to launch and evade missiles, how to deal with the powerful gravity field of the star itself and when to risk a return to Hyperspace. The game contains a colorful map, 100 cardboard playing pieces and a short rules booklet. Starquest is a fast moving game that can be played in anywhere from a few minutes to an hour.

title: China Topf
description:
In English, this game is called Chinese Wok, after the small wooden wok that is the centerpiece of the game.  The 3 wok has a round bottom, which causes it to be wobbly.  Each player is given an assortment of wooden food items of different colors, and the object of the game is to be the first player to place all of your food into the wok.  The items include orange carrots, white eggs, green peas, blue fish, yellow pasta, and long purple sticks.

Each player takes turns rolling a special die.  On each face of the die are two colors. The player selects one of their food items that matches one of the rolled colors, and carefully places the item into the unstable wok.  If any items fall out of the wok, the player must take those items (up to two pieces) and place them back into the wok on subsequent turns.

A number of tofu cubes are included that may be placed into the wok at the beginning of the game to adjust the difficulty level or compensate for the number of players.

title: Plagio
description: Half of a famous book's incipit is read, and players must secretly complete it on a paper. Then all the papers are gathered and read aloud: among them lies the correct ending (from the original card). Players then can score by pointing out which was the true ending, and by having other players' selecting their composition.

title: RisiKard!
description:
Risikard is similar to Risk in that players are warring over global territories. However, in Risikard, battles are resolved by use of cards, instead of dice, and the board serves more as a visual indicator than a gaming area.

The game consists of 1 small map board, 2 tank pieces, a rule book and 110 cards.

There are 42 Territory Cards, each representing one of the areas on the map. Of the information on these cards, the most important are the number 'Value', of which a certain amount are needed to win the game, and the 'Winning Symbol' (explained below). There are 54 Army Cards and one Wild Card. All army cards have symbols representing either infantry, cavalry or artillery and a value from 1-6. There are also 13 Mission Cards, which remain hidden to others throughout the game, and state the formula one must obtain to win.

At the beginning of the game, territories are selected one at a time and starting army hands and a mission card are drawn.

Each turn then commences with an attack by declaring war on an adjacent territory. Cards are revealed from the attacker and defenders hand and whoever has the higher number wins, the wild card trumping any other value. When one player wins two battles, that person gains the other's territory card.

The second stage of the turn is the protection of territories. In this turn you may choose to defend territories by presenting three Territory Cards with different 'Winning Symbols' from the same continent (also known as a set). Protected territories may not be attacked but also can't aid to increase your number of army cards. Army cards in hand are then discarded and the same number of cards are drawn at which point the player may attack again.

In the final stage of a turn, the player adjusts his/her hand based on the number of sets that aren't part of protected territories that they control.

The game is won when a player fulfills the requirements of the 'victory formula' stated on his/her Mission Card. An example of this formula is you must control all of Africa, Oceania and you must have additional territories totalling a value of 12 or more. Players can be eliminated from the game prior to the game's end.

title: Sandsplatters
description: A simple 3D sci-fi wargame, with miniatures.

title: Derby
description: Card game about soccer. Players build a team and then the match starts. The name of the players on the cards are ripped from true existing players by altering one or more letters in the name...

title: Dragon Ball: Alla ricerca delle Sette Sfere
description:
Players try to gather the seven spheres by moving around the world, and challenging characters (and other players) from the comic book.

Integrates with:

    Dragon Ball Z: Il Torneo

title: Ferrari F1
description:
Ferrari F1 simulates a Formula 1 race in which the players' cars move around a track, aiming to be the first to complete the race.  The game was endorsed by Michael Schumacher, a multiple World Champion F1 driver.

There are 18 possible race tracks that can be built from different arrangements the 4 double-sided game boards.  The players choose a track and roll dice to determine whose car token is in pole position (first at the starting line).  They each have a dashboard that shows the gear engaged for his or her car and its fuel gauge.

Taking turns, players move their cars according to the position of their gears.  They can roll dice to pull ahead, moving into spaces that match the color rolled.  This action costs fuel, which is subtracted at the end of their turn.  The game's rules also cater for accidents, pit stops, and other events in an F1 race.

The game ends when all players move their cars two complete times around the track.  The winner is the one who is the first to do so.

title: Gran Gol
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME
Grangol is a simulation of a football match between two teams. The ultimate goal here as in any football match is to score more goals than your opponent!
Actions alternate between players.First they attack and then defend using cards.
PLAYING THE GAME
The player draws a card and gets ready to play a card.
In each turn you draw one more card and play one card unless specified otherwise in the text of the card played.
The first player is the attacker.If he loses the ball do to a card played by the defender he is in turn defending.
There are 5 Field cards which represent the playing field in sections (2 areas, 2 three-quarter, 1 midfield). When one player makes a successful action (both attack and defense), this section turns the field immediately in front of her with
arrows in his favor, to indicate that this is now in that section of the field.
DURATION OF THE GAME
The game is divided into two parts, each time ends as soon as you turn the  recovery card or when a deck is depleted
Between the first and the second Half cautions and dismissals will be reset.

title: Il gioco del campionato
description: This is a simulation of a soccer tournament. Players manage their teams and play each other by rolling dice. The more balls players roll with the special dice. The more balls they throw with the special dice the more goals they potentially can score.

title: Il gioco della Formula Uno
description: Yet another imitation of Formula D. Roll the dice, try to get the correct symbols and run!

title: Fantasy
description: The players represent wizards and visit the many cities of the board delivering messages. While gathering gems in the process, they are also challenged with wild magic creatures to battle with. The wizard who ascends the magic ladder higher wins.

title: Super Pippo
description: Super Pippo (Italian name for Super Goof) is one of those children's games you love when you're an adult too (much like Looping Louie). The board has a big plastic peanut in the middle, filled with holes with numbers in them. The players move around the board collecting peanuts of several colors; once a player has a particular combination, he may launch a Super Goof miniature, using a spring-driven plastic skyscraper, trying to make it land in the holes with high numbers. The higher the number, the more the tiles of a puzzle the player gets. The player completing a puzzle for first is the winner.

title: D3 Time Warriors
description: D3 Time Warriors is a universal rules set for miniature wargaming at a skirmish level. The first publication of the game, in the italian gaming magazine KAOS, included cardboard counters and army lists for playing the game in a science fiction setting, later used also in the Sandsplatters game (based on the same rule set) and in the Nemesis starship combat game.

title: Hold Everything!
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Party Game
description: Reggi un Attimo! (Hold it! in the Pressman american version) is a party-game where players must hold common objects such as umbrellas, pens, chairs, keys or whatever it is decided in the deck of personalizable cards - the players may choose the objects they have at home in that moment. The deck supplied has some suggestions: televisions, glasses, fishbowls (!) and bottles. The board is constructed with cards as well: landing on a space may force you to hold another object or to pass or exchange one with other players. If a player drops an object, he must get two as a penalty. The player getting rid of all his objects wins.

title: Alfreds Other Game
description: This game's name is a play off the fact that the designer, Alfred M. Butts, is also the designer of Scrabble.   Up to four players conduct a solitaire-like contest simultaneously, trying to achieve maximum scores.  Words of all one color double your points, certain letters have premium values, and if you use all the letters in one play you get a bonus.  Has both a basic and a more challenging duplicate mode of play.

title: The Christmas Game
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionTrading
description: Players work together to complete four Christmas scenes before the manger scene in the middle of the board is covered.  Players roll the die and move their piece around the board.  They can land on good spaces (e.g., gift giving, do a good deed, etc.) which allow them to draw one of the scene pieces, trade pieces with another player, etc.  They can also land on bad spaces (e.g., people are mean to one another, robbers, etc.) that cause the player to cover up a section of the manger scene by discarding one of his scene pieces.

title: Millionary
description: Millionary is a big business game about buying and selling shares and options.  The game uses real company names like Shell and Microsoft and real markets like the Dow Jones and the Dax.  The game rules offer both a family version that uses a roll-and-move mechanic, and a strategy version for real gamers that does not involve dice.  The rulebook is highly detailed with three complete sample games, but alas all in German.

title: U.E.F.A.
description: A soccer game simulation. It uses flat cardboard microscopic tokens and mechanics similar to GW's Blood Bowl.

title: Your America
description:
Players move around the game board earning stars (points) by correctly answering trivia questions about the USA in seven different categories:
   People, Places and Things
   Presidents of the United States
   States of the Union
   Inventors and Authors
   Government
   The United States at War
   Famous Americans

title: Stars On Stripes Football Game
description:
Game was produced by Stars on Stripes Co, Incorporated , 406 McKenna Building, Pittsburgh, PA. On the box it says The GRANT Building.

A simple simulation of an football game. The game has taken 14 years to develop, but it is so simplified you can learn to play it in just one minute.
The equipment consists of two boards, three wooden dice, five wooden pegs, a Bakelite football and a 10 yard marker.
First - Call your play (line plunge, off tackle, end run...)
Second - Throw three dice and the results are always read from low to the high number. 5-4-1 will read 145.
Third - look on the Signal chart to see what happens to the ball.
The player must gain 10 yards in four downs or lose the ball.
When the ball touches or goes over the Goal Line it is a Touchdown.

I have the Game and played the game with my friend Mike about every night doing the football seasons, from 1943-1952.  I feel it was a fantastic game and very simple to play, and there were over 1500 different combinations of plays you could make, which made it a very realistic game.  If you would like a copy of the game, just e-mail me, you would need to suppy about 5 push pins, and a 10 yard marker, and marker for the football.  This game is very rare, as it was made in 1941, but to me still a great game, also you would need 3 dice.
jdlaughead@gmail.com

title: 1-2-3 OY!
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Math
description: 1-2-3 OY! is a set of ten card games which are adaptable to any age level or ability.  Flexible rules provide for optional use of one or all of the basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication or division) up to 16x tables.  Both fast and slower card games are included and the games are suitable for ages 5 to adult.  Directions in English, French and Spanish.

title: A-B-C OY!
types: Card Game Children's Game Word Game
description: A-B-C OY! is a collection of eight word and spelling games for all ages. You can learn your alphabet backwards and forwards with YO! YO! OY! or speed spell with SLAP SPELL OY!. Many of the games of A-B-C OY! are played similarly to Dream Green's 1-2-3 OY! and instructions are in English, French and Spanish.

title: Largo Winch
types: Adventure Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
(Based on Tilsit's page: http://www.tilsit.fr/fiches_jeux/largo.php)

After the assassination of his father, the 26-year old Largo Winch finds himself at the head of a ten billion dollar empire, the W Group.  The Adriatic Commission, a secret organization with apparently unlimited power, does not like this and decides to replace him with a more accommodating figure head.  All blows are allowed: physical elimination, dismantlement of the W Group, hostile take-over, criminal frame-up, kidnapping of his loved ones, etc.

Largo must fight on all fronts, investigate and foil all attempts on him.  He can only count on Simon, his childhood friend, Joy, his seductive bodyguard, Sullivan, his director-general, and Kerensky, an ex-KGB high-tech specialist.

This board game of high adventure will keep all fans of the TV series (itself based on the graphic novels created by Jean Van Hamme and drawn by Philippe Francq) on the edge of their seats.

title: Noble Celts
description: Noble Celts is a circular chess boardgame that is played exactly like regulation Chess.  There are 64 circles corresponding to the 64 squares.  Diagonal moves are made along lines that spiral into and out of the center of the board.  Pieces are set up along the outside of the circle and around the center ring, and play is inward or outward.  The lack of a side edge to what, if uncurled, would be a normal chess board makes for very exciting play.

title: XIII: Le Complot
description:
(from Tilsit's page: http://www.tilsit.fr/fiches_jeux/xiii.php)

Vance and Van Hamme have created a very successful graphic novel series entitled XIII --it currently boasts 20 albums (along with 5 albums in it's spin-off series: XIII mystery).  In Tilsit's game XIII : Le Complot based on that police/thriller world, you play each of the 27 key characters in turn.  Your goal is to surmount all obstacles (traps, ambushes, plots) thrown in your way.

The board shows 33 of the albums' key locations; by traveling to each, you assemble a team able to complete a maximum of missions.  Each completed mission awards you investigation points which are necessary for victory.  Of course, there aren't enough missions for every player to win...

The combat encounters will be bloody, and the combined strength of your agents and characters won't be enough --you'll also need to plan your moves and play your cards right...

XIII is an amnesiac whose identity is hotly debated throughout the series.  Various agencies (such as the NSA) have tentatively identified him as various notorious hit men / terrorists / secret agents --but XIII isn't an easy man to catch!

title: Antagon
description: Simple, tile-based game for two players in which each person controls a row of tiles representing various groups of ants.  Once each player has created a row of 6 ant tiles, they begin drawing event cards.  Amongst the event cards are eggs, which can be assigned to groups of your ants.  Other event cards will make the players' ants fight (possibly losing the eggs they're carrying) or allow them to change their ant army, or even allow them to steal the other players' eggs.  Once all the events are drawn, the game ends and the player with the most eggs wins.  Antagon is one of Kidult Games' free, print-n-play games available on their website.
