This gives the item up for bid to your opponent, but ends all bidding for accessories and sends you to the next stage of the game.

Once you have a robot and accessories for it, it is time to battle in the arena. You build your robot on a plastic arm that has a wheel control and trigger on the other side. Robots face off on any flat surface. Battles have a Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots robots feel, as the goal is to maneuver your robot where it can knock off your opponent's armor and expose a release button. Hit the release button and the opponent's robot pops off and you win the round. the first player to win four rounds wins the game.

title: Nimbali
types: Animals Children's Game Dice Educational Environmental
description:
A game for 2-4 players, Ages 5 and up.

The game is set in the African bush. The game board shows four watering holes, each of which is assigned to a player. Each watering hole is filled with 9 blue wooden  raindrops.  Five animals (giraffe, cheetah, lion, zebra, rhino) are placed on the board at the various watering holes. Players throw a single oversized die to determine the action of each move: five of the die faces depict the five animal hide patterns of the animal figures, and the sixth die face shows a blue raindrop. When the player's roll brings up one of the fur patterns, the player moves the corresponding animal clockwise around the board to the next watering hole. When the die roll shows the raindrop symbol, all players remove one raindrop from his watering hole for every animal that is standing at that player's watering hole at that time.

The winner is the player who feeds the most thirsty animals by being the first to run out of raindrops.

title: Stratego Legends: Qa'ans Resurgence
types: Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Fantasy
description:
Expansion set for Stratego Legends that adds a 30 piece army (gray side), 2 new boards, and 12 (of the 30) new characters.

Expands:

    Stratego Legends

title: The Arab Israeli Wars
types: Arabian Dice Expansion for Base-game Fighting Modern Warfare Wargame
description:
The Arab Israeli Wars is an 3rd party expansion for Axis & Allies and is a territorial strategy board game covering the 1967 and 1973 wars between Israel and its Arab neighbors. It is an Empires of History game, which utilizes a D10 variant of the Axis & Allies gaming system. The Arab Israeli Wars includes 2 game scenarios; one for the 1967 War and one for the 1973 War.
 In the 1967 war, Israel must strike out quickly to wrestle the Sinai region away from Egypt and deal deadly blows against Syria and Jordan before the weight of the superior Arab numbers can fully be mobilized, and before Iraq joins in the war against them. Israel's ready reserves gives them an edge in calling up their armies and they have to leverage that for everything it is worth.

In the 1973 war, Israel begins play in control of the Sinai, Palestine, and the Golan Heights. The Arab powers must hit Israel hard and fast, trying to overrun Israel's border armies before Israel can mobilize its then-superior military might.

The Arab Israeli Wars is a fast paced game (some games can be concluded in as little as a hour) historically portraying these two middle east conflicts. Optional rules for land mines and the use of the nuclear weapons adds additional game play variety.

Contents: 

    17 x 22 four piece Cardstock Game Map (four 8.5x11 sheets) 
    270 Plastic Playing Tokens. 
    270 Plastic Playing Tokens Stickers. 
    Game Rule Booklet. 
    1D10 
    Cardstock cut out Mines, Nukes, and National Markers




Expansion For:

    Axis & Allies

title: Stratego Legends: Celestial Vengeance
types: Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Fantasy
description:
Expansion set for Stratego Legends that adds a 30 piece army (beige side), 2 new boards, and 12 (of the 30) new characters.

Expands:

    Stratego Legends

title: Pyramids and Mummies
types: Ancient Children's Game Educational Exploration Puzzle
description:
The box contains two different games: The Pyramid Game and The Mummy Game.

The Pyramid Game is a cooperative game in which players decipher messages in cryptic rebus writing and work together to build a pyramid.  In The Mummy Game players compete to be the first to reach the mummy chamber by following the hieroglyphic path and interpreting rebuses.

title: Hungry Ant
description:
Here's your chance to get an ant's eye view of life. Suppose you're a starving little ant and some people come along and spread out a lot of mouth-watering snacks for their picnic. You'd really love to get a few but you know it's not going to be easy...

This is a children's (Ages 6 - 12) tile laying game where the players try to connect their ant tunnels to the goodies at the picnic (7x7 grid). They can also play tiles of baddies (bug spray, ant-eating spiders, human feet that squash ants, etc.) on the other player's tunnels causing them to go around or play a tile clearing the problem before they can go on. When all the goodies are eaten, the player who got the most wins.

Although simple (only 5 different tunnel patterns to choose from), no dice rolling or memory element helps young gamers develop and rely on their strategy skills instead of luck.

title: Impact Zone
description: Battleship clone where players try to be the first to find the seven UFO pieces their opponent has hidden on their side of the board.  Players take turns calling out zone numbers.  If the space is empty, nothing happens.  If a UFO piece is hidden there, they take it.  If it has a rattlesnake, mine, or coyote, they lose a turn.  Game has sound effects for when a snake, mine, coyote, or UFO is chosen.

title: Batman Returns 3-D Board Game
types: Children's Game Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Players move around the board fighting The Penguin's henchmen.  The first player to collect three henchman tokens that have a Batman symbol on the back is entitled to fight The Penguin himself.  Once The Penguin is defeated, the game is over.

The player with the most points wins.

title: The Art Game
description:
The aim of the game is to buy a complete collection (of real art masterpieces) through auctions and trade between them.

The players read one action card per turn and have one possible purchase per turn. The trading factor is central in the game, and completely free. Both money and pieces of Art can be use as currency.

In Italian, no longer printed, potentially a must have for any collector of boardgames involving Art and trade.
The human interaction factor makes this game very fast and chaotic, and this is the best side of it.

title: Crosswords for Dummies
description:
Have you ever played a crossword game in which you end up with all consonants or all vowels?  Or you get some combination...and still can't come up with even a three-letter word?  As you rearrange the letters one more time, the other players are getting, well, impatient.  That was then but now it's time to play crosswords The Dummies Way.

In this game you begin with 10 word strips and 100 points. Each word strip has a word from 3-7 letters.  On one side the word is written from left to right, on the other it is written from top to bottom.  Players take turns playing their words crossword fashion on a board.  There are bonuses that allow the players to go again or give a word to another player. The object is to get rid of all of your words first. Other players then lose points for the words they have left.

Rounds are played until someone gets to zero and then highest score wins.

title: Chubby Cheeks
description:
Hamsterbacke is a children's game for 2-4 players, Ages 4 and up

The underground burrows of the little hamsters are empty once again.  So the little night critters set out around the circular board to collect plenty of precious provisions--carrots, nuts, and (most valuable of all) bags of grain. 

The game ends when the first hamster collects 3 grain bags, and when the provisions are counted up the hamster (player) with the most points wins.

Contents: 

    4 wooden hamsters
    12 wooden nuts
    12 wooden carrots
    12 little grain bags (apparently with real seed in them!)
    1 dice
    1 game board.

title: Hanna Haselnuss
types: Animals Children's Game Dice Educational Environmental
description:
Hanna Haselnuss is a children's game for 2-4 players aged 4+.

It is autumn and the squirrels are busily collecting nuts for the long cold winter. They work hard carrying one nut after the other, laying in a stock. Each player has a wooden suirrel who moves around the circular board according to the symbols on a specialized die; certain types of moves enable one's squirrel to take a hazelnut from the center stock or from another player.

The first player to collect 5 nuts is the winner.

title: Ouk Chatrang
description: Cambodia has several games played on the chessboard of which this is the one most similar to international Chess and most clearly derived from the Indian game of Chaturanga. As in Thai chess (Makruk), the pawns (interestingly called Fish) are set up on the third row. They are promoted to queens on reaching the sixth rank. The bishop and queen have limited movement, as in most non-European forms of Chess.

title: The Journeys of St. Paul
types: Ancient Children's Game Educational Racing Religious
description: Designed by a minister and possibly developed by Tom Shaw, it recounts the various journeys of St. Paul. The game simulates the difficulties and challenges confronted by Paul and his companions. You must be daring and cunning, strategic in thought and a good manager of resources as you race against your friends and family to the mighty gates of Rome.

title: Sittuyin
description:
The traditional chess of Burma (Myanmar) appears to have all but died out, supplanted by international chess. This is one of the most unusual regional variations of the game. The pawns are set up in staggered formation near the center of the board, and the other pieces are deployed ad lib behind the line. Pawns are promoted on different ranks of the board depending on their file.

It's doubtful that the rules were ever completely standardized. The standard account in English is given by Pritchard in his Encyclopedia of Chess Variants.

title: The Addams Family
types: Children's Game Horror Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: This weird family does everything different than most folks and this game follows that concept. The object of the game is to lose, not win, for if you win you lose and it's fun either way! The object of the game is to try and stay near the trailer site on the island and not finish first.

title: The Coach's Game
description:
Football simulation touted as NFL strategy at its best! on the box. Simplistic game whereby each player selects a play (offense and defense) and the result is determined based on the plays picked. No randomizing or multiple outcomes, just very straightforward play.

Contents:

    Game board (football field representation)
    Time clock disk for tracking game clock
    10-yard marker
    Two offensive play books -- one run and one pass (actually fold-out cards listing a total of 48 play choices and the results of each when called against each available defense)
    One defensive playbook (10 defensive plays listed on a fold-out card)
    One special teams playbook/card
    30 token football players (one each for the 30 NFL teams existing in 1996)
    Three stands
    One die
    One scoreboard
    One rulebook.

title: How to Host a Murder: The Hollywood Premiere of Powar and Greede
description:
You and the other guests are gathered -- in the glare of the spotlights at Powars Oriental Gardens Theater for the premiere of Powar Film Studios' newest release, Powar and Greede. A small, private party for the cast is being held in the Banquet Room adjoining the theatre, while outside, Hollywood's elite mills about, breathlessly anticipating the 8:30 curtain.

Earlier today, W. Anton Powar appeared in the private garden of the theatre where, as a publicity stunt for the new film, the impression of his bare feet was made in concrete beside that of his former stare, Tatyana Eltale.  After retiring to his private apartment at the conclusion of the ceremony, Powar was expected to join you and his other special guests for cocktails before the movie starts, but he's running curiously late...

Characters: 

    Denise Ann Dayer
    Hack Ryder
    Hi Voltaje
    Ivonde B. Alone
    Savoy R. Fayre
    Sel U. Lloyd
    Tatyana Eltale
    Stu Dyron.

title: Suspicion
description:
One of you is guilty...

The adult murder mystery game where a party of guests (the players) must discover who among them is guilty of doing away with the host--the mysterious Doctor Fenn. Logic and reasoning are the keys to success.

It is midnight. Dr. Felix Fenn, world famous surgeon, has just been found in his private study, dead! Murdered! You and the other players are the only guests at Fenn Manor. One of you is guilty. The rest must find out who did it, before the murderer has a chance to cover his tracks; before the murderer leaves at dawn; before the murderer strikes again!

Contents:

    6 clues envelopes (one for each player)
    6 tokens
    1 notes pad
    1 pair of dice
    1 gameboard
    60 evidence envelopes and corresponding clue cards divided into four suits: Weapons, Alibis, Motives, and Circumstances.

title: Speculation
description:
Speculation is a commodity-trading game for 2 to 4 players, Ages 12 and up

The object of the game is to finish with the most money.  The players start with a portfolio of blue chips, gold, oil, and treasury bonds worth $1,000,000.  Players can buy and sell shares by landing on Market Mover spaces on the gameboard.  Every time someone lands on a Market Mover space, they roll two dice, find the corresponding card, and the share prices all change.  Players get one wild card at the beginning of the game, which can be used to change the market whenever they want according to the card.  Share prices over time are kept track of on a nifty wipe-off board.

The game comes with both play money and shares and with trading worksheets, and players can use one, the other, or both.

title: Maneuver
description:
Maneuver: The scheming game of getting it all together!

This offering by Mattel was recommended by Games Magazine way back in 1978. Two to four players each choose a set of colored marbles which are placed on the board and then shaken up with an opaque lid on top. The board is configured unevenly so that it forms a diagonal grid where the marbles can nestle. There's a great deal of luck involved since marbles may land favorably for some players and not others.

The object is simply to move your marbles one spot at a time in any diagonal direction to arrange your twelve marbles into lines of three or more, while blocking your opponents in the process.

title: Mars 2020
description:
MISSION OBJECTIVE:

Choose a spaceship and sign on as your favorite crew member. Players then zoom around the orbital path from Earth toward Mars. Along the way, you'll repair malfunctions (breakdowns) by answering questions on science and technology. If all systems are go (your ship has no malfunctions), be the first to land on Mars to win. It won't be easy: Mars is a moving target, that is orbiting swiftly on its path!

This is essentially an educational answer-questions-about-space-and-science game, although it does include a half-dozen cool plastic spaceships and a big heavy Mars-marble!

title: Challenge the Chief
description:
The object of the game is to get rid of all your marbles first.

Players get rid of their marbles by dropping them into the chutes on top of the tomahawks without letting more marbles fall off of them. This is very tricky to do because when you place a marble on one tomahawk, the weight of the marble pushes that tomahawk down while pushing the opposite tomahawk up and there are openings along the edges of the chutes which allow some marbles to fall back out.

This game requires some weight distribution reasoning and deduction and it is not as simple as it looks.

title: Murder à la carte: A Deadly Design
description:
From the box:

The mystery - The Queen of High Fashion, Francesca Baldini, created a Spring collection to die for.  Unfortunately, she was found dead at her elegant FAB couture house.  Around her are the slashed remains of her  Spring collection.  Accessorizing the scene is a footprint in blood near her head.  You and 5 others are woven into the fabric of this murder.  This is a tale of high society and high fashion.  It will seduce you into the seamy side with a deadly combination of violence and vogue.

The Suspects:

Gloria Spoddy - She is the aloof and confident international model whose striking looks are perfect for Francesca's designs.  Is she capable of murder most fashionable?

Mike Ruffone - Dangerously handsome, this ex-rock star gave up his career for the love of Francesca.  But is he strumming her heart strings for his own mysterious reasons?

Doll Chevita - Francesca's younger sister, her meek demeanor covers a violent past.  But is this babydoll really as innocent as she appears to be?

Minnie Kashfloe - A stylish socialite and devoted follower of Francesca's designs.  But below the satin and lace lies a heart of steel that drives her to take whatever she wants.

Cameron Tripod - Francesca's favorite but difficult photographer.  As Francesca's ex-lover, has he been over-exposed to her manipulation of his affections?

Ron Dewing - He is the financial clout behind Francesca's salon.  But where does his money come from and what secrets thread through his life?

title: Ultimate Muscle: The Kinnikuman Legacy Battle Card Game
description:
A card game based on the Ultimate Muscle cartoon.  Use techniques and assistance to put your opponent's deck into their discard pile.  First to run out of cards looses.

Comes with one Micro Muscle Wrestler, similar to those in the M.U.S.C.L.E. Mega Match boardgame, except in Transparent Blue or Transparent Red.

Package includes a mat(required for the game), Ten card pack, and a random figure.

title: Trade Winds
description:
In Trade Winds, players collect treasure to accumulate enough points to win.  Players can attack and rob other players ships. 
 This appears to be a derivation of Waddington's Games, Inc.'s Buccaneer game.

title: Robo Force
description: Three dimensional game that uses the popomatic dice system.  Be the first robot to rescue a Uni-Bot from evil Nazgar's tower and carry it to the space ship.  Geared toward the 12 year old boys and younger crowd because of the hands on gameboard with knock 'em over, zap them off pieces and parts.

title: Trade In
types: Children's Game Dice Educational Negotiation Racing
description:
You start by buying a car at the dealership.

- You can get insurance, buy extras or get a road service plan at the time
- There are five different car models to choose from every time 
- You buy at list price, sell at book value or trade up at the upgrade price

You drive the car around in any direction, just obeying basic traffic rules.

- You can choose to move forward, at normal or high speed, or go in reverse, on every play
- You can pass other cars or make U turns, where permitted
- You can park your vehicle at home or at the dealership and skip your turn to play
- You try to steer clear of accidents, because they cost you money and you may get traffic tickets
- You try to avoid tickets for speeding at the police station or the school zone

You try to make money, save it and reinvest it.

- If traffic allows, you can drive home every time you need to collect money from business
- You avoid the risk of getting traffic tickets that will cost money to clear
- You can buy insurance for your car to protect you in case of accidents
- You can buy extras, or upgrades for your car, to increase its resale value
- You can get a road service plan so you don't have to pay for repairs along the way

You trade your car up, whenever you can afford it, or down whenever you need the cash.

- You can stay with an older model and wait to buy the latest model at list price, paying in a lump sum
- Or you can pay the upgrade price and get a step-up upgrade as soon as you have the money
- Or you can also sell your car for the book value and buy an older model to get cash

You win when you are the first player to drive home the latest model car!

title: Prince Valiant
description: Based on the comic strip by Harold Foster but released to help merchandise the movie of the same name from 1954.  Players use a spinner to determine their movement around the board.  Each player needs to travel through the 7 adventures of Prince Valiant in his quest for knighthood which is achieved by being the first to reach the castle.

title: Blisters
description:
According to the instruction booklet, this game was developed while the designer was on a 6-month hike on the Appalachian Trail.  He wanted to come up with a game to pass the time during rainy days that wouldn't take up much space and wouldn't add weight to his backpack. The game comes in a small rip stop bag with a drawstring closure.  The bag contains 6 dice (a pair each of red, blue, and green), a small pencil, and a small instruction booklet.

The object of the game is to control the dice and accumulate points towards a goal score (agreed upon in advance). The playing mechanism involves matching pairs of dice, either by number or color or both.  At various stages in rolling the dice the player has the option to stop and keep their accumulated points or continue rolling and risk losing everything.

title: Driveway Deals
description: Driving Deals is a board game about shopping at garage sales. You're on a mission to collect five random items-- but you don't know what they are. Travel around the board finding the best bargains you can, avoiding pitfalls like parking tickets and unpaved roads, and then get back home to find out if you've picked up what you need.

title: The "I Love Lucy" Game
description: A board game based on the I Love Lucy television series. Players travel around the board gaining cash and act out famous scenes from the series.

title: Stock Car Saturday Night
description:
Print-'n'-Play game by Greg Poehlein brings stock car racing action to your tabletop! This unique racing board game offers cool components in a slick and compact board game design that captures the fast-action feel and strategy of small-town stock car racing in an exciting new way!

The game abandons the traditional oval-track-on-a-board approach in favor of a mechanic that emphasizes strategy and maneuver relative to the other cars on the track. Strategy cards held by the drivers put race tactics and skillful play in control of the result instead of just rolls of the dice.

Any good ol' boy can put the hammer down, but maneuvering through the pack, watching your tire wear and fuel consumption and knowing the limits of your machine are tricks only the best drivers can hope to master. When Stock Car Saturday Night is over, will you be up on Victory Lane making a hot date with the Performance Princess, or down in the garage gettin' greasy under a broken stock car?

The game includes printable PDF files for full-color counters, a two-section mapboard, turn and lap markers, and 160 strategy cards as well as a simple three-page rulesheet. Also included is a unique cardstock construct in the MicroTactix tradition -- a paperback-sized full-color slipcase storage box you print and assemble to hold all the game components, allowing you to display and transport your game after it is printed.

Web Page: http://www.microtactix.com/

title: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Romulan Challenge
Die Schatzinsel
types: Exploration Industry / Manufacturing Nautical Novel-based Pirates

title: Speedway Challenge
description:
Speedway Challenge is a quick playing card game based on motorcycle speedway.

Races feature 4 riders, with rules for 2/3/4 players determining hand size and whether you control one or two riders each - how many races you play is up to you.

A race consists of 5 rounds, with players playing one card per round for each of their riders.  The concept being that the track has 3 lanes (the white line, middle, and round the boards), with bikes only able to play cards in either unblocked lanes, or with a value lower than a bike already occupying a lane that turn.  Since the leading bike gets first play the next turn, there is plenty of opportunity for blocking and jockeying for position before the end of the final lap.

Added to this are the chance of falls, injuries, start line infringements or even mechanical failures, to give a wide variety of race outcomes.

title: Let's Make A Deal
description: Based on the game show hosted by Monty Hall, this version has a large modular stage which simulates the Doors, Curtains, and Boxes. Each player takes turns as emcee, encouraging others to take worthless items instead of prizes which are hidden from view. Whoever has the most winnings at the end of the game wins.

title: Color Match
description:
Color Match consists of 60 random 3x3 grid multi-colored cards which fit over pegs in the 6x6 grid gameboard.  Players try to form complete blocks of 3x3 grids of only one designated color in order to win points.

Although the title does not include Rubik this is a Rubik's Cube-based game, at least from a marketing standpoint.

title: Inferno
description:
Inferno is a card game when you trade souls of famous damned historical character.

An intriguing game of trade when time is the enemy.

title: Verba Volant International
description:
Cardboard tiles (or, in one edition, cards) with letters on them are dealt face down on the table. Each player during his phase turns at least 4 tiles over. The goal is to compose a word with all the turned up tiles; if this does not happen, you turn down the tiles and the game continues.

A game of memory, luck and skill.

title: Behind the "8" Ball
description:
This is a variation of the card game of Poker.  Players move around the gameboard and drop off or pick up cards which potentially make their 5 card hand better.  When they feel lucky they can on their turn wager points and challenge the 8 ball  by shaking it up and turning it over to reveal a randomly selected dealer hand.

Game ends when either a player or the bank goes broke.

title: Agatha Christie: Behind the Screen
description:
This is a VHS Murder Mystery game where the players try to solve the case of who killed Tyler Dudden.

The game contains a 30 minute video and 8 cards.  At intervals in the video you pause and read out one side of the numbered cards.  At the end of the game the players review the clues and try to solve the crime.

There is a booklet with the solutions to all the possible combinations.

title: Numbters
description:
An interesting UNO derivative.

From the box:

All players start with seven cards. On each card is both a number from 1-26 and a letter from A-Z.  Which card should you play and do you play it as the number or the letter? Win rounds by being the first player to get rid of all the cards in your hand. Score points by adding up the values of your opponents' remaining cards. Included is a custom card holder that forms two stacks of played cards - one for letters and one for numbers. The card holder's indicator designates the direction of each stack. Play a card from your hand - making sure it matches the direction of play. If you can't play a card, draw one. There are also Bomb cards, which make the next player play 2 cards (play when you think they can't!) and every card has the possibility of being a wild card, based on the colors of the discard and matching a small 2 colored circle on each card. 

Interesting family card game with some tactical play possible.

title: Eliminator
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSimultaneous Action Selection
description:
Based on Chess, but with less tactical requirements of the player.

Players have eight pieces - six soldiers, a King and a Kings Guard. The player starts by rolling a dice, giving him a number that is the maximum moves that player can make during his turn. He may move any pieces he wants as long as their moves add up to or below the total rolled on the dice. All pieces move once for every dot on the dice except the King's Guard, who moves twice, never less, for each spot used.

This is played out on a chess board with a blue and a red team. Blue moves first. The objectives are either to kill the other King whilst protecting one's own (Eliminator) or just to kill every enemy piece on the board (Speed Eliminator). To perform a kill, your piece must leap frog another. If your piece passes over another - whichever team it belongs to - it is dead and removed from the board.

Each piece has a forward facing arrow on its head except the King's Guard. These show the directions the pieces are allowed to move in. The KG may move in any direction, but for the other pieces to change direction, the directional dice (which tells you which way to turn) must be rolled instead of the movement dice. The result of the roll must be adhered to with one of your pieces changing direction accordingly.

If a piece reaches the enemy's side, it recieves a cap that allows it to move in any direction. This cap is also a shield which can 'die' instead of the piece, should the piece be killed. If the piece lands infront of the King, the cap may be transfered, but the piece must remain in the direction it faces when the cap is removed.

A four player version has been developed and can be accessed from the link below, but email me at writer@philipstobbart.co.uk for the username and password before going for it!

title: Up For Grabs
description:
Up For Grabs: The Make or Take It Word Game

The object of the game is to create or steal as many scoring words as possible.  You can create new words from the tiles that are flipped over. Or you can Grab a word by adding a letter to it to form a new word.

Mindware has a new release of this game and here is their description:
Up for Grabs! Is a quick-to-learn language building game. Hexagon-shaped letter tiles are revealed one at a time. Be the first player to see a word and grab the letter tiles, and the word is yours. Letters will continue to be turned over; at any time, a player can take over your word by adding at least one new letter to it. At the end of the game, words with more than four letters are tallied, and the person with the highest score wins! Includes 100 tiles, score pad and instructions.

title: La Conquête du Pétrole
description:
In the fictional country of Araweit, you compete in the exploration and exploitation of petroleum to be the first to amass 500 MF (500 million francs).

The map shows the country, divided into two zones; the A zone is harder to get to and out of, so exploration permits are cheaper --because only big deposits are likely to be money makers.  Some of the A zone lots are offshore.

What you can do during your turn is driven by the outer track.  Eventually, you'll buy permits, conduct seismic exploration, drill (also a form of exploration), place reservoir markers for oil or gas.  Random events intervene, and nationalization occurs now and then.

The game has a definite educational bent to it.

title: Mental Disorder
types: Abstract Strategy Adventure Card Game Dice Educational Horror
description:
Imagine yourself as an eccentric psychopath, being diagnosed with schizophrenia and having the opportunity to submit to toxic lifetime maintenance medication every day for the rest of your life. Or how about sending someone you just met into an insane asylum because you as a licensed alienist have legitimate authority to clinically diagnose and scientifically influence judgment. These and many other fascinating scenarios, including the care of Lunatics await everyone who endeavors to journey into the hideous realm of Mental Disorder.

On your turn you may: 

    Make a prognosis on another player. 
    Diagnose your neighbor. 
    Submit to Voluntary or Involuntary Treatment. 
    Influence diagnostic battles with Mental Healthcare Professionals and Publications. 
    Use defensive mechanism. 
    Role dice and draw Random Events. 




Game ends when a player acquires 100 Insanity Points (IP) or more. The survivor with the least acquired IP at game end is generally the winner.

title: Surprise Attack!
description:
From the rulebook:

In Surprise Attack!, each player is the commander of a military forceone has his army encamped in the middle of the battlefield at the time when the other hurls his forces into action from the surrounding forest, launching the surprise attack.  The defender suffers early losses, then regroups and attempts to move two of his valuable Command Units to the safety of the forest.  The attacker tries to capture two of the defender's three Command Units before they make good their escape.

title: Scrutineyes Junior
description: The game is played by drawing a card and then racing to see who can find 2 items on the list of 5 first.  The items you find are on 1 of 6 large cartoon drawings.

title: EuroHit
types: Card Game Deduction Spies/Secret Agents Transportation Travel
description:
From the back of the box:

Eurohit is an enjoyable and challenging card game for 3-6 players aged 10 years and upwards.  The rules are easy to understand and allow play to be friendly or cunningly crafty, depending on your style of play and the group of players.

The object of the game is to score 500 points (or over) by visiting as many European Cities as possible whilst keeping one step ahead of the Hit Man.  However, as the Hit Man, you can score points off the other players.

You will soon master the rules, and some, but not maybe all, of the possible stategies, but if you do, there are optional rules to alter the play to make it an easier or harder, shorter or longer game.

The game has a homebrew quality about it (comparable to Cheapass Games products, but in a nice carton).  Noteable for being acquired by Avalon Hill and being reissued as the much maligned Assassin, featuring better components but adds some rather odd tweaks and revisions to the rules.

title: Antipalos
description: Like Hex, Twixt, Connections, and similar games, the object of Antipalos is to connect opposite sides of the board.  Antipalos is played on a 16X16 grid of squares, or 17x17 points.  Pieces are placed in turns diagonally across the squares, connecting vertices.  It is possible (unlike Hex and Twixt) for opposing lines to cross each other, where they meet at a vertex.  Players are limited in the number of pieces that may be played.  When the limit is reached, players must remove pieces and reposition them.

title: Fatal Alliances
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
description: Wargame simulating the First World War using the maps and simplified concepts from the World War II game World in Flames.

title: Temptation
description:
The object is to be the first to cap off your 5x5 grid.

On your turn, you roll the five dice (each of which is 0-0-0-0-1-1).  Each die that comes up 1 earns you a cap and the opportunity to roll again.  If you choose to do so, you roll the 0 dice in the hope of getting more 1s...But if you roll no 1s, you lose your turn and any 1s rolled previously.  Hence the Temptation.  If you manage to get five 1s, you place five caps (see below) and take another turn.

The caps won must be placed in a straight orthogonal line, adjacent to at least one previously placed cap.  You lose the caps won if you can't place them.  You may even cap off part of another player's grid --this helps him somewhat, but may make the rest of his grid harder to cap off, by breaking up the pattern.

When playing multiple rounds, the winner of a round scores the other players' remaining cap spaces.

title: Down the Tubes
description:
Down the Tubes is basically Chinese Checkers with a twist.

The six sections that make up the board can be rearranged in a great number of ways to make play unpredictable.  Simply put, some of the spaces you move your pegs to are deeper than the others, so your peg falls out of the game.  You may then use this space as your piece stands on the last piece.  You must choose your movement carefully and try to remember which spaces are safe!

title: Beverly Hills
description:
The object of this game is to accumulate status.  You do this by trading your Ford up to a Rolls, Mercedes or Cadillac, by dining at the right places and, of course, by spending extravagantly.  Each player starts with a credit line of 25 k$ (cash being too tacky for this game); you win by gaining 500 status point *and* having at least 10 k$ left.

You move about town (the board is a simplified street map of Beverly Hills) and follow the instructions of Status, Bank and Jet Set cards.  When you reach the Gold Streets, you get to patronize various establishments, where you spend money and spin the Status Wheel (which directs you to instruction booklets).

The box is lined with a fake velvet which leaves tiny short hairs everywhere.  Eeek.

title: Space Survival
description:
Known as Survie 2000 in French.

Two planets are in desperate need of the Uranium found on a third.  Whoever brings back the most to his planet, facing natural dangers and the enemy's might, wins.

Ships come in four types: Astrobase (strongest, initially carries everything else), Fighter (fast but weak), Battle-Cruiser (medium strength, carries Laser Gun and Force Field Transmitter) and Carrier (slowest and weakest, transports the Uranium [NOT the Fighters] --may steal the cargo of another Carrier).  Each is rated in Offensive Potential, Defensive Potential and Motion Potential (which is also the Firing Range).  Laser Guns are immobile firing platforms; Force Field Transmitters are obstacles and may be combined to erect linear barriers (when their separation is at most 3 hexes).

Natural obstacles include Magnetic Storm Zones, Asteroids (fixed and mobile) and a Black Hole.  Combat uses a classic odds-ratio table (CRT), with possible results being destruction, breakdown (out of action for a turn) or deviation (moving the ship 3 hexes) --the aggressor may suffer as well as the defender, depending on the odds.  Collisions can occur but not on purpose (no ramming).

title: Kinesis
description:
Be the first to get one of your pieces across the board.  Pieces move only one space on the board but can slide great distances on top of sticks.  Use chains of sticks to quickly advance your stones.  But careful...the chains can also be used by your opponent.

1992 Mensa Select

title: King Arthur
description: Simulation of the mythical battle of Camlann fought between King Arthur and his son, Mordred.  Uses the Great Medieval Battles rules.

title: Paymi
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Children's Game Dice Educational Memory
description:
Paymi consist of two standard 6 sided dice and a deck of 42 cards with the picture of two rolled dice on each card.

The cards are the 36 combinations you can get from rolling two dice plus six extra cards with the doubles on them. Each player start with five cards in their hand. The dice are rolled and the first player to call out Paymi and place down a card that matches the combination rolled wins one chip from the other players if the combination was a double you win two chips. The first player to play all five of his card wins one additional chip from the other players for every spot on each card still in their hand.

The game ends when one player has lost all of his chips and the player with the most chips wins. Adding an extra die or two can make the game a little more exciting.

title: Leagathon
description: This is a football game,  the object of which is to acquire as much wealth as possible during regular season games and in the championship playoff games by making the vital financial decisions that mean the difference between profit and loss.

title: Vamos
description:
The Ultimate Lifestyle Boardgame - Can you collect all 4 Star Bytes and rise to the Ultimate Challenge?.

Players answer cheeky questions corresponding to the square they land on after each throw of the dice.

The categories cover wealth, personality, careers, predictions and inspiration.  Participants must talk non-stop for 30 seconds on subjects such has 'If you could become the sex slave of any person from history, who would you choose?' or 'You are offered 50,000 to appear nude in a national magazine - do you accept?'

Contents:

    Cards in 6 categories
    30-second sand timer
    Mounted board
    Dice
    Pawns
    Notepad
    Secret challenge envelope
    Drawstring bag filled with golden stars

title: Virus Alert
description:
From the publisher's website:

The basic premise of the game is to acquire 10 virus-free Object cards that represent computer resources such as Graphics, Software, Web Pages, Games, Documents, and Email. Action cards provide game play strategy that allows players to introduce viruses (represented by tokens) onto their opponents Object cards. You cant win unless you have 10 Object cards on your side with no virus tokens on them. Other Action cards shield your Objects from viruses (like Anti Virus), and help to clean virus tokens off your Object cards (Cleanup). There are Action cards that allow you to steal a card from another player (Piracy), remove anti-virus protection (AV Killer), or that pesky Virus Generator card (Scan), or search for a card in the discard pile (Backup). Some Action cards like Virus!, Recycle or Repair use a 6-sided die to determine how many virus tokens are placed or removed from your Object cards. This adds an aspect of chance to the game, and helps make every game you play different.

A more attainable goal of playing to just 6 virus-free objects is recommended by some players.

title: Maltese
description:
Maltese uses tiles in an original rummy-type game in which completing sets can enable players to force tiles out of their opponent's hands.

Tiles come in 5 colors, and each tile has an inset in any of those same 5 colors.  Half of the insets will match the tile's exterior, half won't.  So, for example, of the 16 green tiles, 8 have green insets, 2 have orange, 2 have white, 2 have read, and 2 have blue.

All players can see the external color of a tile, but only the owner sees its inset - and the inset color is what really counts.

Additionally, each player has a tile holder (shield) which holds the tiles in 5 rows.  When playing into this section of the shield, all the tiles in a row must be a single color (inset), and each row must be a different color.  So you'll have one row that is all-white, one that is all-red, etc, but you can choose which is which.  Furthermore, each row contains a different # of tiles, from 1-5.  The goal is to completely fill in this section of your shield: a total of 5 matched rows with a total of 15 tiles.

A typical turn involves choosing a tile randomly, placing it into your hand, and then moving one tile from your hand into the central, scoring, part of the shield.  There are two key moves that occur.  One is when you complete a row.  At this point, you announce ALL UNFINISHED ROWS OF THAT SAME INSET COLOR GO BACK TO THE ARMORY (Draw pile).  This is where both the varying # of tiles, and the limited information are crucial.  You could, for example, play a single green tile in your #1 row - and complete it.  If an opponent is working on a larger green row that is incomplete, he may have to discard as many as 4 green tiles.  You know that half of the green exterior tiles are green - so you only have limited information as to which of your opponents' rows might be green, or if they are even working on any green rows.

The second attack move occurs when you complete a row that is entirely matched (Insert color matches exterior color).  You can even do this by replacing unmatched tiles with matched tiles in rows you've already completed.  You then announce ALL FINISHED BUT UNMATCHED ROWS OF THAT SAME ROW NUMBER ARE BACK TO THE ARMORY.  In this case, if you complete a matched #3 row, all opponents who have completed unmatched #3 rows must toss all of these three tiles back into the draw pile.

Game ends when the first player completes all 5 rows with 5 different colors - matched or not.

title: Das große Unternehmen Erdgas
description:
This is the first published game to use a victory point track going around the board (known among German gamers as a Kramerleiste).

This game is a precursor to Wolfgang Kramer's Wildlife Adventure and Expedition games, utilizing similar mechanisms but with a gas pipeline-building theme.  It was produced as part of an advertising campaign (presumably for an oil company?).

title: Fowlplay
mechanisms: Dice RollingLine DrawingRoll / Spin and Move
description:
'Fowlplay, the board game where it's duck season 365 days a year!

Object of the game:  kill your limit of six ducks without going over the limit and return to the clubhouse.

Two to 10 players move shotgun-shaped playing pieces around the board to land in one of four hunting locations:  a blind, a pit, a boat or a log.  Once there, Shell Cards are played to shoot and Duck Dice are rolled to see how many birds fly over.  Players draw from the Duck Deck to see what kinds of ducks they kill; some Miss Cards included.  As players move around the board they may land on certain spaces that require drawing a card from the Draw Deck of various consequences.  Fowlplay simulates a real duck hunt featuring real photographs of six species of ducks.

The game is enhanced by the availability of custom playing pieces with your own picture on them!  Fun for ages 6 and up.  Made in USA.

title: Death in the Dark
description:
Published in 1998, and based off of The Universal Soldiers tabletop miniatures rules by Colin McClelland, Paul Sharpe  John Laing, this game is similar to Mordheim, in its fantasy skirmish theme.  The theme in this game, however, is that of rival mining companies fighting for success in the mines/dungeons/caverns surrounding the underground holdings of Arkonis.

The base game comes with two sides:  the Dwarven Prospectors vs. the Vanir (dark elves) and their terrible spider minions.

The game features upgrading units, hiring mercenaries, and buying weapons and equipment between scenarios.  The combat rules are more streamlined than that of Morheim, and the campaign game is more fleshed out.  You can buy add-ons to the home base of your mining company that can do numerous things for you.  Things that increase income, security, etc.

Many battles take place in the corridors of the mines, but the battle can be taken to a player's home base if needed.  As such, players map out their home bases as they purchase rooms (e.g. jails, vaults, storage, etc), fortifications (e.g. gates, walls, traps, etc), and other assorted upgrades on to them.

RAFM has released other races to play, including Orcs, Undead, and Reptiliads (lizard men) to name a few.  In addition, the game works very well with the line of dungeon scenery from Dwarven Forge.  The playing time noted above should be considered the time for one or two scenarios, including the in between campaign management.  But, like most games of this type, it can go on for as long as you like.

title: Happy Hour: The Game
description:
The object of this drinking game disguised as a trivia game is to acquire trivia tokens for Beer, Mix, Music and Sports.

When a question is answered correctly, they receive a token for the category they answered. When a question is answered incorrectly, the player must drink. If a player has a token for that category, that player doesn't have to answer any more questions in that category. If a player is sent to Hoistland all tokens are lost and that player must drink when anyone rolls a six. That player can only leave Hoistland when they roll a six themselves.

title: La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean
description:
The Battle of Waterloo.

This game came in 2 editions,  an Expansion Kit and a Deluxe Edition.

For the expansion kit you must own La Bataille de Ligny and La Bataille des Quatre Bras as it only contains maps, special rules and background. The Deluxe Edition contains those items plus the counters and basic rules.

The Deluxe edition contains:
  4 34x22 maps
  3 Organizational Displays
  Standard Rules  Special Rulebook
  6 Counter Sheets (2 Quatre Bras, 3 Ligny, 1 Informational markers)
  Charts  Tables

Mont St. Jean is the French name for the Battle of Waterloo, and the Prussians called this The battle of Belle Alliance.

scale = 100 m/hex; 
time = 20 min/GT; 
strength = 50-100 men/SP (Regimental/Brigade Size)

title: Diangle
description:
Diangle is a race game of luck and strategy.

Players race to be the first to complete levels 1 through 6 and back again, in order on their triangular gameboard. Each player has a set of 6 custom dice. Each die is different, having a different face marked in red. Players can complete a numbered level by rolling 3 dice with that number, and then can move on and try to complete the next level. To win, you'll have to move fast,  as you work on the completion of 3 levels a time. The red numbers complete their level all by themselves, giving you the chance to race ahead.

title: Blind Date
description:
Players move around the board putting together pictures of various people for a Blind Date.  Each picture is divided into 25 pieces, which are mixed up during game play.  The player who has his date completed first, with any and all items in his or her hand or attached to his or her body (puzzle) is the winner. The puzzles are the six figures shown in the photo.

The game could be enhanced with further buys of additional picture puzzle sets.
5 sets, each with 6 different pictures, were available.

title: Le Jeu de l'Energie
description:
Each player is  one nation's energy supremo attempting to achieve a 'national energy  plan' by acquiring a combination of oil, gas, uranium and coal units that varies for each nation.  Commodities acquired  surplus to the 'national plan', can be sold on the open market, which is, unsurprisingly highly volatile via die-rolls and the usual medium of card-play.

The object is to be the first to achieve the plan at the same time having a (large) cash surplus.

title: The One World
description:
Subtitled A Strategic Game of the Aztecs 1426-1501.

Internecine Aztec warfare among the Tepanscanpan, Acolhuacan, Tlahuican, Chalco, Tlateputzco and Mexica tribes.

title: AC/DC
description:
From the box:

The game contains 84 cards, each representing a part of an electric circuit. The first player to finish putting together his circuits - before his opponents shock or short him out, wins! It's an engaging way to learn about electric circuits and is suitable for experts too.

Directions and easy explanation of electric circuits are included.

title: Gravity Blocks
description:
The game contains four sets of five uniquely shaped blocks.

Each player or team gets a complete set of five blocks of the same color.  A wooden die is rolled and the color shown goes first.  Players take turns balancing their blocks on a central tower.  You lose if you make it fall over.  The blocks are each made of a different type of wood.

Blindfolds are provided for two player teams.  One person places the block blindfolded while the other coaches.

title: Rocket Flight
description:
Each player starts as a space faring company in the year 2020 trying to make a profit in trade and technology development. The design utilizes the theories of Lagrange Points, Specific Impulse, and Remote Power Sources.

As of 2003, out of print. As of 2010, completely redesigned as High Frontier.

title: Bailiwick
description:
From the box:

'Bailiwick is a fun easy to learn strategy game (only seven rules) of fast moves and quick-thinking, where players zigzag their tokens forward and backward around the rings, while racing to the center. The kaleidoscopic game board is a tricky maze where you must be on guard, because with the roll of the dice and the movement of a token, the whole can quickly shift!

The challenge of Bailiwick' is to wind your way through the four rings, moving your triangular tokens either forward (counter-clockwise) on the colored spaces, or backward (clockwise) on the white ones, and maneuvering them onto the steppingstones, to advance upward, as you try to be the first player to get all four tokens into your matching center bailiwick space.

This game shares some similarities with Pachisi and Aggravation.

title: Chapter 11
description: This game is based in New York City. Players make millions for themselves by buying and selling stocks and real estate while driving other players into bankruptcy.

title: The Ultimate Route
description:
Although billed as a game for Ages 12 and up, this is a very simple roll-and-move game where the object is to make a round trip on a track that represents the Alaska Highway. It starts in Dawson Creek, B.C., goes through Fairbanks and Anchorage, Alaska and then returns to Dawson Creek.

Spaces are either blank, have an instruction to follow, or have you pick one of two types of cards which then give you instructions to follow.

title: Burger Battle
description: Card game where players add toppings (lettuce, mushrooms, cucumbers, egg, onions, bacon) to make the best hamburger.

title: Aeroduel
types: Aviation / Flight Expansion for Base-game Fighting
description:
Aeroduel introduces air power to Car Wars, with complete rules for the expensive but ultra-deadly aircraft of the 21st century. Includes rules for construction, movement and combat for everything that flies -- airplanes, ultralights, airships, helicopters, gliders, autogyros, balloon and even jet packs!

Part of the Car Wars Series.

title: The Pink Panther
description:
The object of the game is to be the first Inspector (the players are all Clouseaus) to catch the Pink Panther four times, thus putting him in the pokey and out of circulation.

The Pink Panther starts in the inner track and rolls two dice; the players start on the outer track and roll one die.  Note that the Pink Panther moves on each player's turn.  Whenever the Pink Panther lands on a Trapped? space, a die against die check is made, re-rolling ties; if red is higher than white, the Pink Panther escapes.  Otherwise the player gets a Pink Panther card.

The players can enter the inner track, triggering Trapped? checks as before.  The risk, however, is that by landing on an Escapes? space, the player may lose a Pink Panther card (this isn't as bad as it sounds, since the space gives a card as often as it takes one).  If both the Pink Panther and the player land on an Escapes?/Trapped? space simultaneously, this is considered an automatic Escape/Capture.

On an Escapes? space, if you have two or more Pink Panther cards, you may go for the Big Chance.  This is a die check as above, the stakes being all of your Pink Panther cards against instant victory.

title: Compact Sprint
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveVariable Player Powers
description:
The game is a simple race between a snail, a tortoise, a squirrel and a hare.  Each rolls a custom die, the hare being swift and the snail slow.  To compensate, each animal's track is of varying length, so they are roughly matched.

Diset has another game of the same name (Sprint), but the latter is a completely different bicycle racing game.

title: Sprint
description:
Build a bicycle racing track (rally-style) using varying puzzle-linked pieces, then race teams across the circuit, jostling for the better finish positions. Random events enliven the race.

Diset has another game of the same name (Compact Sprint), but the latter is a completely different children's animal racing game.

title: Paraguay Pirates
description: Paraguay Pirates, it is a what if ironclad combat game in the XIX century, during the Triplice Aliana War, between Brasil, Argentina and Paraguay.  The game is free for download in PDF format . The game is not available, and your basic engine was improved and changed for the wargame Riachuelos Naval Battle.

title: Swoggle
description:
Players take turns rolling the die and writing that many letters on the crossword grid using a water-soluble marker.  Each space on the grid has either a printed point value or a color that indicates points are to be determined by additional die roll(s).  Players get to choose their own letters so they never get stuck with a letter they can't use.

Best New Word Game 1991 -- Games Magazine

title: Höhlengrölen
description:
Hhlengrlen is a satirical card game of prehistoric musicians in the folk, pop, metal and rap genres, many of whom seem to resemble their 21st century counterparts.

Players collect cards from the deck and discards to form bands in one of the genres or crossover bands in the form of boy bands and girl groups.  Each group's value is based on the aggregate appeal of the invididual musicians, how novel they are and whether they employed singing and dancing instructors, not to mention the all-important stylist.

The boss demands that each producer's (player's) band be an improvement over his last one so it gets trickier and trickier.  This is made harder by the fact that a player may never keep more than six cards. Play over several hands to see who is the best producer of them all.

Card artwork by Lutz Winter.

Premiered Essen 2002.

From the publisher's site:

Perform castings to choose among the (more or less) talented stone age musicians and form succesful bands with them. Maybe you succeed in becoming Producer of the Year. But to achieve that every new band has to surpass their predecessors... no easy task!

60 cards in cardboard box
6,50 
English rules available online at this site: http://www.krimsu.de/indexenglish.html

title: Bamboozle
types: Abstract Strategy Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
From the box:

Bamboozle - The Hide and Seek game with McKeever and the Colonel as seen on NBC TV.

The game board is a symmetric 'battlefield', each side containing 6 huts connected by pathways. A Grey path separates the Red and Blue sides of the board.

Each player starts the game with eight pieces: two marked 1 (which move one space per turn), three marked 2 (which move two spaces) and three marked 3 (which move three spaces). These are also the victory point values of the pieces.

A screen is placed between the two sides and each player places their eight 'men' into one of the six huts (some huts may be left empty). Once all pieces are placed, the screen is removed and the game begins.

On his turn, a player may 'start' a piece (by moving it from a hut) or move an active piece the number of spaces equal to it's value. If a piece can reach an opponent by exact count, the opponent's piece is captured and removed from the game. If a piece reaches a hut, the opponent MUST start a piece from the hut on his next turn (if a piece is hidden there).

The game ends when one player moves 10 points worth of pieces across the Grey center path or, if both players have less than 10, all of his pieces (they highest total wins).

title: Eliot Ness and the Untouchables
types: Abstract Strategy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The game is played on a 24X24 grid that has 24 areas designated as 'mobster hideouts'.  In each of the hideouts a scoring marker (a small cardboard gun inserted into a random scoring base which varies in points from 1,000 to 5,000 points) is placed face down so that none of the players know the values beforehand.

Each player (up to four) is given a set of 30 tiles on which is printed a 'chain' (or in game terms... a police cordon).  Tiles must be placed on the grid so that the 'chain' is continued.  Certain squares on the board provide an additional turn.

When the 'chain' forms a closed loop and encloses one or more 'mobster hideouts', the player who closed the loop takes the scoring markers for all of the hideouts inside the loop.  Placement within the loop is now forbidden and any tiles that exist within the loop are returned to their owner.

When all 24 hideouts have been surrounded, the player who encircled the last hideout gets 1,000 bonus points.  Players add up the values of all the mobsters that they captured and the one with the most points wins.

title: Pferdemist
description:
Horses leave apples as they wander in the pasture, the farmers collect the apples hoping to use the manure in their gardens, the rabbits try to eat the farmers' vegetables and the hunters try to stop the rabbits. The first farmer to score 50 points by growing vegetables and collecting manure wins.

The game is played on a board with a 16 by 16 grid, divided up into four 8 by 8 fields (i.e. 4 chess boards put together). Each player controls a horse that roams around leaving manure in the field. The player's farmer wants to collect the manure to use in his field to grow his vegetables. Each player also controls a rabbit which will try to eat the other players' vegetables and a hunter that tries to keep the rabbit away. In the game the pieces have moves similar to chess pieces. The horse moves like a knight (of course), the farmer like the king, the rabbit like a bishop and the hunter like a rook. Players receive 2 points for each vegetable grown and 1 point for each bucket of manure.

The game may be played solitaire, by 2 or 4 players or by teams.

title: Jactus
description:
This is a commercial game inspired by the dice games played by the ancient Romans.

From the box:

Six sided dice, known as tesserae, were thrown with the highest throw being known as the Jactus Venerus (the Venus Throw). The lowest throw was called the Jactus Canicula (the little dog). In JACTVS, players throw dice in an attempt to be the first to win an image of Venus, the goddess of love; an image of the little dog and a Roman coin.

Contents: 

    4 replica Roman coins
    3 images of Venus
    9 images of a dog
    5 dice marked I, II, III, IV, V and VI




by PAST TIMES, Oxford, England
MADE IN ENGLAND
Devised and created by Oxford Games Ltd.

The back of the rules contain historical information about Roman coins as well as the emperors Hadrian, Antoninus Pius, Septimius Severus and Carausius.

title: Changing Society
description:
A Monopoly clone with a twist... you are never forced out of the game... you just become your descendant, go back on welfare, and keep going.

Components restrict the game to six, but any number can play.  Players keep going until a set time limit is reached (I suggest at least 2 hours) or when the there is only one player left in the game (if played without descendants).  If descendants are being used, the game is never ending and can go on indefinitely.

The highs and lows of society are portrayed by spaces on the board.  Businesses may be bought and sold, players may get a higher education, join a Co-op, become a thief, enter the military, etc.

An additional random element is in the form of 'Change' cards.  With the draw of a card you can become an alcoholic, get busted and sent to prison, become a parent of quintuplets, etc.  Because there are only 54 of these cards, they seem to come up again and again... expecially when six are playing.

Elections make the game the most fun.  During an election, players are encouraged to put issues to a vote... majority rules.  This allows aspects of the game rules to be changed or outright ingored!  Because of this, interesting things can happen, for example: elimination of taxes or a military coup d'etat.

title: Alien Invasion USA
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingSecret Unit Deployment
description: Parasitic aliens have infiltrated a small Midwestern town! The towns inhabitants must find out who amongst them have turned into aliens and defeat them. The 3 player version adds a splinter group of aliens who battle against the townspeople and their fellow aliens and a 4 player version includes government agents, who are only interested in taking specimens  both alien groups or townspeople if need be!

title: Camp Wanagi
mechanisms: Dice RollingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveTile Placement
description:
Camp Wanagi challenges you to be the first to make it out of a maze like forest while being chased by two hockey mask wearing psychopaths.

Along the way you'll get a chance to run into mountains, lakes, dead ends, and cabins (where you can get weapons). You'll also get a chance to trample over your friends as you race blindly to escape the scary forest.

title: Parity
description:
Subtitled The Othello Card Game, Parity consists of a deck of 51 cards, each containing a 2x3 grid of black and white Othello pieces, plus a Centerpiece Card containing the familiar starting pattern of two black and two white.

The game is played in rounds, in which each player plays one card on the table adjacent to the Centerpiece Card or previously played cards.  Whoever played the card that captured the most pieces of one color in that round (using the normal Othello capturing rules) picks up all the cards from that round and puts them in his score pile.

When all the cards have been played, the winner is the player who has scored the most cards.

title: White Collar Blues
mechanisms: Hand ManagementPick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSimulation
description: Experience a day in the office job from hell! Make sales telephone calls, gossip and back stab your colleagues, and perform all sorts of menial tasks (secret or otherwise) all in order to collect Brownie points to please the boss. The day culminates when you must eventually see the boss for your review. The player with the most Brownie points at the end of the day is the winner!

title: Treasure (in the Canadian Rockies)
mechanisms: Line DrawingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Each player has a team of three figures, two adventurers and one guide. The guide is used to collect Grub Stake cards which allow you to climb the mountain and get the treasure. Your adventurers are used to climb for the gold and to delay other players.

The game is interesting in that it has a molded plastic wall which must be climbed. The square 'Grub Stake' cards are placed into slots on the wall to allow a players figure to ascend the mountain.

Movement is by roll of two dice which may be split amongst any of your three figures. The pieces move in a straight line only... no turns are allowed during a move.

If a Bear card is discovered while exploring, it can be used to send an opponent back to start or delay him while he's climbing for treasure.

The game is entirely dependent on the roll of the dice and the cards gained through random draw. Nevertheless, it's a fun little race game with a 3D board.

title: Ben Casey M.D.
types: Medical Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Players roll a die and move through the rooms of a fictional hospital collecting Reports.  There are four different kinds: Symptom, X-Ray, Laboratory, and Spinal Tap.

When a player has collected at least one of each report he may attempt to match these reports to a Diagnosis card.  If they match, the player takes the Diagnosis along with the matching reports and places them in front of him.  If they don't match, the diagnosis is replaced, face down, where it came from.

Play continues until all of the Diagnosis cards have been 'filled'... the player with the most correct diagnoses is the winner.

The only skill involved is in remembering what each diagnosis requires and where they are on the charts.  The rest of the game is simple roll and move and hope that you land on the right combination of Reports.

title: The Outer Limits
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The game consists of a deck of 42 cards:  8 'Radar Image', 32 'Monster Parts', and 2 Wild cards.  A game board is also included which has spaces for up to four 'radar' screens'.

The entire deck is shuffled and five to ten cards are dealt to each player (depending on how many are playing).

On each turn a player draws one card and then may play one card to each active Radar screen on the board.  If he holds a 'Radar Image' and an empty screen exists it must be played (this is the only compulsory play).  Monster Parts may only be played on areas that have an Image.

The first person to get rid of his hand of cards wins.

A good card matching game for Ages 7 - 12... not much more.

title: Steve Canyon
description:
Based on the popular comic strip, Steve Canyon, this game lets up to four players fly their F-105 Thunderchiefs to three different air bases. The first person to complete this circuit wins.

Very luck driven, in that a roll of one die determines movement on the map and also altitude increments of 1,000 ft. Player choices amount to deciding what altitude to fly and which air field to visit next.

Random weather cards cause problems while flying over certain areas of the board or flying through certain altitudes. Fuel consumption is basically one unit every time the die is rolled, and running out of fuel can force a landing at an emergency air field or cause a pilot to bail out.

The game is interesting because of the scale plastic planes used as playing pieces (actual reproductions of the F-105) and in the cardboard 'control panels' which players use to keep track of altitude and fuel. The rules also include a two-page insert describing the world's most powerful one-man airplane in detail.

title: Madcap Monkey Business
description:
From the box:

There's fast-paced fun as players race around a zany zoo trying to take photos of five animals. First player to collect all five wins. Sounds easy enough, right? But somehow the animals always seem to be where you aren't...mainly, because the other players are trying to ruin your chances by moving the animals from cage to cage.

title: The Flintstones Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Prehistoric Racing
description: A very generic spin the spinner and move type game with a Flintstone theme tacked on. The few spaces on the board that differ from the normal spaces tell the player to move ahead so many spaces, go back so many spaces, lose a turn, or draw a card (which tell the player to move ahead so many spaces, go back so many spaces, or lose a turn).

title: Oh What a Mountain!
description:
From the box:

An exciting path game that challenges you to find the quickest route up a very, merry 3-dimensional mountain. 

On the climb, you might go Ram Watching, meet the Abominable Snowball or the Falling Rocks. They're hazards that actually move...pushing, shoving and sweeping you and your fellow climbers from the path and back to the First Aid Station at Base Camp #1. Don't forget the deep, dark cave either, you could easily get lost in it. But don't give up! Even though Oh What A Mountain has its ups and downs, the first climber to reach the peak of the mountain is rewarded with a winner's flag that acually pops right-up to announce the victory.

Happy hiking!

title: Mickey Mouse Follow the Leader Game
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description:
From the box:

Using Disney characters, children play a whimsical game of Follow the Leader on a three dimensional game board. Players travel from place to place on the board stopping to perform various stunts.

title: Dragon Ball Z: Majin Buu Saga
description:
From the box:

In Dragonball Z battle boardgame, you and your friends play your favorite heroes and villains battling to control the seven dragon balls! Power up! Search for dragon balls! And fight your oponents with the best punches, kicks, and energy blasts from the Dragon Ball Z television show.

title: Zeppelin
types: Aviation / Flight Wargame World War I
description:
Germany's World War I strategic bombing campaign against England.

First published game on this topic.

title: Riesenflugzeugabteilungen
types: Aviation / Flight Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
description:
Expansion module to Luftschiff introduces the great multi-engined bombers of the Italian, Russian, and German air forces during WWI and the Russian Civil War. Title means Giant Aircraft Section.

Expands:

    Luftschiff

title: ZRCV: Flying Flat-Top
types: Aviation / Flight Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War I
description:
Expansion for Luftschiff covering the awesome U.S. flying aircraft carriers of the inter-war years. Includes the Akron, Macon, and never-built ZRCV, along with Imperial Japanese Navy units for them to face off against in hypothetical War Plan Orange actions.

Also available as AIRSHIPS AT WAR, 1914-1941 which is a combination package including both Luftschiff and ZRCV with a special color cover.

Expands

    Luftschiff

title: Siege
description:
Siege is a man-to-man small scale combat game set in medieval Europe (maybe around the 13th century).

The game is both a game by itself or can be played as an expansion to Cry Havoc. As a stand-alone game it has 5 scenarios and 2 maps (a camp and a castle). There are rules that cover a range of siege warfare tactics such as siege weapons, fire, breaching walls and scaling ladders. It is well suited for play-by-email format and can be adapted for decent solitaire play as well.

The unit scale is one man to one counter. Each man (or woman! They are here too!) is generally represented by multiple counters or both sides of a single counter to portray healthy and wounded combatants as well as mounted and unmounted (including the horses) where applicable. Each counter has a nicely colored picture of each man with attack defense and movement values in addition to the name of the person depicted.

Integrates with:

    Outremer




The Cry Havoc series page contains information about the game system and history of the game including fan expansions.

title: Trigon Chess & Checkers
description: Chess and Checkers for 3 players using a trigonal board.

title: Viceroys: Expansion Set 1 – Columbus
types: Expansion for Base-game Exploration Renaissance Wargame
description:
Supplementary expansion kit to commemorate the 500th anniversary of Columbus' first famous voyage.

Adds the following:

    Rules for China
    Extra pieces to support an 8th player
    Rules and counters to support the following:
        natural wonders 
        special discoveries
        leader values
        missions and colonial improvements
    
    48 additional cards
    8th office (the Waiter)
    Extra rules:
        variable player order
        land movement
        boarding parties
        hasty fortifications
        colonial construction
        growth of native empires
        technology upgrades
        minimum income
        national revival
    
    Additional scenarios:
        Chinese Admiral of the Ocean
        China and Quick Start empires
        additional random events
    
    Strategy Guide: Pillage, Plunder and Piracy
    Strategy Guide: To the Antipodes!
    Errata
    Rating Scale and VP Point Tally Sheets

title: Big Aisle, Small Cart
description:
Congratulations shopper. You have been chosen to compete on Japan's #1 rated grocery combat show, Happy Fun Shopping Battle. You've completed your physical, passed your psychological testing, and mastered the art of combat shopping cart driving.

Fabulous prizes await the winner, while the losers receive soul-crushing shame... and a lovely parting gift. The eyes of a nation are upon you. Go forth and shop with honor.

title: Monopoly: Hawaii
description:
Buy! Sell!  Pass GO and Collect $200! or Go directly to Jail!

All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in this Hawaiian Edition of the Monopoly Game.  Buy airlines, utility companies, and properties of all types - including the valuable Kahala Mandarin Oriental and The Royal Hawaiian. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels.  Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and you're the winner!

title: Dire Straits
description: Intended as a humourous look at life in the 1980's, this simple roll and move game sees players start with a house, a car and a job.  The goal is to lose everything slower than the other players.

title: Bat Masterson
types: American West Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
This is a simple deduction game.  Player's take on the roles of 'Deputies' and attempt to track down the outlaw known as The Chief.

Six Clue cards, distributed at various locations around the board, tell you who is not The Chief.  The remaining outlaws will hinder your investigation. The game is basically a race game to find all of the clues before your opponents and to drag the guilty culprit back to jail.

The game comes with large cardboard building that are placed on the board. The look of a small western town gives a little flavor to an otherwise bland game.

title: The Man from U.N.C.L.E.
description:
Each of up to four Agents is given an assignment: 'Find your THRUSH Agent and deliver him to U.N.C.L.E. Headquarters'.  If you do this before your opponents, you win the game.

Subtle strategies make this game a little better than your basic 'roll and move' game. Movement is governed by dice roll, but you only get the roll from one of them, unless you roll doubles.

For example: If you Roll a 3 and 5, you choose whether you move 3 or 5 spaces. If you roll a 6 and 6, you MUST move 12.

You may also 'steal' Agents from other players to keep them from winning by landing on them by exact count.  Once you've found your assignment you have to try to keep it a secret before you 'make your run for home base' as your opponents will be out to get you.

title: Airline
description:
Airline is a very simple 'roll and move' game with a few twists.

Players are competing airlines trying to collect money for 'landing rights' at various cities around the world.  You can only collect this money if you have a route (either direct or indirect) from your home city.  Players start with $100,000,000.

Money collected for landing rights varies depending on the size of your airline, indicated by the playing piece (prop, jet, or SST) that you have in play. Once paid, the landing rights to a city may be challenged by paying the owner an additional $20,000,000 and then rolling the dice... high dice wins (ties go to the current owner). If a player cannot pay a debt, he is bankrupt and out of the game.

Play continues until only one player is left and is declared the winner.

title: The Lucy Show Game
description:
Lucy and Vivian are each given a lot of money... the bet is on as to who can spend their money the fastest.

Players roll the dice and move around the board to attempt a visit to every store at least once and spend all of their money exactly.  Players may buy an item at each place they visit.  Everything from Jewelry to Real Estate is represented by cardboard tokens.

The first player to spend all of their money wins.

title: Mankka
description:
A version of the African game of Mancala from Copp Clark.

The game comes with a plastic tray with 12 'pits' and 48 marbles that are used as stones.

The rules provide for three different variations of the basic Mancala game which can aid players who are not familiar with the original.

title: SurfSide 6
types: Deduction Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
A clever deduction game in that you have to pin the 'crime' on another player to win.

One of six houses contains a body... along with three clues: a hat, a gun, and a fingerprint.
