Skirmish is a basic introduction to wargaming. Think of it as a game of chess on steroids. When most wargames fall short of enjoyment because of game length and complexity (Most last between 6-80 hours and take even longer to learn) we have kept this game simple and enjoyable so it can be learned and played in as short as 15 minutes. Of course we have longer scenarios too for those of you who enjoy a longer game! Various game scenarios are included with an open-ended ability for you to add your own, making it a game guaranteed never to collect dust on your game shelf!

For details see http://www.biglittlegames.com/skirmish.php

title: Maze
description: A co-operative two player game that has the flavor of chess.  Each player starts with two pieces, called Mates, that s/he must exchange places with the other player.  There are six other types of pieces with various moving powers.  The challenge of the game is to figure how to move the other pieces out of the way so that the Mates can freely move.

title: Wall Street
mechanisms: Betting/WageringCommodity SpeculationRoll / Spin and MoveStock Holding
description: Maintaining Net Worth is the key to becoming the winner.  Buy stocks when they are down and sell when they are up--unless you are Selling Short.  Once you have enough capital, walk the Chairman of the Board to assess liens on your competition and force them into bankruptcy.  A series of 300 cards determine how stock prices fluctuate.

title: You Need Drew's Truck
description:
A cute little game where you have large items you need to get home and a mutual friend Drew has a truck that can transport those things for you.  Competition revolves around getting the truck to go where you want it to go and arranging for there to be room in the truck for your things.

Aside from moving the truck around the board,  there are also cards you can play to repack the truck, drop things off the truck, give other players flat tires or bad backs or otherwise impede their progress.

The truck is metal and the things are differently shaped magnets. Very much like Tetris in a moving vehicle.

Online Play

     CCG Workshop (no longer available)

title: Worldwide Wines
types: Card Game Educational Party Game Trivia
description:
A card and board game where a wine novice can beat a connoisseur.
Worldwide Wines patented mode of play features Region Cards, which provide the game's strategic element and Money Cards, which educate players to the many aspects of wines of the world. 
Players must collect and BUY certain combinations of Region Cards, which relate directly to the 106 wine regions on the game board map (Winning R. Card Combinations:3 stars/$24 Million each OR 4 wine bottles/$18 Million each OR 5 wine glasses/$14 Million each OR a flush).  
Over 300 Money Cards present players with a wide range of challenging questions and interesting facts on the wine regions, their wine styles and production methods.  The Money Cards also give OR take away the cash needed to buy strategic Region Cards.  WILD Opportunity Cards (included in the Region Card deck) give players the opportunity to buy owned Region Cards right out from under opponents.
All players have an equal chance of winning due to the Region Card strategy aspect.

title: Power Power: The Werecat Card Battle
Monster Collection
description:
A fantasy collectible card game with many of the same themes as Magic: The Gathering. You have a bunch of monsters that you move along land that it set between the two players (with the monsters actually on the land, unlike Magic, but somewhat like the CCG 'Guardians').

Was fairly popular, with at about 4 expansions before a sequel was produced.

title: High School of Blitz
description: An unusual collectible card game that centers on cute characters as its selling point. Each player plays someone who has become class president of a girls high school classroom, and tries to raise a group to save the world from destruction (and battle against the other classes).

title: Aquarian Age
description: One on one collectible card game with a strong emphasis on cute girls drawn by a variety of artists. The theme goes all over the place (fantasy, science fiction, etc). Was very popular, spawning a ton of expansions, multiple art books, a sequel game( Aquarian Age 2), drama CDs, anime, and misc. other merchandise.

title: Girls High School Athletic Festival
description: Try to overcome different difficult athletic events while trying to become the most successful at a high school athletics festival (at least, more successful than the other players). Use items to improve your odds of winning.

title: Langrisser Trading Card Game
description:
Collectible trading card game based off the Langrisser video game series. The main set is based off Langrissers 1-5, and has art by Satoshi Urushihara. There was one expansion set produced, based off Langrisser Millenium, but has a different artist than the main set.

The game has many similarities to Magic, but some major differences, such as no land cards. However, you have generals and monsters that you use to protect #039;yourself#039; much the same way monsters protect #039;yourself#039; in Magic.

title: Monster Jam Truck Game
description: Monster Jam Truck Game: In this fast-paced never-before-seen game, kids can re-create the rugged challenges and outrageous antics they see on Monster Jam television shows. This is the first board game to feature the massively popular Monster Trucks. The game features Hot Wheels licenses, including He-Man and Gravedigger, the hottest Monster Truck around. Cards guide the players through the jumps and stunts of the game.

title: RPM
description: RPM is a word game played on a revolving board. The board is divided into 4 quarters. Each quarter has a top and bottom section. The object of the game is to form and capture words of 2 or more letters by placing letter tiles, one per quarter, as the board revolves. All players make their moves at the same time. The board makes exactly 5 revolutions before it is automatically stopped. This gives each player 20 opportunities to place his tiles. Colored tiles are used to capture completed words.

title: Max Roll
description:
From the Box:

quot;Have you ever had a few minutes between games or between turns in a long game and needed something to do?  This is just the game for you.  Get your friends and play this simple, fast, real-time game of pattern recognition.  You can adjust the level of difficulty to suit the time available and skill of those involved.  A few of the hundreds of variants are supplied with the game.

Contents:
1 Playing mat with inscribed scoring and example patterns.
1 Set of the required dice [each player needs own set].
1 Instruction sheet. quot;

title: Stock Market: The Wall Street Trading Game
description: The idea of the game is to trade stocks: buying, selling and selling short so profitably that one becomes the richest trader and the winner. A player is chosen to 'function' as the Stockbroker. The Market is opened with the turning up of the top Ticker Tape, then unlimited trading in lots of 100 shares may begin. News Cards affect stock prices up and down. A Record is kept of every trade and each change in price. A Market Closing Time is set, at which time all trading stops. Players and Broker settle up at the last price on the record. The game is one of fun, excitement, skill, and educational value.

title: Home You Go
description:
A very simple yet exciting family game for 2 OR 4 players Ages 6 and up

Yes , very simple rules. Each player has 5 men of the same color. These men have to be moved to the other side of the board to win. Movement is by dice and only straight forward (no change of direction allowed).

When  players land in other player pieces that second piece goes back to the start : HOME YOU GO!!

The fun is when 4 people play, as attackers will come from all the 3 sides!!! as the board becomes more and more busy.

It has some simple strategy. Children and adults will like it.

title: Monster Maker Resurrection: The Monster Maker TCG
description:
Fantasy game with the Monster Maker characters. Vaguely similar to Magic, but only in the broadest sense.

Unlike the rest of the Mosnter Maker card games, this one is a collectible card game where players construct their won decks, instead of a fixed-deck set. Also, while the original artist does have cards he drew in this set, it is the first Monster Maker card game to use art from a variety or artists.

There are expansion sets produced for this game.

title: Dragoons in the Donjons
description: Instead of a few adventurers entering a dungeon to fight monsters, in this game, a militia goes down into the dungeon. That militia is composed of the likes of pikeman and infantry.

title: Space Emperor
description: In this game, each player uses his Spaceship and Super Weapon cards to attack the other players, and try to take over territory in space.

title: Tokyo Crisis
description: In this game, you play detectives trying to do the best job solving crimes. Different crimes have different success level rankings in 3 different categories, with a value attached to solving the crime. You want to solve 1500 points worth of crimes before the other players.

title: Flash Fighter
description: Science fiction mecha fighting game. The object is to be the last player alive. There are weapon, defense, support, and special cards. You power up your robot with those cards and try to defeat everyone else's robots.

title: Panic High School
description: A card game set in recent/modern day Japan. Enlist the use of various school clubs (such as the Chemistry Club and Bunny-Girl Club) to help you in your quest to command the school via taking over the most territory in it.

title: Alien High School
description: Alien Highschool is a Japanese card game in which aliens have been infiltrating the Earth for more than 10 years.  Their target is a super-weapon that lies beneath a metropolitan high school for girls.  When the students learned of their plans, they band together to fend off the secret invasion.  Players assume the roles of these students and use their cards to foil the alien schemes.  When all incidents have been resolved, the player who foiled the most schemes is the winner.  One of the player, however, could be an alien in disguise and might betray the team at any time.

title: Tower Quest
description:
Tower Quest is a card game set in a fantasy world.  Players attempt to collect a set of cards to become the winner.

Each player is given a hand of 7 cards at the start, while all the other cards are mixed into a common deck.  One player starts the game by drawing a card from the deck and playing it.  Character cards (those with an icon) are placed face down, while other cards are played face up.  Going clockwise, the next player plays a card of higher value from his or her hand or passes.  The player who drew and played the initial card is the last to decide whether to play a card of higher value or not.  The player who played the highest value card in the pile gains the initial card into his or her collection; all other cards are discarded.  Players replenish their hands after the conclusion of this round and the next round begins with the next player.

Once a player has collected a pre-determined set of Character cards (based on their icons), he or she can call an end to the game.  The players tally their scores from the cards in their hand and collection, and add any bonuses (for ending the game, the collected Character cards, etc).  The player with the highest score is the winner.

title: Monster Hunt
description:
A fantasy game with unique monsters as opposed to having each combat simply being a different strength rating die roll. Monsters each have their own set of attacks: A Cockatrice has Stone x2 and Claw x2 for its attack, and is immune to holy spells and vulnerable to fire; A Ghoul has Fang x1 and Poison x2 attacks, and is immune to stone, song, poison, and curse based attacks.

This game is monsters vs. monsters, neither player has characters that act as adventurers/heroes. There is the usual variety of spells and items and events to affect the outcomes of combat between the monsters.

title: Level Up!
description: A Fantasy card game, with art by the writer/artist of Dragon Half. You play monsters, friends, and items. You defeat monsters to gain experience, and when you reach 4th level, you can then fight the final boss to win the game.

title: Lemlican Series 3: Arms Collection
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy
description:
Final part of an ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This set provides many weapons, as well as various cards meant to make it also playable stand-alone. 
However, it was really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expands

    Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG

title: Lemlican Series 2: Lemlican Monsters
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy
description:
2nd of an ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This set provides the monsters for the game.

Also playable as a stand-alone game, but really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expands

    Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG

title: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit
Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG
description:
An ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This is the base set, this set providing characters, items, and some events.

Also playable as a stand-alone game, but really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expanded by

    Lemlican Series 2: Lemlican Monsters
    Lemlican Series 3: Arms Collection

title: Kimagure Angels
description: A fantasy card game about a groups/parties of characters that have been given a second chance at life. The players play good or evil angels, who grant parties of adventurers a second chance at life. You try to have them finish quests to support your cause.

title: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball
description:
A fantasy sports game, fairly close in rules to baseball. There are many minor rules differences, and characters can be injured as well. You have a team of characters that each have their own statistics. You play cards based on what you pitch you expect the other team to throw, or attempt to throw a type of pitch the other team isn't expecting.

There is an expansion that adds items and spells to the game.

Expanded by:

    Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit

title: Dynamite Nurse 2: Bloody Temple
description: Sequel to the original, this is a stand alone game. It retains the theme (with a fantasy setting) of curing various ills of patients. Problems such as critical hit (an arrow in the forehead) abound, and events such as an uncured patient turning to an Undead can occur.

title: Dynamite Nurse
description: Comical medical game. Slight fantasy feel, with catgirls and the like. Try to cure the illnesses of various people, with some occasionally less-than-efficient nurses (like the intern who completely slips when using her scalpel).

title: Seriously Silly
types: Bluffing Card Game Humor Negotiation Party Game Word Game
description: It will have you rolling on the floor with laughter... If you can even get the words out. Play this Seriously Silly game to learn from others what an inflatable chicken is and what a mentholated hairline is for. The trick is getting your opponent to believe you. So what are freeze-dried underwear for and what kind of person owns turbo sheep?

title: Monster Maker: Space Trader
description: The Monster Maker characters in a science-fiction theme. The game remains similar to the later games in the Monster Maker series, with player, monster, and treasure cards (but of course, no corridor cards).

title: Monster Maker M3
description: Amateur and very unofficial/unlicensed game based off Monster Maker. The box calls it A Sexual Combat of Beautiful Gals in Monster Maker world. Sexual items are used to arouse the characters. Sorry, only the cover will be scanned, this is a family webpage.

title: Gal Master 2
description: Similar to the original Gal Master 1, this is a stand alone game. This adds a few new card types, such as one that requires a player to return all of their defeated monsters (and therefore go back to zero points), and ones that double or reverse the value of monsters.

title: Tank Hunter
description:
Detailed World War 2 card game that covers the ground war. Very ambitous, it covers many countries and their infantry, artillery, and tanks.

An optional expansion named Tank Buster was released, which adds terrain and event cards.

Expanded by:

    Tank Buster

title: Tank Buster
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game World War II
description:
While it says it can be played as a stand-alone game, it is meant to be played as an expansion to Tank Hunter, and adds terrain and events to the units from the main game.

Expands:

    Tank Hunter

title: Gal Master 1
description: In this game, each player starts with a set of 12 hero cards, numbered 1-12. The main deck of monsters is played one at a time, and each monster has a value (a few are even negative). Players then each play a hero card, and the high card kills the monster, and the player gets points equal to the value of the monster. If there is a tie, the highest non-tied character wins, so the winner when heroes rated 9,9,5,and 4 are played is the player who played the 5). At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

title: Horror Hunter
description:
Players play the role of horror hunters, attempting to defeat monsters both magical (like vampires) and mundane (like psycho killers). The game has a light-hearted feel, with (unlicensed) use of many horror characters such as Jason, Freddy, and the girl from The Exorcist.

Players are rated with attack strength and spiritual strength values. Monsters have strength ratings, terror points, and value ratings for when they're defeated. Events can lower your spiritual strength, and various insanities can afflict your character. Visits to a psychologist can restore your spiritual strength.

title: Operation Barbarossa: Moscow Winter General
description:
A World War 2 card game with mechanics similar to the same company's Monster Maker game. You play distance cards to represent the German's travel towards Moscow. There are enemy troops to interfere with your movement, and time cards simulate the passage of time (Winter saves Moscow!).

Includes rules for solo play, or works as a 2-6 player game as well.

title: Monster Maker School Festival
description:
Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 2nd in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this game, there are various events at the school festival worth points to the player who plays the highest rating (1-10); if there is a tie, the highest non-tied ranking wins the event (so the winner when scores of 9,9,5,and 4 are played is the player who played the 5). Some events are unpopular and worth negative points that you don#039;t want to win.

title: Monster Maker School Excursion
description:
Alternate title: Monster Maker Shuugaku Ryoukou

Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 3rd in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this game, everyone goes on school vacations. You need to find someone to go together with; certain characters get along better with each other. You need to find an airplane that goes to the destination card you want to go to. Going on vacations to exotic places are worth the most points; vacations to the Dark Land are negative points.

title: Monster Maker School
description:
Alternate name: Monster Maker Gakuen

Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 1st in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this one, try to match up characters to make them fall in love, but there are such things to worry about like having an ex-girlfriend Succubus.

title: Europe 1520
mechanisms: Area MovementCo-operative PlayDice RollingPoint to Point MovementSimulationVariable Player Powers
description:
If you like Risk and Axis  Alies, you'll love this game. It's all the fun with half the learning. The year is 1520, a time of political and military upheaval as great empires juggled for world power. Meet face to face with great empires such as Ottoman, Iberian, Spanish, Mughal, Safid, Russian, Quing, Japanese, French, English, and more. Will you be the next great world leader? Play this classic strategy game and find out?

For details see http://ajaster.com/biglittlegames/europe1520.html

title: Pargolf
description: Pargolf does an amazing job of simulating the actual game of golf. The game is played over a challenging 6970 yard par 72 test of skill judgement and luck. It requires all the shots you have in the bag.

title: 5 Card Nancy
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Humor Party Game
description:
5 Card Nancy is a card game invented by cartoonist Scott McCloud, author of Understanding Comics and Reinventing Comics, and creator of the Zot! series of comic books (among others).
 5 Card Nancy has never been published, so all existing sets have been constructed by hand.
 The game is essentially an exercise in collaborative storytelling, played with a deck of cards. Each card in the deck features a single, unique panel taken from Ernie Bushmiller's classic newspaper comic-strip Nancy. The strip is still in syndication today (and currently drawn by Guy Gilchrist), but McCloud insists that only panels from Bushmiller's peak years on the strip -- 1946 and later -- are suitable for use in a 5 Card Nancy deck.
 Game play is very simple: an initial card is selected randomly from the draw pile and placed face up on the table. This card will serve as the first panel in the collaborative comic strip that will emerge as a result of gameplay. On her turn, a player will then select a single card from her hand, and place that card face up and to the right of the emerging comic strip. A judge or judges (usually the other players) then vote on the appropriateness of that particular panel to the unfolding narrative. If majority opinion favors the proposed panel, it becomes a part of the strip, otherwise it returns to the hand of the player who proposed it.

McCloud describes the game as a Dada game, by which he means a game in the spirit of the Dada movement.

title: Coma: Guerra Biológica
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenDice RollingPartnershipsVariable Player Powers
description:
The players take turns playing as Body defenses/medication/etc. (one per round), while all the other players play as external agents trying to take over the control of the body.  The battle takes place using a schema of the human body, and the winner is the player, when playing as defense, who can eliminate all the aggressors.
It's a Brazilian boardgame made by one of the best game creator's of this country.

title: Golfer's Dominoes
description: Golfer's Dominoes is a companion set to Dr. Miller's Golf Ace, with similar packaging and somewhat jocular, quirky rules, but there the similarity ends. Dominoes is, mechanically, a much simpler game, based on playing the most advantageous domino depicting one of seven possible golfing situations, from your hand of 4. The 28 dominoes are made of stiffened card and bear simple cartoon-style drawings of a golf ball lying on the fairway, beside a bunker, in a bunker, beside water, in water, beside the hole and in the hole. The player managing to place legitimately an in the hole domino with no hazard domino showing on any of the four ends of the pattern wins the hole.  There is no counting of strokes. The victor is simply the one who wins most holes.

title: You Just Became a Millionaire
description: A player draws a card that poses a question, and each  player predicts how others will answer. Players wager an amount on their prediction and then the question is answered, presumably honestly. The flavor hook to this game is that all players are immensely wealthy, and all the questions are about what they are going to do now that they are loaded.

title: Power Moves
description: A speed based game with 8 different card types. Players maintain a hand of 5 cards. Each time a card is played on the single play pile, it opens up the possibility for certain other cards to be played by any player. What cards you can play will depend on whether or not you have possession and what card preceded it. For example, a block can be played after a shot, but not after a 3 point shot, and after playing it the player would have possession, opening up the opportunity for a shot from them.

title: Farook
description:
This is billed as the ultimate tic-tac-toe and has some resemblance to nine men's morris. The array is 4x4, and players alternate placing one of their 6 pieces on, placing one of the two wild pieces on, or moving/jumping with one of their pieces or the wild pieces. The goal is to get 4 in a row, make a square (2x2), or occupy all 4 corners. There are a number of anti-stalling rules and stakes raising, as in backgammon to round out the game.

1993 Mensa Select

Online Play


     http://www.highergames.com

title: And Now For Something Completely Different... The Board Game
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
The game plays like Snake  Ladders on Spam.

Players line their markers on the Its starting space, roll the die, move forward and try to reach the last space, an illustration of the Python foot. Should a marker land on certain spaces (rose stems and very long, Terry Gilliam-cartoon-like, winding arms), it goes backwards or forwards a certain number of spaces. A pretty simple, straightforward fare up until now, right? Right!
Now the Pythonian fun begins... Several spaces along the track are special and come in three different varieties: Task, Trivia and Character Type.

Task spaces require the active player to draw a Task card and perform the task described on it (e.g. Explain your theory on spontaneous combustion in which must be included goats, a kettle, Venus, a jelly babies and a sock with a hole in it). The other players then vote on the active players performance and, should the vote be positive, he gets an Award card (more on them later).

Trivia spaces require another player other than the active player do draw a Trivia card and read the Python-related question on it. If the answer is correct, another Award card is given.

Character types spaces have, well... character types on them (e.g. Canadian lumberjack, Spanish waiter, etc.) which the active player must take on as a persona until his next turn. If the other players decide he didnt put in enough of an effort, they can just move his marker back to the starting space...

Finally, the Award cards. Apart from some flavor, most of these cards serve no other purpose other than being able to display your proud array of awards. The ones that do have game text on them require the player to perform some sort of task until the end of the game to keep the award.

title: LAB
types: Collectible Components Industry / Manufacturing Miniatures Science Fiction
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingVariable Player Powers
description:
Your creations slowly come to life in the heart of the laboratory.

Have you been smart.

LAB is a miniatures game where you construct electrifying machines to feed your Kryo-chamber with resources. Then your dreadful creations emerge from the inner depths of your machine.

Every monster has  unique features and the challenge is for you to construct a laboratory capable of creating the monsters you want in your horde. After that, you only have to make them obey...

The key to victory is to construct a laboratory optimal to the strategy you have chosen, and use it tactically while defending it from the opponent monsters and ordering your monsters to raze his laboratory.

title: Age of Steam Expansion #1: England & Ireland
description:
Age of Steam expansion set with a double sided mapboard with England/Wales on one side and Ireland on the reverse.

The English/Wales map is designed for 5/6 players.

The Irish Map is designed for 3/4 players and has new rules to cover the special development of the Irish railway system.

title: Wild: Cribbage Expansion
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Humor
description: Wild is a cribbage additive... it is a deck of 31 playing cards that are set beside the crib board. When a player counts a multiple of 5, that player draws a Wild card and follows the instructions on it.

title: Pack die Sieben
description:
Promotional family game, published by Mercedes Benz  Ravensburger.

Theme
A road trip with grandma, grandpa, mum, dad and three children, who all have to be put into the car so that you can be the first to reach the holiday destination.

Goal
Be the first to reach the finish line by successfully completing activities and being lucky in a roll-and-move part.

Game play
The game is divided into two phases:

In phase 1, players try to fill their car (= their player board) as fast as possible. They do so by completing tasks from the activity cards. 
The first area of the board shows a track consisting of spaces in six different colours. There is one pawn for all the players. Players take turns rolling the die and move the pawn accordingly. Depending on the colour of the space the pawn lands on, the active player has to 

     mime or draw one of two words from the card and the other players guess what it is, 
     read a story from the card and everyone guesses if it is true or false, 
     guess if the other players will raise an even or an odd number of fingers, 
     write down what they associate with a word, and the other players have to guess. 




Players who successfully complete a task and players who guess correctly get to spin a spinner showing the different family members. If they haven't already got this family member, they take a matching chip and put it on their player board. Otherwise they have to gift it to someone else.

If the pawn lands on a light or dark pink space, players play The magical 7 (trying to come as close as possible to 7 with two die rolls - the winner spins the spinner) or Spinner poker (betting one of your chips to get to spin the spinner twice - if the spinner points towards the family member you were betting on, you win that chip, otherwise you lose the one you bet).

Phase 2: Once a player has filled his/her car, he/she proceeds to the second part of the board. Here, each player has a car pawn. Players try to reach the finish line as fast as possible. Obstacle tokens and event spaces make you lose or win family members. If a player lands on a space that is already occupied, he/she can steal a family member to fill an empty spot in their own car.

The first player to reach the finish line wins the game.

title: Lakeedah
description:
Lakeedah is an exciting strategy game that's fast to learn and helps build critical thinking and planning skills while having fun. Both children and adults enjoy Lakeedah's varieties of play, which includes two-player, four-player, and team play variations that span the range from very strategic to fast and tactical.

Lakeedah is designed as an Open Source game, that is, players have the ability to create new game variations and submit them to this website and for possible inclusion in the Official Rulebook.

www.lakeedah.com

title: Ghost Train
description:
(from the box)

A 3-Dimensional fearful fun game - but watch out!  The ghosts are out to get you.

Turn the wheels and run the gauntlet of ghastly ghouls!  Get caught in the spookey spider's web!  Sit with skeletons in the haunted waiting room!


Ghost Train is a British game based on those haunted amusement park rides.

The gameboard simulates the inside of a 'Ghost Train' complete with lurking ghosts, bats, skeletons and spiders, etc.

The mechanics (spinning tracks which change direction of movement) are the same as those in the Walt Disney Haunted Mansion Ride Game.

The game simulates many of the 'quirks' of such rides including sudden and jolting changes of direction, dead stops, being 'stuck' at one of the exhibits, and mechanical moving spooks.

Game Play:

Players enter the Ghost Train form the outside in little buggies and navigate the ride while being subjected to detours, directional changes, dead ends, delays and all sorts of creepy monsters.

Players can occasionally spin the turntables to either change a buggies direction (inside the circle) or have an attacked spook knock over an opponents buggy back (outside track) sending it to the 'waiting room'.

There is also a giant swinging spider guarding the exit!

title: Airport
description:
This is a simple family boardgame. Each player operates a delivery company which deliver goods for customers from one city to another via airplanes. Players play card from their hands to finish the delivery job. Amount of money obtained is also written on the cards.

On the map, each city can only be occupied by a player. So hand management is important in planning ones' own delivery routes.

title: Thunderbirds Mission Alert
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
If you have to smile when you think back to the cheesy special effects of your childhood, youll love this nod to the classic supermarionation series, Thunderbirds. More than a nod to nostalgia, this game features completing exciting missions to win. The board features Tracy Island in the center (which is home base) and five zones: Space, Air, Oil Rig, Underground and City. Draw Mission cards to see where youll go, who will lead, what vehicle youll use, what you will accomplish and how many points your mission is worth. Complete the mission and return to Tracy Island safely and you'll get the points. At the end of the game, add up your points to see who wins!

Contents: 
66 Thunderbird Cards 
25 Mission Cards
24 Equipment Cards
17 Thunderbird 5 Cards
6 Pawns
1 die.

For 2 to 6 players.

title: Recycling
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all of their waste without going broke.  The theme is about recycling products, and appropriately, the game components are all recycled materials: milk caps for movers, various beads and plastic chips for the waste products, etc.

title: Star Poker
description:
Object
Create poker hands - pairs, straights, flushes, etc. - to score points. After all the tiles have been played, the player with the highest score wins!

Contents
54 poker tiles including 2 jokers
Scoring chips: Blue = 5 points, Red = 10 points, White = 25 points
7 racks
Disk
Label
Score card

Set up
Players draw a tile from the quot;pool;quot; the one with the highest tile goes first, then play moves in a clockwise direction. Return those tiles to the pool and mix them.

Playing
On a turn, place a tile on one of the seven sides of the disk. Then take a tile from the pool so that you always have five tiles in your hand. Play continues to the second player who can place a tile after the tile just played, or on any of the other sides of the disk. Then he takes a tile from the pool. Players continue taking their turns until someone scores.

Scoring
Players score by making various poker hands: 1 Pair, 3 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, etc. (see POKER HANDS). The hands are formed by combining the last or quot;openquot; tiles in any of the paths leading from the disk.

Blocking
When you do not have a tile that you can lay down to score points, you may want to block the other players from scoring.

5 Tile Plays
Any time a player scores by creating a 5 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, Flush, Straight Flush, Royal Flush after receiving his points for that round, ALL of those tiles that were used to score are turned face down so that they cannot be used again. Players can play tiles from their hands off of the turned down tiles, as if starting from the beginning (tiles placed before the turned-down tiles cannot be used to form hands).

Note: Do not turn the tiles over upon creating 2 pairs and 4 of a Kind. This allows for the creation of a Full House and 5 of a Kind.

Jokers
A joker can be used as a quot;Wild Cardquot; to represent a ny tile. (Color does not matter - a red joker can represent a spade or club, etc.) The player that places a joker determines what tile it represents; the joker will remain as that chosen tile for the rest of the game. If another player holds the tile that the joker represents, he can play that tile as well.

Points Chart
Some of the scoring in Star Poker differs from the scoring in the standard poker game. This is due to the probabilities of creating different hands.

1 Pair = 5 pts.
2 Pairs = 10 pts.
3 of a Kind = 30 pts.
4 of a Kind = 75 pts.
5 of a Kind = 100 pts.
Full House = 40 pts.
Straight = 50 pts.
Flush = 50 pts.
Straight Flush = 100 pts.
Royal Flush = 100 pts.
Blue Chips = 5 pts.
Red Chips = 10 pts.
White Chips = 25 pts.

Ending and Winning the Game
Players continue until there are no more tiles to draw from and all tiles in their hands have been placed. In a four player game, once a player draws the tile that leaves two tiles left, the game ends after that player takes his turn. In a five player game, play until there are four tiles left and in a seven player game, play until five tiles are left. The player with the most points wins.

title: L'Encanteur
description:
L'Encanteur - the French fish auctioneer
The bidding's master of ceremony - l'encanteur - used to sing prices.
The song-bidding system is a two-phase process : first, the price decreasing phase and then the price increasing phase.
Each player impersonates a restaurant owner.

Goal : Be the first to serve your secret fish-combination after having made your shopping at the song-bidding.
Game turns are played by pairs : morning is when you go to the song-bidding and buy your different species of fish or seafood, afternoon is when you try to serve the best your clients.

Number of players : 3 or 4
Ages 8 and up
Average length : 15-20 mn.
Number of cards : 110 cards (rulebook in French, English, Dutch, German)

title: Up Periscope
description:
Each player has four merchant ships which they are trying to race across their own side of the board to the home port. They also have a submarine (which can attack the merchants) and a destroyer (which can counter-attack the sub).

The game is basically like Battleships with movement. The cool part of the game is the board.

The board stands up vertically and each player plays his own side of the board. The ships stay in place as their bases are short pegs that fit pretty tightly in holes on the board. The board is made of a sandwich of two thick card boards with a thin sheet of rubbery plastic in between, so you can't see which holes your opponents ships are in. But you can push your torpedo and depth charge through the hole, stretching out the rubber and popping your opponents ship off the board. Coolest physical game mechanic ever! No, wait, it gets better! At the bottom of the board is a periscope. Yes, it really has mirrors. You slide this left and right to any column of the board, and then peek through the eyepiece to sight the enemy. You get a view of one column of the board and a peripheral view of the columns each side. If you get a sighting of an opponents ship on the central column you can try and estimate the range and torpedo it. The enemy destroyer then gets a shot at counterattacking your sub. The view through the periscope looks just like looking out from a sub and seeing ships peeping out of the ocean (nicely painted board) along the line of sight. Absolutely the coolest physical game mechanic ever!!!

Board: 13 x 13 square grid

Pieces each side: 4 Merchant ships, 1 Sub, 1 Destroyer, 1 Torpedo, 1 Depth Charge

title: Commander
description: Commander is the game of airplane pilots. Each player must collect a certain number of flight Km, making his own career by piloting bigger and bigger airplanes, and choosing starting and ending airports. This is easily made by rolling dices to travel around the world and rolling other dices to be able to take off and land on each airport.

title: Quick Count
description: A furious scramble to circle the numbers from 60 down to 1 on a pad of paper. The catch? Only 1 pencil! While one player searches for numbers, the next player rolls a die continually. As soon as he rolls Quick Count! he grabs the pencil and begins searching for his numbers as the next person rolls the die.

title: Photopress
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description: In this funny and easy old game the players act as photo reporters. Their objective is to get the highest number of photos of some important people and then sell them, before those people travel away, making the news obsolete. To do this players roll the dice and walk in a maze like area of streets. Some major streets head towards particular places (Park, Theater, Industry, Airport, Zoo). Players roll dice and the roll of those dice decides which v.i.p. moves and where each goes.

title: Passtimes
description:
Passtimes: The Game of History challenges players to answer questions about events in our past.  The game is played among groups or individuals, who are given pairs of tokens to move on the board.

When a player takes his or her turn, a card is drawn for them.  The player must answer a set of questions printed on that card.  If they answer a question correctly, they roll a die and move one of their tokens by the die's result.  An incorrect answer ends his or her turn and starts the next player's.  If a Time Warp card was drawn, the player switches one of his or her token with the token closes to the ending square.

The first player to move both of his or her tokens to the ending square wins and ends the game.

title: Super Nova
types: Card Game Collectible Components Economic Political Science Fiction Wargame
description:
From the Rules Introduction:

Super Nova is a game of intergalactic expansion and conquest. Players start from their home worlds, discover new planets, and compete for control of other planets. Power is wielded militarily, diplomatically, and economically, with an occasional natural disaster thrown in. To win, you must create the empire that supports the most population.

Super Nova was originally published in a collectible format, but is now published as a 165-card complete game.

Expanded by:

    Super Nova: Event Horizon

title: Merge War
description:
Publisher's Description:

Acquire.  Liquidate.  Control.
Join the ranks of the global financial elite in Merge War.  Take control of an international corporation, acquire the building blocks of world monopolies, and mercilessly steal assets to thwart your rivals!  The first CEO to hit one trillion dollars wins, and has the world economy in his iron grip.  In this game for 2-4 players, do you have what it takes to reach the top?

Contents:
46 game cards
2 reference cards
2 rules cards
All cards are black and white, business card size, and packaged in a small zip lock bag.

title: Spuren im Busch
description:
A band of 12 poachers is sought out in Casablanca. Before they can be arrested, they succeed in escaping to the Rif and Atlas mountains. From there, their tracks lead to the south and the east of Africa.

The players in this game represent game wardens who try to follow the tracks of the poachers through Africa to their hiding place in order to arrest them, meeting many exotic animals along the way.

During the game, the players move their pawns on the spaces marked 1 to 36 and pick up the small tracking tiles, which show them, where the tracks of the poachers lead. Each player on his destination sheet draws in the tracks that he has uncovered. With each game, there is only one set of continuous tracks from the space marked 1 up to one of the hiding places (spaces A through K).

The goal of the game is to follow this continuous set of tracks and discover which hiding place the poachers are using. A player that knows or believes he knows the correct hiding place can arrest poachers from that space. The winner is the player who arrests the most poachers from the correct hiding place.

title: Go Bark Card Game
types: Animals Bluffing Card Game Children's Game Educational Memory
description:
Go Bark is the matching card game that has it all: 4-color pictures of dog breeds, special strategy and lots of barking out loud. Use cards for traditional Go Fish play or the more advanced Go Bark play. Special Bark Cards will get you woofing and yapping to throw players off your scent. 54 premium playing cards plus instructions included. 48 Dog breed cards, 6 Bark Cards plus instruction card included. Teachers love Go Bark for educational play!
www.gobark.com

title: Combat
types: Abstract Strategy Movies / TV / Radio theme Wargame World War II
description:
The object of Combat is to occupy enemy headquarters or capture all the enemy soldiers. A spinner is used for movement and escape and capture decisions.

In more detail, this is a strategy game for two players. The theme is from the Second World War War, as was the TV series from which the images on the cover of the game were taken. The playing is simple ,you control 6 soldiers and you move them through the game board by spinning the game's special wheel.

There are also at your disposal order cards that either can help you or cause you trouble.

title: Buy or Sell
description: Educational game based on stock market charting.  Players each have their own stock chart, created by the placement of tiles that depict stock chart patterns.  A player can play on his stock with a rising pattern, or play on his opponent's, with a declining pattern.  Not a bad way to learn about this 1960's technique of stock market analysis...don't know if it's still in vogue.

title: Florida
description: Florida is the first in a series of multi-player games that captures the excitement and drama of the Age of Discovery. The players must brave hostile Indians, storms and fight each other in an attempt to build settlements in this new land.

title: Living Life
description: Subtitled the reality game that gets real, Living Life is more of an experience than a game. It comes with 30 real-life adventures designed to guide you to live your life to the fullest. Examples of the cards: Watch the sun rise, contact old friends, and take a day trip.

title: Hannibal: The Italian Campaign
description: Hannibal is a medium complexity strategic simulation of the Carthaginian General's campaign in Italy during the Second Punic War. The game is played in a series of turns composed of a number of phases. Field combat, sieges, siege combat, recruitment, and Roman elections are all taken into account.

title: Norseman: Viking Kingdoms of the North Sea
description: Norseman is a game of the latter half of the Viking period. The game is played in a series of turns, each of which is composed of phases, each of which may contain one or more sequenced segments. Raid, trade, incursion, levy, and outright warfare are all covered.

title: Who Said That?
description: Who Said That? is a party-style self-expression game, in which players write down their own answers to a common question posed to everyone.  The playing objective is for each player to accurately predict which opponent provided which answer, although the real point of the game is as a conversation starter.

title: Hot Corner Baseball
description: Hot Corner Baseball is a typical tabletop baseball game in the genre of Strat-o-matic or Statis Pro.  Its original contribution at the time of its release was to be the only game offering complete cards for all teams and leagues going back well into the 19th century.

title: Arguile
description: Arguile is an abstract strategy game with some similarities to checkers.  One color plays red, the other black, and players can jump opposing pieces, including multiple jumps, as in checkers.  The twist in Arguile is that each player also holds three cards, unknown to the opponent, which can be revealed on the player's turn to turn over all of the disks on a diagonal.  The game is a combination of abstract spatial strategy, combined with timing the playing of one's cards for the optimal moment.

title: Thunderin' Guns
description: The board shows a typical stretch of Hollywood West: there's a town at the center with a rail line and a stage line running through it, a badlands in one corner where the outlaws hide out, and an Indian village in another corner. Players take the roles of outlaws, sheriffs, marshals, or gunfighters; round up gangs or posses and then either rob the stage/train/bank/whatever, or chase those that do, or challenge each other to gunfights, based on their profession and location on the board. Gunfights are abstract and are handled by a single roll of the die on a CRT. Outlaws win by stashing away loot, lawmen win by stashing away outlaws, and gunfighters win by reaching a high enough reputation level.

title: Tiddlycroquet
description:
Tiddlycroquet is played to rules similar to outdoor croquet.  The only changes are to allow you to use counters rather than balls.

The object of Tiddlycroquet is to be the first to get your small counters through all the hoops in the correct order and direction and then hit them onto the peg.

The hoops are set out on a table or other hard surface in a set pattern (or create your own).

Two to four people can play, or with 2 or 4, play with all counters or as partners, choosing which of the two counters to flick on your side's turn.

When your counter hits any other counter, called a 'roquet', you place your counter on top of the counter it hit, and flick the two together, called 'taking croquet'.  You then flick your counter once more.  If you flick either counter off the table your turn ends.

If you flick your counter through a hoop, you get another turn--and more chances to 'roquet' the other counters.

title: Kage
description:
The surround and conquer strategy game.

The object of Kage is to cage your opponent's bird, that is, to surround your opponent's bird with a continuous enclosing border made of bars while preventing your opponent from doing the same to your bird.

On your turn you may move your bird or place a bar on a line.

title: Melvin the Moon Man
description: Space Explorers must roll the die and collect moonbucks along the way.  The astronaut with the most moonbucks at the end of the game wins.

title: Le Camino
description:
In this game the players (2 or 4 playing as partners) are trying to connect two opposite corners of the board with a road.  Unlike in many connection games, the players' roads may cross each other and even run contiguously.  In addition to the roads, there are rivers and railroad tracks which interfere with placement.  Players score based on the length of their roads (shorter is better) and the number of rivers and railroads crossed over (fewer is better).  There are a number of rules which together can cause significant numbers of forced placements in a way vaguely reminiscent of Fresh Fish.

The game won l'Oscar du Jouet 1974 in the Jeux Senior category.

title: Super Nova: Event Horizon
types: Card Game Economic Expansion for Base-game Political Science Fiction
description:
Event Horizon is the long awaited expansion set for the science fiction card game Super Nova.

The supplement features 60 all new cards, including two new alien races, plus new ships, planets, and specials. There's also an all new type of card, the Event card. Event cards are played during the Event phase (a new phase that occurs right after the Draw phase) and include things like Mass Insanity, Floater Migration, Temporal Storm, and Emperor's Birthday.

Note, however, that this is not a stand-alone expansion. You need a copy of Super Nova.

Expands:

    Super Nova

title: Backscrabbing
mechanisms: Commodity SpeculationHand ManagementRoll / Spin and MoveStock HoldingTrading
description:
(From the Back of the Box)

Backscrabbing is the exiting new game that lets you use your skills in making deals and back scratching and back stabbing your way to the top. A real world game, Backscrabbing  combines subtle strategy with a little luck for fast and funny entertainment!

The object of Backscrabbing is to become the controlling shareholder of a large corporation. This is accomplished by rolling the dice, moving around the board and following the instructions on a series of cards.

There are also failed stabs, punishments, scapegoats, Team stabs and more. Watch the excitement level rise when players are given just 30 seconds for free-for-all trading!

title: Destination Mars
description:
From the box:
Will you be the first to Mars?
Only if you play your cards right. Move you spaceship closer to Mars by matching your cards for points. But watch out for asteroids, comets and space junk!

title: Force
description:
The game is played on a square 12 x 12 board with holes in it. During setup, twelve pins are put in the holes, and both players now place two elastic bands (Warp Bands) from one board side to another, wrapping them around the pins.

The object of the game is to free your Warp Bands (those placed by your opponent) so that they no longer touch a pin. To accomplish this, both players take turns in which they place a pin on the board and remove another pin. This placement is restricted: each hole on the boards shows one of six symbols, and the hole from which a pin is removed must carry the same symbol as the hole in which a pin is placed.

title: Off Course
description: Players advance around a Monopoly style outer board collecting cards which they use with a die to play an inner 9 hole golf course.

title: Fields of Chivalry
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenDice RollingRock-Paper-ScissorsVariable Player Powers
description: Fields of Chivalry  is two games. The Tourney and The Joust. The game is played on a fold out paper board with figures and scenery cut from card stock. Combat cards and a chart are used to determine outcomes.

title: East & West: Global War in 1948
description:
East  West is an Axis & Allies expansion set in 1948.  The siege of Berlin has dissolved into open warfare between NATO and the Warsaw Pact.

Contains:

Detailed rule book
130+ miniature plastic playing pieces
Chips

title: Captain Tsubasa Trading Card Game
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Sports
description:
This Trading Card Game is based on the famous Captain Tsubasa comic/animation. The theme is about the World Cup 2002, in which Tsubasa leads the Japan team to challenge soccer players from other countries.

Konami Japan also uses the similar rules to release another TCG, the Perfect Eleven.

title: Käp'tän Buddel
description:
Kp'tn Buddel features a 6x6 grid of large dice, which represent a treasure-filled island.  Players use the rolls of regular dice to place pirates on the island, move them around, and dig (by turning the island dice to higher numbers).  Digging far enough gets you treasure chips and the object is to be the first to get chips valued at 15 gold.

There is a tactical variant in which players get action points to spend each turn instead of rolling dice.

The game was originally published in 1989 under the slightly different title of Kp'ten Buddel (in a limited edition of 100 copies), and then re-released in 1992 in Abacus' white-box series.  In the later version the treasure chips are pulled from a bag, in the earlier version they are picked up with a magnet on a stick (the chip colors are also a bit different).

title: Abaco Zuzzurellone
description: Based on a Italian Dictionary (but it can be done with any dictionary in any language) A.Z. has got a number of cards on which there are written two words. After a card is taken, each player must think and write the highest number of words of the dictionary that stay between those two. The game is easy and liked by addicts of the genre, and it's easy enough even as a party game, although it may be boring after a while.

title: Top Quark
description: An abstract game in which players move their pawns by an increasing number of positions at every turn, following certain predefined directions (that cover the board as if they were sorts of circles), that can be blocked by other pawns. The objective of the game is to eat the opponent's pawns by falling exactly on them. It looks like a sort of checkers variation, although mechanics are rather non-intuitive and the game is neither as fast nor as original as other abstract modern games.

title: Murder Mystery Party: A Taste for Wine and Murder
description:
An entry in the Murder  la carte mystery dinner party games.  The story:

It's a tour of California Wine Country with its peaceful vineyards and picturesque wineries.  The annual wine-tasting festival is in full swing when the body of local vineyard owner, Barry Underwood, is found hidden beneath his wine cellar.  Barry has been missing for six long years but with the discovery of his body comes a wealth of new clues to solve the mystery.  It's a vintage murder and you may be a suspect.

The suspects are: Otton Von Schnapps, Marilyn Merlot, Tiny Bubbles, Ralph Rottingrape, Papa Vito, and Hedy Shablee.  Extra guests are Bonny Lass and Bud Wizer.

Contents:
- Party planner with recipes and menu by Cookbook Author Sandra Gluck - including music and decorating tips
- Character Booklets for all suspects, includes their roles and background information
- Eight Place Cards
- Eight Party Invitations and Envelopes
- Six Secret Clues
- Cassette Tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime.

- more recent versions replace the Cassette Tape with a CD.

title: Murder à la carte: Pasta, Passion & Pistols
description:
An entry in the Murder A La Carte series of murder mystery party games.  The story:

The succulent aroma of home cooked pasta is drifting from New York City's most popular Italian eatery, La Speranza, but something else is heating up the kitchen...cold blooded murder!  Restauranteur, Pepi Roni, has been shot in the back with his own pistol.  Tonight his family and friends will gather to pay their respects to poor Pepi, but one of the guests won't be shedding any tears.

The suspects: Rocco Scarfazzi, Bo Jalais, Mama Rosa, Angel Roni, Marco Roni, and Tara Misu.  Extra guests: Father Al Fredo and Clair Voyant.

Contents:
- Party planner with recipes and menu by Cookbook Author Sandra Gluck - including music and decorating tips
- Character booklets for all suspects, includes their roles and background information
- Eight place cards
- Eight party invitations and envelopes
- Six secret clues
- Cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events, and the solution to the crime

title: Murder à la carte: Bullets 'N' Barbecue
description:
An entry in the Murder A La Carte series of murder mystery party games.  The story:

It's the Old West.  A town called Drygulch.  The morning stillness is broken by the crackle of gunfire.  Moments later the townfolk find Sheriff Take Noble face down in the dust.  shot in the back.  Who would do such a thing?  Plenty of people.  Maybe even you.  Later that day you and the other suspects belly up to the bar at the Paradise Saloon to solve the crime.

Contents:
- Party planner booklet containing menu and recipe suggestions, music and decorating tips
- Character booklets for all six suspects, includes their roles and background information
- Six place cards
- Six party invitations and envelopes
- Six secret clues
- Cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime

title: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the S. S. Titania
description:
An entry in the Murder Mystery Party line of murder mystery party games.  The story:

Who killed Captain Yardarm?  The time is 1st April 1928.  The place is at the Captain's table on the maiden voyage of the S.S. Titania.  Captain Yardarm is holding a party to celebrate the maiden voyage.  Unfortunately the Captain will not be joining the party as he has just been found dead in his cabin by his steward, traces of poison were found in his pre-dinner cocktail.  Each guest wanted the Captain dead as he knew nasty secrets about their past.  Join us in solving this murder on the S.S. Titania.

Contents:
- Invitations to be sent to your guests
- Complete instructions on how to host your party
- Background information on each character
- Clue sheets for each of the six rounds
- Costume suggestions
- Menu suggestions
- Tape recording of the murder
- Name tags for each guest
- Solution to the murder

title: Floß geht's!
mechanisms: Dice RollingModular BoardPattern RecognitionRoll / Spin and Move
description: Players race their rafts along a variable game board. First one to reach the river mouth wins. Players advance their rafts by matching the symbol on their die to the next one on the river tiles. On a player's turn, he may roll his own die or someone else's. He then advances his own raft down the river. Anchors (don't move) and suns (wild) add more chaos to the mix. For players age 4 and above.

title: Fleet Fins
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Memory Nautical
description: Similar to memory, but with a twist. The cards are illustrated like fish. Half of them are placed face-up on the board, along with Seamus the Old Seadog. A stack of tiles are flipped one at a time, with the players racing to put their net over the right fish card on the table (or occasionally, Seamus). The player who catches the most fish wins. Ages 4 and up

title: Audit: The Tax Game
description: This board game centers around the yearly encounter with the Internal Revenue Service and the preparations necessary to successfully deal with this confrontation. Players try to convert taxable money to non-taxable by landing on positions which contain various tax shelters and credits.

title: Lodz 1914: First Blitzkrieg
description:
LODZ 1914: FIRST BLITZKRIEG is an operational simulation of the clash between German and Russian armies in Poland during November and December of 1914. The game is intended for two players, one taking each side, but is suited for team or solitaire play as well. The German side represents the forces of 9th Army, and the Russian side represents the forces of Northwest Front. Lodz 1914 is a detailed study of this battle presenting a realistic combat system, Army, Corps, and Division HQs, artillery, engineers, reserve movement, reconnaissance and more.
A wargame very mobile and giving both sides enough opportunities for attack and defend.

title: Espionage
description:
The most challenging game of strategy ever created! sayeth the box...proof that truth in advertising laws weren't quite so stringent in the early 70's.

Espionage is an advanced roll and move game similar to the Project KGB games from the same time period.  Each player tryies to be the first to move their four spies from Mission Control to the waiting helicopters in the Abandoned Airfield.  Along the way there are various pitfalls to slow the players down and cloak and dagger spaces which require drawing a card and doing what it says.  Movement is handled by rolling the two dice and either moving one spy the sum of the two dice or two spies the amount shown on one die (i.e., a roll of 2  3 means you can move one spy 5 spaces or one spy 2 spaces and a different spy 3 spaces).  Landing on an enemy spy sends that spy back to the nearest safe area, so the game is cut-throat to be sure.

Towards the end of the board, at the Guerrilla Camp, players draw a letter card for each spy that they want to pass through to the airfield.  The requirement is that the player be able to spell out a word with their letter cards in order to win the game (four letter cards - one for each spy).  If a player doesn't like the letter they drew, they can return it to the deck and wait until their next turn to draw another.

title: Circus Mouse
description:
Players take turns moving the mouse hole frame around the board (one space at a time orthogonally) trying to get to the space that shows the face-up treat tile. Moving to a cheese space allows the player to continue moving. Moving to a cat space ends that player's turn. The player that moves to the correct treat space claims the tile and turns over the next one.  The first player to collect four treat tiles wins the game.

Box contents:
- Game board
- Mouse Hole frame
- 18 treat cards
- Instruction card

title: Who Am I? The Biography Game
description:
Blurb from the back of the box:

Every life has a story.

For the past twelve years, Biography and A  E Television Networks have profiled well-known personalities from all walks of life - from actors to astronauts, sports heroes to scientists, politicians to playwrights.  Who Am I? The Biography Game challenges your knowledge of such personalities through clever clues and insightful anecdotes as players hear first-person hints and have to guess Who Am I?

Based on the column from Biography Magazine.

Ages 12 and up

title: S.F.3.D II Operation Faserei
description:
(from the back of the Twentieth Century Imports version:)

S.F.3.D #2 is a fast-moving, realistic 2-player game of war. It is a sequel to S.F.3.D #1, and is meant to expand this game. While it can be played separately, most of the scenarios enclosed involve using maps and counters from both games. This game has been thoroughly playtested in the U.S.

Limited, Numbered Edition of 2,040.

- 480 Superb, die-cut, double-sided oversized counters; most are entirely new units (sp) types (see box front and back).
- 3 folding, full-color, semi-geomorphic mapboards.
- 24-page Japanese rules book, and...
- 16-page English rules book, numbered.  This book contains the complete S.F.3.D rules, not just the new features to this edition.  New features: Morale, Artillery, Mines, Engineers, Fire, Smoke, Elevation, Infantry, and others.
- Variants by the American Play test Team.
- 12 New Scenarios, in booklet form.
- 2 Combat Results Cards, 2 Dice, 1 counters tray.

(C) 1986 - Twentieth Century Imports, USA

title: Leopard II
description:
The game of tank combat in the future war.  In case you don't know, this game is not a sequel.  A Leopard II is a type of German tank (for all you non-grognards).  This game uses hidden movement and several maps of the same terrain on two different scales.


(Blurb from the sticker on the American box from the importer:)

LEOPARD II is a tactical tank game using 5 second turns and pitting the West German army against the Soviets.  This Si-Mov Hidden movement game has 15 countersheets using 3,000 highly detailed game counters, a plotting pad, 6 unmounted maps, rulebook, 6 CRTs and charts, dice, 30 cards detailing various AFVs, and fully translated English rules.

Imported by Quarterdeck Games who brought you PACIFIC FLEET, YAMATO, and BITTER END.

QUARTERDECK GAMES,
P.O. BOX 658, CAMBRIA, CA., 93428.

title: Full Metal Planete: Plateau Modulaire
types: Expansion for Base-game Science Fiction Wargame
description: You thought you knew all about Full Metal Planete? Thanks to these 19 modules made of rigid cardboard, positionable in an infinity of combinations, you will be able to compose and discover tens of thousands of unknown sectors of this mythical planet. You want a rather mountainous plateau, or a marsh? You prefer a large river, or a chaotic archipelago? It is up to you to decide. This box also contains additional rules as well as 19 elements of 37 hexagons.

title: Isaac Asimov's Robots VCR Mystery Game
Hetzer Sniper!: Sniper Companion Game #1
description:
From the back of the box:

You send a squad to draw fire, and if they draw fire and come back, then you know where the Germans are. - anonymous soldier in Normandy, 1944

Hetzer: the Bushwacker.  Not just a tank, but a strategy.  In the hedges of Normandy, the mountain villages of Italy, and the forests of Belgium, Allied and German soldiers fought a tense, cat-and-mouse war.  Sudden death hid inside every hedgerow and farm.  It's not just a tank...

HETZER SNIPER! GAME OF MAN-TO-MAN COMBAT IN EUROPE, 1940-45

HETZER expands the popular Sniper! (second edition) game system with an in-depth examination of man-to-man combat on the Western Front in World War II.  Scenarios cover the German blitz of 1940, the Allied crawl up the Italian peninsula, and the furious fighting in the dense hedgerow country in northern France.  Fighting vehicles are covered in great detail, with game statistics on over 40 tanks, trucks, halftracks, and armored cars.  Players can select squads from seven nations, plus paratroopers, S.S., and volksgrenadiers.  Campaign rules allow individual squads to fight their way through an endless series of battles, losing casualties and gaining experience along the way.

HETZER is a complete game; the SNIPER! game is not required to play HETZER.

DESIGNER: Steve Winter
COMPLEXITY LEVEL: Medium
PLAYING TIME: 1 to 4 hours
NO. OF PLAYERS: 2
SOLITAIRE SUITABILITY: Medium

COMPONENTS
(2) 22 x 34 maps
(1) 24 p. Rules book
(1) 16 p. Rules book
(1) 8 p. Scenarios book
(3) sheets of vehicles
(2) six-sided dice
(1) counter tray
400 die-cut counters

(c) 1987 TSR Inc.
Stock No. 3022
$15.00 U.S.

title: Panguingue
description:
Panguingue (pan-ginn'-gay), or Pan, is a popular rummy game in the Western part of the United States.  Its origin is unknown, but it was regularly played in gambling halls during the California gold rush.

Pan is played with a deck of 320 cards (8 standard decks with the 8's, 9's, and 10's removed -- no Jokers).  Each player is dealt a hand of 10 cards.  The winner of the hand is the first person to meld 11 cards (his 10 card hand plus a draw).  Certain melds are called conditions and result in the player collecting chips from the other players.  There are rules regarding what is a valid meld, folding at the beginning of the hand, and so on.  Check out the link to the rules at U.S. Playing Card Co., if you are interested.

title: Spongebob Squarepants: Deep Sea Duel
types: Card Game Children's Game Collectible Components Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Spongebob Squarepants makes his inevitable, though short-lived, entry into the world of collectible card games.  Deep Sea Duel is the name of the entry-level starter deck for the game and at least one expansion was released to expand the game.  In the game, players attempt to talk customers in different locations into trying a nice Krusty Krab Krabby Patty.  You win the game either by katching 4 customers each from different locations, 4 customers from the same location, or a mixture of both.

Play begins by drawing a hand of 5 cards, taking a card from the separate Location deck, and placing it in one of 4 slots in the middle.  The potential katcher (active player) may then play a Katcher from their hand under a location to attempt to katch it.  (They may play up to 2 Katchers under two separate locations, but both are played at the same time.)  The opposing player can attempt to stop the katch by playing a strategy card from their hand, or playing a Katcher of their own from their hand.  Players go back and forth in this Showdown until one does not want to, or cannot, respond.

The last Katcher played by each player is compared, and the one with the highest Patty Pouch wins.  If the potential katcher won, they take the Location card.  If the opposing player wins, they have stopped the katch and the Location card remains on the board.  Once a turn is over, both players may discard up to 2 cards if they wish, and then both draw until they have 5 cards in hand each.

title: 3 SPOT game
description:
From Mr. de Bono's website:
The intention was to produce the simplest possible game that could be played with a high degree of skill. An attempt was made to fulfill the following conditions:

1. A minimum number of playing pieces, preferably one each. 
The smallest possible board.

2. A game with very few rules, one that would be very simple to learn and play.

3. A game that could be played with a high degree of skill.

4. A game that would not be determinate. A determinate game such as nim or noughts and crosses, is one in which the starting player could always win if he knew the strategy. An indeterminate game is one which two perfect players would play for ever.

The object is to score 12 points provided that the other player scores at least 6 points - if the other player scores less than six points then the player reaching 12 points is the loser! Whereas in most games the person scoring the highest number of points is the winner - in the 3 Spot game the 'winner' can be the 'loser'.

Points are scored by the position of the tiles on the board which is a 3x3 grid. You can try to score the points you need, or force your opponent to take points.

Appears with L-Game in Rex Games' Two Smart Games mini-anthology.

title: Cyber-Sea
description:
From the www.GamingReport.com review:

Cyber-Sea by Delmer Esau is a new version of an independent board game for two to four players. Like the original game, The Fish Tank, each player of this game controls a team of soldiers including a ronin, a hacker, and three foot soldiers on a mission to rescue a genetic super fish. Well, rescue may be a little overly noble. Steal the genetic super-fish is a more accurate description of the game mission. Naturally, in the world of undersea warfare, the competition is fierce so killing as many of the enemy is a possibly close second game objective. The teams fight each other, while having to overcome locked hatchways, flooded chambers, and automatic guns. The game is available from RPGNow.com in electronic PDF format. To play, all the components have to be printed out with subsequent cutting, folding, and possibly even gluing required.

From the product website:

Infiltrate a Pacifica research facility with your hired Ronin and their mercenary team. Hack the installation computer net with your Fader. Lay down the firepower with the Gun-suit heavy combat unit. Kick ass. Take names. Then put the game away till you do it again the next day...

Game is available from http://www.blackpowdergames.com

This game is out of print.

title: Uncle Happy's Train Game
description:
A crayon-rail game for kids that is reminiscent of Milton Bradley's classic Game of the States.  Has two levels of play:

At the first level, players are dealt five state cards and have to connect them all together with rail along with an east-coast state and a west-coast state.  The first to do this wins.

At the second level, a random load chip is drawn and added to each of the five state cards.  The winner is the first player to connect up all five states plus the states that produce the loads (the coastal states requirement is dropped).

A spinner is spun each turn to determine how many (adjacent) states a player can hook up to their line.

title: Duo
description:
Colors and numbers in a duel of dice. Two players. Two strategies. Two chances!  
  
Roll the dice, observe the colors and select the numbers for getting the best result.  
  
Duo. A lucky duel and reasoning

title: Itty Bitty Battles
types: Adventure Fantasy Fighting Print & Play Wargame
description:
Itty Bitty Battles is a free-for-the-download Fantasy Wargame designed along the lines of Swords and Sorcery and other fantasy battle games.  Has a somewhat unique speed-based initiative system where units locked in battle engage in a hierarchical fashion (spells first, missile weapons next, etc).  Units move in formation with a leader counter commanding.  The leader counters act like initiative chits.  Combat resolution is fairly normal, a modified CRT system with major column shifts.  IBB has a ton of stuff in it including a combat magic system for Priests and Wizards.

Download here: http://micro.brainiac.com/ibb.zip

title: Peanut Panic
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Real-time
description:
From the box: A game with peanuts that bounce and elephants that pounce.  It's a panicky contest where every peanut counts.  It's an all family game from Tomy.

The circus game with elephants any kid can tame.  Tap your button and the peanuts begin to bounce.  When a peanut stands up in the center ring, make your elephant pounce on it.  But watch out for the other elephant or he'll snatch your peanut away.  The player with the most peanuts wins.  This nutty game is a panic for kids 5 and up.

title: Hook Line & Stinker
description:
From the box:
A funny magnetic fishing game for 2 to 4 players. No reading required. Ages 4 and up.  Featuring Scratch and Sniff Skunk. Some assembly requires.

You catch fish or you catch junk but you better watch out or you'll catch the skunk!!  Scratch and sniff him if you dare a terrible odor fills the air.

The first person to catch 3 fish of the same color wins.

title: Quadrature
description:
Played on an 11 by 11 board.  If you form a rectangle with 3 of your pieces and one of your opponents pieces, your opponent's piece is converted into one of yours.

1993 Mensa Select

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: Tanbo
description: Played with a standard Go set.  Players take turns adding stones to the board, forming roots - no clumps or enclosures.  When roots run out of space they die and are removed from the board.  Object: kill all of your opponents roots and completely eliminate his stones from the board.

title: Impasse
description:
Played with a standard Checkers/Draughts set.  Singles move diagonally forward any number of squares. Doubles move diagonally backward any number of squares.  Kind of a blocking, racing game.  Draws and ties cannot occur.

Object: remove all of your own checkers from the board.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

title: The Play's the Thing
description:
From the back of the box:

The Setting - London, England in the year 1603.

The Players - You and your friends, all Elizabethan actors.

The Plot - Dash and duel your way around the Globe Theater board.  Watch out for stage mishaps, missed cues, and even the plague while you collect scenes - plot lines, quotations, and characters - from Shakespeare's latest plays.

A Happy Ending - to win, collect and perform the most scenes.  No acting necessary, unless you want to!

To Act or Not to Act - Beginners to experts can play together on these four levels.
1. Novice: You know nothing about Shakespeare's plays and just want to have fun.  To perform a scene, simply lay down matching sets of cards, Rummy-style.
2. Apprentice: You're not familiar with a play, but want to be by the end of the game.  To perform, answer easy questions.
3. Scholar: You know the play, and want to review it or learn more about it.  To perform, answer tougher questions.
4. Actor's Choice: You love to act, but may or may not know the play well.  To perform, memorize and recite lines - with feeling! - one short scene at a time.

What's Inside - 

     Master Card Set: Hamlet, Julius Caesar, Romeo and Juliet
     Globe Theater game board
     6 Actor Playing Pieces
     1 Die
     Booklet with rules, background, and a recommended reading list




Expanded by:

    The Play's The Thing Comedy Set

title: Justice League MegaClash
description:
Based on the characters of DC Comics' Justice League of America, two players fight battles at five different locations, attempting to vanquish the enemy.  Wonderful artwork on the cards is reminiscent of the Justice League Cartoon Network series.
