The game bears similarities to Lost Cities and Schotten Totten.  Although lighter than those two, there are still interesting decisions and choices to be made in this fast and fun game that takes about five-to-ten minutes to play.

title: Dark Horizon: Notice of Termination
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fighting Science Fiction
description:
From the rules introduction:

In DH: Notice of Termination, one player controls the agent for an underground organization called PUNT (People for a UNified Tomorrow), as its agents infiltrate the Talobar Technologies megacorp headquarters.  The other player controls the Talobar CorpGuards who will do whatever possible to stop them.

From the back of the box:

Dark Horizon: Notice of Termination is both an introduction to the Dark Horizon game system, and an expansion to the popular Dark Horizon: Escape.  [...]

Advanced rules include:

     Weapon-linked cameras - ceiling-mounted, computer-controlled cameras linked to LazRifles or SMGs
     Armor-piercing flechette pistols
     Blast weapons like mines, grenades and timed charges.  And not all of these blast weapons go Boom!  Some produce chemical or radiation effects
     Rules for aiming and peeking around corners
     New rules for Gen2 cybermods for even more enhanced performance
     Complete rules for ratigators
     Rules for aiming at figure locations, and using weapon scopes

title: Lay an Egg
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Electronic Farming
description:
From the box:  The all-family game that will give you lots of cackles.  As the chicken goes around in a circle, the player that makes her lay the most eggs wins.  It's Grade AA fun for everyone Ages 5 and up

As the chick approaches your egg basket you push a button to make her lay an egg.  If the player times his push right the chicken will swivel its rear and an egg will drop out of it's body.

The chicken even makes a clucking noise as it goes around in a circle...

title: Toothache
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Humor
description:
This game is the logical companion to Operation.  Players require steady hands and strong nerves to extract teeth without making their patient SCREAM!

Patients have different numbers of teeth to extract.  Side teeth are more difficult than front teeth.  A probe and mirror are the only tools to be used.  One slip and the patient screams loud and long.

The teeth with their specially designed hooks are carefully nudged from behind the patients mouth.  Only by using the mirror can you see what you are doing.

title: Newtown
description:
Newtown is a city building game designed to be used as a modern teaching aid in leading university city planning departments. Students play individually or in teams. Players take turns buying land and building on it. Earn points for placing homes near schools and churches, factories near water routes and railroads. At the end of each round, town meetings are held to pay taxes and vote on the locations of community facilities (from schools to dumps)

A professional version for educators was published in 1967. A simpler commercial version (still with some educational material) was published in 1971 and a still simpler version in 1972.

title: Corsairs and Hellcats
types: Aviation / Flight Card Game Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
(from GMT website:)

Volume IV in the Down in Flames card game series covers World War II in the Pacific from mid-1942 until early 1945, starting where Volume III (Zero!) left off.

Corsairs  Hellcats is a DiF Gamette, including all of the major late war aircraft types developed by both sides (Zero! is required in order to play this gamette). Allied players can fly the game's namesakes, the F4U-1 Corsair and F6F Hellcat, as well as the British Firefly, the P47-N, and the P-61 Black Widow. Japanese players can counter with two models of late war Zero, the Ki-84 Frank, the N1K1 George, and the J2M Jack. New bomber types include the TBF Avenger, the B-29 Superfortress, and the Ki-49 Helen. There's even a new kind of bomber: the Attack Bomber, which can strafe and bomb. Two types are present in Corsair  Hellcats: the B-25C-1 field modification and the solid nose B-25J, which carried a dozen (!) fixed forward-firing .50 caliber machine guns.

All of these aircraft (plus many of the ones in Zero!) are used in seven new campaigns. Eastern Solomons and Santa Cruz are carrier campaigns like those pioneered in Zero!. Solomon Islands, Philippines 1944, and Okinawa use the land campaign structure familiar to players of the previous games in the series. The other two campaigns are quite different, though. Guadalcanal models the drawn out struggle for control of the airspace above that island. Players allocate available aircraft to two missions each week in an attempt to force a withdrawal by their opponent. The campaign also includes the option to play the Eastern Solomons and Santa Cruz campaigns as part of the battle, feeding the results of the carrier encounters back into the main campaign. B-29s in China is a solitaire campaign representing the beginning of the strategic bombing offensive against Japan. The player controls three Superfortresses and must balance their activities between training, carrying supplies, repairing damage, and conducting bombing missions.

In addition, Corsairs  Hellcats includes new target types, skilled pilots, and ordnance. The game also has rules for Kamikazes, supply drops, submarines, and mine laying. There's even a new method of selecting skilled (and green) pilots and crews that reflects the changes in aircrew quality that both sides went through during the course of the war. Are you ready to relive history? Can you sweep the skies in the cockpit of your Corsair or Hellcat? Pilots, man your planes...

NOTE: In order to play Corsairs  Hellcats you must have a copy of Zero!.
 CONTENTS:

    88 full-color, die-cut counters
    124 full-color Playing Cards
    7 Campaign Map Displays
    One Player Aid Card
    One Resource Sheet
    6 Target Displays
    4 Campaign Logs
    16-Page Rules Booklet




Designed by Dan Verssen
Developed by Mike Lemick

title: Ten Speed Card Game
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Educational Math Number Racing
description:
This game is in essence a competitive flipping game.  Each player takes one deck of cards and lays eight cards on the table.  Someone says go and players race to find one or two card combinations which sum ten.  The first player to exhaust their deck wins.

The game can also be played solitaire with different rules.

title: Hockey Card Game
description: Pass! Shoot! Score! An action packed card game based on NHL strategy. Using real hockey strategy, the object of the game is to obtain possession of the puck, shoot on net, and score more goals than your opponent(s).

title: Balderdash Junior
types: Bluffing Children's Game Educational Humor Party Game
description: From the box:  If you thought Balderdash inspired new heights of silliness among adults, wait until the kids get into the act!  Balderdash Junior features an entirely new set of crazy-sounding but real words that will have kids laughing for hours.  Players choose the best definition for such Balderdash words as quot;Ichibooquot;, quot;Towillyquot;, and Mohoohooquot; and get the chance to make up definitions of their own.  It#039;s all the fun of an American favorite... but this time, it#039;s for the kids.  Balderdash Junior, for 2 to 6 players.

title: Walt Disney Character Master Mind Game
types: Abstract Strategy Bluffing Children's Game Deduction Memory Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: From the box: Walt Disney's Master Mind is the child's version of the World's Greatest Game.  The Walt Disney cartoon characters add extra excitement and fun for children.

title: Who is it?
description: From the box: The object of the game is to find a particular child from among 64 children as quickly as possible.  This is done through skillful questioning and clever deduction.  The winner is the player who identifies the child after the fewest number of questions.  The game, for which there are three, very different variations, provides fun and excitement for the whole family.  That, in fact, important processes such as logical and deductive thinking and powers of concentration are all integral to play.

title: Rocket Hockey
description:
From the box: The ultimate game of speed and reaction! Send the puck zooming into your opponent's goal as he tries to block it! First player to score 10 goals wins.

The metal puck can get going pretty darn fast in this game. It is a game of pure reflex.

title: Trap Door
description: The object of the game is to get three marbles to the center bin before your opponents.  On your turn you roll a die and then move one of your marbles that many spaces.  If you land on an opponent you press your marble against your opponents.  Some spaces are trapped and others aren't.  If your opponents marble falls into a trap down they fall and out they go.  The trapped marble must start over again.

title: O Senhor dos Anéis: A Sociedade do Anel – A Guerra do Anel
types: Adventure Children's Game Fantasy Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
Name translates as The Lord of the Rings - The Fellowship of the Ring - The War of the Ring.

The Fellowship tries to reach Mordor, while the forces of Evil try to stop them. Tiles with arrows determine direction of movement and attack, which may be reversed as long as counter-strike tiles are played by both players. Dummy tiles are used to hide the actual number of counter-strikes a player has.

Either side wins by defeating all enemies, but the Fellowship also wins if any member reaches Mordor.

title: Hockey Challenge
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenDice RollingMemoryRoll / Spin and MoveTrading
description:
From the box:  NHL Hockey Challenge is a game of fun and strategy that takes you through the excitement of the regular season to playoff action while testing your memory of NHL trivia.  There are over 1000 questions designed to match any player level.  Just choose your game level and match wits with friends and family.

Roll the dice, land on a team and you own it.  Try to collect as many teams as possible to better your playoff chances.  When all 21 teams are owned, the regular season begins as teams compete against each other until only the top 8 teams survive.  The top 8 teams enter the playoffs and play each other in the best of three matches, until only one team reigns champion.

title: TV Guide: The Game
types: Electronic Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description:
Players divide into two teams and answer television trivia questions in their choice of three difficulty levels from categories announced at random by an electronic remote control.

Contents:
TV Guide Book with instructions and 2,700 questions, electronic selector remote, gameboard, 2 pawns, 4 scoring clips

title: Box Office
description:
From the back of the box:

Box Office is the game you've been playing all your life.  Everyone has a favorite movie line, and Box Office has over 2,400 of the best movie quotes of all time!  You won't need to know them all to win!  Some of the lines have clues in them and some are so famous you'll know them right away.

Playing Box Office couldn't be easier.  Hear a movie line and just guess the movie title.  Watch out though!  You may land on Flop squares or Impersonate Hollywood's most famous stars on your way to fame and fortune.

Contents:
1 playing board, 1 die, 50 Flop cards, 40 Impersonation cards, 450 Quote cards, 5 player pieces, 25 Nomination Chips, 1 set of directions and 1 card box

title: Wyrm Wars
description:
Wyrm Wars is a simple card game wherein players attempt to meld cards of like color.  Melds score points geometrically proportionate to their number of cards.  Several special-power cards as well as Dragons and Wyrms (which can remove a card from an opponent's meld and cancel a card as it is played, respectively) add variety and flavor.

From the back of the box:

In ages past, the Powers-that-be manifested themselves in spectacular conflict.  Enter the war.  Order the great Wyrms into battle.  Build an empire.  Spy on your opponents.  Then dispatch a Dragon to devour your neighbor's precious little Unicorn.  Smile.  Eat pretzels.  Drink (root?) beer.  And, rain havoc down from above.  Only five minutes to learn.

Contents:

     90 full-color cards with fantasy themed art
     rule sheet

title: Foursight
description:
From the back of the box:

FOURSIGHT - a classic game for two, is the only board game that actually allows you to play half of your opponent's pieces as well as your own.  To win, you must learn to think like your opponent and have the foresight to change your strategy as conditions of play change.  Your object: get 4 in a row to win immediately or three in a row four times.  Colored scoring pieces may only be played on neutral (foundation) pieces.  Plan your strategy well, because once you've placed your pieces on the board, they can't be moved.

FOURSIGHT combines the simplicity of tic-tac-toe with the challenge of chess for a game of infinite variations.

title: Maptitude
types: Bluffing Card Game Civilization Educational Territory Building Trivia
description:
From the back of the box:

Master the globe, with luck and strategy!  Three paths of Maptitude action lead to triumph:

1. Match borderlands to capture scoring tokens.   
2. Use tactical skill to gain valuable cards for the Country Showdown.    
3. Be first to claim a country from all six continents, and take the Continent Sweep!

Up to four players hone their global ability with every round, winning countries and scoring tokens on the way to the final reckoning.

The Maptitude deck also serves as an excellent set of flashcards!  Game includes 200 highly-detailed cards; a full-color, current world map, and 50 scoring tokens.

Ages 10 and up.

title: Oxfurd Bluff
types: Educational Party Game Trivia Word Game
description:
There are a number of word games, of varying difficulty, on the market, but none Words has encountered has the appeal of Oxfurd Bluff, a creation of Manvers Games Inc. of Toronto.  Ignore the game's trifling title and press on; there is much here to tantalize and fascinate word freaks. (And we'll skip the details on the rules; they're easily grasped. There is a strong element of guesswork and chance involved.)

For example, must is defined on one of the game's cards as (1) in law, an exception to a standard code or doctrine; (2) an elephant in heat; (3) the juice of various fruits before fermentation.

Number two is correct (an awesome must), as is number 3.

(Taken from a review of the game by Lew Gloin in The Toronto Star - Sunday, July 14, 1985)

title: Domino's Pizza Delivery Game
mechanisms: Dice RollingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Players are competing Domino's Pizza drivers who draw orders and attempt to deliver them in time.  And naturally, it comes in a box that looks like it could hold a pizza...

From the rules:
The DELIVERY GAME is genuinely realistic and exciting to play.  Driving situations that occur are everyday encounters taken from real life situations.  Both licensed and unlicensed drivers will enjoy the opportunities for success and the challenges faced by the delivery person.  Game participants will develop safety awareness, rules of the road knowledge and a better driver attitude while having fun trying to win!

title: The Tennis Game
description:
(Please note: there is no publication date on this game.  The date entered above is an estimate.)

A simple tennis game.  It comes with a board, a cardboard quot;ballquot; token, a deck of movement cards, and a deck of action cards for each player.  Each action card deck contains a result for a serve and a volley (e.g. quot;Ace on serve, Smash to Crosscourt on Volleysquot;).  Movement cards specify places on the court with the occasional special action, such as quot;Slipped/Fellquot;.  Players start with a hand of cards and must play movement cards facedown before the opponent#039;s action card is revealed.  If the player#039;s movement card took them to the appropriate spot on the board to return the shot, then they get to play an action card.

title: Mystify
types: Deduction Educational Party Game Word Game
description:
From the back of the box:

MYSTIFY is the exciting party game that has players racing against each other to solve over 1900 mystery words, names and numbers in five different card categories.

When the timer is turned, the fun begins:  players start scribbling away in frantic pursuit of the elusive answer which is literally staring them in the face.  A clue tells you if it's a Famous Actor, Popular Musical Figure, Place, Object, Date, etc.  Who will be the first to say, Aha, I've got it?  Anyone can blurt out a guess at any time - but with only one guess allowed, you had better get it right!

Ages 12 and up.

Contents:

1920 Scrambles
884 cards
Gameboard
Playing pieces and die
Notepad
30 second timer
1 page instruction guide.

title: Universe
types: Abstract Strategy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Parker Brothers pentomino game for 2 to 4. Play the last piece to win the game.
This game is an updated version of the earlier Pan-Kai by the same author, to which Universe adds the three and four players variants.

The game box featured publicity stills from the movie 2001: A Space Odyssey.  In the movie, one of astronauts plays Universe with Hal (the computer). This scene was cut and replaced with Dave playing Chess with Hal. The director thought it would be more understandable by the audience.

The game doesn't mention puzzles, but there are plenty of patterns to try to make with the pentominoes. For example, form a 5x12 rectangle, or a 6x10 rectangle, with one set of pieces.

The two player form of this game was published in 1961 as Pan-Kai

title: Good Old Houses
description:
The game consists of eight puzzles of houses representing different architectural styles popular in American history. There is a series of games for different age levels, all designed to familiarize players with these architectural styles.

From the rules:
GOOD OLD HOUSES is a series of games about American architecture. The objective in all the games is to entertain while building an awareness of some basic architectural styles. The houses in this set are illustrations of general styles rather than portrayals of specific, existing buildings. (Neighborhood houses seldom show all the style traits illustrated here. In some houses only a single feature makes a style recognizable, while in others there is a mixture of style traits.) The range of styles, from Federal to Bungalow, isn't intended to encompass the breadth of American architectural history, but to represent the basic building styles most frequently employed between the late 18th and early 20th centuries when the greatest thrust of settlement and urban development occurred in the United States. After playing the games in GOOD OLD HOUSES, players will be more observant of houses in their own neighborhoods and better able to describe what they see.

The eight house puzzles (12 pieces per puzzle) are used in four different games for 2 to 8 players. The games are divided into three levels determined by age: under 8, 8 and over, 10 and over.

title: See the USA
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Educational Travel
description: A player spins the spinner to get a letter and then turns the sand timer over.  That player has until the sand runs out to peg as many locations as he/she can on the USA map that begin with their letter.  The first player to peg all of their locations wins.  There is also a variant where everyone plays simultaneously.

title: Cashflow 202
types: Economic Educational Expansion for Base-game Math Number
mechanisms: Betting/WageringCommodity SpeculationPaper-and-PencilRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionSimulation
description:
Cashflow 202 is an expansion to Cashflow 101 that focuses on Technical Investing including a simple system for options and short sales. The expansion pack is a new set of four decks of cards and new player sheets to handle the new investments possible. It is unplayable without Cashflow 101.

Components:
Capital Gain Deal cards replace the Small Deal deck.
Cash Flow Deals replace the Big Deal deck.
A new deck of more punishing Doodad cards replaces the 101 Doodad cards. 
42 Market cards replace the 101 Market deck.
Stock shorting envelopes for each player for the two major stocks players can make short sales in. (Unfortunately with glue still on the envelope flaps that people will invariably forget and lick shut.)
(4 cassette tapes on investing.)

Major rule changes
Market Deck is now reshuffled after drawing 25 cards, removing the guarantee that all Market cards will be played.
Also, a new rule exists that attempts to fix how the Market deck was under drawn with 2-4 players. Now landing in the Rat Race on either an Opportunity or Market space causes you to draw both a Deal card (your choice still large or small) and a Market card each time.
In the Fast Track, landing on a business you already own allows you to franchise it. Pay the down payment, add an additional token, and receive the additional cashflow listed on the board again.

Players not only start by filling out their sheet with a ?career? as before, but also randomly draw a starting investment portfolio as well.

The game is definitely more chaotic and not as idiot-proof as Cashflow 101, and investments can be entirely wiped out. The game teaches gambling theory and cash management. For instance, if a bet only wins 1 in 20 times, but pays off 50:1 when it does, this is a good bet. The issue then is cash management through the losing cycle placing bets steadily while waiting for the payoff.

title: Bluenose
mechanisms: Betting/WageringCard DraftingHand ManagementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Bluenose is a fishing game based on the famous Canadian sailing ship Bluenose.  The object of the game is to navigate your ship out to the fishing grounds and return safely with a catch of fish which are sold at market.  The prices of the market are controlled by cards.  The price of half of the fishing commodities are known and the other half hidden at all times.  Navigation out to the fishing grounds is done by rolling of die.  In addition, there are wind currents to speed up movement and shallows and rocks to avoid.  The paths closer to the rocks are riskier, but generally faster.  A collision with rocks causes a shipwreck and the loss of your catch.

The first person to reach the agreed upon amount of money (through selling fish at market) is the winner.

title: 007 James Bond: You Only Live Twice
types: Adventure Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
From the back of the box; Aboard 'Little Nellie' the one-man flying machine, James Bond travels to the volcano where suspicious events have been reported. Suddenly the mission turns into a deadly fight, where every second counts as you struggle to outwit the enemy helicopters emerging from a hidden opening in the volcano!

Overview: A recreation of the air combat scene from the same movie one player plays James Bond moving around the board seeking to destroy his opponents with a vast array of arms (machine guns, missiles, rockets, flamethrower, and air mines) while the opponent with his four helicopters tries to blow up Little Nellie with machine guns. The board is dot/line spaces over a painting of a volcano where some dots are high elevation and some are low elevation making it easier and harder to hit your opponent.

title: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Inc.
description: No longer satisfied with being a  child's pasttime,  Rock, Paper and Scissors have all gone into business against each other: Rocks Inc., Paper Inc., and Scissors Inc. Your job is to invest in these rising new companies and make more money than your opponent. How? Well, by playing Rock, Paper, Scissors of course! This game was a finalist in the 2003 Simultaneous Movement Board Game Design Competition sponsored by About.com Board Games and Abstract Games Magazine.

title: 007 James Bond: Goldfinger
types: Adventure Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
From the back of the box; Team up with James Bond in the famous Aston Martin DB V! Can you outwit the Korean guards and Odd Job in this famous car chase? Every minute counts as you try to rescue Tilly Masterson and escape from Auric Enterprises.

Overview: A two player only game where one player takes the roll of James Bond in his Astin Martin. He must move around a board that simulates the grounds of Auric Enterprises and find the Tilly Masterson card before he can move off the board to win. The Astin Martin has a collection of special equipment (machine guns, oil slick, smoke screen, ejection seat) that helps him overcome the opponents four enemy cars that only have machine guns. There is also an Odd Job card, Old Lady (with machine gun) card, and a Mirror card (per the movie). Bond begins the game with a guard in his car with him and must use the ejection seat to eliminate him.

title: Assembly Line
types: Abstract Strategy Bluffing Economic Print & Play
description: Players each control nine workers on an assembly line. As the products roll by, players will get a chance to score at certain points in the game, based on what product they're working on at that moment. This game won the 2003 Simultaneous Movement Board Game Design Competition sponsored by About.com Board Games and Abstract Games Magazine.

title: Lickin' Lizards
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Real-time
description:
The Game of Sticky, Stretchy Tongues!

A rotating base contains bug or spider disks.  Each player has a plastic lizard with an Elastomeric tongue (patents no. 4,369,284 and 4,618,213) which can stretch to 750% of its normal length.  Try to collect disks using the sticky, stretchy tongue.  Three different variations are included.

title: Slobberin' Sam
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Electronic
description:
This is a children's dexterity game featuring a motorized dog which eats up the bones players try to flip into his mouth.

From the box:

He's a big, friendly dog
with a long, sloppy tongue.
When you toss Sam a bone,
he slurps it up for fun!

Sam loves his tasty treats.
He quickly licks 'em up.
So give him all you can.
He's a very hungry pup!

Sam slobbers up his lunch,
and now he wants his dinner.
Try to feed him all your bones,
and you're the lucky winner!

title: The Odd-Ball Scenario
description:
Small expansion to Save the President. Bag contains additional rules, cards and data sheets.

Expands:

    Save the President

title: Batalo
description:
Each player has six stones and a column at his command -- and with these, he must either capture all his opponent's stones, or occupy his opponent's base in order to achieve victory.  Stones move in a limited, leap-frog fashion; while the column can do this, or move a straight line until it reaches a border or another object playing piece.

It is possible to end in a stale-mate.

title: Tilez!
description:
From the publisher's website: Tilez! (rhymes with smiles) is a color-matching and spatial relations puzzle game that comes with 80 all-different L-shaped tiles. The object is to select a tile from your rack and place it on the board such that it matches as many existing neighboring colors as possible. As the game progresses the board becomes a mosaic of color with ever-greater challenges and ever greater opportunities to score.

Includes 80 magnetic L-shaped tiles, 4 custom racks, gameboard, scoring markers, and instructions.

Tylz! is the travel version.  No racks or box, but otherwise the same rules, components and game play.

title: Blaster Bots
description:
From the publisher's website:

Bored by their trek across the endless vacuum of space, a shipload of killer robots decide to have some fun. Coding themselves to utilize their most deadly weapons, all but one are destroyed in a matter of seconds. Can you survive the Phazo-Oscillating Beam Master or avoid the deadly rays of the Ionified Reflecto-Blaster and Residulating Impulsor?

Blaster Bots is a quick card game for 3-6 players. Firing Mechanisms, Weapon Effects and Target cards combine to make new, unexpected and sometimes downright mind-boggling weapons. Half the fun is saying the names of the weapons you'll create. The other half is figuring out what they do when they go off. As usual, everything you need to play comes crammed in one small box.

title: World Cup in the Void
description:
An interesting card game developed in Hong Kong. Based on a comic story about the famous soccer players in the world.

There are soccer player cards and another 5 set of action cards with different background color. Each player starts with 11 soccer player cards and 25 action cards.

By playing the action cards, player can tackle, pass or shoot. There are 5 numbers on each of the soccer player cards, to represent their strength in different abilities, like tackling, passing or shooting the ball.

title: Sabuca
description:
Sabuca is a word game that uses a rummy style of play. Unlike most games though, each player must form words and then scramble them in the hope that the opposition cant figure them out. The twist to Sabuca is that any player can stop the action at any moment when they think they have the goods!

Sabuca is a tricky little word game that is made all the more difficult by the time limit and ability for other players to end things before you are ready. This lends the game a frantic, tense feel and this is something that will likely be favored by the word smiths out there. The nature of trying to unscramble other player's words adds Sabuca a level of depth as it almost forms a game within a game.

title: Booty
description:
Your objective is to land on the jackpots scattered around the board - both neutral and belonging to other players - take the tokens contained within, and exit through one of four starting squares with no fewer than 25 tokens in your possession. Easy right?

Wrong! Because in the meantime, players are placing directional chips around the board in an effort to block your path, open lanes for attacking your jackpot, trapping you between directional chips, and trying to steal your tokens by landing on your game piece.

title: Lights Camera Action
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
Lights...Camera...Action! is a movie quote board game based on your favorite movie moments. First, your team is given a movie quote and you try to guess the movie title. If you are unable to name the movie, you will get a second chance when the actor is revealed. Still stumped? You will be given the situation.

Lights...Camera...Action! provides you and your friends hours of entertainment remembering popular movie moments using famous movie quotes, from the classics to current hits.

title: Coodju
description: (Back of the Box) ...teams battle for points by spelling everyday words in a host of bizarre and crazy ways!  Coodju's quirky team play will provide you and your friends with plenty of mental mix-ups and lots of laughs.  Coodju is easy to learn, quick to play, and irresistible to watch!  It's spelling with a twist!

title: Radar Search
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSecret Unit DeploymentVariable Player Powers
description:
One player is the spy who has two ships trying to get to a location and back to his hideout.  The other player, the agent, sits on the other side of the upright board and has one helicopter that moves twice as fast, and tries to catch either spy ship.

The game features a radar scope, which the agent uses every other turn to see where one of the spy's ships is.  Each piece is connected by a wire to the board.  When the agent is on the same space as the spy, a buzzer goes off.

title: Stampin'
description:
Stampin' is a game approved by the U.S. Postal Service. The object is to collect sets of four stamps. You'll need to wheel and deal to get the cards you need. And, you'll need to manage your cash flow so that you can buy stamps, as well as win auctions along the way. 
The game comes with a book about stamp collecting, and has many pictures of actual stamps in game play.

title: Glasnost
description:
Game about peace and communications between the USSR and the Western world - the end of the Cold War.

Players take sides as either Americans or Soviets. As players move around the gameboard according to the dictates of a die, they will eventually engage in debates on specific issues. A neutral player will judge which player has the better argument and award the winning side a Peace Chip. The player and side that accumulates the target number chips (this varies with the number of players) wins.

title: Wall Street Game
description: Wall Street Game simulates the international stock market scene for players to speculate in.  The goal is to amass the greatest fortune as the players buy and sell shares on 17 bourses such as in New York, London, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Moscow.  Currency exchange also comes into play as the players can trade in US dollars, the Deutschmark, and in gold bullion.  During play, prices on the indices will fluctuate and possibly crash.

title: Build Puzzle Town
description:
Youre one of the Master Builders of a brand new community called Puzzle Town. You and your opponents take turns playing Tiles that form complete town blocks, attempting to score the most profit  points (while avoiding losses for construction stoppage and zoning violations). When no more Tiles can be played, the scores are tallied. If youve made the best plays, youll win by having the greatest profit.

A special solitaire version is included in which you, alone, can try to build the complete community- there are thousands of ways to do it, but we challenge you to find just one.

Text from box.

title: Aventuras Heróicas: A Revelação da Princesa / O Encontro com Kaleb
types: Adventure Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Fighting
description:
Expansion featuring two new adventures for Aventuras Hericas, in nine scenarios. The princess, who was rescued in the end of the base game, joins the party. This time they must destroy Kaleb and his minions.

Expands:

    Aventuras Heróicas

title: Aventuras Heróicas
types: Adventure Collectible Components Exploration Fantasy Fighting Miniatures
description: Simple Brazilian board RPG with lead/pewter miniatures. A party of heroes - Warrior, Cleric, Elven Mage and Dwarf - must fight their way through 5 scenarios to rescue a kidnapped princess from the dungeons of the evil Kaleb.

title: SkyCapers
description:
One of the original five games produced by Winning Moves.

From the box:
SkyCapers is a stacking game which features 48 handsome wooden blocks cut into several different shapes.  Matching pairs of blocks fit together allowing players to build many unique towers.  As each tower grows taller, it may become unstable.  Your very next move might cause one to collapse.  But to score, you have to risk performing Capers -- the transferring of a whole stack of blocks from one tower to another.  If you play your blocks right, you'll outscore your opponents and win the game!

title: Coronets
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingModular BoardPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
This game is about murder, but there is no mystery who did it: all of the players! Players try to kill their relatives in order to inherit a title such as Duke or Earl. There tends to be a great deal of laughter during this game as players move around from shop to shop to collect weapons and from estate to estate where their relatives are visiting, waiting to be murdered.

There is strategy: start killing immediately with your bare hands, collect the best weapons that are most effective in certain locations, or collect as many weapons as you can then start murdering with the best available at each location.

It can also be tactical: change your path to avoid the detective, or drop your weapons so he won't be suspicious of you? When to play cards that can help you or hurt your opponents? Rearrange the board to help yourself and/or hinder other players?

One favorite is the Distraction card: Look a comet! you shout as you move closer to the edge of the cliff to push your cousin off.

title: Purse & Pockets Plus
types: Action / Dexterity Party Game Print & Play Racing Real-time
description:
2 points to the first team who brings me a.....gum wrapper!

Watch the mayhem as everyone searches their pockets, purses, backpacks, and surroundings for the item needed.  It's up to the leader to determine whether a similar item is close enough (here's a wrapper from chewy candy!).

This party game is sort of like a scavenger hunt, but it all takes place in a single location rather than running all around the neighborhood bothering outsiders.

There are categories of items to please just about everyone:  
Purse (mostly things found in ladies' purses, best for an all female group like at a shower)
Pockets (items typically found in anyone's pockets, good for most groups)
House  Garden (if you're brave enough to have people rummaging through things in your house)
Office (good for an office party or as an ice-breaker at a meeting)
Something that...(items that fit a description, such as something that has a team logo, nice to mix this in with other categories)
Kids (can play with an all children group or kids can play with adults, as long as the leader is an adult)
Wild  Crazy (some items may be a bit wild for the standard group, but great for a bachelor or bachelorette party)

2 to 3 teams race to bring the required items, and everyone seems to enjoy it whether their team actually wins or not.

title: Murderless Mysteries: Arch Villains Anonymous
types: Deduction Humor Mafia Murder/Mystery Party Game Pirates
description:
This is a mystery party game, but NOT a murder mystery.

First in a series called quot;Murderless Mysteriesquot;, that claim the following difference from other mystery party games:
There is no murder, the crime to be solved is non-violent.
An unlimited number of party guests can participate.
The same game can be played again with a different solution.
No one, including the host and even the culprit, can ever be sure of who dunnit, until it is revealed at the end of the game.

There are 6 main characters who are encouraged to dress in costume but not required, plus a game leader.  But other guests at the party can ask questions and vote on who they think did it.

The six main characters in this story are members of a club similar to Alcoholics Anonymous, but they#039;ve sworn off evil-doings:
Hagatha GrubThe Activities Director is a wicked old witch who cackles often, sometimes for no apparent reason. Hunched shoulders under black clothing complete with pointy hat, she frequently pets her only friend, her cat.

Professor Trixie GimmickThe Club#039;s Technical Administrator who runs the club website is an ultimate techo-geek. She prefers machines over people and plays with gadgets all the time, getting a little annoyed when people interrupt her work to talk to her.

Vanessa Van AvariceThe club Secretary is a beautiful vamp, vain, ruthless and very greedy. She flirts with all the men and is catty to all the women.

Captain Brutus LeCad Would you trust a former pirate as Club Treasurer?

Morley KruptA former gangster makes a great Security Officer.

Barnaby UnderwoodThe club Vice President is a stereotypical villain from melodramas. He constantly twirls his large black mustache and has an evil laugh. He doesn#039;t understand why everyone yells quot;booquot; every time his name is spoken.

title: Charlie Brown Plays Baseball
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The deck is a standard deck of cards, but augmented with text relevant to the baseball themed game. For example, the jack of spades is a walk card.

The play is simple, the batting cards are black, the fielding cards are red, and one player is batting the other fielding. Both players play a card, first batter then fielder, and this may result in base advancement or outs. Players maintain a hand of 7 cards, and play 9 innings, 3 outs for each player.

title: Logistic
description:
The idea of the game is based on the organization of a worldwide transfer of goods.

From the editor:
In Logistics the two players are managers of competitive companies. They have to use tactics and control to plan a build up optimum routes of transport for delivering their goods to the destination. Both players may use the routes of transport of the opponent. At the time the player may limit the range of action of the opponent and delay his strategy by skillful moves.
The winner and top manager of the game is the player, who delivered the largest amount of good to the destination

The game contains English rules.

title: Flotte Krabbe
description:
There are 18 crabs on the beach trying to reach the other side of the board (made by a sort of leather). Your 9 crabs must be faster than the opponent's crabs.

The game a very short rules - only in German.

It was published in Abacus' white box series.

Apparently, this is the racing game Sniggle from Sly

title: Munchkin 3: Clerical Errors
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting Humor
mechanisms: Card DraftingDice RollingHand ManagementTake ThatVariable Player Powers
description:
Publisher's Description

You wanted more Munchkin, so here it is! Created by Steve Jackson and illustrated by John Kovalic... Munchkin 3 - Clerical Errors has 112 more cards for the best-selling game of killing monsters and taking their stuff. Play a new race: Gnomes! Try on the Bard class. Face the Tequila Mockingbird, the Bad Ass, and the dreaded Auntie Paladin! Equip yourself with amazing items like the Chainmail Bikini and the Stab-A-Matic... and show them who's the mightiest, munchkinest dungeon delver of them all.

And this set has a special treat. We asked five of our favorite Comic Guys to do one card each. So in this set you'll find:

     Phil Foglio's Magnificent Hat
     Pete Abrams' Perfectly Ordinary Rabbit
     Tom Ricket's Stick Figure
     Jon Rosenberg's Fowl Fiend
     and Randy Milholland's Redneck Tree!




Munchkin 3 - Clerical Errors is a supplement to Munchkin; you will need the original game to play. Or you could add it to a game of Munchkin, Munchkin Fu, or Munchkin Bites! instead, or mix them all together for a Munchkin-fest of truly mind-bending proportions!

				
					Other

Part of the Munchkin series.

title: American Idol Board Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Music Party Game
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionSinging
description:
From the game box: 
Have you got what it takes to be an American Idol? Find out in this fast paced, fun packed game that will teach you all the highs and lows of becoming an Idol.

Idols is a game based on the popular TV show where unknown people can become idols by showing their singing skills. With Idols - The Game you can show others your true capacity.

Each player takes a couple of his cd's with him to play this game. The board has a track with 60 spaces. Each round the players move their pawn by using a roll  die mechanic. Several spaces trigger actions. There is a space when you can choose a song from a cd and the player if choice has to guess the title of this song; if he fails his pawn goes a determined number of spaces back. There are also spaces where you have to continue the lyrics of a song or where you have the sing a couple of lines. The player who is first to reach space nr. 60 on the board wins.

Each Idol game is based on the region of origin, with music reflective of the competitors on that show.

title: MINDFIELD, The Game of US Military Trivia
types: American Civil War American Indian Wars American Revolutionary War Educational Korean War Modern Warfare
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayDice RollingPartnershipsRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Like the military? Are you a trivia and/or history buff? Play the new game, MINDFIELD, The Game of US Military Trivia. The game is designed for 4 players or 4 teams. Players roll a die and move tanks around the board, answering a question depending on the category landed upon. Categories include: Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Equipment, Battles, Presidents and Miscellaneous. The questions range from continental times through the beginning of 2002. The question and answer cards have been designed with large font for ease in reading. Get one question right in each category and win the game! Beware of the bomb!
Gontza Games
www.gontzagames.com
.

title: Rat-Mal
description:
An array of tiles is placed on the table - with pictures of many different things - hat, bell, igloo, sun, tent, and so forth. One player hides a counter under one of the tiles. The others ask questions about the location of the secret counter, and remove tiles they decide it is not underneath. For example, Is it under something that can fly? being answered no would eliminate the butterfly and airplane.

The goal is to find the hidden counter.

title: Electronic Lightfight: The Games of Dueling Lights
description: 5 fast action games that demand split second response from lightning fast fingers. Carefully watch the diamond grid gameboard and locate the on target light. Try to hit the target by pressing the two buttons that correspond to its position. Hit the target before your opponent to score or to advance.

title: Rockets Red Glare
description: This is a game type simulation of the War Of 1812 in North America on the strategic and operational levels. The objective of both players will be to accumulate victory points for certain actions. The player who has accumulated the most victory points by the end of the game is the winner.

title: The Fonz: Hanging Out at Arnold's
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: The object of the game is to be ready with the right set of cards to meet the Fonz at the door. Spinning the spinner allows you to draw cards, swap a card with another player, or check the door. When you check the door, you open it and see if you have the correct set of three cards that match the Fonz's activity. If the Nerd is behind the door, you lose your set of three cards.

title: The Fall Guy
description: Roll the dice and move around the board. Be the first player to capture the bail jumper and have all four stunt cards face up.

title: Plott: Adventures in Space
description:
Each player has five, different sized, space ships to place within his radar grid. The players take turns placing volleys of five numbered marking pins on their blank radar grids, attempting to locate and thereby destroy their opponents space fleet.

Essentially, this game has the same game play as the well known game Battleship.

title: Seapower & the State
description: This game is a game type simulation of potential future naval combat during World War 3. The viewpoint of the simulation is that of grand strategy and thus has the players acting as the overall commanders of the naval forces of the Eastern or Western alliances. Scenarios are presented for various force levels for the years 1984, 1989, and 1994.

title: Rival Den of Thieves
description: Rival Den of Thieves is a strategic card game for two to five players. The criminal element of the city is in a race to steal the most -- from the bank or each other. Each player controls one of the dens, and each card in her/his hand represents one of the thieves in his/her den.  Each player chooses which of her/his thieves to make active, knowing which thieves are in every player's den (and knowing that they know which cards s/he is choosing between).  Guessing which thief another player is making active can help block and/or steal from that other player.  Players bluff and back stab their way to victory, using the upper class thieves in the city -- including the Counterfeiter, the Gentleman Burglar, and the Lawyer. The game can be combined with Den of Thieves for richer play. The game can accommodate 2-5 players -- up to 10 with a second deck or Den of Thieves added.

title: Collision!
description: Race your cars around a track by rolling the dice and moving the number rolled. If you are passing an opponents car and have rolled doubles, your opponents car gets bumped of the track and is out of the game. The object is to be the last person with at least one car still on the track.

title: Intercept: The Electronic Search and Destroy Game
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementSecret Unit Deployment
description:
One person takes the role of the attack pilot, who is attempting to sneak past the opponent's surface-to-air missile sites, by maneuvering secretly across the tracking grid, to attack the opponent's airfield. The other person must use logic to pin point the attacker's position, fire his missiles, and attempt to score a direct hit.

Lights and sounds indicate radar warnings, the launch of air missiles, and signal a direct hit.

title: Card Attack
description: The object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand. The cards you are allowed to play must match the number, color, or be in sequence with the top card in the discard pile. When someone plays a Terrible 10 or Card Attack card, someone will be pushing the button on the Card Attack machine. The machine is unpredictable: you may press the button a number of times and it won't fire, or it might fire after one hit. If it fires, it shoots cards at you and won't stop until you hit the button again. The cards go into your hand and play carries on this way until one person is out of cards. The winner is the person with the lowest score at the end of a predetermined number of rounds.

title: Centurions: Jake Rockwell's Battle to Stop Dr. Terror Game
mechanisms: Modular BoardPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Doctor Terror is up to no good and has created three phony Centurions that look exactly like Jake Rockwell. These three impostors have been sent to Earth to confuse the other Centurions while carrying out Dr. Terror's sinister plan. Only one person can stop this mad plot and save the world - you! Be the first to equip your Centurions Exo-Frame with all six assault weapon system cards and you've proven that your Centurion is the REAL Jake Rockwell!

Simple die roll and movement is used to collect the cards needed.

title: The Archie Game
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Dice Number
description: From the Archies Comic books. Play as Archie, Jughead, Veronica, Betty or Reggie. A Quick check of the dice to determine whether their both odd or even determines which character Archie attempts to capture. That character must pull his piece away before Archie captures it. A quick thinking then reacting game.

title: Crescendo
description:
[From the game box description] 
On the 60 lovely squares, 2, 3, or 4 players move their pawns to build a tower as quickly as possible. But do pay attention because an unprotected tower risks being dispersed to all four points of the compass by an unscrupulous opposite player! The last one to finish his tower is eliminated and the survivors get themselves ready to start a new game with more pawns. Crescendo offers a lot of possible game boards to develop vigilance and tactical sense in common with psychology and taking risks.

title: Barney Miller
description:
From the 1977 Parker Brothers catalog:

Assume the identity of one of Barney Miller's detectives.  Use a deck of evidence cards and arrest warrants to be the first to book all four suspects that appear on your wanted poster.

Contents: Playing Board; 1 Die; 1 Playing Piece; a Supply of Chips; 1 Deck of 56 Cards

title: Murder à la carte: A Taste of His Own Medicine
description:
Revenge, fear and greed stalk the corridors of Headline Hall in the summer of 1947, as six people gather to hear Michael Monty Montague announce his plans for Montague Enterprises.  One of the six murders Monty by poison, but was the poison meant for someone else...?

You and your guests will play the roles of these six characters.  Suspicion and deceit will dominate the evening as you each use your powers of detection and subterfuge to interrogate the other characters and prove your own innocence.  But one of you is the murderer...and only one person has worked out the identity of the murderer -- Dr. Jock McClew, the detective in charge of the case.  He has recorded some pieces of information that will help you in your hunt for the murderer, so remember to heed his warnings well!

Contents:
- Costume suggestions and recipe ideas
- Party instructions
- 5 Invitations and envelopes
- Name tags
- 6 Character handbooks
- 6 Secret clues
- Cassette tape

title: Jenga Jacks
description:
Well the box says...
Jenga, the original game of tower-building fun, has been combined with the skill of card playing. Get rid of your cards before your opponents, by moving the matching blocks in the tower. But be careful! Keep your hand steady and play your cards well - you do not want to be holding high-scoring cards when the tower collapses!

title: Blank
types: Educational Party Game Puzzle Word Game
description: Blank is a word game from the UK. Designed by 2 word game fans for anyone who loves crosswords, word searches, Scrabble, Boggle, etc. Blank can be played with any number of people. It's very competitive, educational and fun. The game revolves around the precision engineered LetterSelector. It's been specifically designed to be simple to learn, but difficult to master.

title: When Darkness Comes: The Most Dangerous Game
types: Dice Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Spies/Secret Agents
description:
You are a spy, a superspy if you will, working for a large world organization to sequester the political and not so political entanglements that threaten the calm and quiet existence of a world on the brink of disaster.

This game will take you on wild chases through the small streets of Europe as you run for your life or pursue your enemy. Failure is not an option, and sometimes it takes the assistance of others and a little luck to complete your mission. But trust no one, and proceed carefully.

The set contains a rulebook, scenario book, 8 tiles and 48 disks. You will find new rules for vehicles, chases, disguises and traps.

This is an expansion for When Darkness Comes. (But, the first scenario can be played without the core set.)

title: Quinto
description:
Cards are played, Uno-style, to rows to capture point cards.  There are three types of playing cards:  combination cards contain one to four symbols in one of four shapes and colors; word cards name a particular attribute (number, color, shape); bridge cards allow a player to connect two word cards.  One a row contains five cards, a Quinto is formed and the player takes the point card associated with the row.

As the game progresses the point cards become more valuable, both in the number of points available and in that a player making a Quinto  from another player's cards scores the point card and may steal a point card from the player.

For 2 to 4 players Ages 12 and up.

title: Nummerus Zahlus
description:
Disks bearing the numbers 1 through 48 and a green selection disk are shuffled and placed in an irregularly-shaped grid.  Players move the selection disk like a chess queen, capturing the first number disk along the selection disk's move.  If no such capture can be made the player may move the selection disk to any space containing a number disk.

When all 48 number disks are captured the player with the longest chain of sequential numbers (i.e., 13-14-15-16) wins.  The game can also be played for points, where chains score points based upon their length.

title: Riskkapitalist
mechanisms: Auction/BiddingDice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveStock HoldingTrading
description:
Riskkapitalist is a Swedish game and a mix between Monopoly and Finance, with a bit more risk taking.
Each player venture their money into different industries, buying/selling stocks and watching the market for changes.

title: Touchdown A Minute Football
description:
Touchdown-A-Minute Football is a Micro Box game. You pick from a set selection of six sided dice that have different faces on them to give your team the best chance at beating your opponent. Play a full season, or start up a league, it's all part of the game.

You decide how to run your offense. You set your team, control the quarterback, the ends, the receivers, the front line - and pit them against a defense that is ready for anything, and determined to bring you down! Touchdowns, Point After Attempts, Field Goals, penalties and more are all in this amazingly fast dice game.

Touchdown-A-Minute Football is a dice games published by Fast Forward Entertainment. The authors are listed, copyrights are to William W. Connors and Tim Brown.

title: World War II in the West
description:
World War II in the West a division-corps scale wargame depicting the Second World War in Europe and North and East Africa.

World War II in the West gives you control of all of the major participating nations that fought World War II, and allows you to play a simple yet accurate portrayal of the war. World War II in the West was originally designed for play with Axis and Allies figures and rule, but is now a stand-alone game which includes over 1,600 counters. However, the rules and the hex sizes still allow Axis and Allies fans to get the most accurate World War II wargame they can find while still using the popular rules and pieces if they wish.

In fact, World War II in the West can be used effectively to bring Axis and Allies fans into the wargaming hobby as the game combines some of the features of Axis and Allies and conventional counter wargames to produce a new style of game that is simple yet complex, fun yet challenging.

With World War II in the West, you fight for the convoy routes, have air battles over London, conduct landing operations on the northern French coast, outflank and surround forces on the Eastern Front, and manage the industrial output of your nation.

World War II in the West includes over 1,600 counters depicting the armed forces of the major belligerents as well as informational counters needed to play the game. Along with the major nations, you can find in the counter mix Canadian, Australian, New Zealander, South African, Czech, Indian, and East African units, as well as the well-known Spanish Blue Division that fought on the Eastern Front with the German Army.

The beautifully hand-drawn map is made up of 12-pieces, totalling a size of 50 by 40 inches. Also included is a smaller East African map to be used in play. The map has all of the charts and boxes needed for game play and has a scale of approximately 150km per hex. The hexes are large enough to hold Axis and Allies pieces, but it is ideally played with the counters that are sized to decrease mess and accidents during play.

The game is best played with the grand campaign which runs from September 1939 until the end of 1945, in monthly and bi-weekly turns. Two scenarios are included with the game allowing you to play the war in Africa or Operation Overlord in a shorter time than the campaign game. Also, new scenarios will be posted on the website.
 World War II in the Wests complexity is what sets it apart. It sets it apart from the other Axis and Allies games as the complexity is far greater and the history  more accurate. It also sets it apart from the conventional  counter wargames as its complexity is slightly more simple, yet still depicts the war accurately while being fun and challenging. This is not a simple game, but its complexity allows both experienced and beginner wargamers to understand the rules and enjoy the game.

World War II in the West can be combined with World War II in the East to play the entire global war, both games combining to use over 2,500 counters and 25 square feet of maps!

title: Corda
description:
Corda is a tricky puzzle for one or more players using rhombs. The rhombs show vines.
As a solo puzzle, the player tries to connect the 48 rhombs, which have thick branches or thin vines on their edges, into one continuous picture.
As a competitive game, 35 or 36 tiles (depending on the number of players) are dealt out among the players. The remaining tiles are placed openly on the table. Each player now tries to connect his/her tiles into one picture. Players can take turns taking tiles from the table. A player who took a tile is allowed to put one back there as well, but that is not mandatory, so players can opt to increase the number of their tiles.  
When no one can place any more tiles, the scoring starts. All tiles a player couldn't use counts 2 negative points. Each placed tile counts two points; this is doubled if the tiles form a closed ring. Points can also be scored by connecting the thin vines. The player with most points is the winner.

title: Raven
description:
User Description

A set of 25/28mm fantasy miniature wargame in the world of Raven.

The world of Raven is rich in magic with 16 different factions: 

    Vardulack
    Wood Elves
    Shadow Elves
    High Elves
    Barbarians
    Barnorsk Orcs
    Undead
    Kustoss Orcs
    Kzar
    Helsinians
    Ver'men
    Beastmen
    Dwarfs
    Saracens
    Goblins
    Nightlings




Also a number of large creatures's which can be added to each armies.

The 144 page rule book contains; Background to the world of Raven, Rules of play, Magic system, Armies lists and Beastiary, Figure painting article and a introductory scenario.

Harlequin Miniatures Ltd. produced a large variety of pewter miniatures for the game (see the images gallery for examples).

title: Bastard
types: Exploration Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Based off the strangely named anime of the same name, this is a fantasy dungeon exploration game most similar to 'Dungeonquest', and like that game, it is fairly luck (and dice) dependant.

The game uses a board filled with squares that the room tiles are secretly placed on. There are 5 scenarios included with the game, each with different objectives for winning the game. One is Hydra, where the object is, what else.. to kill the Hydra. Battle Royale is a fight to the death in the dungeon. One has you placing a flame sword in the middle of the dungeon and then getting out. One has you trying to rescue 'Yohko' and get back out of the dungeon, and the last has you trying to get 'Satan's Ring' and escape from the dungeon with it.

title: Forte Trivia Cards, Volume One
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Party Game Trivia
description:
These came out at the height of the Trivial Pursuit craze in the early 1980s and has rules as a stand-alone trivia game or for use with Trivial Pursuit.  Like the official expansions of the time, this one has 1000 cards with 6000 questions and answers.

The categories are:

Soaps: Peyton Place, Dallas and beyond Another World
Cartoons: Bugs Bunny, The Flintstones, Pink Panther and more
Space: Sputnik to Star Wars, Buck Rogers to Apollo
Famous Pairs: Antony and Cleopatra to Bette Davis' eyes
Advertising Slogans: Memorable lines that sold us all
Fairplay: If it's trivia, it's eligible

The back of the box promised three more sets of Forte Trivia Cards.  Forte Trivia Cards Volume II has a BGG entry, although its description says it contained only 363 cards instead of the promised 1000.  But Volumes 3 and 4 were, to the best of my knowledge, never produced.

There were some good questions, but a bunch of gamers in their twenties had no idea for the answers to the Soaps questions.

title: BLARF
mechanisms: Dice RollingMemoryPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Backwards...Left...Any Straight Angle...Right...Forward...let's BLARF

Each player has five pieces with the letters B, L, A, R or F printed on one side and A on the other. On each turn, players roll a six-sided die and move one piece the number of spaces indicated in the direction allowed for that piece, or in any direction if the piece is resting on a free (black) square. Then the moved piece is flipped over. Landing upon a free square earns an extra turn. Capturing opposing pieces is by displacement, but capture by jumping is also allowed on a roll of two. Any capture also earns an extra turn. Moving a piece up against the edge of the board indicated by its letter, thus making further moves with that piece impossible, causes that piece to be removed. The last player with pieces remaining on the board wins.

title: Paris Zoom
description:
Commissioned by the Paris board of transportation, players move around the Paris subway and bus networks. Each has a specific character chosen from the twenty-four available, e.g. Architect, Student, Nightclubber, Movie Buff... Children down to age 8 can play the Urchin and the Parisian Kid. The players must answer questions pertaining to their chosen character. The first who completes a predetermined circuit wins.

The questions are general knowledge, historic, cultural, weird... :

- For the Writer: What kind of animal did Grard de Nerval take out for a walk at the Palais-Royal ?
- For the Musician: In which famous club did Boris Vian play jazz ?
- For the Cemetery Keeper: What did Cyrano of Bergerac and Molire have in common ?

The characters were drawn by the French artist Tignous.

I find it interesting to combine variable powers with a trivia game.

title: Who?
description:
Character Guessing Game
 Players randomly choose one of 10 character cards which depict one of the cast of characters.  Accountant, Bootblack, Clergyman, Doctor, Editor, Financier, Grandfather, Hobo, Investigator, Judge. Places which players visit as they move around the board give clues as to who they are. The Hobo for example can visit the Soup Kitchen, The Police Station, The Bus Line and The Drug Store - but, of course, cannot visit the Country Club. Players try to guess the identity of their opponents while remaining unidentified themselves. Disguise Caps spaces on the board allow players to move onto spaces they normally would not be allowed to visit. The winner is the player who manages to conceal his identity from the other players until he alone remains in the game.

title: Verbatim
description:
From the back of the box:

Verbatim gives new meaning to word games. It's a classic spelling game with a big difference. The difference is you only have one each of the 26 letters of the alphabet to work with. Each player takes a turn and tries to complete a word of five letters or more by adding a new letter to the letters already on the board.  Complete the word and score. Now you are eligible for the Bonus Round: Spell as many new words as you can in 60 seconds using only the letters of the accepted word and increase your score.

Contains:

One classically designed game board
26 letter cubes
One letter rack
One-minute timer
Instructions

title: Seven Seas to Victory
description:
Hypothetical 1945 naval conflict around Panama Canal in which the Axis have conquered all of the world except North and South America.

Uses the Victory at Midway system.

title: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot VIOLET Booster
types: Animals Card Game Expansion for Base-game Humor Negotiation
description:
This is the VIOLET Booster expansion to the non-collectible, hysterical Killer Bunnies game. This expansion includes 55 new cards and a clear 20 sided die.

From the back of the box:
Killer Bunnies are back again, sporting new Specialty bunnies, which make taking double turns a snap!
...
Can you escape the Bittersweet Chocolate Covered Anti-Matter Raisins or avoid a run-in at the Local Crow Bar?  Pick the fabulous triple Specialty Bunny and play two cards in a row!  The Laughs continue as this hysterical Violet Booster Deck delivers a deeper strategic edge and new ways to claim the Magic Carrot and win!

Expands:

    Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

title: Sports Franchise
description:
Sports Franchise is the board game that makes every player the owner of a major league Sports Franchise.  Your luck and competitive instinct will be tested while you attempt to become the most successful owner.

The object of the game is to become the wealthiest Franchise Owner.  This is done by shaping your original team of rookies into stars and by acquiring money, stadiums, concession stands, and souvenir stands.  You will build your Franchise on the board's outside track and play a scheduled series of games against your opponents on the inside track.  When the regular season is over and a championship game has been played, the Franchise Owner that has accumulated the most wealth will be the winner.

title: Charlie's Angels
types: Adventure Movies / TV / Radio theme Spies/Secret Agents
mechanisms: Area EnclosurePoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
From the box:  Kelly, Sabrina, and Kris make up the team of Charlie's Angels.  Charlie's phone calls give this beautiful squad of crime busters the information needed to capture the target villain.  They work as a team, each using her special talents to apprehend the culprit.

Each player controls three agents and attempts to trap the villain using their team members.  You score points once the villain has been surrounded and is unable to move.

title: Murphy's Magic Island
mechanisms: Dice RollingModular BoardPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description: Players race to collect 6 tokens, one of each color, which are spread about on a wildly complex modular board. The board is all knotted paths that fork  and twist about, with tunnels and teleporters, curse cards, and benefit cards thrown into the mix.

title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea Card Game
types: Card Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: A crazy eights style game, with three suits from 1-13. There are no wild cards or special cards, just 39 oversized number cards. The person who goes out scores one point for each card left in the opponent's hands, and the game is played to 21.

title: Dick Tracy Playing Card Game
description:
A simple but original card game - the goal is to get a hand which is just Dick Tracy and 4 Jewels. There are only 3 card types, Dick Tracy, Jewels, and Thugs. Each turn you can discard Jewels, Dick Tracy, or Thug WITH Dick Tracy, as many times as you like - filling your hand back to 5 at the end of the turn. If you only have Thugs you show your hand and discard one card.

Going out is 30 points. Other players are penalized for each thug in their hand not canceled by a Dick Tracy, and rewarded for each Jewel. The game is to 100.

title: Transformers Adventure Game
description: A board game based on the Transformers Universe. You play as Optimus Prime (4 different colors) who must rescue the mini-cars from the Decepticons. Has tokens, dice, cards.

title: Arbora
description:
Arbora is a tile-laying game with a (very thin) environmental theme.  The 36 tiles depict silhouettes of different kinds of leaves or branches, four on each one (one per side).  These are placed on a 6x6 grid in an effort to complete 2x2 squares and rows of 6 (both of which get you points).

Since each picture has only one match, so once one tile is placed on the board (which is randomly done to start the game), the entire layout is determined, and players simply can choose (so far as their draws let them) when to play which tile(s).

title: Lords Of The Middle Sea
description:
. . . that above the drowned lands, the Middle Sea as is known to men, or else as the Shroud.  It buoys we of the Salvar, its issue strengthens our bellies, it alike washes storm womb and the ashy roots of the Forges, it salutes the steaming Godwall and the last island Wardom before the Greater Sea, it guards us well from the lost lands where iron walked . . .

In the year 2401, players will guide the fortunes of nations as the Emperor of the Nahuas, the President of Mexico, the First Rider of TransWyoming, or as the Fisher of Wardoms -- The Lords of the Middle Sea.

A post-apocalyptic wargame played on a map of an inundated North America. Only the tops of mountain ranges are usable land.  A sci-fi mix of galleons, dirigibles, and medieval troops.  Ships and airships have area movement while land movement is through hexes.  Several scenarios are offered for 2 to 4 players.

title: Road Block
description:
An educational game which illustrates the penalties of drinking and driving.

Take a drive through North America, but beware of the road block. Drink and Drive at your peril, find yourself in court, lose your license, become a pedestrian... all this while trying to accumulate money and avoid being caught by the roving police officer.

title: Power Play
description: Played according to regular hockey rules. It has a chess like style to the game play. Be the person to score the most goals in the three periods.

title: Scooby-doo! Thrills and Spills
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The first player to move both of their player pieces all the way up the path to the Mystery Machine wins the game.  A spinner determines how many spaces you move.  If you land on a monster space you wind up the top and set it loose.  Any game pieces it knocks over are returned to start.

Ages 6 and up

Includes: gameboard, plastic mountain pieces, legs, C shaped ring, Mystery Machine, top with handle, 8 movers, spinner, 3 monster cards, label sheet and instructions.

An electronic talking version was later released which is the same game but adds speech (3 different phrases) as the top is spun.

title: Auf der Flucht vor Tyrannosaurus
mechanisms: Area MovementModular BoardSecret Unit DeploymentSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Player Powers
description:
Played on a 5x5 board, players try to steer their dinosaurs to feed on plants, and avoid the evil T.Rex as well as each other.

Card play determines if the dino moves, stays put, or panics. In case of a panic, the other(!) players simultaneously, secretly determine the dinos movement. Afterwards, the T.Rex is moved in the same way by all
players.

The 4 dinos have different features, some can fly over the volcano, swim through the lake (both variable board elements), and have different amounts of panic cards (which must be played throughout the game).

The player who ate the most plants in 8 rounds wins (9 for 3 players).

title: À qui le tour ?
description:
A cycle racing game inspired by the Tour de France. Each player runs a team of 4, 5 or 6 racers, teamwork between the racers helps to improve the position of the team's racers through slip-streaming. 
There are four short stages and 2 long (mountain) stages to the full race, but a lesser number could be raced over. There are 34 (green) random movement ( event) cards: nine '1's, 13 '2's , nine '3's and one '4', a hunger/fall card and a weakness/blackout card. Each player also holds a pack of 9 yellow cards. one '+5', one '+3' one '+2' three '+1's, a spare wheel, a food musette (musette = In cycling, a bag containing food handed out in a feed zone of a multi-stage race such as the Tour de France) , and a 'Baraka'. (which means good luck in French slang.) On their turn the active player draws a random card for each of their racers, and if desired adds one of their yellow cards. Yellow cards are discarded for the stage after play. 
If a racer ends his move with one space between him and the player of his team ahead of him, then he can slip-stream into the space provided it is not filled by racers of other teams. A racer can also slipstream another team's racer if there is a completely empty road space between them. Roads are 4, 3 or two riders wide, depending upon the terrain.
The winner can be decided by shortest number of turns taken to complete the course, or by placing in the finishing order of each stage - (better to agree this in advance). The short stages can take between 30 and 60 minutes, and the long stages 60 to 90. A lot depends upon the number of players, and of racers per team. If the whole race is to be run is would be best to spell it over a weekend with some other games filling between stages.

title: Crosscheck
description: CrossCheck is a crossword puzzle game with an erasable game board, question books and grease pencil. Each player is trying to solve crossword questions competitively on the common board, with the intention of creating an unbroken chain of words to their home square before their opponents. The game includes question books for adults and children.

title: Head to Head
description: Head to Head is a crossword game that is played simultaneously between two players. Players grab 14 random plastic letters from a bag, then race against each other to form words on the board, crossword-style, that score points. Squares on the board have varying point values. Players are timed with an egg-timer during play.

title: The Amazing Spider Man Game with the Fantastic Four!
description:
Based on the Marvel comic book characters.

From the box:
Each player becomes a super-hero, attempting to score the most points. To win you must skillfully capture villains along the Spider Web path and collect Race Place cards from the center Spiderman Circle.

A Game for 2, 3 or 4 players.

title: Spider-Man
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Comic Book / Strip
description: Using the die-launcher, players attempt to shoot villains off of the Daily Bugle building without hitting Peter Parker's pals. First player to knock down three villains and then finally Kingpin wins the game.

title: Monopoly: Batman & Robin
types: Comic Book / Strip Economic Movies / TV / Radio theme Negotiation
description:
Monopoly... Batman Style. Comes with 8 pewter tokens: Batman Symbol, Robin Symbol, Poison Ivy Leaf, Diamond, Freezemobile, Robin's Motorcycle, the BatHammer, and The Batmobile! New money, Batman and Robin cards (instead of Chance and Community Chest), new property cards and a great looking board are all included.

Based on the 1997 movie of the same name.

title: Tripoley Dice
description:
Tripoley Dice is described on the front cover of the rulebook as a game for two or more, ages 8 and up.  The game comes with 9 special dice, 1 dice cup, rules, and 1 pad of scoring sheets.

The object is to win the most total points in each game, or series of games.  A game of Tripoley Dice consists of three known games, or sections: Hearts, Poker, and Michigan Rummy.  Instead of using cards, players roll dice to determine their hands.  The nine dice contain all 52 cards and two jokers.  At the end of all three sections, the player with the highest total is the winner of a Tripoley Dice game.

title: Star Wars: Yoda the Jedi Master
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Star Wars - the Empire Strikes Back - Yoda, the Jedi Master game. Board game based on the hit movie.

Object: Be the first player to become a Jedi Knight, defeat the Dark Side of the Force and win! Travel to the Dagobah System where Yoda, the ancient Jedi Master, will teach you the ways of the Force. Acquire Jedi merit as you successfully accomplish the difficult tasks and trials Yoda sets for your training. Once you've obtained sufficient merit as a Jedi, enter the Jedi Knight circle and out-spin the Dark Side of the Force to win.

Ages 8 and Up
