2 - 4 players.

Includes:
Dagobah Swamp Planet Game Board
64 Jedi Cards
28 Yoda Cards
4 Luke Skywalker Tokens w/base
Spinner
Instructions

title: The Rescuers
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
The object of the game is to move your playing token around the board, trying to get enough help from Bianca, Bernard, and all the other kindhearted creatures to rescue Penny from the villains. The first player to collect five rescue chips will save Penny from Medusa, Snoops, and the two crocodiles - Brutus and Nero.

Ages 6 - 12

Includes:
Game board
3 large villain cards
28 rescue chips
Devil's Eye Diamond Spinner
4 tokens with Penny pictured on them
4 plastic stands

title: Revanche
description:
This is a 2 player game on the battle which occurred on the 12th  13th September 1944 around the town of Dompaire in France using the final iteration of the Blood and Steel series rules.

After breaking out of the Normandy Bridgehead in July, the Free French 2nd Armoured, triumphantly entered Paris and advanced across the French country side, intent on liberating the province of Lorraine. Desperate to stop the Allied blitzkrieg and recapture the vital railroad center at Nancy, Hitler placed General Von Rundstedt in command. To support the counter attack, emergency reinforcements were ordered up to the Western Front that included new and improved models of Panther tanks.

The battle saw the Free French 2nd Armoured Division, led by General Jacques Leclerc, pitted against the counter attacking German forces of the 112th Panzer Brigade. The armored clash at Dompaire confirmed that the French had learned the lessons of war well, and that Allied victory in the West was now at hand.

title: Redguard
types: Civil War Modern Warfare Territory Building Wargame
description:
THE CHINESE CULTURAL REVOLUTION

Up to 6 players struggle for control of key Chinese sites while anxiously watching Chairman Mao's health. Will your faction be ready to assume power when the great leader departs the workers paradise ? Or will you be able to exert your dominance even before the tragic event?

36 tiles create a map of important Chinese political, military and social sites 
1 sheet of 216 die cut counters shows the forces involved

title: Star Wars: The Ultimate Space Adventure Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
You and your opponents are commanders in the Rebel Alliance. The remote ice planet Hoth has been your base since you escaped from the superior Empire forces. But wait! The Empire has sent probes into the far reaches of the galaxy, and your position has been revealed. Even now, an Imperial TIE fighter commanded by the evil Darth Vader is invading Planet Hoth's atmosphere. To escape, you must pilot your X-Wing Fighter on a perilous journey through the unknown to Planet Dantooine. One - and only one - Rebel fighter can complete the journey. Will it be yours?

Ages 7 to 14

Includes:
Game board
4 Rebel X-Wing fighter markers
1 Imperial TIE fighter marker
4 puzzles of X-Wing fighters
Rebel and Imperial spinners
The Force card

title: WWF World Wrestling Federation Wrestling Trivia Game
description:
Take your knowledge to the mat with this trivia game about wrestling. 800 WWF trivia questions.

Take your knowledge to the mat with this fascinating trivia game about wrestling! Young people can play with the old pros...Everybody wins! - But there is only one champion!

800 World Wrestling Federation Trivia questions - 5 levels of difficulty - Each player (or tag team) selects a level, and the tournament begins. Go for that World Wrestling Federation Championship belt... Pin your opponents! Create your own dream team.

At the end of the tournament - claim the prize (the best spot in front of the tv?) - Until the next match.

title: Bartok
description:
Bartok is a game that is remarkably similar to UNO, at least initially. It is played with one or more decks of cards - I play with a shoe box of old, partly complete packs :)

There the similarities end:

1. If you only have one card left, you have to say 'Bartok'. If you don't, you get your hand made back up to maximum.

2. Most other rules violations require you to take one or more cards.

3. Players aren't allowed to ask questions during a game. Ask a question, take a card. This is most entertaining when someone comes along and asks 'What are you playing?'. They'll usually get a card, and then several more when they don't say Bartok.

4. This is the doozy: A player that successfully gets rid of his last card is deemed the winner for that round, and gets to make a new rule, which overrides any later rules. These can be as simple or as brain-hurty as you like. Usually the game gets harder as it progresses, as rules feed off each other and make lethal feedback loops.

5. Some example rules, to give you an idea of the flavor of the game:

When a change of suit changes color, play direction reverses. (easy)
When a two is played, play skips a player. (easy)
Threes don't exist. (somewhat metaphysical)
When a black ace is played, each player must slap a card face down in the middle of the table. The last player to do so takes all of the other cards. (moderate, more of a wakey wakey rule)
When a black queen is played, all of the cards increment their values by one, with kings wrapping to become aces. Red queens decrement the values by one. (somewhat mind numbing)
Prime numbered cards swap to become the suit of the same colour - ie. clubs - spades, diamonds - hearts. (brain hurty, especially when combined with the rule above)

Any rule disputes are usually settled by voting.

You play until you're bored, or until someone creates a win condition and manages to achieve it.

SURGEON-GENERAL'S WARNING: Do not play this game with mathematicians :)

title: North to Alaska
description:
A Roll-and-Move travel boardgame that was apparently released in 1984 as a promotion for Yukon Sam Rest Stops.

Up to eight players attempt to successfully navigate the Alaska-Canada Highway from Seattle, Washington to Anchorage, Alaska. The object of the game is to arrive in Anchorage with the most money, which is found through panning for gold, visiting gold mines, and other events along the way. Hazards that players encounter during game play duplicate some of the real-life problems motorists may face driving to Alaska's largest city, such as icy roads, landslides, bears, and everybody's favorite, a boarded-up gas station in the middle of nowhere. 
Solid production values here, with some colorful cartoon-style graphics on the Encounter Cards and game board. There's a prospector's poke containing some exquisite pewter playing pieces (a la Monopoly) that include a moose, a jeep, a bush plane, and a dog sled, among others. The game has plenty of Yukon Sam Bucks provided in various denominations, along with a handy storage tray, and is topped off with a pair of substantial dice and a Rainbow Road/Pan For Gold spinner.

title: The Happy Highway Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Dice Educational Racing Religious
description: An educational game meant to teach kids as young as three how to play a simple board game. It encourages interaction among family members using cards that have fairly innocuous Truth Or Dare type questions or activity suggestions on them. Players roll and advance their cars along the Happy Highway to the finish. Comes with a booklet for parents.

title: Totally Twister
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Humor Party Game Real-time
mechanisms: Co-operative PlayPartnershipsPick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementSimultaneous Action Selection
description: Totally Twister is an electronic contraption that looks something like a multi-colored cube. There are a few different types of games available for it, such as Pass It and Turbo Pass but the object generally involves quickly passing or moving the contraption between two people by placing it between the two named body parts. It's more akin to Funny Bones than the original Twister game.

title: Prism Quest
description: Players try to deduce one another's hidden sequence of colors using cards and yes/no responses.

title: Bonaparte
description:
great campaign of Napoleon from 1806 to 1812

Bonaparte is a game of strategy in which players simulate all the Napoleonic campaigns in Europe starting from 1807, from that time on, in fact, the conflict between France and England was decidedly in the hands of Napoleon. All the various campaigns (Spain, Portugal, Prussia, Austria, etc) were not considered separate and isolated from one another, as they were in reality. The necessity to count battles on two, three, or four fronts as all being connected is dictated by several historical assumptions: the numbers of enemies to face, the blocking off of England, which was likely to become a way to isolate France on the continent, and the British tenacity in arousing national anti-French sentiments. Napoleon's goal is to conquer all of Europe, without which the financial possibilities of the English would render impossible the existence of the empire. The play of alliances, created according to the political and military mechanisms which are always unstable, is an instrument equally valid foe either player to use in order to obtain a victory which only the forces of the two individual countries could not obtain, even in theory.

title: Spells & Spell Casters, Phantasy Realm Expansion #001
types: Adventure Dice Expansion for Base-game Exploration Fantasy Fighting
mechanisms: Chit-Pull SystemDice RollingModular BoardRole PlayingVariable Player Powers
description:
This first expansion for the Phantasy Realm fantasy-adventure board game includes 2 new characters (allowing for 6-player Phantasy Realm games), 2 new adventures, a number of new encounters and magic objects and introduces spell casting (63 spell cards) and magical mounts (special Encounter chits).

The addition of spells allows for increased direct interaction between characters, while the spell themselves support the competitive-not-elimination style of play found in the basic game.

title: Alaric the Goth: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
description:
Alaric the Goth is a grand strategic game of the Barbarian invasions of the Western Roman Empire during the Fourth and Fifth centuries A.D. The game is abstract and is not a direct simulation. Can be played solitaire by playing the Romans and defending against the oncoming hordes, led by Alaric, the man who finally brought about the fall of the Roman Empire.

Can be combined with Attila the Hun:  The Roman Empire in the East which simulates the barabarian invasions of the Eastern Roman Empire.

title: BattleTech Combat Book Expansion: Basic Terrain Cards
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Science Fiction
description: This is a Terrain Card set used with the Battletech Combat Books by Nova. Each time a player makes a maneuver that changes range, that player draws a new, random, terrain card. The terrain cards are used to change the amount of damage a Mech may take, the amount of heat generated, or the maneuvers that the Mech may choose. There are 64 cards in this set and the terrains included are: Barren Earth, Open Terrain, Open Water, Swamp, Rough Terrain, Rocky Terrain, Light Forest, Rubble amp; Debris, Wood Buildings, Heavy Forest, and Concrete and Steel.

title: BattleTech Combat Book Expansion: Urban Terrain Cards
types: Expansion for Base-game Fighting Science Fiction
description: This is an Urban Terrain Card set used with the Battletech Combat Books by Nova. Each time a player makes a maneuver that changes range, that player draws a new, random, terrain card. The terrain cards are used to change the amount of damage a Mech may take, the amount of heat generated, or the maneuvers that the Mech may choose. There are 64 cards in this set and the terrains included are:Open Terrain, Parking Lot, City Park, Power Substation, Fuel Tanks, Rivers amp; Canals, Wood Buildings, Light Rubble, Heavy Rubble, Narrow Streets, Brick Buildings, and Concrete amp; Steel.

title: Holiday Hop!
description: A unique look at history, inventions, people and events.  Your children will love the ups and downs of this fast-paced stroll through the calendar year.  Parents love that it is 100% factual!!!!

title: Batman: Poker gegen Joker
description:
This is a game about the first Batman movie. The notorious Joker attempts to bring the cities under his control and Batman comes to save the day!
One of the players takes the role of the Dark Knight and the other one that of the Joker.

Gameplay:
Each player takes a stack of cards that correspond to his character according to the symbols to the back of the cards.
From the City maps the two cards with zero are discarded, the remaining City maps are juxtaposed in the center of the pitch.
The City tickets are each rotated to their current owners, with each player at the beginning of 4 is City Card. 
Joker starts the game and then players alternately play.
There are two types of cards: Power cards and Action cards
On his turn the active player takes the top card of his own deck of cards. The card is then applied to the City maps. Just keep in mind that there are power and action cards.
The City maps are quite large. They show a numerical value of 0-4 and a symbol of Batman or Joker.

The Cards:
1) Power Cards: Each player has in his deck 36 power cards with values ​​from 1 to 12, each card is available three times. A maximum of four cards can be applied on the City maps.
2) KO Card: This card means that the opposing player is obligated to discard the next card that he draws.
3) Stop card: it is placed under a City map. Players use them on the opposing side of the city. Their effect is that the opponent can only go to that city with power cards valued 1 and no other value. 
4) Tchomb cards: They can also be stored underneath a city map on the opposing side rendering the cards already there worthless (they now have 0 value)
5) Attack Card: Will be played on an opponent's row and the player can take a power card from that row.
6) Change Map: Players switch roles and change sides.

The game ends in the round in which neither player can do more to create a map. 
The City cards are counted and they are considered to belong to the player who has the higher total numbers on the power cards. In case of a tie, neither player wins the City map. City maps that have been conquered, that belonged to the other players at the start get an extra point to their printed score.
The player with the highest total score wins the game.

title: Attack! Expansion
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Negotiation Political Wargame World War II
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemArea MovementAuction/BiddingDice RollingPlayer EliminationPoint to Point Movement
description:
From the publisher's web site:

Attack! Expansion will add quite a bit of detail while retaining playability.  Players will be able to choose from many new options including (They will get 3 per turn): Moving Military Units, Playing Political Cards, Attempting a Diplomatic Blitz, Beginning a Trade Route Auction, Purchasing Units, Researching a New Technology, Trading with another Player, or a Strategic Move (Land, Sea, or Air).

Politics: Each player nation and each minor nation will have one of the four political affiliations: Fascist, Monarchy, Democracy, or Communism. Political cards will allow the players to influence the minor nations governments with propaganda, or even overthrow them in an attempt to install a friendly government that they can then influence to join their sphere. Other diplomatic cards will allow players to spy on each other or perform various internal political actions.

Trade Routes: Players will be able to bid on Trade Route cards. The highest bidder gets the card. Trade cards act just like any other economic card, except they are wild cards and may be used to create sets. They also usually have higher than normal economic values. The downside to Trade Route cards is that they may be blocked or destroyed by blockades or Submarine warfare.

Technology: After the initial expansion, players usually begin to build alliances and the wars begin. Having a technology that gives you an advantage on the battlefield is critical. Players may spend an action (and money) attempting to develop a special technology.

Oil: Oil also takes on its historical importance in Attack! Expansion. Every time a player moves tank, air, or naval units, they must spend oil units from their reserve. The oil reserve may only be replenished when oil cards are used to do so rather than used in a player's economy that turn.

Attack! and Attack! Expansion will contain the same quality art and components featured in other Eagle-Gryphon Games products.

Expands:

    Attack!




Parts Manifest:

     Game board (Eastern Hemisphere)
     Rule book (20 pages)
     6 sets of pieces in red, deep blue, dark green, grey, tan, taupe (submarines, destroyers, battleships, aircraft carriers)
     90 government type counters
     48 Economics Cards
         Factories (21, 32, 23, 14)
         Minerals (21, 32, 23, 14)
         Oil (21, 32, 23, 14)
         Population (61)
         Rail Transport (21, 32, 23, 14)
         Trade Route (23, 34, 35, 26)
    
     24 Technology cards (all different)
     72 Political Action cards
         3 Assassin
         3 Counter Espionage
         4 Coup!
         1 Double Agent
         1 Embargo
         1 Free Elections
         1 Leader Assassinated
         2 Master Spy
         1 Master Spy Ring
         2 Military Aid to Minor Neutral
         3 Military Parade
         3 Naval Building Program (one each: Battleship, Destroyer, Submarine)
         2 Partisans
         5 Political Upheaval
         4 Production Drive (1 artillery, 1 air, 2 tank)
         7 Propaganda
         2 Propaganda Posters
         2 Radio Address
         1 Revolt!
         2 Sabotage
         4 Secret Treaty
         4 Spy
         2 Spy Ring
         4 Support Minor Neutral
         1 Technology Initiative
         4 Threaten to Invade
         3 War Bonds
    
     Stack of Production Point and Oil Reserve Certificates (paper money)

title: Super Bowl
description: An American Football simulation.

title: 21 Freeze Out
description:
The game's objective seems rather simple - collect 5 cards which equal 21. But with Wild cards, Freeze cards, Defrost cards, Anti-Freeze cards and a Blizzard card, the road to victory is not always easy. Variations include Partner play  Multi-Board play.

Difficult (but not impossible) game to find.
INCLUDES: 6 colored Play boards, 126 Numbered cards (21 each of 6 colors --- 2 cards each color of numbers 1, 2, 3, 7, 8  9 and 3 cards each color of numbers 4, 5  6), 21 Chill cards (4 Wild, 4 Defrost, 6 Freeze, 6 Anti-Freeze  1 Blizzard)  instructions.

title: Auf Teufel komm raus!
description: Using triangular tiles, players try to connect devils with their tail ends. The longer the tail (number of tiles), the more the devil/tail scores.

title: Hast du Worte?
description:
In Hast du Worte?players in turn reveal letter tiles, until one recognizes a word which can be formed using some of the tiles. On top, one can steal a word from another player, if all letters from the other player and some from the active tiles can be used to form a new, longer word. 
The player with the most letters wins.

title: Grand Prix
description:
It's a simulation of F1 race based on increased risk with increased speed.
The player predetermines the speed and the risk depends on a die roll and on the squares of the circuit the car (represented by a counter) is going to pass through.
It's possible to control the car by brakes, change of speed, but is very risky to go fast in dangerous point of the circuit because the damages can stop you.

title: Playoff
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveVariable Phase Order
description:
It's a simulation of basketball game. There are two fields in the box, so it's possible to play two matches together.
Every 3 seconds of virtual time the player can have an action with one of his players. They can throw, pass, move with the ball, move without the ball, try to steal the ball.
After a missed throw it is possible to get the rebound and start a new action.
The players have some special attitudes that make them specialists in rebounds, defending, passing, throwing or moving with the ball.

title: 3-D Viewmaster Trivia Quiz
description:
The die is rolled to determine the question category and the corresponding View Master reel.

The 3-d picture in that reel and the the challenging question about what you see in the picture. Answer correctly ..and move one step closer to entering the View Master 3-D Trivia Quiz Winner's Circle

title: Affenfelsenspiel
description: Each player has 3 apes who race around a rock-strewn fieldm trying to get to the Baobab first. (The Baobab is a tree found in the savannas of Africa and India, mostly around the equator. It can grow up to 65 feet tall and can live for several thousand years. The Baobab is leafless for nine months of the year). Movement is controlled by a special die which determines whether your ape can walk upright, walk on all fours, climb a rock, or swing from the trees. A panther occasionally comes out and frightens the apes away.

title: Trinidad
description:
Selection #3 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

A quick but treacherous game where speed and sacrifice count, as players maneuver to unite three pieces in a row of the central tic-tac-toe.
Type of game: Strategic movement with goal pattern.
A combination of checkers with tic-tac-toe.

title: Di-Cross
description:
Selection #2 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

A game of thought and foresight, as players use the numbers initially rolled, in a placement contest of rows versus columns.
Each line of 4 dice is scored for pairs, runs and special combinations in an attempt to achieve the highest overall score.

title: Mundialito
description:
It's a simulation of football (soccer) matches where the field is divided in about 40 squares and the players are pieces of wood.
Every turn the player with the ball (attacker) rolls a die to know how many players will move during the turn. Than he could passes the ball or shoots on goal and moves the players.
The defender moves after one player less than the attacker and every time during the turn that there are players of both the teams in the same square there is a tackle (a rolls of dice) that permit to change the ball's owner.
The matches are very fast so is possible to play a tournament between five teams in an evening.

title: Justice League Hexors Game
types: Collectible Components Comic Book / Strip Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Justice League Hexors Game features collectible tile pieces and can be refreshed with the booster pack, so its a new game every time. The Starter comes with 10 Hexors all with different ratings to each of their sides. There are 75 different Hexor tiles you can collect. The object, for two to four players, is to defend Metropolis against evil villains. The Hexors game also comes packed with a key chain that kids can attach to their backpacks and take wherever they go.

The Starter set contents:

1 Game Mat
10 Hexor Tiles
1 Colored Die
6 Beads
2 8 Chains
1 Instruction Booklet

This game directly relates to the Yu-Gi-Oh! Hexors game released in 2002.

title: 2nd Guess
description:
Prove your knowledge of the second largest, the second farthest, the second fastest, the second of just about everything in this 2nd trivia game.

Start by choosing a 2nd Guess topic and answer the question immediately for the most points.  If you are unsure of the answer, you can ask for a second chance which enables you to choose from 4 multiple choice answers - but you get fewer points and give other players a chance to score as well by second guessing you.  Highest score at game's end reigns as 2nd Guess champion - second to none!

title: Sixth Sense
description:
The game that challenges both your intelligence and power of deduction.  It was created by Marko Meirovitz, the inventor of Master Mind(R).

Master Mind meets Battleship!

Each player inserts symbols and/or numbers into a plastic playing board using colored pegs.  Then, in turn, each players asks the opponent(s) if a peg is in a desired section of their board.  Each player keeps track of all guesses either on a separate board or in memory.  The player whose symbols and letters have been discovered is out of the game.  The player who outlasts and outwits the others wins.

title: Viaduct
description: Viaduct is a 3 dimensional game in which players must stack bridges next to or on top of each other to connect opposite sides of the board. It was published in the Ravensburger Casino Series.

title: Kreuz und Quer
description:
Kreuz und Quer is played on a 17x17 board. Players try to move their 3 musketeers and 8 soldiers to the other side of the board, using two dice:
First, the red dice indicates mandatory backward or sideways movement of one unit, followed by mandatory forward movement from the green dice. Soldiers move orthogonally, musketeers can move diagonally as well. Musketeers count double at the end of the game.

title: Star Wars: Hoth Ice Planet Adventure Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Space Exploration
description:
Objective: Be the first player to acquire sufficient Force to battle and defeat Darth Vader!

Spin to pilot your Millennium Falcon around Hoth. There are incidents along the way and battles for Force Cards with Imperial villains. Plan your strategy in wagering Force cards and spinning against Boba Fett, Stormtrooper, Probot, and AT-AT/ Once you have enough Force, you can enter the center of the board and challenge Darth Vader. First player to master the Force and successfully out-spin Darth Vader wins!
Players: 2-4
Ages 7 and up
Includes:
Game Board
4 Millennium Falcon tokens
Spinner
Force cards
Incident cards
Instructions

Another in a long line of generic games based on the Star Wars movies. Very similar in play to Kenner's Yoda game.

title: Money Card
description:
Players visit Europe and enjoy all the pleasures of a real vacation - souvenir hunting, sightseeing, betting at Monte Carlo and essential to this game's design: using American Express Traveler's Cheques.

Players race against one another to travel to 8 key cities in Europe: London, Copenhagen, Lisbon, Paris, Rome, Madrid, Vienna  Athens. In each city players collect Keys to the cities while trying not to run out of Traveler's Cheques.

Bonus moves are made by collecting Language cards and completing foreign phrases printed on the cards.

First player to show possession of their 8 Keys wins.

title: Ballistic Missile
description:
One of the 70s-era Micro-Warfare games published by Heritage Models, Inc, under its Tabletop Games subsidiary.
The Cold War heats up on your kitchen table, as Red launches it's nuclear arsenal of ICBM's, IRBM's, and Strategic Bombers against Blue's air defense command. 
Blue occupies two thirds of the table with his cities, missile silos, radar sites, and surface-to-air missiles, while Red lurks menacingly behind his Fail-Safe Line, awaiting the go-codes to unleash Armageddon. 
Supplied components are a rulebook, the cardboard pieces that you must cut out, and a pad of Missile Attack/Defense Order sheets. Players must supply two different colored dice and a meter stick. 
(A sharp pencil and a calculator are recommended as well.)
Despite involving a somewhat greater-than-usual amount of record-keeping, both players quickly find themselves in a tense battle of nuclear bluff and counter-bluff. 
Are those incoming blips merely a Red ruse, or is that The Real Thing building up behind Red's Fail Safe Line? 
Should Blue strip the air defenses of his cities to assure his getting off a retaliatory ICBM strike against Red, or protect his populace and risk obliteration of his missile silos?
Overall, a tight, well-balanced table-topper 
It never plays the same way twice.

title: Insomnie
description:
Each player tries to sleep for 12 hours --that is to say, play unchallenged sleep cards to collect 12 plastic pillows.  Noise cards of various kinds can be played on the adversaries to prevent them from doing the same.  One of the noise cards actually wakes up every one.

In the standard rules, you can only attack your neighbor to the left, but the variant is obvious.

title: Voice of the Mummy
mechanisms: Dice RollingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Players move around a multi-level pyramid collecting gems; small battery-powered record player inside sarcophagus at the center of the board instructs players who land on certain spaces on their moves or gem collecting. Once the Great Jewel is removed from sarcophagus (along with the evil cobra-shaped Spell), the record is turned over, and the game becomes a race back to player's home temple by exact count; player with highest gem value wins, regardless of whether they are the first player to reach home base.  This game saw a sequel in the rare Séance.

Fan Home Page: http://www.voiceofthemummygame.com
and 
Fan Home Page: http://www.voiceofthemummy.com

title: The Yuppie Game
mechanisms: Roll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionStock Holding
description:
According to instruction sheets:  Welcome to the world of the Young Urban Professional or Yuppie!  Once known simply as Baby Boomers, Yuppies are generally 25-40 years old and reside in or near a major metropolis.  Because yuppies are hell-bent on having it all, this game tests those players on accumulating wealth and everything else life has to offer.

The players roll the dice and move around the board following directions on the squares.  The first player to achieve seven Yuppie goals wins.  Just a sample of these goals are: getting a marriage partner, a fast-track career, and more than $150,000 in the bank.

title: TV Scrabble
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Word Game
description:
Based on the long-running (1984-90/1993) NBC game show, two players or teams face off by solving words on a game board laid out on paper. Using a special console, a clue is given about each word. A player selects two numbers at random and the console displays two letters to choose from. Some letters are Stoppers, which pass their turn if used.

Play passes back and forth for three Sprints, and the player/team with the most points after three rounds wins.

title: Warrior Quest
description:
The game takes place in the sixteenth century in Japan. Japanese warlords fight the power hungry Shogun tyrant for control over the land and its precious commodities. Only you, using your knowledge of the martial arts gained while playing the game, can enter the castle and assassinate the Shogun and end the tyranny.

The game can be played solitaire or with up to 6 players and it comes with a lot of fun bits.

Two different 22 square mounted boards, one representing the village, the other the castle.  Lots of cards representing characters, encounters and weapons. Four spinners for fight results depending on board and circumstance, 4 different multi-sided dice, fifty red discs, and most retro of all, pointed sticks to write on six Warrior Character ranking pads and one Shogun score pad, all erasable by lifting the transparency with flick of the wrist.

title: Ultimate Rummy
description:
From the directions:
Ultimate Rummy is a card game that consists of five or ten progressive hands.  Each hand played requires one more card than the last for its initial meld.  The object of each hand is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards.  After making your initial meld, you layoff [sic] cards on any meld in play in order to get rid of your cards and go out.  Special decks of cards are used which includes [sic] 6 wild cards called Swirls.  The winner of each hand scores the value of all the cards that remain in the hands of the opponents.

From the credits:
Ultimate Rummy is based upon a version of Rummy known as Contract Rummy.  People may know Contract Rummy by different names, such as Joker Rummy, King Rummy, Progressive Rummy or Shanghai Rummy.  What they all have in common is a fixed number of deals, with each deal having a prefixed goal.  Ultimate Rummy is not so much a creation of one individual, as it is a perfection of the Rummy games that have preceded it.  We therefore must give credit to all the players who over the years have added their own nuances in seeking to achieve the 'ultimate' rummy game.

title: Air Empire
types: Aviation / Flight Economic Industry / Manufacturing Transportation
description: Build an Air Empire! Start air routes and make money --- but you have to maintain them, too. Expand, bid  eliminate the competition. No business experience needed. One of the earliest AH games --- before they made their move to Harford Rd. Object of the game is to own and operate your own airline in this game of jet age transportation. Obtain route franchises, buy and operate planes, attempt to build a profitable airline and eliminate competition.

title: Nautic Miles
types: Card Game Nautical Wargame World War II
description:
This game is a distant relative of Mille Bornes.

You play Convoy cards hidden and try to take them across (accumulate 4000 nautical miles). When an Alert is played, the convoy is vulnerable to attack by warships (carrier beats destroyer beats frigate and so on down to the sub, but two subs beat the carrier); if you cannot defend against the attack, your convoy is sunk (score is based on the convoy's tonnage). Otherwise it survives and the alert is passed. You can play an End of Alert, of course. Two Airplane cards in a row (by the same player) will also sink the convoy; the Airplane Hit card defends. The Mine sinks the convoy outright unless a Minesweeper is played. The Storm slows you down but you cannot be attacked except by the Mine. You can fly the Neutral pavilion, which protects you against anything but the Mine.

Radar cards can reveal the convoy's value. This may be good, revealing the decoy Fishing Trawler (of no value), or bad --the revealed convoy is worth double, either to the sinker or the player!

The game is played in several hands until a set score is reached.

title: Mystic Castle
description: Each player is a Wizard, trying to build his Mystic Castle.  This consists of four towers and the four walls connecting them.  You may protect your castle with soldiers, fences and crowns, and attack the other players' castles with dragons, forces, thieves, lightning bolts.  Other cards (ring, amulet, sygil [sic]) protect against some attacks.  The relation between the ring and dragon colours is a little convoluted, adding to the complexity a little.

title: Cutlass of Fire
description:
Seven jewels have been stolen from the eyes of seven skulls [they must have been cyclops skulls, eh? - though I suppose it's easier than having three and a half skulls lying around...].  You have been given the challenge of returning them.

Points are scored by delivering gems and by defeating monsters.  Your character assigns points between Sword, Mace and Axe talents but also Earth, Water and Fire spells (no Air?!).  The dungeon is made up from the face-down hexagonal tiles at the outset.  When explored, you get to orient the hex tile.

A tile may have nothing, a chest, a monster or a skull on it.  Combat with monsters is a simple dicing affair.  The chest rules are unclear; it seems they're used to store stuff (since your hand of cards is normally limited to three).

Really crude components that you must assemble yourself.

title: 007 James Bond: The Man with the Golden Gun
types: Adventure Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Spies/Secret Agents
description:
From the back of the box:  quot;James Bond has tracked the remarkable Solex Agitator, power source of the Golden Gun, to the home of his enemy, Scaramanga.  You are lured into Scaramanga#039;s fun house maze, where Scaramanga and the Agitator await you.  The tension mounts as you try to escape from the maze with the Solex Agitator and return it to the free world!quot;

A simple solitaire game where you venture through the maze of the funhouse -- find the Solex Agitator and find your way out of the funhouse before you are killed by Scaramanga or one of his traps.  The random map changes with each play; a card placed in each room describes what Bond finds there.  Encounters include Scaramanga and his henchman Nick Nack, a gallery of trigger happy mannequin#039;s, and a sliding floor.

title: Finger-Flick Sports: All-American Edition
description:
The All-American Edition contains three games: Finger-Flick Baseball, Finger-Flick Football and Finger-Flick Basketball.

In Finger-Flick Baseball, the batter flicks a disk from home plate trying to hit specific targets representing base hits.  If he hits into the field away from any target, then the defender tries to flick the disk to an out target.

In Finger-Flick Basketball, the offensive team tries to pass the ball to their players and then shoot it into their basket.  The defensive players attempt to stop their opponent from completing passes and taking shots.

In Finger-Flick Football, the offense tries to flick the ball to their players, moving down the field until scoring a touchdown or field goal.  The defense's object is to knock the offensive player off his player targets and prevent him from scoring.

title: Astro Blitz
description:
A game created by a mad scientist (according to the cover) who combined the best parts of Chess, Checkers, and Chinese Checkers.

An abstract strategy game with some light outer space chrome.  The hex grid mapboard is double sided -- one side is for the two player game, the other side is for three players.  The object of the game is to occupy hexes in an opponent's space station (indicated by a small group of colored hexes.)  Players have two types of pawns: yeoman satellites and explorer satellites.  Yeoman satellites are restricted to the owning player's home territory.  Pawns may jump to move, and opposing pieces are captured by jumping.  Some hexes have obstructions which prohibit movement into or over them.

Re-implemented as:

    Lancer

title: Euro Jump
description: An abstract logical game made of a board with 12 stars put in a circle like in the European flag. One player puts his pieces clockwise and the other one in the opposite direction. The objective of the game is to try to form a stones position over which a player would jump creating an infinite loop. Interesting and original mechanics, and very nice materials. The game is made by a small circular bag, that, when empty, becomes the board itself.

title: Forma o Colore
description: An abstract strategy game in which players must create patterns on the board by flipping discs. Discs have got two types of shapes on the two sides (X or O) and two type of colors (red or green). One player must align  shapes, the opponent colors.

title: Jinx
description:
Jinx is a simple dice game whereby players strive to place three of their markers in a row on the game board.

Only the roll of the dice dictates the placement of your markers.  One white dice and one black dice are rolled.  The spot on the board where those two numbers meet is marked with your color.  If you roll the same combination in the same round, you lose all of your markers currently on the board.  Get three in a row and you win the round.

Win three rounds to win the game.

title: Phoney Baloney
description: In this trivia party game, the object is to guess which of three answers are wrong, not correct.  Whoever can guess the most incorrect answers is the winner!

title: Numbskull
description:
Numbskull: A game that preps you for the college entrance SAT test? In the words of your basic teenager, That could be either totally boring or totally fun. In the words of 23-year-old game inventor Michael Bergman, The traditional test preparations are boring and Numbskull is fun! Family and friends can gather around, make fools out of themselves, and at the same time brush up on the skills necessary to succeed on the SAT.

Numbskull utilizes many of the top 500 vocabulary words used on the SAT (Scholastic Aptitude Test), and has over 300 math and verbal questions.  Instead of using a traditional timer, Numbskull makes the opposing team perform and complete physical and mental tasks to determine when the other players time is up.

title: Pinocchio
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based
description:
The decorated title is Walt Disney Presents Pinocchio Game.

The object of this young children's game is to collect a set of colored cards showing Pinocchio as a real live boy.  As the players go round the track (using a spinner), they draw cards and follow their instructions (Return a Pinocchio Card, Draw a Pinocchio Card and Move Forward Three Spaces, etc.).  Several bad spaces make you lose a turn --because Pinocchio gets in trouble.

In the first stage, each player tries to collect the three parts of Pinocchio's silhouette, in black and white, never holding more than three cards at once.  Once this is achieved, the player is now safe from losing any of these cards.  From that point on, the player hopes to get Turn a Pinocchio Card cards --once all three parts of Pinocchio are in color, he comes alive and the player wins.

title: A Nightmare On Elm Street: The Freddy Game
description:
A game where you use your wildest imagination . You put cards together to make up a story that moves you through Freddy's house. You have to get Freddy before he gets you...the problem is you don't know which player is Freddy! Collect weapons and special cards  see if you can do away with Freddy! 3 or more players. Ages 8 and up.

A complete game includes: Gameboard, 3 Walls, 8 cardboard Character playing pieces, cardboard Freddy playing piece, black-backed Cards, white-backed Cards, die  instructions.

Please add the number of white and black cards!

title: 9 Tibbit Edition
description:
Tibbits is a variation and combination of several games - but played with cubes. The cubes have A, K  Q on them (like cards) and in different colors. You try to build combinations (like 3 identical As,  A-K-Q of the same color, etc.) and collect chips based on what colors and combinations you make. There's also a game called Tic-Tac-Tibbit included. Nice family game. Any number. Ages 8 and up.

A complete copy should include: Gameboard, 9 Tibbit Cubes with dice cup  lid, 60 chips, Folio, pad, pencil  instructions.

title: Conquest of the Ring
description:
Conquest of the Ring, A Middle Earth Game for the entire family by Hobbit Toys and Games, Inc., 1311 Healy Street, Kalamazoo, Michigan.

Conquest of the Ring is a fast action pursuit game in which each of two to four players compete for the ONE Ring of Power.  Located in the center of the playing board, the Ring waits to be claimed by the first player who traces his way through the maze from the point of beginning in his Hobbit Shire. Once claimed, the Ring is placed over the successful player's pawn and the chase is on! To win the game, a player must successfully elude the pursuit of his opponents and carry the Ring back to the starting space of his Hobbit Shire.

title: The Hobbit Game
description:
[From Kulkmann's Gamebox]

The board is a large forest scene with five white trails with white, green and red numbered dots. The trails connect Hobbit Hill(start) to Lonely Mountain (drawing of a treasure trove, mountain and smaug) You travel one of four trails (varying degrees of difficulty) to Lonely Mountain where you get either 20, or 30 gold coins (depending on difficulty of trail). After you reach lonely mountain, you travel back to hobbit hill and do it all over again.

During your travels you may buy equipment (little cardboard pieces) that affect your interaction with the adventure and creature cards. Equipment you can buy (listed on board with cost menu): Ring, Sword, Map, Armor, Eagle

There are red (creature) and green (adventure) cards. These cards depict scenes from the animated cartoon and have brief descriptions of what happens (much like talisman adventure cards).

title: There and Back Again
description: West Coast Games' name for their fantasy adventure game based on The Hobbit. The player attempts to maneuver the company on the playing map to the Lonely Mountain and back again to Rivendell. It is up to you which paths you take and how you handle the encounters.

title: The Ringbearer
description: The Ringbearer - a wargame in which 4 - 10 players use dice and old-time school fantasy miniatures to either capture the Great Ring for the forces of evil, or destroy it by delivering it to the Crack of Darkness.

title: The Siege of Barad-Dur 3430
description:
Near the end of the Second Age of Middle Earth in the year 3430. The Last Alliance of Men and Elves was forced to combat the resurgent power of Sauron. Led by Gil-Galad, the Elven King, and the high King of Men, Elendil, the Army of the Last Alliance decisively defeated the Dark Lord (Sauron) in the battle of Celebrant. Sauron (and presumably his evil servants, the Nazgul, said by some to be his children) fled to his Fortress-Prison, the Barad-Dur, or Dark Tower. It withstood a Seven Year Siege, and then fell when hunger swept the ranks of the Orcs (the Army of Sauron mostly consisted of these creatures. They came in assorted sizes, had leathery hide and unpleasant temper, and would soon kill each other as the enemy but for the powerful leadership of Sauron) and reduced the garrison to a point of being too weak to hold of fort. The final weeks of this siege and the final assault from the subject of this game.

The Siege of Barad-Dur appeared in issue JagdPanther magazine #8, 15 January 1975, with PQ-17.

title: Touché-Coulé infrarouge
description:
This latest evolution of the antique Battleship game (the French name would translate as Infrared Battleship, I guess) seems to be available only in France, Belgium and French Canada so far --I've yet to see an English version.

The two Battleship display boxes have been replaced by full-fledged computers with an infrared link.  The game features sound effects, it talks, it recognizes vocal commands.  (I'm not sure if it can be networked to play with more than two --too bad if it can't!)  Besides the standard Battleship rules, it allows advanced twists like scouting planes and the like --all made possible by the electronic referee.

title: Baffles: Intriguing Game of Words
description:
A unique Word game of skill and strategy. You unscramble words or fill-in missing letters to solve Word Puzzlers - and 1 of every 5 cards is a RACE card, where all players RACE to answer. The goal is to advance around the gameboard and be the first to reach the center. There are 6 categories comprising 2,100 Word Puzzlers. Three methods of play: Official regular game (roughly 1-2 hours playing time), Express (fast-paced game about 1 hour) or Expert (hours upon hours of play). 2 to 6 players. Ages 12 and up.

Game includes: Gameboard, 420 Puzzle cards, 6 pawns, 6 markers, die, and instructions.

title: Bionic Woman
types: Adventure Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Spies/Secret Agents
description:
FROM THE BOX:

Jaime Sommers, The Bionic Woman, is about to go on assignment and needs your help. Assist her through perilous adventures, including the Top Secret Assignment, and you may win the game. THE BONIC WOMAN is an intriguing game for up to four children aged 7 through 12. With a combination of luck and strategy each player tries to move through as many assignments as possible. Accumulating points along the way Steve Austin may add a surprise assist at any time, and there's always the Special Assignments and the final Top Secret Assignment to work toward. The action is fast-paced and full of suspense. Players race around the board, accumulating points by completing assignments. But there's always the chance that an error in judgment will result in a loss, making the final outcome a surprise until the last minute.

Includes: Gameboard, 40 cards (36 Adventure  4 Special), 4 playing pieces, plastic clips  instructions (on inside insert).

Based on the hit 1976-78 ABC/NBC TV series of the same name.

title: Rags To Riches
description:
RAGS TO RICHES is a dice-based stock trading game where each player races to accumulate enough wealth to build his/her own luxury mansion and retire to a quiet life.

The mechanics of the game are quite simple.  Players move around the board, buying and selling stock shares in hopes of creating a profit for themselves so that they can make even bigger investments later on.  Stock prices are always determined by a dice-roll, so prices move up and down quickly and randomly.  Certain safe stocks don't move around in price that much and offer higher dividends, while riskier stocks are much more volatile, but tend to offer higher returns.  The challenge is for each individual player to determine how much money he/she can afford to risk in any particular situation since an unlucky dice roll can wipe that player out.

There is also a simple, yet elegant means of borrowing money in this game.  Players are allowed to borrow money from the bank as long as they pay back double the borrowed amount by the time that his/her token completes two full turns around the board.  This helps to make the game more strategic since players will often find themselves in need of extra cash which they can only borrow with a pretty high interest penalty.

Overall, RAGS TO RICHES is a nice blend of strategy and luck (probably 70% strategy, 30% luck).  The games typically last around 120 minutes (depending on who is playing) and usually keeps everyone in the game until the very end.

title: Alien Armada
description:
Alien Armada pits human defenders of the far future in a desperate struggle against an invading fleet of alien ships and the alien's clone soldiers. Using an easy-to-learn, but subtle game system, Alien Armada presents an infinite variety of strategic and tactical options to all of its one to four players. In addition to its two-player scenario, there are solitaire and multi-player scenarios. The game contains a full-color 22x34 game map, 300 back-printed, mounted playing pieces, a die and a twelve page rules book with separate player record sheets.

--From a Centvrion Games brochure

Note: the approximate playing time is a guess, as I have not played this game, and the rules do not give any estimate.

title: Ubiquity
description:
Each player (red or yellow) starts with 4 randomly positioned cities each with one emperor piece (large cylinder) and three warriors (small cylinders). Each turn two dice are rolled with two different pieces being moved along interconnecting lines between or into cities. A warrior which lands on a piece removes it from the board. An emperor landing on a piece removes it from the board. An emperor passing over an opposition warrior paralyzes it with a white disc until an emperor from its color lands on it. Pieces landing on paralyzed pieces or pieces of their own color move to the next square. Towns are taken over by moving two warriors into them. When this happens any opposition pieces still in the city are removed from the board and one of each type may be returned to the board by the invader. While they have one or more piece in that taken city it is not able to be entered by the opposition.
Game ends when a.) all opposition towns have been taken. or b.) all opposition pieces taken and or paralyzed.

title: King Hamlet
description: Players race around Elsinor castle collect the ten letters that spell KING HAMLET while engaging in duels and avoiding assassination.

title: Penumbra
description: Abstract racing game where each player attempts to be the first to move five Scorers to the top of the pyramid of the Sun.  A player uses three Eclipsers and two Captors to hinder the opponent.

title: The Simpsons Mystery of Life
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Trivia
description:
Be the player (Homer, Marge, Bart or Lisa) to get all five items on their Agenda Card checked off and back to HOME first, or get all Twelve Donuts and ignore your Agenda Card.

Game has a nice Board, with an outer Area with four 'inner' paths to travel as well. The Springfield Shopping Mall caters to Marge's Agenda, while the Springfield School is more for Bart and Lisa and of course Homer's path has the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant.

Gameplay is simple.... roll and move, try to land on special spaces to accomplish goals. Get Grocery Chits for Marge or roll to see how many hours Bart goofed off or Homer spent at work. Or, skip the Agenda and just try to beg/borrow/steal or; gasp, buy all the donuts!

Components are thin; the cards and chits are no more than double paper thin, and the money is paper. The Artwork is Grade A Simpson, and liberally applied all over! The game is 1990 so the artwork is less refined First Season Simpsons. The playing pieces are ok, cardboard stand-ups with plastic bases.

title: Counter Point
description:
Players pull chips at random, scoring by completing a row vertically, horizontally or diagonally in four colors. The rows apply thereby horizontal, vertically and diagonally.

It was published as 'Quaro' in the Ravensburger Casino Series.

title: Saturday Night Live Trivia Board Game
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game Trivia
description:
(From the back of the box):It's the Saturday Night Live Trivia Game! Test your knowledge of nearly two decades of hilarious television comedy from Saturday Night Live. Every card brings another SNL sketch to life! You and your teammates are challenged to dramatize or draw various character references, famous phrases or funny scenes from the show. Impersonate Roseanne Roseannadanna or the prim Church Lady - imitate the outrageous antics of Wayne's World and the Coneheads. Also included are over 500 trivia questions that test your knowledge of obscure SNL humor! It's great fun for everyone.

In this beer-and-pretzels game 2 groups of 2 players(minimum of 4 players to play the game) compete by answering trivia or by trying to get their partner to guess something SNL-related by drawing it, charading it, or by acting it out.

title: Cranium Booster Box 1
types: Action / Dexterity Expansion for Base-game Humor Memory Party Game Trivia
description:
More cards for the base game.

Expands:

    Cranium

title: The Duel
description:
A miniatures based dueling game.

From the back cover:

This book includes full rules for the Elven fighting style of SHA-DAK Kir. Players can create characters and duel together in order to improve their honor and nobility.

title: Pferdeäppel
description: Pferdeppel is a tactical 2-player game.  It is fast and easy to learn. Each player controls a horse and tries to either capture their opponent or make their opponent's piece unmovable.  The horses move just like in chess.  The twist is that each time a piece is moved the prior spot it occupied is marked.  Marked spots can no longer be moved into, so eventually somebody gets stuck (or captured).

title: LifeStories
description:
Basically, roll the dice, move, draw a card, and share something about your life as directed on the card.

From the front of the box:

A fun game of telling tales and sharing smiles with family and friends.

title: Swordplay
description:
Swordplay is a man-to-man duel in medieval times.  Each player has a map of their body over which a hex map is laid.  In the course of the duel, they will position their shield over some hexes (a portion of the body).  Depending on the action they select for the turn, they may position their sword over some more hexes (for a parry) or may point it at some part of the opponent.  The actions and positions chosen will result in some outcome which may include damage to the opponent.

The game includes plastic swords of the same sort that are used as swizzle sticks in mixed drinks.

title: The Peloponnesian War
description: The Peloponnesian War is a game simulation of the war waged between Athens and Sparta and their respective allies from 431 to 404 B.C. for control of the Hellenic world. The game is a strategic level simulation with each turn representing one year. The main infantry unit is a mora of hoplites and the main naval unit is a squadron of triremes.

title: Tricolor
description:
Tricolor is a game of pure strategy. In the two person game each player has 18 stackable checkers in his color. If three people play, each one has 11 checkers. The counters are placed on the hexagonal board with fields in different colours. Different colours mean different strength for the checkers - the aim is to eliminate all opponents checkers from the board.

The game was invented by the famous Belgian mathematician Maurice Kraitchik who described it for the first time in his book La Mathmatique des Jeux (Brussels 1930) on page VII-VIII (introduction) and 470-475 (rules, example games). It is one of the oldest stacking games (older are just Tower of Hanoi, Lasca and Bashni).

title: Treffles Playing Cards
description:
The Treffles deck is made up of 40 cards, each divided into three segments containing zero to three dots.  Five games are described in the rules:


    The Snake - a matching game
    Treffles Gin - a Gin Rummy adaptation
    Sluff - a Spite and Malice style matching game
    High or Low - a trick-taking game
    Partners - a Concentration/Memory game


Re-implemented by: Space Dominoes

title: Scrabble Overturn
description:
Fundamentally, Scrabble Overturn is a scoring variant on Scrabble (q.v.)

The board is a simple grid, into which one places letter cylinders which depict a given letter in four colors.  If a player employs existing cylinders in making a word, those cylinders are rotated to show the active player's color.

Score is totaled only at the end of the game; and only words whose cylinders are entirely in one color count.

title: The Battle of Saratoga
types: Age of Reason American Revolutionary War Wargame
description: Medium complexity wargame of the Battles of Saratoga during the American Revolutionary War. Generals Gates and Arnold with Colonel Morgan's Virginians triumph in the most important battle of the Revolutionary War.  144 counters. Rare.  Limited Printing.

title: Match 'Em
description:
The object of the game is to be the first to win three hands.  In each hand, players aim to play all of his/her cards before the opponents.

The game comes with a plastic play mat.  It basically outlines where each player plays his/her cards and where the stockpile is placed.

Players attempt to match the exact sum of the previous play with one or more cards from their hand.

title: Pharaoh's Quest
description:
Pharaoh's Quest is a strategy game presented with a historical flavor.  It presents itself as a tool used by Egyptian pharaohs to learn strategy; around 1700 BCE, the Egyptian empire was conquered by the Hyksos and it took them 100 years to drive the invaders out of their lands. One player assumes the role of an Egyptian pharaoh and the other a Hyksos invader.

The game takes place on a board that is nine by four squares; an extra 4-square row extends the playing area at the bottom left of each player's side.  The players set up their pieces in their respective corners and take turns to move their pieces.  Each player has four cities and the remaining pieces are military units with different movements.  The first player to capture all four of their opponent's cities (by moving military units onto them) wins the game.

title: Lee vs. Meade
description:
The Battle of Gettysburg was fought in July 1, 1863 until July 3rd of the same year. It took place in and around the town of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. 
It was the battle with the largest number of casualties in the American Civil War and is often described as the war's turning point.
Union Major General George Gordon Meade's Army of the Potomac defeated attacks by Confederate General Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia. This battle put an end to Lee's plans for an invasion of the North.

Lee vs Meade is a game that covers the Battle of Gettysburg. It was the first game in a series of games put out by Rand known as the 'Command Series Volume I'.  The later version put out by Gamut of Games featured a mounted map-board while the original Rand Games version had a map on heavy paper.
Lee vs. Meade has a 17X17 map 72 counters(36 for each player) combat charts and turn records charts along with a rulebook.  The scale used is 1/2 mile per square and each unit is considered to be an entire division.  The two-color map is mainly green but there are also some hills and ridges. There is a clearly shown road network of the area as well as terrain that are suitable for defensive outposts.

The map of the Gettysburg area is broken up into a 12x12 square grid.  This grid system was used in several of the games developed by Rand Game Associates and was called the Time/Space Grid. Movement costs necessary to go from one square to the next are visible on the grid at the edges and corners between the squares making it easier to move without the use of a movement chart. Unlike some games that use a square grid, diagonal movement is permitted.

Another feature common to most of the games offered by Rand Games was fairly elaborate combat sub-routine in which the attacker and defender would each pick a combat method from a 6x6 matrix called the Tactical Analysis Chart and draw the appropriate Tac Card. These Tac Cards are numbered from 1 to 6. The cell on the Tactical Analysis Chart that corresponds to the intersection of the two players' combat methods determines which combat results table is used. There are 6 different types of CRT used in this game.

The turn sequence is easy. Firstly the Confederate army moves.Any combat resulting is resolved and then the Union army moves and any combat is resolved.
In order to initiate a combat you have to move your units onto a square edge that contains enemy units. 
There are four different scenarios in the game. A different time of the battle is used in each one and different victory conditions are required for each one.

title: Subway Vigilante
description:
Ever wanted to be Charles Bronson in Death Wish, just gunning down any punk that gets in your face, sasses you back, or even looks at you funny?

From the box cover:
You've read about this sort of thing in the newspapers and magazines. Now you can play it!

Starting with a handgun and six bullets, up to four players attempt to survive a harrowing ride from Brooklyn to the Bronx on a New York City subway system jam-packed with vicious Punks. Shoving matches, car derailments, nosy security guards, overworked policemen, and botched subway transfers add to the game's (and your) Angst level the closer you get to home. 
Game mechanics are basic roll-and-move, with Punk and Make My Day! cards being drawn if you land on the appropriate space. Game components are semi-professional
as regards the gameboard, rules, and cards, along with four metal handgun tokens and twenty four bullets. You will need every one of them.

Interestingly, the rules include guidelines for a Roundtable Discussion to be held after the game is finished. 
Just try to keep a straight face!

title: Thrice
description: A round is three rolls of five 30-sided dice with letters on them (26 letters + 3 wilds +1 wild vowel). Each player chooses where to fill in the letters on their own work sheets - everyone uses the same letters, but assigns them in secret. These choices limit you as the round goes on.  You can leave gaps in your words, hoping the next roll will fill them in.    You also have an initial pool of letters you can use to fill in blanks.  Only complete words score.

title: Nix
description: This is a nice set of blank cards. Great if you want to make a prototype game, bad if you expected to actually be buying a game. Makes a great gag gift too.

title: Toy War
description:
Basically, battle it out with your toys, but use some rules to keep everyone honest.

Imagine an elite squad of Barbies taking on the fluffy bear patrol. You can do this and much more, or less, with Toy Wars.
 
     http://www.teamfrog.com/toywar.htm

title: Capital Adventure
description:
The object of the game is to travel around the world from West to East. You must manage your money well and answer travel questions properly to obtain more money.

Players race their way around the world answering questions to get money to pay for air fares.  Various obstacles and dangers (in the form of event cards) will be met along the way.  Can be played in teams as well.  The box is large and heavy (loads of question cards) and the board a nearly 4ft long map of the world.

title: Tarawa: Bloody Betio
description:
Tarawa: Bloody Betio is a war game that attempts to simulate the World War 2 battle over the titular island between Japan and the United States of America.  In the historical battle, the US Second Marine Division had 3 days to clear the island of Japanese soldiers.  The bloody battle inflicted nearly 3,000 casualties on the Marines; only 17 of 4,700 Japanese soldiers survived.  The solitaire game places the player in command of the US forces to determine how he or she performs compared to the historical outcome.

A map overlaid with a hexagonal grid forms the game's playing field.  In the middle lies the isle of Tarawa, surrounded by water.  The terrain and Japanese defenses are also printed out, as well as the US-designated landing beaches.  Each turn, the player receives an amount of forces to deploy onto the beaches.  He or she handles attacks between the two armies, rolling dice and checking tables to resolve their effects.  When the Marines has defeated the Japanese in a hex, a cleared marker is placed on it (and removed if the US forces retreat from the hex due to a counterattack).  If the Japanese attack is particularly effective, the Marines suffers casualties, which is reflected by moving a marker on the Casualty Track.  The player also has to concern him- or herself with booby traps, snipers, air raids, morale, and supply.

The game ends at the end of the third turn.  The player wins if all hexes of the island are cleared and the Casualty Track reflects less than 5,000 casualties.

title: Charlotte's Web Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description: In this 1974 children's game by Hasbro based on the cartoon movie, players begin on the starting square, spin the movement wheel to determine who will move first, then, on their turn, spin to determine how many spaces they will move. Some squares have certain instructions the player must follow. The gameplay is very simple and resembles Candyland, although the board is winding and contains a crossing loop. The first player to reach the Wilbur is Safe with Friends square wins. The board contains many characters and references from the movie.

title: España 36
description: Espaa 36 is a game that reproduces the development of the Spanish Civil War in it's military, economic, political and diplomatic aspects, including the fight in the sea and in the air, espionage, foreign intervention, etc..

title: Generations
description:
The Game of Family Knowledge

This is a party game intended for play by families.  Each team tries to answer questions about their own family; the best ones are those where one player has to write down his answer to a personal question, then everyone else tries to guess what his answer was.  Good for a light fun time at a family get-together.

title: Cromwell
types: Civil War Pike and Shot Wargame
description:
Pouch Series Game #8

Cromwell is a dual game, that is, two levels of complexity are provided. The game board shows a strategic map of England at the time of the First Civil war (September, 1642, to May, 1646) separated into counties and important cities, hereafter referred to as AREAS.
Is a two players game, but more players may be added. In all multi-player games, the Royalist supreme commander would of course be King CHARLES.

title: Monster Fressen
description: Light, fun game with some strategy and interesting dice mechanics.  Players move around the monster's cooking pot looking to pick up the highest scoring disgusting ingredients while bopping other players that they land on.

title: Ticker Tape
description:
Thirty-two companies are represented. Each is assigned to one or more of nineteen industries. Changes in prices of the stocks of each company are noted on the gameboard using a china marker.

Each player begins with $15,000 and a sheet of blank stock certificates on which to record purchases and sales. The pawn, there is only one for all players to move, is placed on 'start'. The space on which the pawn rests tells the player to obey a chance card, or more likely, which industries stock prices will rise and fall on the next turn.

A player's turn begins with the roll of the dice to determine how much each affected stock has changed. (There is a chance table for each stock.) The pawn is advanced the number rolled and the player who rolled the dice may purchase as much stock of one company and sell as much of another company desired.

The players play until the end of the time limit agreed upon. The players cash in their stocks and the one with the most money wins.

title: Templum
description: A beautiful production for a variation of Stack 4, or Connectris, in which when a column is filled the bottom stone (of that only column) is removed. In this kind of advanced connect four game, you try to connect 5 balls to a row on 5 sticks. Adding a 6th to one pile drops the bottom one out of the game ...

title: Electronic Master Mind
description:
Invicta's Super-Sonic Mastermind is founded on the original game of the same name.

1-4 players are trying to guess a combination of numbers that has been randomly selected by the computer. When a guess is entered, a response is returned indicating how many digits are correct and how many digits are correct but in the incorrect position.

Depending on the difficulty level, players have a limited number of guesses to find the correct code.

The Super-Sonic in the name is for an upgrade of the original Invicta Electronic MasterMind that has added a timer and sound effects.

title: Hannibal
description:
Hannibal from Rusiecki is a strategic Roman game and is the first game where land combat occurs in same hex and uses fluid movement/combat system.Board mounted on foam core.

This game is played in turns of one year each. Starting in 218 B.C.,a time marker piece is moved down the Time Records one space after the completion of each FULL turn. The game ends in the 202 B.C. turn.

Components:
1 Map
42 Carthaginians red round counters + 2 red markers
42 Roman white round counters + 2 white markers
1 die
1 Box made of white bristol board

A second edition was published in 1972 and a third in 1973.

title: The American Girls Game
description:
A game from the maker of the popular American Girl line of dolls and accessories.  Players move around the board trying to collect tokens and sets of matching cards.  Trading cards are drawn each turn and several spots on the board provide a chance to trade cards among the players.  Trivia cards about the American Girl stories provide opportunities to earn extra tokens.

Comes with six detailed pewter figurines that are used as the player pawns.

title: The High Crusade
description: Ares Magazine #16. 1345 AD, Aliens land a starship on earth, unfortunately the local knights defeat the aliens, and steals the starship. Thus starts the crusade against the aliens, with some help from independent races. Based on the novel of the same name by Poul Anderson.

title: Jumble Plus
description:
Players form up to four teams. A card is drawn to determine the puzzles for the team taking its turn. All the letters to be used to spell out the answers to the questions on the card are placed in front of the team.

The reader reads the category aloud. The team now has two minutes to answer as many questions as possible and spell on the answers on the gameboard. There are a three-letter, a four-letter, a five-letter, a six-letter and a seven-letter word. In addition, those five words' initial letters are an anagram for another word. If time still remains there is a ten-letter word to unscramble!

Teams can by a hint at the cost of one point. Score is based on the number and length of words solved.

The winning team is the one with the most points after five rounds of play.

title: Shot and Shell
description:
Shot and Shell - Naval Combat in the Civil War, is an extension of the Yaquinto game The Ironclads and includes a conversion chart. Scale is 100 yards per hex, 3 minutes per turn, with 1 ship or regiment (of infantry, or equivalent in cavalry or artillery) per unit-counter. 27 scenarios and 6 maps.

Shot and Shell can be treated as a stand-alone game. It comes with everything needed to play.

The land-warfare dimension is greatly expanded in Shot and Shell (over that of the Ironclads Expansion Kit). Scenarios can be naval only or land-sea combined--or even land-only, if one wanted to design such a scenario. There are also rules for firing several same-caliber guns at once, reducing the amount of die rolling.

title: Taxdodger
description: Taxdodger (warning! Tax evasion is a serious offense) is printed several times on the board and box. This Canadian game pits one player as the taxman trying to accumulate money by performing audits and increasing the tax rate, while the rest of the players are taxpayers trying to accumulate money through legitimate tax shelters and tax evasion.

title: Operation Corndog
description:
Build a profitable lineup of carnival attractions, while stopping the other players from doing the same. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

Card Examples

Attractions: Ferris Wheel, Food Booth, Petting Zoo

Modifiers: Breakdown, Faulty Equipment, Fun Factor +3

Specials: Free Admission, Hide the Body

title: Orcs in the Hood
description:
The war was long. The war was bloody. But now, the Orcish Brotherhood has the last of the Human Alliance holed up in the crumbling ruins of the lower east side. Victory is assured, but when the dust settles, who will lead the victors?

A strategic combat game for 2-4 players.

title: Glider-Pit Gladiators
types: Ancient Fantasy Fighting Print & Play Sports Wargame
description:
Glider-Pit Gladiators is a board game of ancient aerial combat. The latest version (2002) is currently available for download from the BoardGameGeek files section below.

Two to six players control primitive gliders descending into a deep, sheer-walled pit. Within this natural arena the glider pilots engage in ritualistic gladiatorial combat. A combination of martial and flying skills is required for victory. Every decision a player makes, from the selection of weapons to the anticipation of fickle air currents, helps determine whether a gladiator is on the road to glory... or disaster.

The object of the game is simply to have the last glider airborne. The game features a variable player turn order (depending on the altitude and speed of each glider), five different types of weapons (including ranged weapons and nets), risky ramming attacks, and up/down drafts. Players have the option of controlling more than one glider (up to three each in a two-player game). The competition may be a last man flying free-for-all or the players can form competing teams of gliders.

The experimental Campaign Expansion rules allow you to play a continuing gladiator character. The Expansion includes rules for Character Survival, Experience, and Special Abilities and Advantages. Gladiator characters who survive a match (and aren't crippled in the process) receive experience and a chance to gain special abilities and advantages. Gladiators who are victorious are more likely develop skills that will help them gain future victories in the arena. A procedure for randomly generating experienced gladiator characters is also described.

Glider-Pit Gladiators was originally designed (under a deadline of a month or two) for the online 1998 Microgame Design Contest held via the Yahoo Groups Microgame Mailing List. The game was updated under the name Glider-Pit Gladiators 2002 for the second micro-game design competition. The 2002 update focused on cleaning up the rules and making improvements to the spartan components. The experimental Campaign Expansion Rules were developed to provide added depth, and they were also updated in 2002.

title: Coral Sea
description: Coral Sea covers the battles that took place in the Southern Pacific during World War Two.   Search moves are plotted and task forces can only be attacked once found.

title: Political Asylum
description:
Political Asylum by Windbreaker Entertainment Inc. is an extremist political board game, with the objective of acquiring a specific inventory of items, (from the rules...) most readily accomplished by assuming the role of an ideal liberal.

The players take turns rolling the dice, drawing cards, collecting money and moving strategically around the board. Players may buy cars to facilitate their movement. There are 2 sets of cards - Liberal, marked by a pink pig on the back of the black cards, and Conservative - marked by a white eagle on the back of the black cards. There are party elections, Welfare Certificates, Court Summons Cards (used to sue another player), lotteries, an Employment Agency, Food Stamps and various other unusual game play facets.

The artwork in this game was done by Mike Snavely.

Mfg. Suggested Ages on the game box are Politically Aware to Adult

title: The Cinderella Game
types: Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: In this children's game based on the popular fairytale and cartoon movie, players take turns spinning the game spinner, and move their playing pawns accordingly. The board tells the classic tale with words and pictures, and there are special pumpkin and slipper squares placed throughout the board. A player landing on one of these squares either moves back 6 squares for a pumpkin, or forward 7 squares for a slipper, and also takes a card representing that item(if that particular item has already been taken, a player either takes a rose card or takes another turn). The first player to reach the finish at end of the board or collect all three cards(rose, pumpkin and slipper) wins.

title: Creeps' Castle
description:
This is a children game from Spear's. It does not use a battery , but a ball bearing  to get the doors and traps moving. The horror theme is always attractive to kids.
Each player tries to go from the bottom to top of the 3D castle. Each time a piece lands in a white square, the player must press hard on it in order to release the ball. The ball will fall down and on its way through certain doors and traps will flick hitting the players pieces. Those hit pieces will fall from the Castle and need to start again !!
Look the pictures and rules, and you can figure it out quickly.

The magic part, is that the ball, can follow 3 different ways of coming down... so flicking different traps and doors each time accordingly. Therefore, some shouting and excitement, and if lucky relief, when standing in a dangerous place and you hear the ball coming down...it could be you!

title: Mega Meal
description:
6 Cheeseburgers, 2 Salads, 1 Ketchup, 7 Milkshakes.  Ketchup King is crowded with people!  Can you memorize all the orders?
