AirLand Battle: Corps Operational Command in Europe is an operational level wargame that pits an American corps against a Soviet combined arms army which is reinforced by a second echelon tank army.

Players control additional air, artillery and helicopter assets.

This hex and counter wargame features limited intelligence, doctrinal tactical formations, organic supplies, missile and artillery ammunition restrictions, electronic warfare capabilities, chemical warfare, night combat restrictions, special light infantry capabilities, air interdiction and close air support units, refit of units and more.

title: Battle Cry!
description:
Battle Cry! is a man-to-man wargame covering infantry battles on a tactical level between US Marine units and the Imperial Japanese army units. The scale is 10 metres from hexside to hexside and each counter represents a single infantry.

Four maps are provided which simulates the typical terrain found in the Pacific War. The maps include a beach map, jungle map, mixed terrain map and rough terrain map.

Each individual unit will have a performance rating (PR) which requires that a performance check (PC) be made before moving, firing, observing or assaulting.

The advanced game includes armoured fighting vehicles (AFVs), crew-served weapons, anti-tank weapons, mortars, flamethrowers, mines, hidden units and more.

title: See Queue
description: This is a two - to four person tic-tac-toe-like game using a four level circular board.  You try to complete a line of four in your color or an orbit in your color. Interesting twist on a rather basic game - interesting ability to add additional players - helps mitigate first player advantage.

title: VCR Baseball
description:
From the back of the box:

VCR Baseball is the exciting baseball strategy game that can turn an ordinary afternoon into a thrilling day at the ballpark.  Become an actual player and see the outcome of your hits on TV as you watch the video tape containing footage of professional slugging action.  Home runs, double plays, triples, fielding errors, pop-ups...it's all there for you to see and experience!

The basic game is quickly learned and fast playing.  Each time you pitch or bat you choose a baseball strategy.  Make your decision just as in real baseball -- depending on what kind of hit you want to get, how many outs there are, and if there are runners on the base.  Then compare your choice with your opponent's and find out what happens.  You could strike out, get a walk, or a hit.  If it's a hit -- you watch the videotape to see the outcome!

And VCR Baseball is actually two strategy games in one.  The advanced game adds more baseball depth.  Your team players have their own batting and pitching abilities, so you can bring in a right-handed pinch hitter to try for a crucial hit off a lefty pitcher.  Or relieve a tiring pitcher.  Intentionally walk an excellent hitter, bunt or steal a base.

Features:
- 2 games in one!
- unlimited replayability
- for 2 players
- live footage of professional ball players in action
- fun for ages 12 to adult

Components:
- approx. 30-minute video tape
- colorful game board
- 6 playing pieces
- batting and pitching cards
- playing grids
- score pad
- player cards
- 3 dice

title: Fibber
description:
From the back of the box:

FIBBER! is the family fun board game with a great new twist -- when players announce what number they've rolled, how can you find out if they're telling the truth when you can't see their die?  By challenging, that's how -- Just say Are you a Fibber?  Off comes the top of their dice shaker and if they were fibbing -- whoops -- back they go; but if they were telling the truth -- then back you go!

title: Tamagotchi: The Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Everybody wants a TAMAGOTCHI toy, but not everyone has the devotion to raise one properly. Here's a perfect solution: The TAMAGOTCHI Game. Play this game with your friends, (with or without the TAMAGOTCHI toy.) Just keep your pet well-fed, happy, healthy, clean, well-trained and amused...before you know it you'll have a full-grown, fully nurtured pet!

Everything you need is here: 4 TAMAGOTCHI moving pieces, 72 nurturing cards, 4 growth meter and an exciting game board. The TAMAGOTCHI Game is a terrific way to enjoy some real interactive quality time with family, friends, and of course, your favorite pet!

title: Escort: The Game of Guys and Gals
description:
Object is for the player to move all three of his 'Gals from their starting places on the board and into their homes on the opposite side of the board.

They're escorted home by the nine 'Guys' of each respective player.

Opposing 'Guys' can be captured by jumping.

'Guys'  'Gals' can move in any direction, backward, forward, left, right or on diagonal.

'Gals' cannot jump and can only be used to block moves.

First player to succeed in getting all three of his 'Gals' into their 'homes' on the opposite side of the board wins the game.

title: Screwball: The Mad, Mad, Mad Game
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Every player or 'Boob' is in the MADvertising business on MADison Avenue. He drives his Jokeswagon along the path, collecting clients and slogans. Meanwhile he spends his Mad Money.

First Boob to lose all his Mad Money ends the game and he is the winner.... Unless... the richest of the remaining players holds in his hand the Madly Rich slogan - this player is then declared the winner.

Supposedly this game was at the center of a Mad Magazine lawsuit which Transogram lost. I haven't been able to find anything substantiating this.

title: Campaigns of the Civil War: Vicksburg and Chancellorsville
description:
Campaigns of the Civil War: Vicksburg and Chancellorsville is a wargame that simulates two critical events of the American Civil War through a game system with a map divided into strategic squares.

While this game is designed especially for solitaire play, it can accommodate a second player.

Individual counters represents divisions, brigades, leaders, ironclads, transports and a handful of companies and battalions deployed in probing operations.

A Combat Results Table (CRT) and a six-sided die is used to resolve combat.

title: Master Herbalist
description:
Object of the game is collect as many illness sets determined by the players.

In his/her turn, each player draws and Illness Card. He then places the card face up in front of him. The player then draws an Herb Card. He then has one chance to identify one illness that is listed on the Herb Dial under that Herb.

If the player is correct, he may retain the Herb Card.

It the Herb Card matches the illness of the card or cards he has, the player has the option of placing it under that illness card or saving it for other possible illness sets.

Winner is the player who first completes the predetermined number of Illness Sets.

title: Legal Decision
description:
Legal Decision is a challenging game for Ages 14 and up. A game like you have never played before -- all the excitement and suspense of a courtroom trial! You can be the quick-witted defense attorney, State's tough prosecutor, jury foreman, or the judge himself! Witnesses testify, cross-examination may change testimony - jurors' sympathy can be swayed, new evidence may be introduced. The drama builds as the jury moves toward its verdict.

The designer is likely Rico Gatti who is listed as the copyright holder.

title: The People's Court
description: The People's Court game is based on the very popular television show where the litigants settle their disputes in Judge Wapner's courtroom. An exciting game where the players are plaintiffs trying to win cases by landing on 'Case Cards', such as Problem Pets, Neighborhood Feuds, Disservices and Shoddy Goods. And, just as on the TV show, Judge Wapner is the ultimate authority.

title: Case Race
description:
Welcome to West's Great American Case Race Game. The objective is to have some old-fashioned fun as you learn the advantages that determine success in computer-assisted legal research. But that's not all. It's a fast-moving game, and it will take some strategy and thinking to win. You will have to make a lot of on-the-spot decisions. The challenge makes the game all the more fun! The rules are straightforward and most of the rules for the game are printed on the board itself. 
West Publishing Company was the parent company for the Westlaw computer-assisted research service, which this game was apparently designed to promote over the competing service, Lexis. The game includes Westlaw and Lexis cards. The Westlaw cards usually score points for the player due to efficient and easy to use services, while the Lexis cards typically cause the players to lose points because of purported 'difficulties' with West's competitor's service.

title: Guilty Party
description: You and your friends are the participants in the trial of David Defendant. The charge is MURDER TWO. After the attorneys and witnesses are finished with all the testimony all of you will become a jury to determine whether or not David was convicted or not. The testimony (facts) change from game to game so it's never the same.

title: Attorney Power
description: Ready to practice law? ATTORNEY POWER (1982) will give you a corner office and as many clients as you can handle, but you have to give oorrect advice to real legal problems. ATTORNEY POWER will give you the opportunity to conduct a bar investigation, neglect to file a lawsuit, give advice on changing a will, decide where to sue, and many more real life legal problems. The game has paralegals, fee gougers and client stealers, as well as 56 evidence and liability rulings based upon recent court decisions in both criminal and civil law.

title: The Story of the U.S. Air Force
types: Aviation / Flight Children's Game Novel-based Racing
description:
A  Landmark Game  based on volume 89 in the Landmark children's book series by Random House. For Ages 9 - 15

The game is a race starting from ground level to see who can be the first into orbit. The players start off with balloons and as they climb upwards various historical aircraft become available (including the Wright Flyer, Curtis Jenny, Spirit of St. Louis, P-51, F-104, and X-15). The higher the altitude reached, the more advanced the aircraft that may be acquired.

The game features colorful components with an interesting gimmick or two - for instance, the spinners are part of a box insert depicting an aircraft control panel, and the players use a miniature compass to try and get a correct reading on a radar screen box.

title: The Boss
description: Have you got what it takes to make it to the Executive Suite, or is Office Boy as high as you'll rise? You'll find out when you play THE BOSS, the fun-filled game that realistically recreates the gotta-get-ahead world of today's big business! You've got to be shrewd enough to make the wildest deals you can dream up -- or break a deal that's holding you back! You can buy 'n lend stock, sell 'n trade Experience, promise future favors (and fail to deliver!) -- yes, you can wheel 'n deal any outrageous way you can get away with! It's fast-movin', fast-talkin', fast-dealin' fun -- all the way to the top!

title: PanzerForce
description:
PanzerForce is a realistic game that shows the problems faced by tank commanders in World War II. But it is much more than just a game. The two different tanks that will collide in battle will respond and perform as they actually did. You, the tank commander, will make the decisions that lead to victory or defeat. This is tank combat, the way it really was, a game of deadly adventure.

A game of tactical tank-to-tank combat where two Tigers face off against four Shermans. The game uses 6 HO scale plastic tanks.

title: Magnetic Poetry The Game for Kids
types: Children's Game Humor Party Game Word Game
description:
Be the first player to make it from the vegetable crisper to the freezer by win four poem-writing rounds.

One player is the judge, who spins a spinner to select the poem category (gross, sad, mad, pretty, silly, happy, gross) The remaining players write poems, based on a subject selected from their hand of subject cards, and using magnetic word tiles selected from the word board arrange them on their play board to form their poem befitting the category and subject. At the end of the three minute timer period, the judge selects the poem that is the best match of subject and category and declares the round winner, whose playing piece moves up one space towards the freezer on the score track. The judgeship passes to the left and play continues until one player wins their fourth poem round.

title: Sue You!
description: Sue You! was invented by a law student in the fall of 1991. He was intrigued -- and troubled -- by society's apparent fascination with lawsuits, and set out to create a game that would capture the essence of that fascination . . . The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player by successfully suing other players. The game ends when one of the players runs out of money. The player with the most money at that time is the winner.

title: UNO: Hello Kitty
types: Card Game Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
It's Uno but with Hello Kitty on the cards.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Hello Kitty Love Me Not' wild card. Upon playing the 'Love Me Not' card the player names a color and discards one card in that color. Each player in turn must then also discard one card from their hand or draw from the draw pile. Those discarding must say Love Me and those drawing, Love Me Not else face the evil UNO penalty of drawing an additional card. Play then resumes as normal upon returning to the player intitiating the love me(not) session.

title: Play the Game
description:
Play the Game. The book you can play. Complete with counters and detailed rules.

Welcome to the exciting world of Board Games! From the earliest known board game in the English language, A Journey Through Europe, invented in 1759, through Edwardian England's Golden Age of Games, to the mid-20th Century, you will travel 300 years of history and pleasure. There are great new experiences for aficionados, as well as intimate games for two and party games for many.

This book includes color photos of the boards from 46 vintage games. Rules are included, along with a sheet of pieces to cut out, so that all of the games may be played.

List of games included

title: Great Board Games
types: Abstract Strategy Adventure Book Children's Game Racing Wargame
description:
Great Board Games. Over 40 games that you can play. 1895-1955. Complete with rules and counters.

Similar to the author's earlier Play the Game book, Great Board Games is a collection of 43 vintage games that you can play. There is a color photo of the board for each game, rules, and a few sheets of game pieces to be cut out.

title: The Boardgame Book
description:
The first edition (Knapp and Cavendish) was published in 1979. It came in a slipcase and included four 20x26 double-sided sheets with extra-large game boards. The second edition (Exeter and Cavendish) was published in 1983 and does not have the slipcase or the extra sheets. Both editions have a loose sheet with cut-out pieces for the games in the book.

Play a boardgame known to the Pharoahs of Egypt, called Senat. Exercise your skill on Go, a boardgame considered an important part of Samurai warriors' education in the seventeenth century. Learn how to play Mu Torere, a popular tribal boardgame from New Zealand, or Konane, the game Captain Cook found the natives playing in Hawaii. Introduce your children to your own childhood favorites, like Ludo, Checkers and Tic-Tac-Toe.

The Boardgame Book is a beautiful compendium of the world's most entertaining and universally popular games. Every board in this fascinating and unique collection of over eighty games can be played on the page, because the book has been specially designed to open flat. For easy reference, instructions with diagrams explaining how to play are on the pages adjoining each board. All the pieces and other equipment needed for play are supplied on a separate cut-out sheet.

Here is a unique collection of over eighty games from every part of the world and dating as far back as five thousand years. Some, though very popular in their countries of origin, are almost totally unknown abroad, and others are rarities only to be found in museums and private collections.

Many of the games reproduced in The Boardgame Book are from an especially fine collection built up by R.C. Bell over many years. All the games have been chosen as much for their interest and visual appeal as for their value as a pleasant and universal pastime. About one third of the boards reproduced in this book are completely new designs which have been specially commissioned, with all the details taking account of traditional models.

title: Speed Dash
description:
Speed Dash!! The Great Sailplane Race.

Strategic decisions you make in The Great Sailplane Race are much like those in real soaring competition. Whether you stay on the main course or fly Cloud Streets, Ridge Lift, or the Wave depends on the situation, how your competitors are doing, and how gutsy you are. A word of warning: Speed Dash brings out the tiger in a pilot!

title: Rennschwein Rudi Rüssel
types: Animals Bluffing Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description: Part of the book and movie franchise of the same name, Rennschwein Rudi Rssel is a simple racing game.  Each player has a hand of cards numbered 1 to 10.  Players simultaneously select and reveal a card.  Whoever plays the highest number moves their racing pig, but only as far as the amount they beat the second highest card by.  If two players play the same high card they swap positions on the race track!  There are also special spaces that allow you to exchange a card from your hand for a card from a face-up deck of additional cards.

title: Omega Expedition
types: Adventure Exploration Mythology Religious Spies/Secret Agents
description:
From the back of the box:

Embark on an epic adventure of truly biblical proportions when you descend deep into the foreboding recesses of the labyrinth in search of holy artifacts.  Surmount obstacles and deadly pitfalls and survive encounters with fierce creatures and supernatural beings bent upon denying you access to the holy artifacts.  Witness history unfolding before your eyes as you find, and recover, holy relics thought to be lost to the ages.

Game is designed for multiple modes of play:

Single Player Mode
Multi-Player Mode (2-3 Individual Players)
Team Mode (up to 4 players per team)

Ages 7 and up

Contents:  Game Board; Explorer's Manual; 80 cards (Level I); 80 cards (Level II); 4 Holy Artifact cards; 6 Mission Directives cards

Bonus Game: Quest for the Holy Treasure
Bonus Game: Mystery of the Number Seven

title: Final Days: Miniatures Battle Game
types: Fantasy Fighting Horror Miniatures Modern Warfare Religious
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementVariable Phase OrderVariable Player Powers
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Apocalypse is here!

The dead of the Earth have risen, and now they roam the land seeking living beings to feed upon. Powerful undead such as vampires and ghouls command legions of flesh-hungry zombies in chilling, inhuman war bands. Small pockets of resistance remain as humans wage a desperate battle for survival in a world where the waters have turned to blood and the sky is night everlasting.

Final Days is a complete boxed miniatures combat game where players command human freedom fighters or undead hordes in Earth's final battle! The combat system uses standard playing cards to determine the outcome of actions, and takes just minutes to learn. Play seamlessly with just two players or a group of eight or more! Everything you need to set up and play this fast-paced, hard-action game is included, and you can be up and  running in no time. This boxed set includes Twenty-Five 25mm metal figures (8 different brand-new sculpts) to recreate your intense tabletop battles.

So grab your shotgun and bar the doors. The dead are coming and nobody is there to rescue you.

Final Days is a skirmish-level miniatures game that uses a standard deck of playing cards, with jokers, as its randomizer.  Each figure has three attributes that determine how many cards it draws during combat, as well as determining how much damage the figure can take.  As a figure takes damage, his combat effectiveness decreases.  The game can be played with any number of players, and lasts on average 1 to 2 hours.

Box Contents

Rulebook
Scenario and Accessory Book
2 Double-sided BW maps
Templates of burned-out cars, desks, dumpsters
2 Combat Trackers
Equipment counters
25 white metal miniatures:
Demon
Vampire
2 Ghouls
13 zombies
6 survivors
2 dogs

title: Panzer Grenadier: Edelweiss
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:
 German mountain troops fought on every front except North Africa, compiling an impressive war record (and a few war crimes as well). These elite mountaineers of the plains saw action in all sorts of terrain and in all weather.

Edelweiss is a 64-page book supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series, based on the battles fought by German regular army and Waffen SS mountain troops. It is not a complete game: playing pieces and maps are drawn from the following Panzer Grenadier games and supplements: Elsenborn Ridge, 1940 - The Fall of France, Arctic Front, Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Sinister Forces, Eastern Front, Afrika Korps and Desert Rats. There are 41 (forty-one!) scenarios, each based on an actual battle or situation, plus historical background on the German mountain divisions and their exploits.

Edelweiss includes 161 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 157 of them the standard 2/3-inch square pieces of the Panzer Grenadier series, and four of them double-sized monsters. Two are Soviet river monitors, and there are two versions of the giant motorized mortar Karl.

title: Panzer Grenadier: Arctic Front
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Adds Finnish troops to Panzer Grenadier. 20 scenarios and 88 mounted and die-cut counters with Sissi ski commandos, Finnish-made BT-42 assault guns, Soviet SMK heavy tanks and Aerosans (An aerosan is a type of propeller-powered snowmobile, running on skis, used for communications, mail deliveries, medical aid, emergency recovery and border patrolling in northern Russia, as well as for recreation.) Aerosans were used by the Soviet Red Army during the Winter War and the Second World War. 
Not playable by itself, but an expansion for Panzer Grenadier: The Eastern Front and Heroes of the Soviet Union.

Expands:

     Panzer Grenadier: The East Front




Re-Implemented in:

     Panzer Grenadier: Arctic Front Deluxe Edition

title: TerraTopia
description:
TerraTopia was released by The Nature Company chain of stores as a product for their children's group, Kids' Club for Nature.  There was a comic book about the characters used in the game, a group of five kids who each had the ability to turn into a different animal.

The game is cooperative.  The kids have been placed on the planet TerraTopia and have to each find their colored stone before the planet's three moons meet (or something along those lines).  The players can choose to travel around the board together or separately.

The game was designed by Peter Olotka, one of the Eon Products team, and his son Greg.  The game definitely shows some of the Eon originality in the mechanics.  The players have to recover their stones by overcoming challenges at various locations on the board.  There are a large number of possible challenges, generated by randomly placing generic challenge markers (e.g., Fog) at the various locations and having a booklet which describes exactly what Fog means at each location.  The players have to be able to explain to each other how they would use their character's powers (shape-changing and normal talents) to overcome the challenges.

title: Star Wars Episode I: War
types: Dice Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description: RISK in the Star Wars universe. The War in the title is how Risk is called in Brazil. In essence, it is the same game, with planets as territories. Apart from the map being as seen in a mirror, the only difference in its layout is an extra link between two planets. For some obscure reason, the game is limited to four players - maybe because they ran out of cool colors, as they used black, white, gold and silver.

title: Schützenfest
description:
The original version is themed around archery; players are attempting to hit targets, or come close while remaining under.

The game was re-released as Hallo, Pauker, where the targets are now teachers, and players take on the role of naughty students.

title: Sextet
description:
A 6-suited deck of cards (adding the blue suits - wheels and rackets) specifically designed for playing Bridge with six players.
In my set there was a copy of the rules to 6 suited Texas Poker, with a list of frequency you can expect. And there were rules for 6 suited Texas Gin Rummy.

title: Weapons & Warriors: Cavalry Attack Set
description: This set adds 2 sets of cavalry to the game and a couple of catapults.

title: Hulk Busts Loose
types: Children's Game Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Be the first player to get past the obstacles and make it to the finish line. Players start off as Bruce Banner and get the chance to turn into the Hulk and race across the board with extra speed. Features Banner-to-Hulk transformation piece with a photo of Eric Bana as Bruce Banner and Dale Keown Hulk artwork

title: Zulu: Rorke's Drift
description:
Fought on January 23, 1879, the Battle of Rorke's Drift could well be called the battle of the Victoria Cross. Of the one hundred thirty personnel involved in the defense of the station and hospital at the Drift, eight of them received this most coveted of all British decorations . . .

Setting Up the Game: The British player places his eleven counters within the seven hexes which represent the Rorke's Drift Compound . . . no British Unit may ever leave the Compound for any reason . . . The Zulu Player places thirty-six Zulu Counters, stacked two high, on the eighteen dotted hexes to the North of the compound.

title: Foreign Legion: Moulay Ishmael
description: The Arabs attacked when the column was in the middle of the valley. At first it appeared as if this was merely a small force of Arabs, and the Foreign Legion companies deployed to drive them back from their positions. Then like a thunderbolt, the Arab cavalry struck. Veterans that they were, the Foreign Legion troops were unable to stand before this new attack . . . The battle of Moulay Ishmael ended with the French retreating while the Arab cavalry made occasional attacks against them. Of the French force of twety-five hundred, one thousand of whom were Legionares, five hundred had fallen and the fight was not yet over . . . Although a complete game in itself, Moulay Ishmael can be combined with Macta using the optional rules in the Macta game.

title: Centipede
description:
From the back of the box:
Enter the World of Centipede. A strange land of squirming centipedes, deadly scorpions, dangerous spiders, and poisonous mushrooms. Danger lurks at every turn as your centipede snakes through the winding mushroom field. Try to reach your opponent's home base before your opponent reaches yours. Shoot your opponent's centipede with your gun to slow it down.  Move the scorpion to plant poisonous mushrooms along the path. When your centipede hits one it turns and takes a shortcut. Use the spider to attack your opponent's gun or to destroy poison mushrooms so your opponent can't use them. Move fast and shoot straight and you'll win the game.
Includes: gameboard, 2 plastic centipedes, 1 plastic spider, 1 plastic scorpion, 20 plastic mushrooms, 2 plastic guns, 10 cardboard poison mushrooms, 1 spinner, and instructions

title: Flash Gordon & the Warriors of Mongo
types: Comic Book / Strip Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description: It is the intention of these rules to provide a simple and schematic system for recreating the adventures of Flash Gordon on the planet Mongo. These adventures are free-wheeling and widely varied with the final goal of overthrowing the evil government of the Emperor Ming the Merciless . . . The basic idea is that teams of players will begin on the outer sections of the schematic map and attempt to gain the support of all nations they pass through. To do so they must defeat monsters, overcome obstacles, deal with traitors, and go to any efforts to enlist the support and aid of the rulers of the countries they pass through on their way to Mingo city.

title: Tournament: Jousting
description: A tournament joust between knights on horseback equipped with lance and shield. The player with the most victory points at the end of three combats wins the joust.

title: Tournament: Melee
description:
Tournament Melee simulates the foot combat of the medieval period. Combining the use of graphic sheets with a map sheet, combat between teams of men armed with mace, ax and sword is portrayed.

The players fight three simultaneous battles between pairs of combatants.

title: Zulu: Isandhlwana
description: January 22, 1879: Isandhlwana, Zululand. British Army Destroyed! On this date the British Army suffered its greatest defeat in the history of the colonial wars. Six companies of the 24th Regiment were wiped out to a man and nearly a thousand members of the British Army were killed. In addition, the regimental colors were lost and two twelve pounders were captured by the Zulus.

title: Zulu: Ulundi
description: Under the hot copper shield of an African sun, clouds of white and grey smoke rose over the battle field of Ulundi: the massed crash of British Imperial infantry rifle fire was decimating the ranks of Cetshwayo's Zulu Army of twenty thousand warriors. Wave after wave of Zulu might flowed against the bulwark of Imperial infantry, only to be drive back by the combined forces of rifle, machine gun and artillery fire. As the smoke rose into the different sky on that July day of 1879, the hopes of the Zulu nation for independence from Imperial rule went with it, dissipating into the realm of what-might-have-been.

title: Orbit War
description:
Orbit War is a stylized game of tactical space combat in the 21st century . . . The playing board consists of eight concentric orbits around a central body; this central body represents a star in all games except the invasion scenario, in which it represents a planet.

Players control individual ships orbiting around a planet. The object is to defeat the enemy fleets by destroying their flagships. Written orders for movement and combat are executed simultaneously.

Note that this is an entirely different game than Wallace Wang's Orbit War released by Steve Jackson Games.

title: Space Fighters
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction Wargame
description:
This game of ship to ship combat takes place on a mapsheet depicting the surface of a large space station dotted with gun towers. There is a trench down the middle of the map with a target at the end. The good-guys are called the Rebels. Their ships are Red Leader, accompanied by Red Two through Red Eleven, and Gold Leader, accompanied by Gold Two through Gold Five. There's also a Pirate Freighter. The bad-guys are called the Empire.

If you haven't gotten the picture yet, the cover art is a drawing of an X-Wing shooting at a Tie Fighter, straight out of Star Wars. This independently produced (and unauthorized?) game depicts the climactic attack on the Death Star . . . I mean, on the Imperial space station.

This game is part of the Star Wars Games.

title: Pacific Theatre Via Midway
types: Expansion for Base-game Nautical Wargame World War II
description:
Pacific Theatre Via Midway is a variant/expansion to the Midway wargame (1975 Avalon Hill) that appeared in The GENERAL Vol.15,No.5, 1984.

The basic idea is each player has his or her own map of the area (in this case the South Pacific) behind a screen. Each player searches for the enemy fleet by flying search planes to the hex and calling the hex number. Once found, bombers can be sent in to sink the enemy fleet. The actual attack is fought on a separate battle board where the ships are first placed on hexes and the attacking planes are placed in hexes to indicate which ship it is attacking.

The basic game is very simple. But there are many additional rules, which add realism (and complexity): CAP fighters, surface actions, bases, inaccurate search reports, etc.

The game is superior with a neutral referee for true double blind play.

title: Goldgeier
description:
Players represent miners digging for gold under dangerous circumstances.  The gameboard itself is printed on the bag which houses the tiles used to create the earth and treasures within.  Beginning with a debt to the bank of ten gold, miners purchase equipemnt from the store -- ladders, backpacks, dynamite, etc.

The further the miners delve, the richer the rewards that await them; but, the further they go, the more likely they are to reach an old patch of unexploded dynamite -- sending them to the hospital.

Frugal miners will visit the bank at regular intervals.  Each successful find will increase the interest level the player owes to the bank.

The person with the plumpest bank account wins the game.

title: Stonez
description:
Abstract game wherein players are to place five tiles in a row.  Tiles are drawn randomly from the bag.

On a turn, a player may --

Draw a tile from a bag, with the player's color face-up.

Rotate a tile.

Remove one of your own tiles from the board, and any single tiles created from this action are removed.

Change the color of a tile, provided the player has power over it.

Place a protector marker over a tile.

title: Guadalcanal
description:
Battles in the Solomon Islands,from August 7 of 1942 at February 7 1943...U.S. Marines to the commandment of the General Vandergrift, disembarked in the beaches of Guadalcanal, Tulagi and Taivo..expelling the Japaneses after long and arduous combats, island for island..
Game with translation only in Spanish.

title: Picknick Panik
description:
Its time for a picnic.  With the food, the players also bring an assortment of fly swatters and bug spray to defend against the hordes of bugs sure to come.

The starting player pulls a bug card from his hand, and passes it to the next player; who can either play another bug -- passing the larger horde on to his neighbor -- or defend his food with one of the aforementioned weapons.  If he fails to do this, he loses food.

The game comes in two editions -- the standard which is comprised of 114 cards and 24 food tiles; and the deluxe, which features 138 wooden tiles.

title: Hexen Werk
description: The King is sick and 10 prescription cards are on the table.  Witches take turns revealing an ingredient, trying to fulfill a prescription.

title: Lawsuit
description:
Try your skills and match wits with your opponents in this legal fantasia. Have you ever wanted to be an attorney? Now you can be! This game is designed to give you that opportunity. You are the Plaintiff's Attorney -- You are the Plaintiff -- You are the Defendant -- You are the Defense Attorney.

A card game in which player's try to build up a successful lawsuit. Players add damage cards to increase the value of their own lawsuit, while playing blocking cards on opponents to contest their suits and reduce the damage award. Each round of play ends when a verdict card is played, and players are awarded the value of their lawsuit at that time. The game ends after the round in which any player's winnings exceed $100,000. The winner is the player with the most money.

title: Reincarnation
description:
Reincarnation. An adult game.

Discover your past lives -- from centuries to thousands of years ago.

Although Reincarnation is actually a game, the instructions for play and our approach to it are rather serious.

Roll the Astragali Bones. Consult the Karma Cards. Use the Locater Disc to chart the place of your past lifetime on a map of the world (including the lost continents of Atlantis and Lemuria, of course.) Determine your past life type - nomadic, rural, or city. Determine the time era of the past life, and the livelihood - court astrologer, teacher-philosopher, farm hand, ship's captain, tribal slave, etc. What past lives will the Soul Pattern Cards reveal for you?

title: Red Letter
description:
From the back of the box:

The strategic word game which allows you to do what that world-renowned word game wouldn't...

25% more tiles, 64 red and 64 black, with storage bag

25% more board spaces

Two-sided tiles with upper and lower case letters allow for proper nouns, acronyms and nicknames

50 unique category cards allow for bonus points

4 tile holders

Durable 12 x 12 rotating playing board with recessed sqares so tiles don't slide

Unique scoring system which offers a greater variety of options and more creative ways to score

Ages 12 and up

title: The Improv Comedy Game
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description: The Improv Comedy Game is based on the TV show and actual comedy club, The Improv.  It tests your ability to make your friends laugh through various actions and jokes.  The game contains 4 booklets, one each of Gags, Improvs, Groans, and Cracks, which are used for each player's turn.  Players move around a board that is encased in the game box, using plastic pawns.  One accumulates points by successfully getting the other players to laugh at the jokes one performs, and can lose points by landing on spaces such as heckler funnier than you, audience speaks no English, and steal material.  There is a pegboard in the center of the game board to keep track of each player's score; players move their pegs point by point from beginner to star, and the first person to become a star is the winner of the game.  The equipment included is listed in the rules as follows:  12 pawns, 4 hilarious comedy booklets, 3 colored dice, 1 timer, 1 game board/score board, 0 Mercedes convertibles

title: Pocket Football
description: Pocket Football will be mechanically familiar to anyone who has played Ace of Aces or Lost Worlds. Each player has a book, and the offensive player and defensive player simultaneously choose plays. The chosen plays together tell each player what pages  to turn to in their books and the pages give the results of the play. Some additional randomness is provided by a mechanic of flipping rapidly through the book and stopping at an arbitrary page, which give you your random result.

title: 1500 Gold
description:
The theme of the game is running, and takes place in three stages. Each player tries to  manage their three racers through training, qualifying, and then during the finals.

Each runner has  three different qualities..

During training you roll dice and choose a pawn to advance, trying to land on beneficial squares and avoid landing on detrimental squares. The  goal of this stage is to get tactic cards to help you win the qualifying race and the big final race.

In the qualifying rounds you roll dice and play cards in an attempt to get one of your better players, with more tactics cards qualified for the final. You are always guaranteed a place in the finals even if you fail to qualify (you get in on a 'technicality'). If that happens though you get no cards and no special abilities.

The finals is a more detailed race - with a race track, blocking, sprinting, and so forth.

title: On-words
description: Once the players have decided on a target score. This target number is based on a dice roll. The twenty-one letter cubes are rolled and, in turn, the players decide which letters cannot, can and must be used. The player who rolled must use the permissible cubes to make a word (or words, in crossword fashion) to reach the target score. There is a sand timer to limit the interval spent on thinking.

title: On-sets
description: ON-SETS is an exciting and colorful resource allocation game that teaches set theorythe foundation of modern mathematics. Players in ON-SETS explore the concepts of union, intersection, difference of sets, complement of a set, set identity, set inclusion, and the null and universal sets. ON-SETS captures the same creative problem-solving and strategic intrigue as EQUATIONS and WFF N PROOF. The basic game can be taught to players as young as six; as players develop skill, the game becomes more sophisticated and ultimately expands to levels that will challenge intelligent adults.

title: Wizard Kings: Expansion Armies
types: Collectible Components Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Wargame
mechanisms: Dice RollingHex-and-CounterModular BoardSecret Unit DeploymentVariable Player Powers
description:
These additional armies provide new units to add diversity and flexibility to your Wizard Kings games.

For more information, see the Wizard Kings wiki page.

				
					First Edition Army Expansions

In the first edition of Wizard Kings, each army expansion included a complete set of blocks for a particular army. The Mercenary armies (Chaos and Werebeast) were exceptions, containing several blocks from each of the seven basic armies so that mercenary units could be distributed as desired.


     Eldryn (Elves) - also included in base game
     Jurak (Orcs) - also included in base game
     Mortod (Undead)
     Khurdak (Dwarves)
     Viksyn (Amazons)
     Wildryn (Barbarians)
     Ferkin (Warboars)
     Chaos (Mercenaries)
     Werebeasts (Mercenaries)


				
					Second Edition Army Expansions

In the second edition of Wizard Kings, expansion units are sold in a random booster format that includes three new blocks for each of seven armies. (Note that the Ferkin army has been replaced with the new Feudal army in the second edition.). In 2012 the initial Heroes  Treasures expansion sets were supplemented by Ancient Kings with an assortment of seven historical armies.


     Heroes  Treasures - Elves, Dwarves, Orcs, Undead, and three human armies: Feudal, Barbarian, Amazon - also included in the base game
     Ancient Kings - Egyptians, Greeks, Persians, Romans, Huns, Chinese, and Japanese.


Expands:

    Wizard Kings

title: Wizard Kings: Expansion Maps
description:
These are expansion maps for Wizard Kings (First Edition).  They are also compatible with the second edition release.

Each map adds new terrain and locales in which to wage war.  There are four sets of two maps each:


     Barrenlands (Maps 5  6)
     Dragonia (Maps 7  8)
     Misty Islands (Maps 9  10)
     Azure Shore (Maps 11  12)


After the release of Second Edition, (which includes maps #13 thru #16), the expansion maps were repackaged into three packs with 4 maps each, (2 two-sided poster maps).
 Pack #1 included maps 1-4 (Maps included in the base game First Edition)
 Pack #2 included maps 5-8
 Pack #3 included maps 9-12

For more information, see the Wizard Kings wiki page.

Expands:

    Wizard Kings

title: Word Pyramid
description: A 3D twist on word games.  Word Pyramid comes with a large 3D pyramid upon which you stick the letter tiles.  Players race against the clock to build words crossword-style onto the game board.

title: The Wonder Garden
description:
When playing The Wonder Garden, players do not compete to win, but work together to complete the game.  They try as a team -- each player taking turns -- to plant flowers into the gardens.  There is a cloud above that at first is a beautiful white cloud, but in the course of the game becomes darker and darker.  Players must finish planting all their flowers before the thundercloud is formed and the sun goes down.  If they do, they are all winners.  If they fail, a thunderstorm springs up destroying the plants and washing the pieces away.

Contents


1 game board
1 die
48 wooden flowers
7 cloud pieces
Game rules

Ages 4 and up

title: Battle Grid
types: American Civil War American Revolutionary War Ancient Dice Fighting Medieval
description:
From the game box.

Close Quarters Combat Board Game

Victor or vanquished. Which will you be?

Since the dawn of civilization, mysterious forces have plucked the ancient armies from their savage battlefields, and placed them on the Battle Grid of eternity. Caught in a maelstrom of space and time, they fight countless battles with the enemies from many famous conflicts: The Hundred Years War, French Revolution, American Revolution, Civil War, World War I and others. Surviving armies savor victory, while the defeated rise again to oppose them. There are battles to be won. Are you ready for more?

Battle Grid uses the Skirmish Combat System to resolve close quarters battle. Each player controls a squad of soldiers on the battlefield. All troop commands are resolved by dice rolls, with the special abilities of each army playing an important strategic role in the conflict.

Object of the Game: Eliminate all of your opponent's soldiers in close quarters, skirmish combat.

title: Plunder: The Great Cayman Treasure Quest
description: Players race across the Islands to be the first to reach a dive site.  The first to do so selects a buddy from among the other players and they then dive on the coral reef, in the hope of recovering treasure.  But...their time underwater is limited and the other players have become sharks, in hot pursuit!  The winner is the first player to return to the airport with 12 doubloons.

title: Allerley Spielerey
description:
Another of the Reiner Knizia's game packs (cf. Neue Spiele im Alten Rom), this one being set in medieval times and including the games

* Am Hofe des Knigs
    * Contra
    * Das Hufeisenspiel
    * Schanzen
    * Der Stein der Znfte
    * Um Speis' und Trank

The set is completely constructed of wood and only 100 numbered copies were produced.

Probably the most interesting of them is Um Speis' und Trank which shows a simple stock market situation in which items fluctuate in value, players employing a swapping mechanism to either trade up or cash out.

Also includes a bottle of wine.

title: Sahara
description:
A hot game for desert foxes... 
The glowing sun and the burning hot desert sand make the life of the desert inhabitants a constant adventure. If one water hole is dried out, then they go to the next. On the way there, everyone is lost who misses the connection to the caravan. In the end, quite a few desert foxes lose their orientation, since their senses are confused by mirages. Therefore, holding the caravan together is the greatest skill of every tribal leader in order to reach the best position at the oasis while still safeguarding the community (from the back of the box).

Player try to lead their camels to the best spots of the oasis. Every player has the same set of cards. Movement is made by choosing one of three visible cards, which range from forward 1-4, backward 1-4 and a few special cards. While moving spaces already occupied by another camel aren't counted, so staying together with the caravan (at least for some time) is quite useful.

title: Nieuchess
description: Abstract hex-based wargame using pawns for units.  This game employs simplified versions of many of the ideas seen in other early Avalon Hill offerings like Tactics II, American Civil War, and Blitzkrieg.  These include mechanics such as invasions, road movement, replacement centers, and the die-driven combat results table.

title: Defender
description:
Object:
to win the most points by using your Defender ships to protect humanoids from waves of aliens.

A set of chance cards will bring the different aliens (bombers, landers and humanoids) into play.
Movement is determined with a spinner.
Players can move their defenders and aliens.

From MNG-AJM Games Catalog: Board game based on the 1980's arcade game of the same name.  Both players control Defender ships which have to protect Earth from alien landers which seek to abduct humans and turn them into mutants which return to attack the Defenders. A spinner is used each turn to decide what type of move you must make, but in each case you can make use of the move to benefit yourself or hinder your opponent.  Interestingly the game ends only when one player has lost all 6 of his Defenders, and the player with most points wins, which may not be the player who still has Defenders left.

title: Interstellar Wars
description:
[From the back cover...]

INTERSTELLAR WARS is a science fiction game that portrays the conflict between two powerful futuristic empires and the players fight for control of star systems in a fast moving and often bloody contest.

The combat system encourages the use of light forces to screen the main battle fleets before committing them to full scale battle. There are three scenarios that gradually build up the complexity of the game and the rules cover re-fueling capacity of star systems, tactical options, commander bonuses and the 'Pirates of Hamrinon'!

The game is suitable for beginners to the hobby of board wargaming the rules being easy to learn and containing numerous examples of play.

Components: 16 x 23.5 full color, mounted map board in two pieces, 100 die-cut counters, rules booklet and one six-sided die.

title: Elmer Wheeler's The Fat Boy's Game
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
Players are given a CALORIE CARD at the start of the game and then travel a course beginning at BREAKFAST, through to LUNCHEON and ending at DINNER TIME.

Along the way, players are tempted with Mid-morning and Afternoon Snacks.

Collecting calories all through the day...

WINNER is the player whose score most closely matches the number of calories shown on his CALORIE CARD.

title: Clifford the Big Red Dog Happy Birthday Game
types: Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Novel-based Number
description: A roll-and-move game based on the idea of getting to Clifford's birthday party with the highest value bones.  Bones are found by collecting gifts (found by landing on certain spaces), each of which has a different number.  Once everyone arrives at the party, count the number of bones on each person's gifts to see who has the most.  So ultimately the game is meant to teach children the ideas of more and less.

title: Constellation: The Space Race Game
description:
Constellation is an exciting space adventure game.  The year is 3001 and you are a finalist in the great Constellation Space Race.  As a spaceship captain you are dealt three of the 88 constellation cards at random.  Now the race begins...choose a pewter spaceship and roll the die.  To travel through space you either have to answer questions or follow actions.  By quickly docking on your constellations and being the first to return to the starting point you will be crowned Space Race Champion!.

Game contains 1 double sided game board, 168 Playing cards, 4 English pewter spaceships, 2 Wooden alien spaceships, 12 wooden pawns 1 wooden die and 1 rules leaflet.

title: Devet
description:
The goal of the game is to place as much as possible elements to the game field, which is a quad-grid 5x5 (but may vary). Elements are 2, 3 and 4 sided in all variations - 11 type of elements.
The game starts with the maximal element (with four sides) already placed in the center of the game field. Every next element, can be put on the field, only where the side of the current element can touch the side of an existing element.
If the side of just-placed element touches the game field border, the set of the connected elements scrolls in the opposite direction, or directions, if the element touches two borders. When this scrolling occurs, extra elements are deleted from the element set (they fall).
The player randomly choose the element which must be placed, and the element which will be the next. In computer realization, these elements are randomly generated by the machine.
Every successfully placed element is counted.
The game ends, when the current element can't be matched nowhere in the field.

The game is designed by Jordan Tuzsuzov.
Official internet site : http://devet.tuzsuzov.com/

title: Blacks & Whites
description:
Originally published as a free game insert (with paper board and unmounted cards that had to be cut out) in the March 1970 issue of Psychology Today magazine (which simultaneously advertised a version in a long cardboard box, with better components and play money, for $5.95), Blacks  Whites was a socially-conscious game which not only reflected the signs of the times but was also meant to effect change. In a sense, it was something more akin to a social experiment and performance art in game form. On the bottom side of its box, the game description reads: Experience the ghetto. Live on Welfare. Try to buy a place in a white suburb. Your challenge: To keep the land-hungry majority type from winning the game cheaply and quickly.... If Black players turn the tide against white advantages, a kind of irrepressible excitement takes over the board.

Players were divided into Whites and Blacks and had to make economic progress while competing with each other. Based on Monopoly, the idea was to demonstrate how the odds were stacked against black people in society by having different rules for each race in the game. The difference between this and all the other roll-and-move go-around-the board-buying-property games is that before the game, each player assumes the role of either a Black or White person.

Whites start out as the majority with $1,000,000.00 to spend and are able to buy property anywhere. Blacks start out as the minority with only $10,000.00 to spend; are unable to buy certain properties; have to draw from a separate Chance deck; are banned from purchasing property in the 'Surburban Zone'; and collect less money for completing a lap around the gameboard. Blacks are limited to certain areas of the board until they had accumulated at least $100,000.00. Players are encouraged to change the rules when anyone lands on the People's Park space.

Needless to say, it turned out to be one of the most controversial board games of all time and even merited an article in Time magazine: The game, produced by Psychology Today Games (an off shoot of the magazine) now on sale ($5.95) at major department stores, was developed at the University of California at Davis by Psychology Department Chairman Robert Sommer. It was conceived as a painless way for middle-class whites to experience  and understand  the frustrations of blacks. In Sommers version, however, the black player could not win; as a simulation of frustration, the game was too successful. Then David Popoff, a Psychology Today editor, redesigned the game, taking suggestions from militant black members of 'US' in San Diego. The new rules give black players an opportunity to use  and even to beat  the System.

Although turning Monopoly into an attempt to draw peoples attention to social issues seems a little bit of a long shot, its worth noting that the original version of 'Monopoly' itself, called The Landlords Game, was designed to demonstrate how the current economic system led to inequality and bankruptcy.

Psychology Todays board game division seems to have been short-lived but other titles included 'The Cities Game' involving urban tension, corruption and the undercurrents of city politics'; and 'Woman and Man' where Each woman must accumulate enough Status Quo points (100) to prove her equality to Men. Each man must collect enough Status Quo points (100) to prove once and for all a Womans place is beneath his.

title: Landsknecht
description:
In the fifteenth century, MAXIMILIAN I to oppose the famous Swiss militia, an army unit with the same characteristics of quality and strength, created the LANDSKNECHT. An elite unit of immense destructive power, which soon had a reputation of invincibility equal to the Swiss experts. Armed with Pikes, Hallebardes, Swords and the most modern throwing weapons, these multicolored hordes fanned out across Europe as a cloud of voracious predators, with no moral or military power having control over them.

In this game, the confrontations between rival militias are shown on an absolutely realistic tactical scale (each counter represents a footman or a horseman), also allowing, for players wanting to leave pre-arranged historical orders of battle, to create their own  Company  without the gameplay suffering negative effects.
A rule with several difficulty levels allows to test different types of clashes, from simple skirmishes between dispersed troops up to the great battle featuring three hundred pieces on the board.

Game for 2 players from 13 years old onwards. Game duration: from 1 to 8 hours. Difficulty:  - 

2 introductory scenario, 1 battle scenario (Grandson)

Components:

    a map board divided in 5 parts (97.5 x 68.5 cm total)
    4 countersheets in different colours with identical cards/units/markers (each contains 160 counters and 5 cards)
    a 20 page rulebook in Italian, French and German
    3 identical chart/table sheets; each  in Italian, French or German




(source: translated from the front box and user's description)

title: Tall Stories
description:
Tall Stories involves rolling two dice and moving a counter (shared by all players) around a board according to the result. The board spaces all describe themes. One die is red, the other is white. A card is drawn and the red and white dice specify two words on that card. A one minute timer is turned and you have that long to tell a story covering the theme you landed on and incorporating the two words you rolled.

It is the job of other players to identify which two words you rolled. The words of course bear no particular relevance to the theme and hiding them on the spot involves the creation of the most colorfully chaotic tales with impromptu decoy words thrown in as fast as possible.

The system of reward has gone lost to me, as have the rules, and I'm unsure of how points are scored, except to say that there is a 1-10 scoring bar in the game. How it is used I don't know.

I have written Crown and Andrews but they have been unable to find any records.

title: Hitchiker
types: Card Game Dice Economic Humor Party Game Political
mechanisms: Betting/WageringCommodity SpeculationDice RollingPick-up and DeliverRoll / Spin and MoveSinging
description:
Hitchiker 2012 is an easy to play adventure where a little imagination, free thinking spirit and love of satire will take you for a wild ride on an emotional rollercoaster.

The premise is simple.  Players (2-6) assume the role of carefree Hitchikers and set out on the road to make their fortune while trying to avoid trouble along the way.  Hitchikers don't have jobs so you'll have to find some more creative ways to make your money.

Each player begins with a HOMETOWN, $25,000 and a Bank envelope.  The object of the game is to be the first player to save $250,000 in your Bank or accumulate $50 million in traveling cash.  You can only deposit money in your bank by passing through or landing on your own HOMETOWN.

The mechanics of the game (play method) will be familiar to anyone who has played a traditional board game like Monopoly except unlike most other games, you're never really out of it until someone actually wins.

Hitchikers travel by rolling two dice and following the highway clockwise around the board.  Each city or location along the road counts as one space.  Upon arrival at your new location, you will either be presented with an opportunity to earn huge sums of money or face a potential disaster like a Bad Ride or worse.

Although random luck (dice) will play a role during the game, there is also a need for strategic planning.  With two ways to win the game delivers an opportunity for everyone to have a chance.  If you tend to be cautious by nature, you can win by being conservative and saving money in your Bank.  On the other hand, if you like to gamble you will love the pursuit of monster payouts as you stack up your traveling cash.

Fast paced, high stakes action.

title: Enchanted Palace
description:
Once upon a time in a land far away, an Evil Witch captured a magical palace and locked its Good Queen in the tower! Can you and your friends help her escape? If you do, you can become Princess of the Kingdom!

Use the enchanted wand to search each palace room for a magic lantern, mirror, and key. When the wand lights up, you'll hear different sounds from each of the 7 rooms - birds singing in the garden, music from the music room, and even moans from the dungeon! Then listen closely and the Good Queen will tell you what to do.

Beware the Evil Witch - she'll turn anyone into a frog! Use the wand to undo her spells and save your friends! To win: collect all 3 magic objects, free the Good Queen, banish the Evil Witch, and become the Princess of the Kingdom!

Features a 3D board and mechanical as well as electronic parts.

title: Explorers
description: Exploration involves much teamwork ... adventurous, exacting, hazardous, rewarding!  Players pick a journey, select what part each will take, make preparations, assemble crews  venture forth.  They make the trip together, each handling different aspects of the expedition.  Actual trips of famous explorers are the basis of each voyage - to the North Pole, across the Atlantic to Canada, the U.S. Central America, into Asia, even around the world.  A good family and classroom game.

title: Astro-Dice
description:
Astro-Dice [Astroleg is Danish and nearest English name would be AstroPlay] A game for everyone who likes to play dice.

If you are not familiar with astrological terms, this could be your opportunity to learn them in an enjoyable way - by playing. This set of dice includes the instructions and rules for three games.

The Oracle for those who want answers to everyday questions. In this game you interpret the symbols on the dice.
Ruler of the Board - a game from 2 or more players to see who can take possession and become Ruler of the board. - a game from 2 or more players to see who can take possession and become Ruler of the board.

Aspect - for 2 to 5 players, who will use the planets to make aspects to each other within a chart wheel - for 2 to 5 players, who will use the planets to make aspects to each other within a chart wheel.

title: Pursuit!
description:
A strategy game for two flying aces! To win, be the last ace in the sky. Attack and Pursue! Knock the enemy out of the sky! A game of aerial strategy. You've got to think fast to win!

A duel between three German and three Allied fighters in World War I. The vertical game board is a clear plastic grid. The aircraft are mounted inside plastic blocks that hang on the grid and allow the aircraft to be rotated to the desired facing.

Each turn, the players secretly set the facing of their aircraft. This is concealed from the opposing player by a rotating shield that is mounted inside the plastic blocks that hold the aircraft. Facing is revealed, and movement or combat occurs.

As the saying goes: No luck, all strategy.

title: Tobruk Expansion Pack 1: Wavell's 30,000
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in 1940.  Adds 12 scenarios, a sheet of counters and some terrain overlays.  Comes in a ziploc bag.

Expands:

    Advanced Tobruk

title: Tobruk Expansion Pack 5A: Kasserine & Beyond
types: Expansion for Base-game Wargame World War II
description:
Expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war with the entry of the US forces.  Twelve scenarios, counters for the US forces, comes in a ziploc bag.

Expands:

    Advanced Tobruk

title: Flight Simulator
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
The APR Flight Simulator is a unique pilot's training device. Developed and tested for several years by leading aviation experts, Flight Simulator answers the need for more realistic ground training by simulating the psychological atmosphere of actual in-flight conditions.

As each pilot flies his cross-country flight, situations are programmed that test his flying abilities. By reference to components of the Flight Simulator, incorrect responses are immediately observed, analyzed, and explained. Greater insight generally results from group discussion of the particular situation.

Each pilot selects a flight course according to his proficiency level. When the Flight Simulator is used by more than one pilot, it becomes a competitive cross-country race. The more experienced airmen are handicapped by flying programmed courses demanding greater skills, and the point score is given consistent with the appropriate knowledge. A student pilot can compete with the private or commercial pilot, while all are fully challenged by the situations encountered.

The Southwestern area of the United States has been chosen as Flight Simulator country in answer to the Simulator's need for the greatest variety of flying terrain. The map-board is WAC scale, 1 inch=1,000,000 inches.

title: Squander
description:
Squander -- the game that allows you to live like a millionaire! Start with a million Squanderbucks. Buy hotels, gold mines -- be a tycoon on the stock market -- take impossible chances at Roulette, Monte Carlo, 21 and at the Horse Races. Spend as recklessly as you wish. The first player to Squander his million wins the game!

Technically the game is titled $QUANDER, as a dollar sign is used in place of the S in the title on the box cover and in the rules.

title: Changing Seasons
description:
A game of fast action and hilarious fun.  Players race to complete their puzzle first.  Face the challenge!  All pieces are mixed and divided evenly.  Players strategically trade for the pieces they need as they assemble their puzzles behind a partition.

A great game for all seasons!


Game Summary
- Use 1 puzzle and matching photo per player, returning the unused one(s) to the box.
- Take apart all puzzles, shuffle the pieces, and divide evenly amongst players
- Shuffle the photos and deal randomly to each player, who will mount it on the inside of their screen.
- Players play simultaneously, trying to assemble their puzzle.
- Exchanges
... At any time, a player may select a set of 1-3 pieces and offer to trade them; must exchange those pieces with the first player to accept the offer (trade for an equal number of pieces)
... Up to 3 times/game, a player may force everyone to trade 1-3 pieces to left/right/across (no 'across' in a 3er, of course!)
... The 'Advanced' Rule: once each (I think), players may force a shuffling and redistribution of the puzzle photos! I must admit that we didn't try this -- it just seems ridiculously chaotic and random.
- The first player to complete their puzzle wins!

title: Jury Trial
description: Jury Trial is a game where each player assumes the role of an 'Attorney', each of whom represents the same Defendant during the course of a Trial. As in life itself, the Attorney who delivers a Not Guilty verdict, and of course earns the most money while doing so, wins the game.

title: Law Courts
description:
A game taken from the British legal system.

A game of excitement, challenge and skill where players have to decide which actions to fight in court and which actions to challenge.

At the start of the game, players are credited with 15,000 Pounds and are deemed to be employed. Throughout the game players have to decide which actions to fight in court. To proceed to the next circuit, players must win at least one action of their own in court, settle all outstanding actions and challenges, still be employed, and increase their holding to 30,000 Pounds.
There can be but one winner! The first player to win an action in the House of Lords wins the game.

title: Attorneys at Flaw
description: The object of the game is to 'earn' a million dollars in CASH. Since the only way to earn money is win lawsuits against 'negligent' or 'insensitive' businesses, begin the game by moving toward one of the 'TIP' locations to obtain your first lawsuit. (Other players may be competing for the same tip!) Then take the case to court and have it tried. Soon you'll be caught up in a wild lawsuit frenzy, suing as many folks as necessary to make your dreams come true!

title: Squeeze the Juice
description:
The game where lawyers get rich and justice comes at a hefty price.

You have just been selected as one of O.J.'s [Simpson] Defense Attorneys and given an initial retainer of $75,000.00. Your objective is to gain control of as many aspects of the trial as you can, then utilize this control to accumulate more of O.J.'s Defense Fund checks than any other defense attorney.

A variation on Monopoly.

title: U.B. the Judge
description: This game is designed to be as realistic as possible, while still retaining the fun quality of a board game. While it is first and foremost a game to entertain the players, it is educational because the criminal defendants who are convicted are sentenced in a manner typical of the criminal justice systems of the United States. To add more realism, it follows the felony determinate sentencing laws of the State of California. The crimes are taken directly from the California Penal Statutes. The sentencing rules are the sentencing laws of the State of California.

title: Goin' Hollywood
description:
The objective is to become the richest producer in town regardless of what it takes.  Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

Contents are game board, 6 plastic game pieces, money, 10 insurance policies, 3 decks of cards (actors, scripts and lifestyle) of 50 cards each, dice, an IOU pad, rule book and deal tips book.

title: VCR Dogfight
types: Aviation / Flight Wargame World War II
description: VCR Dogfight is an exciting World War II era interactive video combat game for two intrepid players. You fly your aircraft around the gameboard in a snarling dogfight to gain advantage over your hapless opponent. When guns are fired, view actual World War II dogfight footage to see if you succeed with a hit, or perish in a blaze of your opponent's ammunition.

title: Treasure of the Lost Temple
description: Treasure of the Lost Temple is an adventure game for one or two players. Each player takes the part of a treasure-seeking archaeologist, who must traverse the Lost Temple, reach the Eye Room to obtain the Jeweled Eye, and retrace his path to escape from the Temple in a given time limit, before the Temple Doors will be sealed shut, trapping him forever.

title: Bike About
description:
From the Box:

Travel the countryside with your friends in this fun-filled cycling game.  It's unique too because there are no dice involved!

Each player has to visit five different destinations - perhaps a castle up in the mountains, a lake in the country, or a Punch and Judy show down by the sea.  It certainly isn't easy though, because there are only two bikes for up to six players.  Everyone keeps trying to pedal them in opposite directions and players don't know whether they're coming or going!

The first player to bike round to all his destinations is the winner.

title: X-C Cross Country
description:
Object of the game: Be the first to arrive and land at your destination airport.

The game is patterned after real life experiences in flying. Players first earn pilots ratings, then 'take off' and climb to sufficient altitude for their Cross Country flight. Once they start Cross Country they encounter 'in flight' problems, the severity depending on how high a pilots rating they earned before they started. As they proceed, the weather may move into their flight path requiring them to detour or climb above it. As the players approach their destinations they must descend to 'pattern altitude' and shake the right sequence of numbers to land and win the game. Good judgment and correct decisions must be made during the game to arrive first at your destination.

title: The Lawyers Game
description:
Your chance to be a Judge, part of the Jury and a Defense Lawyer in a courtroom drama that will crack you up. Starring such notorious criminals as Mr. I.M. Greedy accused of insider dealing, Xerox Van Gogh accused of forgery, and Princess Kleptomania of Kuwait accused of shoplifting, you will be working with a choice of nearly forty dubious defendants.

Each player must take a case to explain away the known facts on their Crime Card in under two minutes, suffer the cross examination of their fellow players and succeed in predicting the jury's verdict following your stirring defense.

Any actual knowledge of the law may be a handicap, so top lawyers will probably do well.

Contents: 36 Crime Cards, 6 Innocent Cards, 6 Guilty Cards, 1 Timer, 1 Plastic Tray, Instructions.

title: Harassment
description:
The Object of the Game: To collect the most points by correctly predicting how your opponents will judge certain cases of Harassment.

Harassment, the newest catch word of The Nineties, is so controversial that no one can even agree on how to pronounce it. Harassment, The Game, creates hours of lively conversation as you and your fellow players wrestle with some of the most perplexing social issues of our time.

Contains: 156 Case Histories, 312 Arguments, 24 Voting Cards, 12 Scoring Pegs, 3 Game Booklets, 1 Score Board.

Unlike similar games, the cases used in this game are fictional.

title: L.A. Law
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Party Game
description:
Players take the roles of their favorite LA LAW lawyers and argue controversial and humorous real-life legal cases. Using the pro and con points provided, the 'attorneys' put their cases to the 'jury' (the other players), using all the logic, passion and powers of persuasion they can summon. After a vote is taken and the verdict is brought in, the real-life verdict is revealed - the results are often surprising, sometimes shocking - and points are awarded to the 'attorneys', both for being right and for successfully persuading their friends, right or wrong!

Includes 150 cases, 10 case files, file holder, 10 yes/no verdict cards, 10 character discs, verdict viewer, blind justice cup, score pad, instructions.

title: Photo Trivia: MGM Movies Game
description:
107 Photos, 64 Questions  Answers. For travel and party fun! Look at the photos and answer the questions.

Object: Players try to win by looking at the photo and correctly answering a question on each card. The player who collects the most cards is the winner.

title: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: War & Victory
types: Expansion for Base-game Party Game Trivia
description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 questions about war and battles.

title: Hundsgemein
description: Players control gangs of nasty flees out to prey upon unsuspecting dogs that are wandering through a seedy section of the city. The fleas are placed on a 7z7 grid while the dogs wander the streets between the rows and columns. Fleas are placed picture-side (flea-side) up, with no identical fleas allowed on adjacent squares. After the grid is filled, the fleas are turned over, displaying the color of the player who placed them. The player with the most fleas on both sides of a street captures the unsuspecting dog on that street. Points for captured dogs are totaled, and the player with the most points wins.

title: Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – Boob Tube
Rich Farmer Poor Farmer
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveStock Holding
description:
From back of game box:

Almost everyone, at one time or another, has wanted to be a farmer; to be able to look back from a tractor seat over a completely plowed field at the end of the day and feel a sense of accomplishment as the smell of newly turned earth slowly surrounds you.

RICH FARMER, POOR FARMER, the only farm game on the market, puts you in the tractor seat, gives you $25,000 to start farming, and youre on your way to an adventurous education of the problems and realities of farming.  It may not give you the smell of freshly plowed ground or the self-satisfaction of a hard days work, but it will wake you up to the fact that farming is much more than just plowing and planting.  Youll experience the responsibility of farm ownership and development, and with luck, reap the benefits of successful farm management.

RICH FARMER, POOR FARMER was invented by a 28-year old Alabama farmer, Donald McDonald, as a means of educating the public to the realities of farming.

The game was first introduced in October, 1978, at the Sunbelt Agricultural Exposition.  With the news coverage of tractorcades and the farmers dilemma over the past year, the games popularity has steadily gained momentum.  It continues to receive widespread exposure in farm magazines, newspapers and television.  As a result, the game has been mailed all over the United States.

The object of the game is to survive financially  just as in real life.  In the game, an actual farmer has no advantage over a city slicker who thinks a bush hog is a type of pig.  Players can end up a Rich Farmer or a Poor Farmer, depending on how well they manage their money.

An entertaining and educational game about farming for 2 to 6 players.

title: What shall I be? The Exciting Game of Career Girls
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Object of the game is to the first player to become a Career Girl.

Players move around the board collecting School Cards, Subject Cards and Personality Cards.

Game ends when one of the players has collected 4 School Cards of one Profession and 2 Subject Cards and 2 Personality Cards that are good for that Profession.

Professions  and their respective schools are:

College - Teacher
Airline Training School - Airline Hostess
Drama School - Actress
Nursing School - Nurse
Charm School - Model
Ballet School - Ballet Dancer

title: What Shall I Be? The Exciting Career Game for Boys
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Object of the game is to be the first player to achieve his career.

Players move around the board collecting School Cards, Subject Cards and Personality Cards.

Game ends when one of the players has collected 4 School Cards of one Profession and 2 Subject Cards and 2 Personality Cards that are good for that Profession.

Professions and their respective schools are:

Law School - Statesman
Graduate School - Scientist
College - Athlete
Medical School - Doctor
Technical School - Engineer
Flight School - Astronaut

title: The Game of Hollywood Stars
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
Become A Star

Players start as an Extra in Hollywood, U.S.A. and make their way through four tracks of their Hollywood career from Extra to Bit Player to Feature Player and finally, Star.

On the way players try to accumulate money and property from Station Wagons to Speedboats and Academy Awards.

Variation on dice rolls prompt players to read from The Hollywood News.

Winner is the player to win both an Academy Award and have $12,000 in property.

title: Skippy Game
types: Animals Children's Game Movies / TV / Radio theme Racing
description:
