Game lends itself to building moral character and leadership skills.  A good family game but not a game involving skill or strategy.

title: Pickin' Chickens
types: Action / Dexterity Animals Children's Game Farming Humor Real-time
description:
In Pickin' Chickens players try to be the first to get their trolley to the chicken as it lays an egg and then return the egg to their frying pan.

The game features a chicken that squawks and moves. When the chicken stands players can roll their trolleys down a rail (by pushing forwards their frying pans which are attached to the rail, thus lifting it up). The first trolley to the chicken while it is still standing will get an egg ( a plastic ball) and will then need to be rolled back to the frying pan (by moving the frying pan back).

title: Renaissance of Infantry
description:
Renaissance of Infantry Tactical Warfare 1250A.D. - 1550A.D.
An Historical Simulation Game, the time is: afternoon, 25 October 1415.

RENAISSANCE OF INFANTRY (originally Strategy  Tactics magazine #22) (Tactical Warfare, 1250AD to 1550AD)


     20 different scenarios
     Melee and Fire combat
     Bonus PanzerBlitz mini-game


Re-fight the battles of Bannockburn, Crecy, Bicocca, Agincourt and many more. Renaissance of Infantry marks the beginning of a whole new line of games. The units in the game are composed of no more than 500 men. Each hex represents 100 meters and each turn represents approximately 20 minutes.

During this historical period, the mounted man-at-arms (or knight in shining armor) fell prey to the better organized and disciplined infantry. After eight hundred years of dominance, the armored horseman again became a second class warrior. The game shows how, and why, infantry lost their traditional dominance -- and how they regained it. There are 20 different games.  Each is a historical battle with its own order of battle, set-up and victory conditions.  Some of the units included in the game are: militia pikemen, crossbowmen, pikemen, arquebusiers, swordsmen, longbowmen and heavy cavalry.

title: Hot Potatoes
description: A fast children's game in which players pass potatoes around and try not to be caught with them when the temperature gets too hot.  You roll dice to determine the size of potato and direction to pass it, but you can move anyone's potatoes.  This give some small tactical decision-making as the mercury in the thermometer rises.

title: Die Mauer
description:
The Wall refers to the Berlin Wall. It is a game about espionage in Berlin during the Cold War.

In the game, one player plays the United States (CIA), the other plays the Soviet Union (KGB). The objective of the game is to get a spy into the opponent's embassy on the other side of the wall.

Each player has six spies. Each turn, they roll a die, and move one of their spies through the streets of Berlin. When landing on a special square, they have the ability to kill an enemy spy, send him back to his embassy or transport themselves to another square on the board (using a secret tunnel, an embassy car etc.).

A special element of the game is that among the six spies of each player, there are two double agents. During the game, players sometimes get the chance to study their opponent's spies to identify their true allegiance. If a player moves a spy into his opponent's embassy and it turns out to be a double agent, he loses the game instead of winning it.

title: Die frosch-fröhliche Poolparty
description: Every player owns a gang of frogs in a pond. Roll the two dice and make your decision on what you want to do with that. Move 2 of your frogs - each with one dice or one with both dice. The player who gets  all frogs of his gang in one line first wins. But the other players destroy your plans by pushing your frogs around.

title: Waterworld
types: Exploration Movies / TV / Radio theme Nautical
description:
Waterworld the boardgame is based the movie Waterworld.

The object is to be the first player to discover dry land.  This can be accomplished by collecting all four resource cards (enola, guns, rope, and trimaran supplies).  Then the player must destroy the Deez to gain control of the compass.  The compass will lead the player to location of the dry land.  The first one to discover dry land with the four resources is the winner.  Of course there are many ways for other players to get in your way and steal your resources or the location of the dry land.

title: Jogo do Hulk
types: Adventure Children's Game Fighting Movies / TV / Radio theme
description: Brazilian game marketed as Hulk official movie merchandise. Each player has a Hulk figure, which is moved around to fight the U.S.Army. This is represented by men, tanks, helicopters and nuclear weapons, and each type of unit is worth a different number of points. When Hulk is hit, he gets bigger and stronger. Game ends when last Army unit is defeated.

title: Living Dead Dolls Board Game
description: Bring your worst enemies together for a deadly adventure. Be the first player to survive the savage lands of the Living Dead Dolls and reach the mausoleum. Using brilliantly twisted playing cards you can buy and trade souls, cast spells, posses opponents, freeze opponents and even morph into the leader the deadly pack. Contents include: Game board, 100 Action Cards, 24 Spell Cards, 100 Soul Deed Cards, 12 Pawns, and one black die. For 3-6 players.

title: 1944: Second Front
description:
1944: SECOND FRONT begins with the Allies well established in France following the D-Day invasions. The Allies are gathered to attempt their breakout and begin the race toward the German frontier. Each player has Combat Units and Headquarters available, and is capable of maneuvering across the map and engaging enemy pieces in combat. You must master the deceptively concise rules for Activation and Movement Point expenditure. And at any given time, you will face the decision of which army to Activate in any one phase - and your opponent will have an immediate opportunity to react . The most interesting aspect of the game is that it seriously tries to model time over the course of the player's turn. You activate HQs, which can then control a varying number of infantry or armor units, depending on nationality. There is a track display that you use during movement/combat. As you make decisions about which actions to take, you branch along the track, limiting your options about what you can do next. Essentially this captures the passage of time required for certain actions. It's easier to play than it is to describe.  For example, suppose you have an armor division near the enemy and a couple of infantry divisions further away. If you move up the infantry to attack and make a breakthrough, the armored unit will probably not be able to move very far through the breach. In effect, the armored unit has spent most of the turn waiting around for the infantry to get in position and make its attack.  The game puts emphasis on elite units on both sides and on the brittleness of the powerful British formations (no replacements). Chrome rules cover Market-Garden and the Bulge.

Contents

        One 32 page rule book
        One full color map
        400 die cut counters
        Five chart sheets
        One 10-sided die
        One plastic tray
        Players: two or more
        Playing Time: 3 to 15 hours
        Complexity: medium to high
        Solitaire Suitability: medium

title: StakXchange
description:
As a commodities and futures trading game, STAKXCHANGE captures the unpredictability and fast-paced nature of the market, while challenging players to build the largest portfolio of money and contracts in their quest to be declared the winner. 
Players begin by collecting $100,000,and move around past gold, pork bellies, coffee and other actual commodities that are traded everyday. The size of the contracts, the amount of the deposits and the price fluctuations are based on the real market.
Besides its intriguing subject matter: STAKXCHANGE grabs attention with the superior, eye-catching graphics that adorn both the packaging and the game board.
The idea behind STAKXCHANGE is to bring family and friends together and have fun and we feel confident that we've struck the right balance of fun, strategy and learning.
Please, visit our web site at: www.stakxchange.com

title: Treasures of the Smithsonian: The Game
description:
(From the Rules)

To complete a treasure hunt of knowledge.  All players are on a treasure hunt to assemble artifacts and knowledge from the different areas of the Smithsonian.  Players can acquire an advantage as they learn more of the answers and improve their skill each time the game is played.  One fun aspect of the game is that the winning treasure hunter receives a round of applause from all players.

(more detail)

There are 15 categories of trivia on each card, each of which corresponds to one of the museums, galleries, or research facilities in the Smithsonian Institution.  The object of the game is to collect one treasure (answer a question correctly) from 6 of the categories then return to the starting space.  Movement is made via a six sided die roll.

title: Willi Wichtel
description:
(From Funagain.com)

In a large meadow, in the middle in the enchanted forest, lives a small family of gnomes. No humans have discovered it so far. Do you want to try? Then you must first find a way through the mysterious and dangerous forest. Carefully creep past snakes, foxes and the giant spider. Finally you#039;ll reach the meadow, where the gnomes live. Now you must look under each fern, each tree root and each stone, because the gnomes are true masters at hiding. Will you find them? Then you are first, and can make friends with Willy Wichtel and his family.

title: The X Game
description:
A trivia game where players collect colored stones for answering questions correctly.  The object of the game is to collect all colors of stones and move to the central square of the board (similar to Trivial Pursuit).  The four categories of trivia are: Parapsychology, Science, Theology, and Occult.

Four of the stone colors are collected by answering a question correctly of the appropriate color, you can only have one stone of each color.  The fifth stone (black), is special, there is only one of them.  It is collected by either moving your pawn to the center of the board, or stealing it from another player (by landing on the same board square as their pawn.)

There is a special rule variant that allows players who have collected stones to use them after a six is rolled on the movement die.  Each color gives the player some kind of advantage (free movement, card skipping, etc).  As well, you get to keep the cards that you have answered correctly (though only one at a time), and use them in much the same way as you use the stones.

From the back of the box.

Why? This question has plagued humanity since... well... forever. It is what drives people and science to explain the unknown. While others embrace the unknown, some fear it... but that's why this is a GAME.

The X-Game combines current knowledge of our world into a fascinating combination of Science, Paranormal, Theology and the Occult trivia. The X-Game contains 1000 questions on 250 cards, 16 Power Stones, 4 Player Pieces, 4 Power Cards, 1 Black Power Stone, instructions and a fantastic playing board. Anywhere from 2 players can compete for the glory of winning (abducting) the Black Power Stone and the rest of the X-Game...

title: The Monitor and the Merrimack
description: Game of the Battle of Hampton Roads. The Confederate player must destroy the Union fleet in two days. Although there are no hexes, the movement definitely could have been plotted with them. Uses a spinner as a randomizer to determine movement and combat outcome.

title: The Great War in the East
description:
Subtitle: Four World War I Battles

This is actually 4 games in one.  A fifth wheel to the series (using the same standard rules) was the Strategy  Tactics magazine game Tannenberg.  
Series designer: David C. Isby
Author of historical article: Richard Spence

Serbia/Galicia: Austria-Hungary must decide how to allocate its forces and respond to progress or the lack of it on two fronts as it undertakes the offensives in Serbia and tries to withstand the onslaught of the Russian juggernaut in its own Galicia province. 
Designer: J.A. Nelson

Von Hindenburg in Poland: Russia and Germany battle for the mineral-rich province of Silesia. 
Designer: Anthony Beavers

The Brusilov Offensive: One of the few effective Russian generals of the periods gets the Russian act together, despite lack of ammunition, and launches one of the most successful Russian drives of the war.  Will it help lessen German pressure against the Allies on the Western front? (With the more controversial Tannenberg, star game of the series.)
Designer: James F. Dunnigan

Caporetto, 1917: the Central Powers push the Italians back over 100 miles. (Dog of the series.)
Designer: Albert A. Nofi

Contents: 4 17x22 maps, 800 playing pieces, 2 standard rules booklets, 4 exclusive rules booklets, original SPI tray and dice.

title: Jason-1: Voyage on the High Seas
mechanisms: Card DraftingPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and MoveSet CollectionSimulationTile Placement
description:
Jason-1 Oceanic Adventure - Voyage on the High Seas. You pilot an Ocean Research Vessel from the Mediterranean Sea to Seattle, Washington, USA. Along the way you must earn at least 150 Discovery Points!
This game is suitable for play both within and outside of the classroom, and although designed for Ages 9 - 13, it offers a fun, learning opportunity for the entire family. In addition to being a game, it is an eye-catching poster showing continents, oceans and all of the major ocean currents. On the reverse, there are black and white educational activities designed to be reproduced directly from the poster for use in the classroom.
This game is fully downloadable from the provided website.

title: Staccato
description: The object of this game is to remove all of your balls from the board. Each player, in turn, inserts his pop-stick through any one of the openings as far into the board as he pleases. The insertion of the stick causes the balls to pop up. The player must remove all of the balls that pop up, even his opponents. The stick may not be removed until his next turn. The stick acts as a block for the opponent. The white block-ball is a barrier and may not be raised. or removed from the position it fell into at the beginning of the game. The winner is the first player to have all his colored balls removed from the board.

title: Plumb Crazy
description: A very interesting race game where you try and connect a sink, bath tub, old-time washing machine, or fire hydrant to the water tower supply before all the rest. You get pieces to connect your piece up. First one to do so wins!

title: Dynamite Shack
description: A rather funny game where you wear oversized thumbs and try to put dynamite sticks into a shack before it blows up.  I enjoyed this as a kid...  I am most certain it would be frowned upon for its explosive theme now-a-days...

title: Wacky Races
description:
Intended for children - this game is based on the Cartoon of the same name (you know the one with Penelope Pitstop).  The object of the game is to beat Dick Dastardly with your racer.

This game is related to The Magnificent Race, though one is not a reprint of the other.

title: Dexter's Laboratory: The Incredible Invention Vs Dee Dee
types: Action / Dexterity Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
Dexter is on a quest to complete his greatest work.  As soon as he can collect the six parts he needs, it will be a fine day for science!  On your turn, you roll the special game die and move your Dexter towards the center of the game board to collect the parts you need.  If you are feeling lucky, once you have picked up one part, you may want to continue and collect a second part before heading back to your lab...
  
But that can be a a daring decision!  When a player rolls Dee Dee, he or she decides whether to move their Dexter or to activate Dee Dee.  If they decide to let her loose (oh no!), they swing her around the pole and any Dexter she knocks over - even their own - has to give back whatever parts he is carrying and return him to his starting position 


Be the first to collect all six cards, and your contraption is complete....OOOH!...you win!

title: Cowgirls
description: A trivia-oriented game targeted at teen-age and young women (guessing ages 16-25 or so) with a western theme.  You roll and move your plastic horses that are used by the players as markers, then answer questions on the cards regarding different categories of question: Sex and Body, Experience and History, Family and Friends, Spirit, Shadow, and Taste. Also, there is a small bag full of metal charms: boots, guns, long horn steer, saddles and spurs used as markers.

title: Polygon
description: You draw hexagonal tiles from a face-down stack and place them in such a way to maximize your score.  Intended for Ages 7 and up; certainly would help kids with math, logic, and geometry.

title: Snow White and the 7 Dwarfs
description:
Form Tactic's webpage:

Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs has always been one of the most popular fairy tales. This game puts you in a dwarfs role to look for Snow White in the forest. But beware of the evil stepmother! Snow White and the seven dwarfs is a fun board game, that children will enjoy time and time again.

The game also includes the fairy tale Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. Once upon a time
  
Recommended Ages 4 and up

title: Little Red Riding Hood
description:
From Tactic's webpage:

In this funny and colorful game you will get to join Little Red Riding Hood on her visit to see grandmother. On your way through the forest you have to find the contents of your lunch basket that you have dropped on the way. But beware of the wolf that is hiding in the forest! It is also easy to get lost in the forest so be careful. Little Red Riding Hood is a fun board game where good memory and luck will help you to grandmothers cabin and victory.

The game also includes the fairy tale Little Red Riding Hood. Once upon a time
 
Recommended Ages 4 and up

title: The Little Mermaid
description:
Little Mermaid is a game based on a well-known fairy tale, where you search for pearls from the sea floor. Players move around the board and look for seashells that might have pearls in them! The player who is the first to find ten pearls wins. Little Mermaid is a board game, that children will enjoy over and over again.

The game also includes the fairy tale Little Mermaid. Once upon a time
 
Recommended Ages 4 and up

title: Scrabble Rebus
description:
There are 108 tiles. Each tile depicts an icon, a letter or diphthong. Tiles have been color-coded into four different types. Players draw two tiles from each set randomly. Each player, in turn, tries to make a sentence or phrase using the tiles in their hand and intersecting those tiles already on the 15 by 15 game board.

The tiles are used to make Rebus words or sentences (similar to using the letter tiles in Scrabble to make words) which are placed on the squares of the 15x15 grid game board. A Rebus is a word or sentence where a symbol replaces part of the word or sentence. For example: if you laid a tile with a picture of a letter S followed by a tile with a picture of an oar (from a rowboat) the the Rebus would read: sore.

The rule book comes with a description of each tile (in case you didn't know just what the picture is) as well as an example of use for each tile. These descriptions come in very handy when playing the game both for stopping player arguments as well as helping out stumped players.

Players score three points for each tile used. Premium squares give players bonuses. Using all eight tiles held scores a fifty point bonus.  Highest score wins.

title: Enterprise
description:
NOVIB is an organisation that battles poverty and injustice in third world countries. They published this game as a means to collect funds and to educate people about the economic problems in the world.

The game is basically monopoly, with some changes:
- After the first round, your income is determined by means of the resources (streets) bought in the first round. The resources you have have to match those of existing countries; each player selects the best (richest) country that matches his resources. A richer country means a higher salary.
- The goal of the game is to become a multinational (that is, have a set of resources complete). At this point, you are no longer a single country, but a multinational (With the highest salary in the game). If you manage to keep this title long enough, you win the game.
- When you land a street owned by someone else, you have to pay a fee, but after that, you are allowed to buy it from him. This way, multinationals can be 'broken'; the player then selects a new country.

The poorer countries are helped by the chance cards, which often award money to the poorer countries, while asking money from the richer countries. The richer countries are still better off, though...

title: What's Up?
description:
Players form two teams. One team devises a phrase or title for the other team to guess. The phrase is spelled out with the letters face down on the gameboard.

Guessing one letter at a time, the team has to guess the secret phrase. The players gain more points for guessing the phrase by taking fewer turns.

The game ends after five rounds. The team with more points wins.

title: Frik
description:
The world of finance

An entertaining game that can be played with the family or between friends. An introduction to the world of finance. A game full of twists, easy to play, rich in emotions. A dynamic game, educational and topical. Receive a portfolio... Make it grow by investing, by taking moderate risks, by speculating... Acquire banks, industries, stores, buildings... Lend some money; invest at a Stock Exchange; buy some gold and contemporary paintings... Two ways to play : short game or long-lasting game.

(From the box)

title: Typhon sur le Pacifique
description:
Typhon sur le Pacifique (Typhoon on the Pacific) simulates the entire Pacific war from December 1941 to August 1945.
1 counter = 1 army or 1 fleet; 1 turn = 3 months.

In the basic version, the game does not cover the China Incident, the Soviet 1945 offensive, or the attack on Pearl Harbor, which is accounted for in the Allied set-up. It is primarily a solitaire game. In actuality, only one side had the initiative at a given time. The Japanese struck first and occupied much of the area, but after the Solomons, were unable to continue the offensive. Then the Allies, after the disastrous start, launched their offensive of reconquest and the capitulation of Japan.

title: Talisman Sorcerers Tower Expansion (Fan expansion for Talisman)
types: Adventure Expansion for Base-game Fan Expansion Fantasy
description:
Fan created expansion:

The crown of command has been stolen by an evil Sorcerer. And at the centre of the land of Talisman stands his ancient, ruined tower. In ages past it belonged to the Wizard who ruled the land, but now it is the lair of the Sorcerer. This expansion set contains a new three-dimensional game board representing the tower, and 32 Sorcerers Tower cards to add a different ending to every game. Now, to win the game, you must battle your way to the top of the tower past hideous monsters and cunning traps, and defeat the Sorcerer in mortal combat.

Expands:

    Talisman

title: One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Go Fish! Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Deduction Memory
description:
The One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Go Fish! Card Game is similar to Go Fish, but set in the world of Dr. Seuss' famous book. It uses 42 cards instead of the standard 52. The deck consists of four suits of ten cards numbered 1-10 (suits are red fish, blue fish, yellow fish, and white fish) and two wild cards.

Players are dealt five cards each and take turns asking the other players for specific numbers or colors. If the asked player has the desired color/number, they must give all of the them up to the asking player. If the asking player doesn't receive any matching colors/numbers, then they must draw from the deck pond.

The player with the most matching numbers wins.

title: Horton Hears A Who! Card Game
types: Card Game Children's Game Fantasy Memory Novel-based
description: Cards are dealt out face-down in a 7x7 grid, representing the clover field. Hidden amongst the Clover cards are Who Cards, a special Who named Jo-jo, Jungle Animal Cards, and Beezle-Nut Oil Cards. Players flip cards starting at the outside edge and proceeding orthogonally until they collect a Who, or run into an Animal stopper. Cards are then re-flipped face down. Once a player finds three Who cards, he or she must then find the Jo-jo card to win the game. The game is designed for ages 4 and up.

title: Kontor: Die Aktionstafeln
description:
Adds 8 action maps to the basic game of Kontor. This variant can be combined also with other variants. Kontor - the Action Boards appeared to 2001 in a limited edition of 600 pieces at Essen.

Expands

    Kontor

title: Matrix
description:
The object of game is to be the first to form a line consisting of four different colored chips. A line consists of four holes in either horizontal, vertical or diagonal directions. Players each choose six chips, 3 each of 2 different colors. Players alternate placing pieces. Chips of the same color cannot be placed in adjacent spaces.

Contents;

     5x5 Game board
     4 Yellow discs
     4 Red discs
     4 Green Discs
     4 Blue Discs




Rules are in box top.

title: Murder Party: Crimini Divertenti
description:
quot;Murder Party - Crimini divertentiquot; collects under a single cover two different murder/mystery party games for 12 people (but quite easily adapted for less people), with all the materials needed to play. They come together with detailed informations about how to host a Murder Party, and some reports of the experiences of the author that used them also in theaters, restaurants, hotels, schools and company training sessions.
quot;Una piroga in fumoquot; (quot;A pirogue that went into smokequot;) is set in Madagascar, among tangled relationships between Europeans and local people. quot;...Solo pi sette ore!quot; (quot;...Just seven hours left!quot;) is about the murder of a young psychiatrist: patients, neightbours, famuly and friends are among the suspects. Both of them include secret goals for each player, besides the solution of the mistery.

title: Murder à la carte: Dracula's Bite on the Side
description: Another in the long line of Murder a la Carte murder mystery games.  Like all others, it's a reason to get together for dinner, play a character, and try to determine the killer.  The twist is that this one is billed as the Horror Edition, set in Transylvania, 1893, with some normal characters except for Count Dracula and Dr. Frankenstein.

title: Admiral
description:
Strategy and tactics, perfect navigation under water, at sea and in the air combined with different ways of assault are the essentials of the modern naval game ADMIRAL.

Two admirals struggle to rule the waves, they engage vessels and aircraft in battle, they occupy islands and install bases. The task is to defeat the enemy on the ocean. Admiraltys orders to the captains and commodores are given with relating dice numbers.....----short extract from the rules

title: The Pearly Gates
types: Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Religious
description: Players take on the roles of Television Evangelists.  Each player rolls dice and moves up the game track following any special instructions they might encounter along the way.  Some things make money for your ministry usually by receiving donations from your followers.  Some things cost your ministry money, like ending up in a motel room with another player.  The object of the game is to make the most money for your ministry by the time you reach the Pearly Gates.  And maybe get a nice tan along the way.

title: Travel Around Australia
description:
In Travel Around Australia  the T-Jet Game, players take a quest to travel around Australia to buy up the landing rights to its airports.

The gameplay is similar to Monopoly: players start with a small stake of credit, roll a die to move their tokens around the board, and buy Airport cards to charge landing and other fees on their opponents who land there.  Jet cards dish out benefits and penalties.

The game ends when all players except one are bankrupt, making the only one with cash the winner.

title: Aussie Animal Sanctuary
description:
Aussie Animal Sanctuary is a collection of trivia cards about Australian animals. The questions on the illustrated cards are separated into 4 levels of expertise to test the players' knowledge. Each game has various themed pieces that go along with it.

The five games are: Zoo game, Mimicry, Quiz capture, Lucky landing, and Sanctuary. All of these games are primarily educational games for school-aged children.

title: Mecha!
description:
From the back cover:

Mecha!(tm) is a fast-paced miniatures combat system that remains true to the Japanese anime giant robot traditions from which it was spawned.  Explosions, missile exchanges, down and dirty hand-to-hand combat, and lethal firefights are the trademarks of this high-action and easy-to-learn game.

A relatively simple rules set for playing a game of anime-style robot combat, they are complete enough to include a limited points-based construction system plus rules for continuing campaigns.  The system uses primarily d6's plus a d10.  Movement rules include support for mode changing (from walking robot mode to hover mode to jet flight mode), and support three-dimension movement, using Battlepoles

138+ pages (probably another dozen pages at the end of the book are unnumbered, containing unit design templates and reference pages).  Artwork is all black-and-white, with mostly hand-drawn art, but includes quite a few photographs of models being used.

title: Sir Ring-A-Lot
types: Action / Dexterity Children's Game Electronic Medieval Real-time
description: This is a childrens motorized action game. There were 4 different games each packaged separately possessing a different theme. This is the medieval themed game Sir Ring-A-Lot. Collectively, the games were called T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hillarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players. Basically, you push on the tower which pushes the knight up allowing the player to spear the rings that are picked up by the flying bats rotating around the castle. From the box: Capture the Rings from the Fly-By-Knight Bats!

title: Spacefarers
description:
A very early offering from Games Workshop, and apparently an ancestor of what would become Warhammer 40,000, Spacefarers is a set of science fiction skirmish rules designed specifically for the Spacefarers range of figures manufactured by Citadel Miniatures Ltd... The rules have been designed for two players to carry out small scale skirmishes with each player in control of a unit of Imperial Marines, Dark Disciples, Star Patrolmen, or independent gangs.

Most of the rules are pretty standard tabletop miniature skirmish rules.  Each unit may move a certain number of inches per turn, may fire a ranged weapon, and/or engage in close combat with models in close proximity.  No grid is used for movement, a ruler is used to measure linear distances.

Unlike the massive armies sported by the game's descendants, Spacefarers focuses on single squads, and allows for more detail, such as rudimentary hit location, along with different armor protection for each location, and individually equipped models.  The game appears to have much more in common with games like Necromunda or Mordheim in this respect.

The rules are short, only 44 pages, with sparse hand-drawn artwork; not a single photograph is used.  Two introductory scenarios are included, rules are included for constructing your own forces.  Depending on which force you choose to represent, you get a certain amount of money to use to buy equipment, and the rules indicate how large your squad will be (in one case, it's random!).

title: Countdown
description:
Countdown is a mathematics educational game centered around the theme of sending a rocket into outer space.

Players roll dice and draw cards based on the dice's results.  Even cards carry addition and multiplication problems that when answered correctly, move the answering player's token forward on the track (which is patterned like our solar system).  Odd cards have subtraction and division questions; answering them correctly moves the player's token backwards.  When a token lands on certain spaces with instructions, the player must carry out what was printed as well (lose a turn, move the token to another space, etc).

The game ends when a player's token reaches Pluto, making him or her the winner.

title: The Family Game
description: Family members gather to play. A playing deck is arranged from the question cards provided to reflect the relationships of the players. The players advance along the gameboard track by giving answers without being challenged as fakes. The first to reach the end of the track wins.

title: Hook the Crook
description:
A children's game in which players advance around a circular track, partly by roll-and-move, but mainly by being able to recall four characteristics of a thief whose appearance constantly changes and who can only be glimpsed fleetingly as he is rotated between screens by a clockwork mechanism.

The first player to reach the end of the track is deemed to have arrested the thief and so won the game.

title: Combat
description:
An introductory wargame, noteworthy for having been endorsed by one of the leading British generals of World War II.

The board consists of a plain grid of green squares. Terrain features are printed on vinyl that may be temporarily attached to the board creating a unique battlefield for each game.

There are three types of unit. Tanks move more quickly, while Guns can fire over a longer range. Aircraft can attack targets anywhere on the battlefield, but risk being shot down each time they do so.

The winner is the first player to achieve a 3:1 superiority in remaining units.

title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
types: Movies / TV / Radio theme Science Fiction
description:
Race to collect Terminator parts (arm and chip) and computer files, and then be the player to destroy the T-1000 cyborg.

First,you must run a frantic race around the board to find three high-tech equipment tokens.
As you rush to complete your mission, you must fight the dreaded T-1000, an incredible liquid-metal cyborg from the future. A roll of the battle dice will determine your success. Be the first to melt the T-1000 in a vat of molten steel and win the game!

Contents of British edition:
1 Game Board.
4 John/Sarah Conner Playing Pieces.
1 T-1000 Piece.
5 Stands.
12 High-Tech Equipment Tokens.
48 Cards.
3 Dice.
1 Rules Booklet.

title: Trucks, Trains, Boats and Planes game
description: A pursuit type game similar to Candyland for little boys produced in 1963.  Game was released with 3 other children's games by the publisher in the hopes of volumes of sales and profit in the children's game market in an eleventh hour effort to stave off bankruptcy.  The 4 games released were not good sellers and in late 1963 the company went bankrupt, only to reappear in 1964 under new management and the company prospered in the market.  Game uses a wooden die with faces of six different colors, a roll of the die shows the color space that the moving player advances to.  Some spaces call for a return to the beginning or a move backward.  The first player to the end of the track wins.  The board is marked with the themes of transportation by, well, trucks, trains, boats and planes!  The youngest player moves first, and the game can be played solitaire where the player tries to move the length of the track within an alloted number of rolls of the die.  Game stock number was 101 and original 1963 price was $.98  A similar pursuit game for little girls was called The Doll House game, and the two other 1963 children's titles were Imagination and What Time Is It?

title: Trio
description: Similar to Mag-Nif 's Rex but played on a staggered 3-2-3 square rather than on a triangle, this is a game of alignment constrained by the previously played pieces.  Either player stacks pieces on long pegs, hoping to achieve as many lines vertically, horizontally or diagonally as possible --in three dimensions.  All 24 pieces are played, then the alignments are counted: whoever achieved the most wins.  Solitaire rules are also included.

title: Confrontation
description:
Confrontation is a wargame covering hypothetical conflicts during the 1950-70 period on a global scale.  It is fairly abstract, with generic land units but some detail on the capabilities of different air and naval units.

Confrontation was the first wargame to have a map of the entire world (a Rand McNally map with movement points and such printed over it), one of the first to cover modern warfare, and one of the first to allow for more than two players (although the emphasis is on the two-player game).

Expanded by:

     Confrontation Expansion Kit

title: Confrontation Expansion Kit
types: Economic Expansion for Base-game Modern Warfare Political World War II
description:
This is a sheaf of paper containing these items:

The Second World War
This uses modified Confrontation rules for a 5-player WWII game.

Milopoliks
A multi-player 19th century military-political game.  This uses the Confrontation maps and land counters but includes a new set of rules and six sheets of cards and counters to cut out (the latter are supposed to be glued to the back of the Confrontation counters).

Chief of State
A large multi-player game (up to 12 people, in theory) in which each player controls a nation's allocation of resources to industry, agricultural production, technology, etc., in an effort to improve its situation more than any other nation's (on a percentage basis).  Conflict is heavily abstracted.  This game uses the Confrontation maps, but has new rules, and doesn't use anything else except the included allocation forms. This game was designed by Scott Duncan.

The Gamescience Report
A newsletter, probably the first (only?) issue.  It has some errata, clarifications, and optional rules for Confrontation.

Play-by-mail rules, plus the cold war and hot war order forms to use with them.

title: Gekishin K.O.
description:
A quick playing 2 player boxing game. There are over 100 different techniques/attacks that can be used. Each one is rated with stats on Damage, Motion (speed), Range, and Target Location. You win by knocking out the other player, which is accomplished by dealing 10 damage to any one area, such as the head, body, or arms. You try to guess where your opponent is attacking as well as roll a die to see if you defend against their attacks. It becomes a rock-paper-scissors type game of guessing.

The first in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring binder in bags and pouches.

title: Dunk Jam
description:
A 2 player basketball game. You choose three of the five available types of players to make up your team (each having a bonus for offensive movement, defensive movement, shooting, etc). You takes turns playing offense. The offensive player has 3 turns to play a card (1/turn) and get a shot off. The offensive player can move and pass the ball around, the defensive player move to block the offensive player, steal the ball, or block the shot. If the offensive player does not get a shot off by the end of the 3rd turn, its a turnover.

The closer you are to the basket, the easier the shot. There are two ways to resolve shots, either a simple roll of the twelve-sided die, with longer shots being tougher, or by a little dexterity shot where you flick a basketball up on a slightly angled board, and try to get it in the basket. The farther away you are on the main board, the further back you have to attempt the dexterity shot with.

The second in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

title: Oval Trick
description:
A racing game where each player starts with the same hand of cards The game is all about positioning and slipstreaming. When you move, you want to position yourself for a slipstream and also so that other players can't position themselves behind you for the same reason.

The third in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

title: Fun Dive
description:
A game where the object is to takes the best pictures of fish in 5 different locations before your air supply runs out.

Each turn, you deduct the air consumption for the turn (the lower you are, the more you lose), move the fish, move your guide piece, and your beginner piece. If you move your beginner piece onto one of the 5 fish pieces, you can take a photograph. There is a pile of cards for each of the 5 fish pieces. A good shot is worth more than a blurry shot. You can take more than one picture of the same fish over different turns, but only get to count the best shot for each of the 5 pieces for determining your score.

There is usually barely enough time to take pictures of all 5 pieces if you just take one shot of each, but sometimes there's not even that much time. It is usually easier to try to take a 2nd or 3rd picture of the same piece, but of course you then won't have time to get pictures of all 5 types of pieces.

The fourth in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

title: Warumono
description:
Each player has an attache case, but only one has the one with the valuables. If you are the mafia, then you grab the valuables, and try to flee from the other players. If you are a detective, you go after the player you think has the valuables and try to catch them. Players can purchase tickets to allow them to flee to certain areas. If you catch another player, you can switch attache cases with them.

The fifth in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

title: Gouwan Strike
description:
A baseball game that concentrates on the pitcher/batter match up. Each pitcher has 6 types of pitches they can throw. The pitcher selects a pitch card and places the card face down (the batter will only know if it's a 'slow' or 'fast' pitch), and places the ball on a square representing the location of the ball. The batter choosing to let the ball pass (if he thinks it'll be a ball), to bunt, or swing. To swing, he places the bat over 4 locations where he thinks the ball may end up. The pitcher then reveals the pitch, and rolls a die to see how many spaces and what direction the pitch moves to determine the final location of the pitch. Curve balls will move a few spaces inwards, a sinker downwards, and so on.

If the ball is hit, the batter rolls a die, and adds a bonus based on which of the 4 locations he covered the ball was thrown to (he may have a +4 to any pitch thrown to the upper right location, but no bonus for the other three squares, for example). For the most part, the higher the roll the better, and you get the results for the hit, such as double play, hit, double, and so on.

The sixth in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring binder in bags and pouches.

title: Gateball?
description:
Based off the Japanese sport of Gateball, which, while different, bears a few resemblances to Croquet.

Each team has 5 balls that they need to hit through 3 gates and then over the finish area. They get 1 point for each ball that gets past each gate, and 2 points for going over the finish line. These must be done in order. You can get a maximum of 5 points per ball (3 for the 3 gates, 2 for the finish).

There are 6 game turns, and in each turn, each ball can move (with different types of shots, such as power or technique). Each time you hit another ball, you get to shoot that ball off (whether its your own or an opponents), and then take an extra turn. You cannot have your current ball hit the same other ball multiple times, but if you hit different balls (or pass through gates) in succession, you can rack up many shots in a row.

The seventh in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring binder in bags and pouches.

title: Inga
description:
You select a party from amongst 50 characters. The object is to get 10 life-strength chips before the other players. You need a mix of characters, as certain human characters cannot go out at night, and vampire players cannot go out during the day.

The eighth in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label Aeronaut. They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

title: Reichstag: The Fall of Berlin
mechanisms: Campaign / Battle Card DrivenDice RollingPoint to Point MovementSecret Unit DeploymentSimulation
description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #1 (Summer 1998)

The player (Russians) fights building to building in downtown Berlin, and must fly the flag over the Reichstag as quickly as possible. (solitaire, tactical level WW2 east front).

Components: 8.5 x 11 map, 72 counters, 22 Event cards, rules.

One Small Step Edition (2015) (Folio Series 8)
Starting on 12 January 1945, the Red Army breached the German front as a result of the VistulaOder Offensive  and advanced westward as much as 40 kilometres (25 miles) a day through East Prussia, Lower Silesia, East Pomerania, and Upper Silesia, temporarily halting on a line 60 km (37 mi) east of Berlin along the Oder River. When the offensive resumed, two Soviet fronts (army groups) attacked Berlin from the east and south, while a third overran German forces positioned north of Berlin. The Battle in Berlin lasted from 20 April until the morning of 2 May.

Folio Contents:
 1 16-Page Rules Book
 16 Event Cards
 1 half sheet of full-color, die-cut counters
 1 17 x22 Map/Playing Surface
 Charts and Tables

title: Murder à la carte: A First Class Murder
description:
Another in the Murder a la Carte line.  Unlike other murder party publishers, this series relies on some lead-in scripted dialog and an audio tape to recap all that is learned (and add more information) during the night.

This particular episode takes place in the first-class compartments of a train in 1925.  Snowbound travelers must determine who amongst them murdered a jockey on the way to the races at Oldmarket.

title: CWARDS: The Ultimate Card & Word Game
description: CWARDS is a card game and a word game mixed into one, combining the pastime of the former with the challenge of the latter.  It is made up of 104 cards, divided into four series of the 26-letter alphabet so that every letter appears four times, once in each suit.

title: Fast Golf
description: A family card game for 2 or 4 players.  Components include 54 stroke cards, 2 golf ball tokens, gameboard, and instructions.

title: Himalaya Blackjack
description:
Gear-up for blackjack - Himalayan style.  Components include 6 reference cards, 15 camp cards, and a deck of 58 playing cards.

The cards are shuffled and stacked. One card is revealed to begin the discard pile. Players alternate taking turns by drawing the top card from the draw pile or drawing the top card from the discard pile. The goal is to get exactly 1000 in Meter cards. Having reached the goal, a player gets a Camp card. Some cards are Shortcuts which award a Camp card for having only 800 meters. There are hazard cards which hinder the unlucky player who draws one.

The winner is the first person to get four Camp cards and collect exactly 1000 meters more.

title: Key-Cue
description: Key-Cue is a word game that challenges each player to quickly identify the name of a subject, after listening to cues given for major syllables or groups of syllables that make up the subject name.  Categories include persons, places, things, and events.

title: Quits
description: Quits is a game of classic simplicity which yet requires considerable powers of cunning and tactical positioning to win.  It's a game in which you fight for territory by trying to place down your special Quits tokens into the right position at the right time.  You're constantly jockeying for position, picking up points along the way, and trying at the same time to block off territory from your opponent.

title: Chug-A-Lug
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME:
CHUG-A-LUG is an exciting adult game of skill and fortune for two to six players. CHUG-A-LUG tests your drinking skill as well as your ability to cope with unusual and hilarious situations.

title: Dschingis Bohn
types: Card Game Expansion for Base-game Farming Fighting Negotiation Territory Building
description:
In Dschingis Bohn (Genghis Bean), Bohnaparte gets some serious competition. The Mongols overrun the Bohnreich and provide for new tactical challenges.

Hanno Girke's new Bohnanza expansion is suitable for 3-5 players. The Bohnanza base game is needed. By combining Dschingis Bohn with Bohnaparte up to 7 players can fight over the Bohnreich.

Dschingis Bohn is part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands

    Bohnanza

title: UNO: X-Men
types: Card Game Comic Book / Strip Fantasy Movies / TV / Radio theme Number
description:
Standard Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Mutate card -- a wild card that allows you to discard all but one card and draw again to make up a new hand, or force an opponent to do so instead.

title: Adam Games Football
description:
Adam Games Football is a statistical replay game. The charts that are included create by dice roll a replay of past seasons.  The game is simple to play. You call a running play or passing play and then roll the dice. There are charts for individual teams and on those charts are listings of who throws the pass or makes the run and then influenced by the defensive rating of the opposition another roll determines how large the gain is on a run or whether or not the pass is complete. There are the possibilities for fumbles and penalties and sacks.

The publisher used to have many years of pro and college teams available, but the website is now defunct.

title: Crown of the Emperor
types: Card Game Collectible Components Science Fiction
mechanisms: Action Point Allowance SystemDice RollingVariable Player Powers
description:
Players construct a deck of military might, characters, and industries, vying for the emperor's seat in the year 2909. Building your own empire Players start with 10 Prestige points, and win by either raising their own Prestige to 40, or lowering their opponent's prestige to 0.

Five pre-constructed decks are offered, each representing a different faction with a special way of gaining bonus prestige.

title: Fence & Fenceability
description: You are trying to fence counterfeit art. On your turn you are the counterfeiter and the rest of the players are the fences trying to sell your work and earn money. You will sometimes bluff to be able to sell the art. When the game ends the winner is the one with most money on   hand.

title: Deadwood: On Location
types: Dice Expansion for Base-game Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme
description:
The only thing worse than acting at Deadwood Studios, debasing yourself for a tiny paycheck by playing such memorable roles as Man on Fire,  is having to go somewhere else to do it. If the gig at Deadwood Studios wasn't bad enough, now you're working on location

Deadwood: On Location is a set of new boards for the Deadwood game, representing six different sets and the bus stops that connect them. You'll need the rules from Deadwood to play, as well as those cards. On Location is also compatible with the four Another Day, Another Dollar card expansions.

title: Ruhe in Frieden
description: Every player has got 5 relatives that are on the brink of dying. The trouble is that there are only 5 graves to bury them in and they all want to be buried in the same cemetery. So you have to speed up your relatives destiny  by bribing the doctor to give them placebo medicine while trying to help the doctor keep other players relatives alive.

title: Ambulance Chase
description: A small Cheapass style envelope game that requires some cutting of counters before play can start. The object of the game is to pick up patients with your ambulance and deliver them safe to the nearest hospital. You earn money for this and the first to accumulate $20 wins the game. The trouble comes when you start to move to fast and can't avoid other players' ambulances, other vehicles and buildings. Ramming something will happen a lot.

title: The Power of Quasar
mechanisms: PartnershipsPattern BuildingRoll / Spin and MoveSet Collection
description:
A bizarre almost-self-published game (Quasar Ent. is based in Edmonton, Ab) uses a huge roulette-like contraption as part of its board.  The pieces are things that came from hardware supply stores (those little plastic caps for twisting wires together make nifty rocketships, eh?), including the magnets one must mount into the board.  The roulette I mentioned is spun now and then during the game, and the magnets and iron bars ensure it clicks into proper alignment every time.

Basically a two-player game, it can be played by teams of two or three.  There are nine winning levels of varying point value: the Weeble (conquer three star bases of different colours), the Skunk (conquer the Time Zone, e.g. 8 blue planets plus a Quasar Shield), the Sweep (conquer all six Star Bases without Weebling first), the Shield (possessing both Quasar Shields), the Shaft (Weeble and Shield), the Level (Skunk and Shield), the Fase (Sweep and Shield), the Scoop (Weeble, Shield and Skunk) and the Quase (Sweep, Shield and Skunk).  And then it gets complicated...

The game is just plain weird, with a distant whiff of Cosmic Encounter to it.

title: Die wilden Fußballkerle
description:
This is a fast Soccer-Cardgame based on the German children's book and movie DIE WILDEN FUBALLKERLE.
The cartoon-like cards show teenagers in street clothes ready to play soccer. You try to make as much goals as possible by dueling one of your cards with one of the opponent's card. Action cards and special abilities further alter the outcome of each Duel.

title: Cargo Wars
mechanisms: Pick-up and DeliverPoint to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
First published in 1990, the game has since been reprinted in a more reasonably-sized box.  Aggressively marketed, it is still in print.

Do you like Monopoly?  Do you like Risk?  Then you'll love Cargo Wars!
Enter the world of international shipping and piracy on the high seas!  Players compete as each attempts to corner global shipping [...] Pirate contracts abound as players smuggle contraband in an attempt to increase cash flow.

The game owes a lot to Rail Baron and is also a distant relative of Pirate and Traveler.  The shipping lanes are progressively bought out as one completes pick-up-and-deliver contracts, with the added twist that some contracts (more lucrative) are illegal --other players may attempt to run you down for a bounty.  Like in Rail Baron, you must get back to your home city to win --again with other players attempting to run you down as you do so.

title: Papperlapapp
types: Action / Dexterity Card Game Word Game
description:
There are 120 cards with one Word and picture on each card. 16 of them are now face-up on the table. Every player manages now to combine all of his hand cards with the cards on the table. e.g. You have the card Kinder and on the table is Garten. Take the matching card and lay the pair in front of you. After one player combined all his cards, every player reads aloud his combinations. Each pair which doesnt fit is not scored (Dictionary necessary). There is also a variant for the pictures on the cards.

Learn German by playing this game: At least you would understand what a DONAUDAMPFSCHIFFAHRTSGESELLSCHAFTSKAPITNSMUTZE is. (why, naturally, it is the hat of the captain of the Donau Steamship Company)

title: Swords & Spells
description:
Rules for Large-Scale Miniatures Battles Based on the Game Dungeons and Dragons
Development by Dave Arneson and Rob Kuntz.

Swords  Spells is a medieval fantasy miniatures taple top that can be used as a stand alone wargame or in conjunction with DD. It uses a dice-less combat resolution system. Attackers' weapons are indexed vs. defenders' armor class resulting in total damage vs. that stand of miniatures.

title: StarGuard!
description:
Starguard! (1974) by McEwan Miniatures. 2nd Edition 1975.

In those glorious golden days of the 23rd Century, when the Terrian Federation was still in its infancy, long before the Peace of the Empire, when no ship traveled the Starlanes unarmed, all that stood between the fragile glassine towers of Terra the Beautiful and the ravaging hordes of Ralni, Dreenoi and other lurkers in the darkness were the men of the Starfleet Command. It is to the marines of the Federation Navy, the STARGUARD, that this record is respectfully dedicated.

Man to man (or alien) SF miniatures tabletop warfare.

Expanded by:

    Orilla: 1st StarGuard Supplement

title: Was Fehlt Denn Da?
types: Card Game Children's Game Educational Memory Party Game Real-time
description:
With this release Adlung Spiele has made a card game version of the old game Kim's game. The deck consists of 60 cards and on each card there is a different picture, eg. a city, a mug, a bike etc... One player places a number of cards on the table (the more cards, the more difficult). The other players study the cards for 30-60 seconds, then they close their eyes. The dealer turns one card over and on the count of three the other players can open their eyes and try to remember what's pictured on the flipped card. The first player to shout out the correct picture on the flipped card gets it. Get the most cards and win the game.

This game can of course be played with anything (a standard deck of cards, toys, kitchen utensils etc.) but it's more fun with a dedicated deck and since it is packed in a real small box it can be taken everywhere.

title: Green Beret
description:
Green Beret is a game for two players simulating the military situation in the Central Highlands of Vietnam in 1964-65. Viet Cong (VC) guerillas and North Vietnamese Army (NVA) regulars faced off against the poorly motivated and unprepared Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN). and Civilian Irregular Defense Groups (CIDG): units of irregular light infantry raised, trained, and advised by US Special Forces A-Teams - the Green Berets.

In many areas, these forces were all that stood in the way of the Communist forces attempting to cut Vietnam in half. The VC player attempts to infiltrate supplies through to the coast, gain control of the population, and destroy CIDG units were possible. The Free World player attempts to stop this by detecting, interdicting, and destroying VC and NVA units.

2001 edition:
Card and counter game played on an abstracted map of the Vietnamese highlands made of 9 cards. The game comes with 60 color markers, 100 black  white cards, a turn record card, two players charts, and rulesbook.

2014 edition, both BTR Games and One Small Step Games:
Map-and-counter revised version of the game; same topic and treatment. 140 colour double-sided counters, colour area movement map, rules and charts. Scenarios: 1964-65 free deployment (two different methods), 1964-65 historical, 1962-63 Operation SWITCHBACK scenario to show the CIDG program at an earlier stage before it was placed under MACV control.

title: The All American Trivia Board Game
description:
From the box:

Do you enjoy trivia games, but are tired of being asked questions about the Queen of England? Perhaps you just want to learn more about your own country! Well, this game is for you! The All American Trivia Board Game features over 2,000 all-American questions falling into four different categories: Geography, History, Arts, and General. Designed for two or more players, Ages 16 and up. This game is both fun and educational.

title: Serata in Giallo: Sangue Blu
description:
Serata in Giallo (Evening of Mystery) is the premier collection of murder mystery games to appear in Italy.  The players are invited to an Evening of Mystery, during the course of which each player enacts the role of one of the protagonists of the event.  The games unfold in acts with a theatrical flavor, and the game may or may not include an investigation team.

Sangue Blu

Sir Reginald MacFergh has been murdered with a blow from a fireplace poker. In one corner of the dining room is his wife, in tears and suffering from shock. What happened here?
A characteristically Sherlockian episode, Blue Blood takes place against the backdrop of a society divided in two: On one side, the nobilityproud of their peerage and contemptuous with their inferiors; on the other side, the humble servants searching for a way to defend their dignity.
The rigid British society of the late 1800's sets the tone for rendering the performance of these entertaining and original characters.

PlaceScotland

TimeOctober 1895

CharactersSix (3 men and 3 women):

Sir Alex Carrington:  45-year-old bachelor of the most noble origins.  He is extremely proud, well-mannered, and refined. He has a condescending attitude towards those whom he considers inferior.

Mr. Bruce Bonanno: 32 years old, of Italian origin. He has an exuberant, extroverted, and fiery nature.  He uses heavy irony to mock all nobility who visit Sir Reginalds estate.

Mr. Cary Lynn: A handsome young 30-year-old man, with a substantial tan.  He is employed as a gardener for Sir Reginalds estate. He has a reserved but passionate nature.

Lady Della MacFergh:  Sir Reginalds sister.  She is 35 years old and is extremely arrogant.

Miss Evelyn: The MacFerghs 22-year-old maid.  She is very energetic and decisive.  She is not afraid to speak her mind

Lady Fiona Fraser: A very fascinating 28-year-old woman.  Originally from Adelaide (Australia), she is the daughter of Simon Fraser, a rich politician. Having grown up in a free and nonconformist environment, she is irritated with British traditionalism and with those who believe in absurd social rules.

title: Great States!
description:
State trivia game with timer.  Better than average components.

From the mfg:

What's the capital of New Jersey? 300 Figure, Fact and Find cards to discover the USA. Questions must be answered before the timer runs out!

title: Addictionary
description:
A bit of a variation on Boggle, utilizing cards.

From the publisher:

The object is to add up the most points you can by building a word with your letter cards before the sand timer runs out. Fast, fun and addictive!

title: The Breyer Game of Horse Sense
types: Children's Game Dice Educational Racing Trivia
description:
Children's trivia game based on horse trivia.  Educational.

From the publisher:

While playing this clever game, kids will learn all about horses - how they're cared for, how they're ridden and much more!

title: Orilla: 1st StarGuard Supplement
types: Expansion for Base-game Miniatures Science Fiction Wargame
description:
34 page supplement booklet to Starguard adding cybernetics, game scenarios new weapons and three new alien races; Orilla, Nekton and Terrellian.

Expands:

    StarGuard!

title: Intermedium: Stepping Stones
description:
Intermedium (or) Stepping Stones, both titles are used in the  rules and on the cover) is a somewhat unusual abstract strategy game played on 7x10 grid.  The players move their pieces on two interweaved but separate sets of paths, and movement/capture is somewhat reminiscent of a 2-dimensional Mancala - a stack of pieces is moved by dropping one piece off the stack in every space it moves into, and opposing pieces can be captured if the last piece ends next to them and certain requirements are met (they have to be surrounded, basically).

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's City, the middle space on their closest row.

title: Guerilla
description:
Guerilla is an abstract strategy game played on a triangular lattice.  Players place pieces to form groups, which can move, larger groups being able to move farther than smaller ones (movement is by jumping).

An unusual feature is that if an enemy piece is captured by overkill (pieces are captured by neighboring pieces which are stronger, strength being measured by the number of adjacent friendly pieces), a red massacre token is placed on its space, which becomes impassable for the rest of the game.

title: Quest for the DragonLords: The Crystal of Power
types: Adventure Dice Expansion for Base-game Fantasy Fighting Miniatures
description:
The Crystal of Power - The 5 to 6 player expansion for Quest for the Dragonlords
The Crystal of Power is the focal point of the universe, binding the fabric of time.  
In the first age, the Gods fought for control of the crystal through their demi-gods the DragonLords.  When the DragonLords clashed the force unleashed was enough to shatter the Crystal of Power.  Shards of the Crystal were thrown to the far reaches of our world, and I suspect even punched through the barriers of time.
The second age was a time of darkness and chaos was upon us with the passing of the great crystal.  You are  our last hope.  I pass to you a great and terrible burden, a shard of the Crystal of Power.  Use it and rule wisely.  Save our people, gather the shards and re-forge the Crystal of Power.

Now 5 or 6 players can embark on a Quest for the DragonLords.  Two new races fight for control of the shards.  The Amazons are skilled in the art of combat and have the ability to charm their opponents.  The Necromancers are the most feared, with the knowledge to raise the fallen.  The Crystal of Power - The 5 to 6 player expansion comes complete with all new adventures and even more powerful spells.

The Crystal of Power contains:
1 set of Necromancer plastic miniatures (45)
1 set of Amazon plastic miniatures (45)
2 Refernce cards
2 DragonLords
4 ships / 6 sails
12 Quest Cards
24 Scroll cards
9 Shards of the Crystal of Power

Expands:

    Quest for the Dragonlords

title: Cacciatori di viverne
mechanisms: Dice RollingHex-and-CounterModular BoardSimulationSimultaneous Action SelectionVariable Phase Order
description:
Cacciatori di viverne is a classic simulation boardgame of air fighting, but with a generic fantasy setting. On a modular map with an hex grid (terrain features have been included for decoration and further modules on ground combat that never appeared) little flying armies fight each other in fierce air battles.
The armies are bought with a point system: flying beasts can be manned by different quantities of soldiers equipped with several kind of weapons. Creatures are of good, neutral and evil alignment: three of the counter sheets include good and neutral creatures, the other three evil and neutral ones (good and evil ones can not be taken together). Each of the 6 sheets includes 140 counters depicting classic and less classic fantasy fliers such as dragons, wyverns, pegasi, flying carpets, elephawks, winged snakes, giant eagles, chimeras and so on.
The rules have two different difficulty levels. The basic system has an initiative check for a variable movement order. Several optional rules are provided for them, while the advanced set of rules has a simultaneous planning of the movement.

title: Mighty Beanz
description: Play em! Race em! Collect em!   Up to 14 different games to play for 1-2+ players.  Plastic version of Mexican jumping beans with cartoon-like illustrated characters printed on them and a Mighty Merit Points (MMP) system for collectible value.

title: James Bond 007
types: Card Game Collectible Components Novel-based Spies/Secret Agents
description:
One of the collectible card games featuring James Bond 007 created by Target games and distributed by Heartbreaker games.

From the box:
You compete with the help of beautiful women and Q's astonishing gadgets to prevent evil villains from performing their diabolical plots.

title: Noah's Ark
description:
A Memory Game - Match the Animals, Two by Two

For 2-4 players, Ages 4 - 7.

Can you remember where the female lion is? Where's the male monkey? This memory game has players searching for pairs of animals to put on Noah's Ark.

All the animals cards are placed face down on the trail of the game board. As players use their colored markers to travel around the board, the cards are turned over, ready to be matched.

All the female animals have bows, the males have ties.

As you find a match, you place the pair in your colored section of Noah's Ark. When all the animals are matched into pairs and placed on the Ark, count how many you placed in your section. Whoever finds the most pairs wins the game.

Contents: Game board, Plastic Ark with gang plank that fits into game board, 20 Animal Cards (10 male, 10 female), 4 colored game pieces, 1 die, Game rules.

Comes in a box with both English and French description and rules. Including a variant of the standard rules.

title: Pacific At War
description:
Looks and feels very similar to Axis  Allies: Pacific.  Description taken from the game manual:

Pacific at War is a multi-player military strategy game taking place in the Pacific theater of operations during World War II. Players must fight battles successfully to win territories and therefore increase their income. The more income a player has, the more buying power he has to purchase the combat units necessary to win battles and gain territories.

In order to achieve their goals, the players have at their disposal playing pieces representing infantry, armor, artillery, fighters, bombers and various types of naval vessels. A player must use clever strategy and planning and purchase units wisely in order to make the most of his resources.

The Japanese player starts the game at war with China. He must decide how much military equipment he wants to commit and for how long before the United States and Britain are brought into the war.

The Chinese player must attempt to inflict as many Japanese casualties as possible and hold out until the Allies enter the war.

The U.S. and Britain will enter the war simultaneously. Until then, they can only prepare the best they can for the inevitable Japanese attack...

title: Lords & Wizards
description:
From the box: Mighty, magical holocausts, awe-inspiring Dragons, weird and terrible monsters, military battles on a grand scale. Which of the combatants, Order or Chaos, shall win? And can the forces of Neutrality maintain the precarious balance of power . . . An exciting, fast moving game of movement and combat in a fantastic world, where skill and strategy will decide the winner.

From the Introduction: It is a game of two to six players, each player being represented by a leader in the game. Players must decide before the game starts whether to be a Lord or Wizard. In addition, a player must also decide whether his leader is to follow Order, Neutrality, or Chaos. These three alignments determine the type of leader, and what that leader can do during the game.

From the Designer's Notes: Lords and Wizards is not just a game; it's an experience. There is nothing quite like the feeling of outwitting an opponent on the field of battle, or in setting up grand alliances, or in stabbing allies in the back, or in discovering lost legends, or in dealing with rebellions, or in avoiding the plague, or in being confounded by the weather, or in.well, you see what I mean.

Components: 72 page 8.5x11 rulebook, 800 die-cut counters, 28x22 map sheet, 4 cardstock game cards, six-sided die, color FGU catalog folder, FGU order sheet.

title: Rhumb Line
description:
Rhumb Line is a sailing race game from Newport to Tortola. This game comes in a tube measuring 20 long with diameter of 2 1/2 and uses  a laminated map for a playing surface.

The object is to race from Newport, Rhode Island to Tortola, British Virgin Islands. Players will roll one die for each move. Some moves will place the player on spaces that will indicate certain penalties. Some spaces will require the player to draw a chance card which will produce benefits or penalties. Other spaces will provide the opportunity to roll again if a nautical trivia question is answered correctly. The first player to reach the destination on an exact roll of the die will win the race and the game.

title: Conversation Pieces: Sports Stories
description:
From the instructions:

The object of the game is for players to get to know each other better and build lasting relationships through telling stories. Players will enjoy hours of entertainment, sharing and having fun with the game.


Each player gets a Pass card. Then the first player takes a question card from the deck of 100. The start player then tells a story based on the question on the card. It can be any type of story, true, fictional, whatever the teller wants. Or the player can use his Pass card and pass both it and the question card to any other player, who then has to answer it with a story. Once a story is told, the next player draws a card and the process begins again. The game ends whenever the participants decide to end it.

title: Crozzle
description:
Each player tries to fill out the same crossword puzzle grid.  Letters in completed words score a point each.  Words within words also score.
To play, each player calls out a letter in turn, and writes it in the square of his choice.  The other players also place that same letter, but not necessarily in the same square, obviously.

The grids include scoring spaces to facilitate the tally.

title: Bärenwald
description:
3 fun children's games in one box. All concern racing wooden bears round a spiral path to collect berries and honey. Very nice wooden pieces (bears and trees)
One game is 2-player only, the other 2 games are 2-4 players. Age range 5+ with adult support. Quite a lot of rules for a 5 year old to take in.

English rules available

title: Austin Powers Trivia Game
types: Dice Humor Movies / TV / Radio theme Spies/Secret Agents Trivia
description:
Be the Ultimate Secret Agent by becoming the first to accumulate quot;One Millionquot; Mojo Points.  Points are earned by correctly answering Trivia questions.  Man of Mystery Cards may cause a player to gain or lose points.

Questions come from all three movies.

Once you reach One Million Mojo Points, the final question is selected from the rest of the group on the next card pulled.  You must answer it correctly to win the game.

title: La Squadriglia degli Assi
description:
The game depicts all kinds of air mission during World War I: from fighting to recon, from bombing to trench strafing and so on. The counters depict every model of airplane that saw operative service on the Italian front between 1915 to 1918, even if in a few exemplars. The map is a full color painting of an aerial view of the front, reconstructed from real recon photos taken on the Italian-Austrian front during WWI, covered by the classical hex grid.
The game has not been put into commerce: it has printed in around 10.000 copies by the Italian Air Force Ministry and given together with the Rivista Aeronautica - Notiziario Giovani magazine. 12 pages were dedicated to the basic rules, optional rules and scenarios.

title: GiochEuro
types: Action / Dexterity Economic Educational Math Memory
description:
GiochEurois a game about conversion from old currency to Euro and about price levels.
There is only a pawn in the game - an Euro coin - that moves around a path. In each of the 24 boxes of the path there is an item - a pen, a motorbike, a comic book, a cinema ticket and so on - with its price in liras. 24 counters depict the same item and price on one side, and the price in Euros on the opposite one: they are put on the table with the Euro side up.
The player in turn rolls the dice. All players have to guess where the coin will land and to put the finger on the Euro price matching the reached item. After they have done it, the coin is moved and the touched counters are turned to check which one is the right one. The players touching it keeps it. In the following turns, it is also possible to take counters from the other players if the same item comes out. The winner is the one reaching a given number of items.
There is a calmer variant of the rules where only one player at a time tries to guess.

title: Shoot the Moon
description:
The object of this game is to have the lowest final score after seven (7) hands of play.  There are two decks of cards, each consisting of five colour-coded suits of fifteen cards, plus one SHOOT THE MOON card, one GO CHICKEN card, and two PLAYING HANDS (reference) cards.  There are also includes twenty-one tokens, a three compartment tray, and two score pads.

Each player attempts to collect required sets (3+ same-number cards in any colour) and or runs (4+ consecutive-numbered cards of a single colour) of cards during each hand of the game.  During each of the seven hands, a different meld is required, starting with two sets for the first hand and working its way up to three runs for the last hand.  During some hands, runs or sets are not allowed.

quot;Going Chickenquot; means laying down the required meld, playing additional cards on any existing melds if possible, and discarding.  quot;Shooting the Moonquot; is the same without the discard --this wins the hand.  You can also win the hand by emptying your hand without discarding, having played the required meld during an earlier turn.  Cards left in others#039; hands count as penalties (of 5 to 30 points each).

The rules also discuss drawing discarded cards out of turn, using Shoot the Moon and Go Chicken cards, and the bonus tokens.

title: Variance
mechanisms: Point to Point MovementRoll / Spin and Move
description:
